product_name: Bimber Ex-Bourbon Single Malt Whisky Batch 1
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a small-batch bourbon cask matured single malt from west London distillery Bimber, made with a combination of American oak ex-bourbon casks and bottled in May 2020. Aromas of green apples, dried peaches, milky cereal and vanilla sponge cake fill the nose alongside hints of desiccated coconut and buttery toast. The palate offers notes of baked apples and apricots, lively pepper, charred oak and creamy vanilla.

product_name: The Legendary Dark Silkie Irish Whiskey
product_description: A rich and smoky blended Irish whiskey from Sliabh Liag Distillers, Dark Silkie is an ode to Donegal whiskies of the past. Made with a combination of triple distilled peated Irish single malts, Irish single malts and smooth grain whiskey, it has aromas of fresh apple, pear, peppery smoke and oak spice on the nose. The palate offers notes of salted caramel, pipe tobacco, liquorice, dark chocolate, toffee and pears.

product_name:
Michter's US*1 Unblended American Whiskey
Gift Box
product_description:
Very fruity and sweet, this whiskey from Michter's positively drips with toffee and butterscotch, enlivened by toasty notes and a hint of vanilla and dried fruit. Technically not a bourbon due to its ageing in 'bourbon-soaked' barrels as opposed to new oak.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Michter's: The Art of American Whiskey Tasting Set
6x3cl
product_description:
There's much more to American whiskey than just bourbon, and US distillery Michter's shows just how much variety there can be, without skimping on the quality. This Perfect Measure tasting set explores the Michter's range, and showcases the many styles of whiskey that it produces.


This set includes a 3cl sample bottle of each of the following: Michter's Number 1 Bourbon, Michter's US*1 Toasted Barrel Finish Bourbon, Michter's Number 1 Straight Rye, Michter's US*1 Barrel Strength Toasted Rye and Michter's 10 Year Old Bourbon

product_name:
Ben Eideann Ruby Galilean Kosher Whisky
Sweet Red Wine Finish
product_description: A spicy, rich Highland single malt from Ben Eideann that has been matured in specially-sourced sweet wine casks. The palate offers notes of chocolate-covered strawberries, plums, malted biscuits and coffee beans, with sweet spices and summer fruits lingering in the finish.

product_name: Heaven's Door Double Barrel American Whiskey
product_description:
This blend of three different whiskeys is married in new American oak barrels and matured for an extra year before bottling at 100 proof. It has a complex palate of caramel, oak, citrus and spice notes, and a long finish.


Heaven's Door whiskeys were created by musician Bob Dylan, whose ornate iron gates (made himself from materials found all over America) are also the inspiration for the bottle's artwork.

product_name:
Perfect Measure Premium Single Malt Whisky Collection
3x3cl
product_description:
Try a range of premium single malt whiskies with the Perfect Measure collection. Inside is a 3cl sample each of Octomore 10.3, Cardrona Just Hatched and Westland Garryana.


Please note


This product is a bundle offer. It will be displayed in the checkout with the special discounted price, and the components shown below without price. Please be aware that there are no extra free items with these bundles.

product_name: The English Smokey Single Malt Whisky
product_description: This is The English Whisky Co's ongoing smoky release. Peated to 45ppm, this has notes of vanilla, aniseed, ginger and of course, smoke. A great introduction of peated whisky.

A five-year-old Irish whiskey from McConnell's, inspired by the historical McConnells Blend founded in Belfast in 1776. Matured in American oak casks this spicy, floral whiskey offers notes of peppery oak, honeysuckle, vanilla, milk chocolate, cinnamon and nutmeg throughout the palate.

product_name:
Ben Eideann Distillery Edition Kosher Whisky
American Oak
product_description: A tropical, creamy Highland single malt from Ben Eideann, this Distillery Edition has been matured in American oak ex-bourbon casks. The palate offers notes of tropical passion fruit and mango, Muscovado sugar and vanilla custard, with warm spices and black pepper in the finish.

product_name: The Pogues Single Malt Irish Whiskey
product_description: A single malt whiskey made by West Cork Distillers and famous band The Pogues. Matured in ex-bourbon casks, this Irish whiskey has delicately floral nose, with aromas of lavender, meadow flowers, sesame, caramelised cashews and salted chocolate. The palate offers notes of dry oak, chai spice, peanut butter, s'mores and summer flowers.

product_name: Stalk & Barrel Red Blend Canadian Whisky
product_description:
Described as 'the quintessential Canadian whisky' by GQ Magazine, this blend of aged single malt, aged rye and a touch of aged corn is a memorably full-bodied dram that's full of honey, granola, cacao, vanilla, cigar box and oak spice flavours. A worthy addition to your whisky cabinet.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Spirit of Hven Urania Swedish Whisky
product_description: The first release of the Spirit of Hven Urania whisky - the first Island single malt produced in Sweden. Named for Urania, the Muse of Astronomy (amongst other things), and made from barley grown in Scotland, Belgium and locally on the island of Hven.

product_name: Best Collection of Malt Scotch Whisky
product_description: Released in 1999, the first edition documenting Valentino Zagatti's collection is dedicated to Scotch malt whiskies. A great book for any enthusiast.

product_name:
WhistlePig 10 Year Old Rye Whiskey
Jeroboam
product_description: A jeroboam of fantastic 10-year-old rye whiskey from the folks at WhistlePig. They've chosen some of the best rye whiskey produced at Alberta Distillers in Canada and bottled it at their farm in Vermont - this goes to show that former Maker's Mark distiller Dave Pickerell certainly knows good whiskey.

product_name: St George Breaking & Entering American Whiskey
product_description: Breaking & Entering is an American whiskey from St George Spirits in California, matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-rye whiskey casks from other distilleries, as well as casks that previously help St George's own malt whiskey. Aromas of coffee beans, peanut brittle, maple syrup and oak char fill the nose, complemented by notes of pecan, chocolate, spicy rye, honeyed cereals and cherry pie throughout the palate.

product_name:
The English Original Single Malt Whisky
Hip Flask Set
product_description:
Whether they're already a fan of this wonderful Norfolk distillery or new to English whisky, your recipient will love this beautiful gift pack, which contains a 200ml bottle of the distillery's Original single malt whisky, plus a handsome blue hip flask.


The English Original Single Malt is aged in ex-bourbon casks and has sweet notes of vanilla ice cream, nuts and a hint of sea spray.

product_name: Spirit of Hven Mercurious Corn Whisky
product_description: A creamy, sweet Swedish corn whisky from Spirit of Hven, MerCurious is made with a mash bill of 88% Swedish corn, 5% wheat, 3.5% barley and 3.5% rye, and matured for up to eight years.

product_name:
Canadian Club 6 Year Old Whisky
Distilled 1958
Spirit of Hven Hvenus Rye Whisky
product_description: An elegant and flavoursome Swedish rye whisky, blended from 42 American oak casks that were matured for a minimum of six years. The nose holds intense vanilla aromas, mingling with freshly cut grass and menthol. The palate is incredibly smooth, opening with vanilla before bursting with spices and toffee notes, then building to more malty notes and dark chocolate. The finish is soft and floral, with notes of vanilla and lavender lingering behind.

product_name: Stalk & Barrel Blue Blend Canadian Whisky
product_description:
From a micro-distillery just north of Toronto comes this rounded, creamy blend of single malt, rye and corn whiskies. A fantastic mix of vanilla, crème brûlée, spice and fruit flavours, which gets more rounded and creamier with water.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Smooth Ambler Old Scout American Whiskey 107
product_description: A full-bodied version of Smooth Ambler's hugely popular Old Scout American Whiskey, with big notes of spice, caramel, vanilla and cinnamon. This is made from whiskey aged both in fresh oak and recharged bourbon casks, sourced from Indiana and Tennessee.

product_name: Smooth Ambler Old Scout American Whiskey
product_description: Smooth Ambler Old Scout American Whiskey is a blend of blend of whiskeys from Indiana and Tennessee. Aged partly in refill barrels (so it can't be called bourbon), this is spicy with notes of cinnamon, ginger, tobacco and caramel.

Very fruity and sweet, this whiskey from Michter's positively drips with toffee and butterscotch, enlivened by toasty notes and a hint of vanilla and dried fruit. Technically not a bourbon due to its ageing in 'bourbon-soaked' barrels as opposed to new oak.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Tunbridge Wells Liqueur Co. Maple Whiskey Liqueur
product_description: Tunbridge Wells Liqueur Co. Maple Whiskey Liqueur is a delicious blend of Kentucky bourbon and Canadian maple syrup. Sweet and rich, this is best served over ice.

product_name: Let Me Tell You About Whisky
product_description: A guide to whisky from the 'Let me tell you about...' series, combining the knowledge of veteran writer Gavin Smith and friend of TWE Neil Ridley to give an engaging and well-written snapshot of the world of whisky.

product_name: Everything You Need To Know About Whisky
product_description:
Everything You Need To Know About Whisky (but are too afraid to ask) is a exploration of the world of whisky, penned by whisky industry veteran Nicholas Morgan in partnership with The Whisky Exchange. It lifts the lid on the whisky industry, diving into its history as well as the topics that are much in the minds of whisky fans today – the culture of whisky, the people behind the spirit, and much more. It's a book for anyone who loves whisky written by someone who has dedicated their life to it.


This book should whet anyone's appetite for whisky, be they expert or novice. It debunks a few myths, sets the record straight here and there, and will I hope provoke both discussion and debate. Nicholas Morgan, Author


This is a book for anyone who loves whisky. They don’t have to be experts, far from it, and there will be plenty to discover (and reconsider) for even the most impassioned and well-informed whisky fan Sukhinder Singh, co-founder of The Whisky Exchange

product_name: Red Spot 15 Year Old Irish Whiskey
product_description:
The third entry in the Spot range of single pot still whiskeys is a rich, spicy and enticing Irish whiskey, exploring the influence of sherry and Marsala casks. Matured for more than 15 years in ex-bourbon, -sherry and -Marsala casks, it combines ripe, dried and stewed fruit flavours with sweetness and spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Michter's US*1 Original Sour Mash Whiskey
Gift Box
product_description:
Beautifully rich and spicy, this sour-mash whiskey from Michter's has an abundance of cinnamon, butter and nutty notes, along with a hint of black pepper to freshen things up. Delicious.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Michter's US*1 Original Sour Mash Whiskey Sample
product_description: A rich, spicy sour mash whiskey from Michter's. This is packed full of flavour: nuts, butter, cinnamon and pepper.

product_name: Sekforde Sicilian Orange & Rosemary Mixer for Whisky or Bourbon
product_description: A sweet, citrus-led mixer from Sekforde, designed for mixing with whisky or bourbon. Notes of Sicilian orange, rosemary and bitter herbs are used to highlight the character of the spirit – be that sweet, smooth vanilla or rich, spicy dried fruit.

product_name: Michael Collins 10 Year Old Malt Whiskey
product_description: Michael Collins 10 year old Malt Whiskey is a combination of both unpeated and peated barley made at Cooley distillery. The brand is rarely seen over here, being aimed at the American market.

product_name: MacNaMara Rum Cask Finish Blended Scotch Whisky
product_description: A blended whisky from the Gaelic Whisky Company, taking their regular MacNaMara and finishing it in Guyanese rum casks for an extra bit of soft sweetness.

product_name: Old Potrero 18th Century Style Rye Whisky Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of an excellent rye from Old Potrero, this is a truly exceptional and unique example of rye whisky as it was originally made in the 18th Century.

product_name:
East London Liquor Co London Rye Whisky
Bot.2020
product_description: The 2020 edition of East London Liquor Company's London Rye Whisky has been matured in a combination of different casks, including virgin French oak, chestnut, shaved-toasted-recharred, sherry and bourbon casks. The palate offers notes of candied orange peel, toffee apples, sour cherries and rich oak that linger in the finish alongside peppery spice.

product_name: Pure Scot Virgin Oak 43 Blended Whisky
product_description: A fresh, spicy blended whisky that has been finished in virgin American oak casks, it has aromas of barley sugar, nutmeg, citrus, green apples and sweet smoke. The palate offers note of honey, orange zest, spicy gingerbread and ripe orchard fruit, before a spicy, fruity finish, with hints of wood smoke.

product_name: Compass Box Delilah's XXV Blended Scotch Whisky
product_description:
Another anniversary bottling for Delilah's! It's almost like they have a birthday every year... This special edition celebrates the Chicago bar's 25th year and owner Mike Miller has worked with Compass Box's John Glaser to create a suitable follow-up to their 20th birthday bottle. This takes some of that original edition, further aged, and combines it with a variety of other whiskies, including lots of sherry-matured spirit. The result is creamy and fruity with a backbone of dried fruit and spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Michter's US*1 Original Sour Mash Whiskey
product_description:
Beautifully rich and spicy, this sour-mash whiskey from Michter's has an abundance of cinnamon, butter and nutty notes, along with a hint of black pepper to freshen things up. Delicious.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Connemara 12 Year Old Peated Irish Whiskey
product_description: The oldest expression in the Connemara range, this fine 12 Year Old peated Irish single malt from the Cooley distillery has won several awards including a Gold medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Fair.

product_name: Pearse Original 5 Year Old Blended Whiskey
product_description: A five-year-old blended Irish whiskey from Pearse distillery, matured in ex-bourbon barrels. Aromas of sweet citrus and soft smoke mingle with malt, honey and summer flowers on the nose. The palate offers notes of spearmint, chocolate, oak, vanilla and caramel that linger in the finish.
None

product_name: Pearse Distiller's Choice 7 Year Old Blended Whiskey Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle f seven-year-old blended Irish whiskey from Pearse Lyons distillery, matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks. Aromas of oranges, cinnamon, dried fruit and sweet fruit cake fill the nose, complemented by notes of light oak, green grape, dark chocolate and caramelised pears throughout the palate.

product_name: Pearse Distiller's Choice 7 Year Old Blended Whiskey
product_description: A seven-year-old blended Irish whiskey from Pearse Lyons distillery, matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks. Aromas of oranges, cinnamon, dried fruit and sweet fruit cake fill the nose, complemented by notes of light oak, green grape, dark chocolate and caramelised pears throughout the palate.

product_name:
The Last Drop 56 Year Old Blended Whisky
Release No.16
product_description: A 56 Year Old blended whisky from bottler The Last Drop, matured initially in sherry butts and finished in ex-bourbon casks, before being bottled in 2019. Each bottle is accompanied by a 5cl miniature of this impressive blend.

product_name: Hinch 5 Year Old Double Wood Irish Whiskey
product_description: From Irish bottler Hinch, this 5-year-old Double Wood has been matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished for at least a year in virgin American oak barrels. It is a smooth, sweet whiskey with notes of vanilla, cinnamon and oak spice throughout the palate.

product_name:
The E&K 5 Year Old Malt Whisky
Indian & Scotch Fusion
product_description:
The E&K blended malt is a tribute to Victor Alexander Bruce, the 9th Earl of Elgin who became Viceroy of India in 1894. It was made in conjunction with independent bottlers Adelphi, whose Alex Bruce is the great-grandson of Victor Bruce.


This limited-edition whisky is a fusion of Scotch from Ardmore and Glenrothes, as well as malt from India's Amrut distillery. It has notes of tropical fruits, scented sandalwood, dark fruit, sweet smoke and Highland toffee, with a lingering and enjoyably complex finish.

product_name: Pearse Founder's Choice 12 Year Old Single Malt Whiskey
product_description: A 12-year-old blended Irish whiskey from Pearse Lyons distillery that has aromas of white peaches, crunchy apples, spiced pears and green pine needles on the nose. The palate offers notes of lemon, dried orange, honeysuckle, clove and ginger throughout the palate.

product_name: Pearse Founder's Choice 12 Year Old Single Malt Whiskey Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 12-year-old blended Irish whiskey from Pearse Lyons distillery that has aromas of white peaches, crunchy apples, spiced pears and green pine needles on the nose. The palate offers notes of lemon, dried orange, honeysuckle, clove and ginger throughout the palate.

product_name: Hinch 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finished Irish Whiskey
product_description: Made by Hinch Distilling Co in Ireland, this 10 Year Old whiskey has been matured in American oak casks, before being finished for at least six months in Oloroso sherry casks from Jerez. A rich, sweet whiskey, it has notes of dried fruit, raisings and creamy vanilla throughout the palate.

product_name:
Scotch
Whisky of Scotland In Fact
product_description: The 2011 update of Sir Robert Bruce Lockhart's Scotch: Whisky of Scotland in Fact. The book describes the author's family's involvement with the Balmenach distillery in Scotland and other less well known incidents.
A square Bohemia crystal decanter that will hold up to a 80cl of whisky, though other uses are, of course, possible.

Part of the second wave of Whisky Works whiskies in 2019, Quartermaster is an 11-year-old blended Scotch whisky, comprised of Highland grain whiskies and Speyside single malts, each matured and finished in different ways. The grain component has been matured in ex-rum casks and finished in Pedro Ximénez sherry casks, while the rest has been matured in a combination of American white oak casks and sherry butts. Fruity aromas of rum-steeped peaches, ground ginger and coffee fill the nose, while the palate offers notes of rich nuts, dried dates, raisins and orange peel.

product_name:
Bowmore 1998
19 Year Old Whisky Agency for TWE
product_description:
A fruity 19-year-old Bowmore bottled by German independent The Whisky Agency exclusively for us here at The Whisky Exchange. Run through with smoky maritime character, it's got piles of fresh fruit as well, harking back to old-school Bowmore. A great dram that shows off our favourite style of Bowmore.

Tasting Notes (1)

Intelligens is a Swedish single malt from Mackmyra distillery, created using artificial intelligence (AI) to determine the combination of casks used. Aromas of toffee, vanilla, apples, pears, citrus and ginger spice fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of oak spice, raisins, stewed pears, zesty orange, tobacco leaves and a whisper of smoke.

Bee is a combination of Swedish whisky, malt vodka and organic honies. The honey is collected from the surrounding area (Gävle and Valbo) and is a mixture of dandelion, linden and forest honies, with some raspberry flowers. Best enjoyed either chilled as an aperitif, or at the end of a meal.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Cambus 1990
29 Year Old Whisky Trail Video Games
product_description: A 1990 Cambus single grain whisky from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured for 29 years in a single hogshead before being bottled in June 2020 as part of its Whisky Trail Video Games series. Aromas of fresh grass, buttery biscuits, lemon, white chocolate and oak spice fill the nose. The palate offers notes of candy apples, hazelnuts, crystalised pineapple, milk chocolate-covered honeycomb and fragrant chamomile tea.

product_name:
Glenrothes 1989
30 Year Old Whisky Trail Retro Cars
product_description:
A 1989 Glenrothes single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers' Whisky Trail Vintage cars series, bottled in October 2019 after 30 years in a single hogshead. Aromas of freshly-waxed wood, tropical fruit, oatcakes and cinnamon buns fill the nose. The palate offers notes of toasted brioche, Madeira, pineapple and dried mango.

Tasting Notes (1)

This incredibly rare Port Ellen was specially bottled for Whiskymessen, the biggest whisky event in Denmark that has been running since 2001. With only 36 bottles ever made, this is a must have for every Port Ellen collector.

product_name:
Bunnahabhain 1989
27 Year Old Whisky Agency TWE
product_description:
Delicate and complex, this long-aged Bunnahabhain will delight any fan of unpeated Islay whisky. Mineral, seaside notes are joined by red fruits and raspberry, enlivened with just a touch of lemon. The definition of restrained elegance. This limited-edition bottling has been created exclusively for us by independent German bottlers The Whisky Agency.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Williams & Sons
Highland Whisky Glass Samovar & Dispenser

Miltonduff 1999
20 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
Twenty years in a hogshead can work magic on a whisky, and this dram from Miltonduff shows off quite how the marriage of oak and time can let a whisky sing. Light, delicate and floral, the wood has lightly kissed the spirit, giving it a little bit of colour and spice, while letting the floral and fruity Miltonduff spirit develop over two decades. A style of whisky we don't see often enough these days.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenburgie 1998
21 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
A 1998 Glenburgie from The Whisky Exchange, matured in a single hogshead for 21 years before being bottled in 2019. Aromas of tinned fruit and cocktail cherries burst forward on the nose, followed by oak, pineapple, barley sugar and candied lemon. The palate offers notes of boiled sweets, sour apples and underripe pears, with hints of waxy furniture polish underneath.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Aberlour 1993
25 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
After a quarter of a century in an ex-bourbon hogshead, this 1993 Aberlour single malt was bottled in 2019 by The Whisky Exchange. A sweet, fruity Speyside whisky, it offers aromas of poached pears, apple, buttery shortbread and cinnamon, while the palate offers notes of nutmeg, ginger, Victoria sponge, sultanas and caramel.

Tasting Notes (1)

A rich and spicy Arran, selected and bottled specially for The Whisky Exchange Whisky Show's 10th Anniversary. At 21 years old, it's almost as old as Arran gets – the distillery started production in 1995 – and the age has helped create an integrated dram, with layers of spice and fruit.

Tasting Notes (1)
A 1999 vintage Caol Ila bottled by The Whisky Trail in 2011. Briny smoke, like a bonfire on the beach, medium-bodied with a slightly spicy finish - a great session whisky.

A 2011 Ardmore single malt from independent bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single cask for nine years, before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of pine needles, liquorice, toasted marshmallows and damp ash that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Balcones 2016
4 Year Old Simply Whisky Dream Big
product_description: A 2016 Balcones American corn whiskey from Simply Whisky, matured for four years in a refill bourbon barrel before being bottled in December 2020.

A 2007 Inchgower single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single ex-bourbon hogshead for 13 years before being bottled in 2020 as part of the second wave of whiskies from Watt Whisky. The palate offers notes of honey, sweet peppers, green olives, butterscotch and gingerbread that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glenlossie 2009
11 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
Matured in a barrel and limited to just 200 bottles, this is a fresh and fruity Glenlossie loaded with sweet apple and pear notes, hints of mango and pineapple, and robust nutty notes. Sure to bring a little sunshine to your glass, whatever the season.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
20 Year Old Speyside Cognac Finish
Whisky Works
product_description:
Part of the second wave of whiskies from independent bottler Whisky Works, this Speyside single malt was distilled at a lost distillery in Carron, Imperial and matured in American oak for two decades before it was finished for seven months in 20-year-old Cognac casks from the Bourgin Estate in southwest France. Bottled in 2019, this is a sweet, floral whisky, with aromas of citrus, violets and sweet, grassy herbal notes on the nose. The palate offers notes of creamy milk chocolate, golden syrup, ginger and strawberries & cream.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Arran 2011
5 Year Old Peated Whisky Agency
product_description: A heavily-peated single-cask Arran bottled by The Whisky Agency for The Whisky Fair - a world-renowned annual event in Limburg, Germany. Aged in a single bourbon cask and peated to 50ppm, this is a great whisky for those who want to see what Arran's Machrie Moor would be like with a bucket-load of extra peat.

A 2007 Linkwood single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single hogshead for 13 years, before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of almonds, pistachios, icing sugar, mint and fudge that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Langatun Old Bear
Smoky Whisky Cask Proof
product_description: A softly smoky Swiss single malt from Langatun distillery, Old Bear is made with peated malt and is matured in ex-Châteauneuf-du-Pape wine casks. Fresh smoke fills the nose, alongside aromas of red fruits and waxy orange. The palate offers notes of juicy grapes, toffee and wood smoke that develop into dark chocolate and smouldering peat fires that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glentauchers 1997
21 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
Matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for 21 years, this 1997 Glentauchers has been bottled by The Whisky Exchange in 2019. A fruity, spicy Speyside single malt, aromas of waxy apples, summer fruits and oak compliment notes of apple pie, cinnamon, apricot jam and liquorice on the palate.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Arran 2011
5 Year Old Peated Whisky Agency
product_description: A heavily-peated single-cask Arran bottled by The Whisky Agency for The Whisky Fair - a world-renowned annual event in Limburg, Germany. Aged in a single bourbon cask and peated to 50ppm, this is a great whisky for those who want to see what Arran's Machrie Moor would be like with a bucket-load of extra peat.

A 2010 Tomintoul single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a refill butt for a decade, before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of vanilla cream, butterscotch, marzipan, cashew nuts and raisins that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Something Special
De Luxe Whisky Bot.1980s

product_description: A 2008 Mannochmore single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a pair of hogsheads of 12 years and rested in an ex-brandy butt for three months before being bottled in 2020. Its a creamy, nutty whisky, with notes of roast hazelnuts, honeycomb and fresh ginger throughout the palate.

product_name:
Bunnahabhain 1997
22 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
Malt loaf, menthol and fresh, mineral high notes are layered atop notes of rich dried fruit, dark chocolate and loamy foundations in this Bunnahabhain, matured in a single hogshead and limited to just 174 bottles.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Littlemill 1989
21 Year Old The Whisky Agency

Littlemill 1990
23 Year Old The Whisky Agency

Glaswegian Single Grain 29 Year Old
Whisky Works
product_description: A classic whisky from a now-silent grain distillery, which once stood at the heart of Glasgow’s waterways. Matured for 29 years in American white-oak casks, this light grain whisky has developed a wonderfully balanced, sweet character full of butterscotch, vanilla and exotic fruity flavours.

product_name:
Irish Single Malt XO
Whisky Agency
product_description: This Irish single malt whiskey was bottled in 2017 by German bottler The Whisky Agency in celebration of Maltstock festival. A sweet and spicy whiskey, it has notes of crystalised ginger, caramel and black pepper throughout the palate.

product_name:
Lauder's
Royal Northern Cream Whisky Bot.1960s

Something Special
De Luxe Whisky Bot.1970s

Strathisla 1967
42 Year Old The Whisky Agency
product_description: A very long-aged Strathisla 1967, bottled in 2009 at 42 years old from a single bourbon hogshead by The Whisky Agency at its natural cask strength of 44.5%.

product_name:
John O'Groat's
Scots Liqueur Whisky Bot.1970s
product_description: A 1970s bottling of John O'Groats liqueur whisky.
Another indie Port Ellen with an eccentric label, this time featuring a lovely pair of melons on the front.

product_name:
Ledaig 2005 Miniature
13 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description: A miniature bottle of 2005 Ledaig single malt from The Whisky Exchange, matured in a single sherry butt for 13 years before being bottled in 2019. Peaty aromas of damp grass, tar, dried mango, sherbet lemons and chocolate fill the nose, with hints of fresh mint underneath. The palate offers notes of smouldering embers, dark chocolate, cinder toffee, singed fruit cake and black liquorice.

product_name:
Caol Ila 2010
10 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A 2010 Caol Ila single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a hogshead for a decade before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of wet bonfire ash, medicinal peat, cream, pear and salty liquorice that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Imperial 1995
23 Year Old TWE Miniature Whisky Show Magic 2019
product_description: A miniature bottle of 1995 Imperial single maltr initially released at Whisky Show 2019 as part of our Magic of the Cask series, it has spent 23 years in a single refill bourbon barrel, before being bottled in 2019. Aromas of sugared almonds, biscuits, lemon curd and meadow flowers fill the nose. The palate offers notes of candy bracelets, sweet cream, cinnamon, buttermints and lemon zest.

product_name:
Glen Elgin 2008
12 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
Matured in a single hogshead for 12 years, this is a richly-fruity whisky in which zesty citrus fruits and jammy orchard-fruit notes marry with fresh bread, airy menthol and earthy cocoa. A rounded and multi-dimensional Speysider.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Ichiro's Malt & Grain
World Blended Whisky 2020 Blue Label
product_description: A limited-edition Ichiro's Malt & Grain from Chichibu, released in 2020, this world blended whisky has been made with a combination of casks from around the globe, creating a sweet, spicy and complex character. The palate offers notes of caramel, toffee, shortbread biscuits, lemon curd, pine needles and sweet blossoms that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glenburgie 1998 Miniature
21 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description: A miniature bottle of 1998 Glenburgie from The Whisky Exchange, matured in a single hogshead for 21 years before being bottled in 2019. Aromas of tinned fruit and cocktail cherries burst forward on the nose, followed by oak, pineapple, barley sugar and candied lemon. The palate offers notes of boiled sweets, sour apples and underripe pears, with hints of waxy furniture polish underneath.

product_name:
Glentauchers 1997 Miniature
21 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description: Matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for 21 years, this miniature bottle of 1997 Glentauchers has been bottled by The Whisky Exchange. A fruity, spicy Speyside single malt, aromas of waxy apples, summer fruits and oak compliment notes of apple pie, cinnamon, apricot jam and liquorice on the palate.

product_name:
Aberlour 1993 Miniature
25 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description: After a quarter of a century in an ex-bourbon hogshead, this miniature of 1993 Aberlour single malt was bottled in 2019 by The Whisky Exchange. A sweet, fruity Speyside whisky, it offers aromas of poached pears, apple, buttery shortbread and cinnamon, while the palate offers notes of nutmeg, ginger, Victoria sponge, sultanas and caramel.

product_name:
Clarendon Rum 2004
16 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A 2004 Clarendon Estate rum from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single barrel for 16 years, before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of ripe strawberries, satsumas, engine oil, liquorice and flint that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Miltonduff 1999 Miniature
20 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description: Twenty years in a hogshead can work magic on a whisky, and this dram from Miltonduff shows off quite how the marriage of oak and time can let a whisky sing. Light, delicate and floral, the wood has lightly kissed the spirit, giving it a little bit of colour and spice, while letting the floral and fruity Miltonduff spirit develop over two decades. A style of whisky we don't see often enough these days.

product_name:
Port Dundas 2000
20 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A 2000 Port Dundas single grain whisky from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single cask for two decades, before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of gingerbread, salted caramel, burnt oranges and cream that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Paul John 2016
4 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A 2016 Paul John Indian single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single barrel for four years, before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of tropical fruits, cloves, cinnamon, vanilla, ginger and plums that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Dailuaine 2008 Sample
12 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2008 Dailuaine single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single ex-bourbon hogshead for 12 years before being bottled as part of its second ever release of whiskies. The palate offers notes of almonds, liquorice, allspice, lime zest, pineapple and soft brown sugar that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Ichiro's Malt & Grain
Japanese Blended Whisky 2020
product_description: A limited-edition bottling of Ichiro's Malt & Grain Japanese blended whisky from Chichibu, released in 2020, is classic and sweet with notes of fresh mint, sticky toffee pudding and wisps of peat smoke throughout the palate.

product_name:
Speyside blended Malt 1973
45 Year Old Whisky Show Magic
product_description: Released at Whisky Show 2019 as part of our Magic of the Cask series, this 1973 Speyside blended malt has been matured in a single sherry butt for 45 years, before being bottled in 2019. Aromas of brown sugar and fruitcake open on the nose, followed by brown bread with butter, maraschino cherries, raisins, cinnamon-baked apples, dried mango and rich, earthy aromas. The palate offers notes of toasted oak, baked apples, sultanas, bitter char, soft spice and light fruitcake.

product_name:
Ichiro's Malt & Grain
World Blended Whisky 2018 Limited Edition
product_description: A limited-edition World blended whisky from Chichibu, made with a selection of whiskies from Japan and from around the world.

product_name:
Smokey Joe
Islay Blended Malt Whisky
product_description: Smokey Joe is a blended Islay malt from Angus Dundee, owners of Tomintoul and Glencadam. As the name suggests, this is a smoky whisky with a hint of sweetness and a touch of lemon.

A 1990 vintage Macallan bottled by Speciality Drinks for their The Whisky Trail range in 2011. Rich fruit and oak flavours and a fantastically accessible, smooth, easy-drinking style make this great value for money compared to the official bottlings.

product_name:
Tomintoul 2010
10 Year Old Sample Watt Whisky
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2010 Tomintoul single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a refill butt for a decade, before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of vanilla cream, butterscotch, marzipan, cashew nuts and raisins that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Springbank 1993 Miniature
26 Year Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description: Matured in a single hogshead for 26 years, this miniature bottle of 1993 Springbank single malt was bottled in 2019 by The Whisky Exchange. A smoky, spicy Campbeltown whisky, aromas of earthy smoke and waxed jackets are balanced by notes of orchard fruit, gentle spice and clove throughout the palate.

product_name:
Speyside Blended Malt 1973
45 Year Old Whisky Show 2019
product_description:
Released at Whisky Show 2019 as part of our Magic of the Cask series, this 1973 Speyside blended malt has been matured in a single sherry butt for 45 years, before being bottled in 2019. Aromas of brown sugar and fruitcake open on the nose, followed by brown bread with butter, maraschino cherries, raisins, cinnamon-baked apples, dried mango and rich, earthy aromas. The palate offers notes of toasted oak, baked apples, sultanas, bitter char, soft spice and light fruitcake.

Tasting Notes (1) 

Please note


Please note that this bottle will be shipped with a small UV torch. Shine it on the label to reveal the full magic of the cask...

product_name:
Port Ellen 1983
28 Year Old The Whisky Trail

Glaswegian Single Grain 29 Year Old Sample
Whisky Works
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a classic whisky from a now-silent grain distillery, which once stood at the heart of Glasgow’s waterways. Matured for 29 years in American white-oak casks, this light grain whisky has developed a wonderfully balanced, sweet character full of butterscotch, vanilla and exotic fruity flavours.

product_name:
Savoy Hotel London
Blended Scotch Whisky Bot.1960s

King of Trees Highland 10 Year Old
Whisky Works
product_description: This blend of Highland malts was initially matured in first-fill bourbon barrels and refill American white-oak casks, before a portion of the blend was finished in a specially-crafted Scottish oak casks. This resulted in a bold streak of orchard fruits throughout the palate, alongside a classic Highland character, with soft spices and ripe fruits.

product_name:
Benromach 2010
10 Year Old Exclusive To The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
An 2010 vintage from Benromach, specially selected by The Whisky Exchange team exclusively for us. It was matured in a first-fill bourbon barrel, giving the gently smoky spirit a creamy character that's complimented by fresh and cooked apples, chocolate, spice and a touch of mint.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Caol Ila 2010 Sample
10 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample of 2010 Caol Ila from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single hogshead and bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of wet bonfire ash, medicinal peat, cream, pear and salty liquorice that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Highland Single Malt 2005
16 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A 2005 Highland single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, made at a mystery distillery and matured in a refill sherry butt for 16 years before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of toffee, dried fruit, pear drops, dark chocolate and honey that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Irish Single Malt 2003
16 Year Old The Whisky Agency
product_description: A 2003 Irish single malt from indie bottler The Whisky Agency, matured for 16 years in a single barrel, before being bottled in 2019.

product_name:
Glen Moray '93
De Luxe Scots Whisky Bot.1950s

Ardbeg Batch 1
That Boutique-y Whisky Co

Orbital 8 Year Old
World Blend Sherry Cask Whisky Magazine
product_description: Orbital is an eight-year-old blended whisky from Whisky Magazine. The samples the publication receives have been blended with an aged grain whisky and married in a Pedro-Ximenez-sherry cask. All profits from the production are being donated to the Walking With the Wounded charity. This has notes of butterscotch, manuka honey, toffee apple, biscuits and subtle warming spices.

product_name:
Admiral Rodney Officer's Release No.2 2009
Irish Whiskey Cask
product_description:
The second entry in Admiral Rodney's Officer's Release series, distilled in 2009 and finished in an ex-Irish whiskey cask. The nose entices you with notes of clove, allspice, baked honey, prunes and rapsberries. The palate is fruity and spicy, expertly combining cherry, blackcurrant, sweet chilli and Asian spices with a hint of saltiness to finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Arran 1996 Sample
24 Year Old Exclusive To The Whisky Exchange
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 1996 Arran single malt bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange in March 2021 after 24 years in a single cask – record-keeping at Arran back then wasn't as good as it is today, and we don't know for certain what type of cask it is. However, after extensive taste testing, we think it's a wine cask of some kind. We can also say that we're big fans. Expect aromas of green walnut, clove-studded orange and crème caramel fill the nose, complemented by notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, fudge, toasted walnuts and fireside embers throughout the palate.

product_name:
Caol Ila 2001
19 Year Old Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
A 2001 Caol Ila single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single first-fill bourbon barrel for 19 years, before being bottled in March 2021 exclusively for The Whisky Exchange. Aromas of honey-glazed ham, aniseed and poached pears fill the nose, complemented by notes of black pepper, green apples and smoking bonfire embers throughout the palate.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Highland Single Malt 2005
16 Year Old Sample Watt Whisky
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2005 Highland single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, made at a mystery distillery and matured in a refill sherry butt for 16 years before being bottled in 2021. The palate offers notes of toffee, dried fruit, pear drops, dark chocolate and honey that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Ardmore 2009 Miniature
9 Years Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description: While you wouldn't necessarily expect one of Scotland's favourite smoky drams to come from the Highlands, Ardmore has been distilling peaty spirit for years and has been quietly sneaking up the leaderboard. This Aird Mhor bottling is not only a peaty dram itself, but was matured for 9 years in a cask that used to hold Laphroaig. The result is a whisky that marries together Ardmore's heathery smoke with a touch of the Islay stalwart's medicinal and fruity character. Flowers, fruit, smoke – it's got it all!

product_name:
Balblair 2005
Bot.2021 Exclusive To The Whisky Exchange
product_description: A 2005 Balblair single malt, matured in a single cask and bottled in 2021 exclusively for The Whisky Exchange. Aromas of ripe pears, green apples and sweet camomile fill the nose, complemented by notes of honeydew melons, lemon bon-bons, Pink Lady apples and vanilla throughout the palate, with hints of grapefruit lingering in the finish.

product_name:
Allt-a-Bhaine 1997 Sample
23 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A 1997 Allt-A-Bhainne single malt from indie bottler Watt Whisky, matured in a single ex-bourbon hogshead for 23 years. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Loch Lomond 2010
10 Year Old Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange
product_description:
A 2010 Loch Lomond single malt bottled in September 2020 exclusively for The Whisky Exchange, after a decade in a single first fill bourbon barrel. It's focused around fruity flavour, with everything from the special wine yeast used to ferment it to the unique straight-necked pot stills creating and concentrating estery fruity notes. Aromas of baked apple, custard, vanilla, flapjacks and pine needles fill the nose, followed by notes of pear drops, peppermint, apple skin, brambles, black pepper and buttery pastry throughout the palate.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Longmorn 1997 Miniature
21 Years Old The Whisky Exchange
product_description: After 21 years in a single hogshead, this miniature bottle of 1997 Longmorn has been bottled by The Whisky Exchange. A fruity, spicy Speyside whisky, aromas of raisins, sultanas and double cream compliment notes of sharp green apples, cinnamon and nutmeg on the palate.

product_name:
Highland Harvest
7 Casks Organic Blended Malt Whisky
product_description: The blended malt offering from Highland Harvest. Each batch is a blend of seven casks of Scotch Single Malt and as with the rest of their range, this is certified organic.

product_name:
Copperworks 3 Year Old
Batch 1 That Boutique-y Whisky Company
product_description: A three-year-old Copperworks American single malt from That Boutique-y Whisky Company, matured in virgin American oak casks. Aromas of apples, sweet oak and green spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of skittles, cask char and honey on the palate.

product_name:
Belize Rum Travellers Distillery 2007
13 Year Old Watt Whisky
product_description: A 2007 vintage rum from indie bottler Watt Whisky, distilled at Travellers Distillery in Belize and matured in an ex-bourbon barrel for eight years in Belize, before being transported to Europe for a further five years of aging. Bottled in 2020, it offers notes of toffee, liquorice, menthol and golden syrup throughout the palate.

product_name:
Balblair 2005 Sample
Bot.2021 Exclusive To The Whisky Exchange
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 2005 Balblair single malt, matured in a single cask and bottled in 2021 exclusively for The Whisky Exchange. Aromas of ripe pears, green apples and sweet camomile fill the nose, complemented by notes of honeydew melons, lemon bon-bons, Pink Lady apples and vanilla throughout the palate, with hints of grapefruit lingering in the finish.

product_name:
Drouet et Fils Poc'han 2011
7 Year Old Armorik Whisky Cask Finish
product_description: A 2011-vintage brandy from Drouet et Fils, Poc'han has been matured in in ex-Cognac casks for five years before spending two years in ex-Amorik French whisky casks. Aromas of sweet cereals, hay and oaky spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of maple syrup, apples, apricots, stewed fruits and roasted hazelnuts.
None
None

A luxurious wooden box, sized to fit most regular bottles. The perfect accompaniment for any spirits gift.


Internal Dimensions:


Height: 13.5" (343mm)


Width: 2.6" (67mm)


Depth: 2.3" (60mm).
None

product_name:
A Fine Christmas Malt 2020
19 Year Old
product_description:
A sherry-aged whisky specially selected by The Whisky Exchange team to celebrate Christmas 2020. It's packed with festive spice, Christmas cake, poached orchard fruit and zingy apples – an excellent all-rounder that's perfect for sipping by the fire.


This year's Christmas Malt is once again a limited edition and 1918 bottles are available.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: The English Gently Smoked Sherry Cask
product_description: A limited-edition single malt from The English, this softly smoky whisky has been matured in a sherry cask for seven years, before being bottled in August 2020. Soft, smoky aromas of raisins, candied orange peel, dates, marzipan, cherries and leather fill the nose, complemented on the palate by notes of dry oak spice, cinnamon, nutmeg, tobacco, cherries, dried fruit and honey, with wisps of smoke throughout.
None

product_name: The English Original, Smokey,Sherry Cask Miniature Gift Pack
product_description: A great introduction to The English Whisky Company – a triple-pack of miniatures with a bottle each of the Original, Smokey and Sherry Cask whiskies. The ideal showcase for this excellent Norfolk-based distillery.

Part of a three-bottle series celebrating the home county of the English Whisky Co, this is a single grain whisky with notes of fresh toffee popcorn, citrus and spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: The English Triple Distilled Peated Single Cask
product_description: A limited-edition peated English single malt from The English, distilled in 2010 and matured in a single refill bourbon barrel until February 2021. The palate is rich and creamy, with notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, savoury peat smoke, honeysuckle and baked apples that linger in the finish.

A popular fortified wine from The English Whisky Company. They shipped over some casks of PX sherry from Spain, used the casks to mature whisky, further fortified the wine with their single malt and then recasked it to mature for a little longer. It's not sherry but it is interesting.

product_name: Plain Black Lacquered Luxury Gift Box
product_description:
A luxurious plain black piano lacquered box, sized to fit most regular bottles. The perfect accompaniment for any spirits gift.


Internal Dimensions:


Height: 12.5" (32cm)


Width: 3.5" (9cm)


Depth: 3" (7cm).

product_name:
New Zealand 18 Year Old Double Wood
Wine Cask
product_description: An 18-year-old small-batch blended whisky distilled at the now-closed Willowbank Distillery, from the New Zealand Whisky Collection. Matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and French-oak New Zealand wine casks, this is a richly fruity and full-bodied whisky with notes of raisin, pineapple, soft caramel and lashings of spice.

product_name:
New Zealand South Island 25 Year Old
Half Bottle
product_description:
A 35cl bottle of 25-year-old whisky from the closed Willowbank distillery, which was operated in Dunedin on New Zealand's South Island until 1997. Notes of sweet malt and golden fruits are interspersed with gentle smoke and a light peat influence in this dram, which has spent its entire life in ex-bourbon barrels.


The Willowbank distillery was the last operational distillery in New Zealand and was closed by its then owners Fosters in 1997. Its stills were subsequently sent to Fiji for making rum.

Tasting Notes (1)
None

Ichiro Akuto, founder of Japan's Chichibu distillery, is not only one of the most respected distillers in the country, but he's also a master whisky blender. His Wine Wood Reserve is a blended malt containing Japanese whiskies from Chichibu that have been finished in red wine casks and Scottish whisky. The result is a rich and jammy dram with lots of complexity.

product_name:
Benrinnes 21 Year Old
Scotch Malt Sales
product_description: A 21-year-old single cask Benrinnes, originally bottled for our friends at Scotch Malt Sales for release on the Japanese market.

product_name:
Clynelish 18 Year Old
Sherry Cask TWE Retro Label
product_description: An 18-year-old Clynelish released for The Whisky Exchange Whisky Show 2014. Heavily sherried whiskies from Clynelish don’t come around very often, and this one carefully balances sherry fruit with the distillery’s famed fruity and waxy character.

An incredibly rare experimental malt from the folks at now closed Littlemill. They had an adjustable rectifier attached to their stills which gave them the ability to produce a number of different distillates. Dunglass, named Dunglas here due to someone not finishing the stencilling on the cask, is an oily, lightly peated spirit that has not been produced again.

product_name:
Longmorn 1974
33 Year Old Sherry Cask Laird Club

product_description:
The final entry in The Future of Whisky series, selected and bottled specially for the 10th Whisky Exchange Whisky Show. This bottle – The Future – is what we see the future of whisky being: old grain. Distilled at Invergordon in 1974, it's an old and elegant dram, with its long maturation adding layers of complexity.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Irish Single Malt 1989
Bot.2016 TWA+Three Rivers + Aren

product_description: An interesting single cask whisky bottled at cask strength in 2011 by The Whisky Exchange. Lochside produced both grain and malt whisky from its opening in 1957 until the early 1970s and this is a 'single blend' using only whisky from the distillery. Unusually, the whisky was blended before ageing, with the mix of grain and malt maturing in the same cask for 46 years. A very rare style from this now closed distillery.

Matured in a single Oloroso sherry cask, this 1981 Lochside was bottled by TWE in 2010 just shy of its 30th birthday. A dramatic old-school sherried Highlander, still very fresh, this needs a drop of water to reveal its full nutty, oaky, fruity, waxy majesty.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Isle of Jura 1999
5 Year Old Heavily Peated
product_description: An awesome bottling (by us) of Isle of Jura 1999, that bears no relation to the mostly gentle, easy-drinking distillery bottlings. This heavily-peated 5yo has been bottled at full natural cask strength in order that its visceral phenols can roar across your tastebuds in their full glory. For hardcore cask-strength peatheads only.

product_name:
Jamaica SMWS 5.2 (Appleton)
2002 10 Year Old Sherry Cask

SMWS 4.65 (Highland Park)
1987 11 Year Old London Members Room

product_description: An incredibly rare bottling from the now-closed Lowland distillery St Magdalene. This was distilled in 1980 and bottled 12 years later by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

The first ever SMWS bottling of Ben Nevis. Distilled in June 1966 and aged for 23 years before being bottled in September 1989. This was released in the same year the Japanese company Nikka bought the distillery.
A rare example of sherried 1966 vintage Inchgower from The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. Distilled in May, it was aged for 35 years in first fill sherry and bottled in June 2001 at an incredible 67.5%.

A rare bottle of Lomond single malt, one of only two bottlings of this single malt ever released and both are from the Scotch Malt Whisky Society, distilled in 1972. This whisky was made at Inverleven distillery using a Lomond still – a unique style of still that loosely resembles a hybrid between a traditional pot and column still.
A well aged Inchgower bottled by The Scotch Malt Whisky, the fourth such cask they bottled. This was distilled in November 1966 and bottled 27 years later in May 1994.

The 2nd ever cask that The Scotch Malt whisky Society bottled from Balmenach in Speyside. The cask managed to keep its strength over the 15 years of maturation, still being over 62% when bottled in 1989.

Tasting Notes (1)

The 6th cask of Coleburn that The Scotch Malt Whisky Society bottled and one of only nine they ever did. This was distilled just a year before the distillery closed for good and is therefore a real piece of history.

The 2nd cask bottled by The Scotch Malt Whisky Society from North Port (also known as Brechin). The distillery closed in 1983 and was dismantled in 1993. From the colour, we imagine this came from a sherry cask.
A 16 year old whisky from Coleburn, closed in 1985 and dismantled in 1996, from the Scotch Malt Whisky Society. It was distilled in March 1977 and bottled in October 1993 at a hefty 64.1% abv.

A 1977 vintage whisky bottled by the SMWS, produced at distillery 56, aka Coleburn - closed since 1985 and since dismantled. This was distilled in March and bottled 16 and half years later in October 1993.

A 2006 Linkwood single malt from independent bottler La Maison du Whisky, matured sherry-seasoned oak for 13 years before being bottled as part of its Artist Collective series. Floral aromas of lavender and violet are joined by liquorice, candied orange, dried mango and salted caramel on the nose, complemented by notes of hay, guava, mango and rose throughout the palate.

product_name:
Redbreast 2001
17 Year Old All Sherry Single Cask French Connections
product_description: A 2001 Redbreast Irish single pot still whiskey from French indie bottler La Maison du Whisky, matured in an oloroso sherry cask for 17 years. Aromas of oranges, toasted walnuts, star anise, black pepper, incense, clove, mango, apricot and flambéed banana fill the nose, complemented by notes of coconut milk, maple syrup, vanilla, lemon drizzle cake, rosemary and lime blossom throughout the palate.

product_name:
Tin Shed Distilling Co Batch 1
3 Year Old TBWC Australian Series
product_description: The first batch of Tin Shed Distilling Co. Australian single malt from That Boutique-y Whisky Company is a sweet, fruity whisky with notes of cherries, apricots, toasted malt and Bakewell tarts that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Coppersea Rye Batch 1
3 Year Old Boutique-y Whsiky Company
product_description: Coppersea is based in the Hudson Valley in New York, they grow and malt their own grain. This is a 100% rye whiskey and this is definitely not a shy and retiring Rye. With a lovely punchy spice and cherry wood, linseed oil notes, this is a distillery to keep a close eye on.

product_name:
Bunnahabhain Stoisha 2014
The Peaty Four Styles
product_description: This young Islay single malt from Bunnahabhain was bottled in 2018 for La Maison du Whisky's Four Styles series. The Peaty is a rich, smoky whisky with notes of vanilla, toasted oak, bonfire smoke and salty driftwood throughout the palate.

Part of La Maison du Whisky's Collective 2.0 series, this 10-year-old single malt from Craigellachie has been matured in 10 first-fill bourbon barrels. Fresh aromas of apples, pears, wet grass and ginger fill the nose initially, developing into rich scents of apricot, peach, honey and malty porridge. The palate offers lively notes of vanilla, ginger, crunchy green apples and zesty oranges, with a rich undercurrent of cocoa, liquorice and toasted oak.


The bottle and box feature a piece by Emilie Chapelais, entitled "Sur la Route".

product_name:
Bakery Hill Batch 1
5 Year Old TBWC Australian Series
product_description: A smoky Bakery Hill Australian single malt from That Boutique-y Whisky Company that was matured in an ex-bourbon cask for five years. This peated Australian whisky offers aromas of sweet peat, green banana, medicinal herbs and a touch of vanilla on the nose and echoed throughout the palate.

product_name:
Belgrove Batch 1
4 Year Old TBWC Australian Series
product_description: The first batch of Belgrove Australian rye whisky from That Boutique-y Whisky Company has been aged for four years creating aromas of barbecued pineapple, smoky agave, green apples, green banana and white pepper on the nose. The palate offers notes of lemon and honey tea, milk chocolate and fireplace embers that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Black Gate Batch 1 3 Year Old
TBWC Australian Series
product_description: The first batch of Black Gate Australian single malt from That Boutique-y Whisky Company is a three-year-old whisky that offers aromas of old, dusty books, red grapes, brown sugar and burnt caramel on the nose and echoed throughout the palate.

product_name:
Chichibu 2009
10 Year Old Artist International 10th Anniversary

Domaine Des Hautes Glaces 2016
Version Française
product_description: A 2016 Domaine Des Hautes Glaces from La Maison du Whisky's Version Francaise series, matured in a second-fill Saint Joseph cask. Aromas of lilies, nectarines, wax and honey fill the nose, complemented by notes of rich malt, white grapes, lemon, black pepper and raspberry throughout the palate.

product_name:
Ledaig 2007
13 Year Old Artist Collective 4.4 LMDW
product_description: A 2007 Ledaig single malt from indie bottler La Maison du Whisky, made at Tobermory Distillery and matured in refill sherry butts for 13 years, before being bottled as part of its Artist Collective series.

product_name:
Aultmore 2006
13 Year Old Artist Collective 3 LMDW
product_description: A 2006 Aultmore single malt from French indie bottler La Maison du Whisky, matured in a first fill sherry butt for 13 years before being released as part of its Artist Collective series. Sweet aromas of apricots, almonds, quince, vanilla, toffee and nectarine fill the nose, followed by black cherry, cocoa, ginger, heather honey and pine needles. The palate initially offers notes lime blossom, lemon verbena, apricot and orange zest, slowly developing malted barley, beeswax, hay, dark chocolate and exotic fruits that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Fradon Lot 70 Cognac
Through The Grapevine
product_description: Bottled for La Maison du Whisky's Through the Grapevine series, this Fradon Lot 70 Cognac offers notes of coconut, vanilla, honeysuckle and apricots throughout the palate.

product_name:
Vaudon 1996 Single Cask Cognac
Through the Grapevine
product_description: Bottled for La Maison du Whisky's Through the Grapevine series, this 1996-vintage Cognac was distilled by Vaudon, and matured in a handful of specially-selected casks. It offers notes of honey, quince jam, plums and oranges, before a lingering finish of lavender, star anise and dates.

The Fruity is a young Speyside single malt made at Mannochmore distillery, bottled in 2018 by La Maison du Whisky for its Four Styles series. Matured in first-fill bourbon barrels, it has notes of vanilla, red berries, green apples and sharp citrus throughout the palate – a fruity, fresh whisky that lives up to its name.

The Malty is a young Speyside single malt from Inchgower distillery, bottled in 2018 by La Maison du Whisky for its Four Styles series. Rich and malty, it has notes of milk chocolate, vanilla, caramel and sweet malt throughout the palate.

A young Speyside single malt from Auchroisk, The Oaky is one of four whiskies in La Maison du Whisky's Four Styles series. Full of rich, oaky spice and sweet vanilla notes, this whisky really lives up to its name.

product_name:
Tessendier Et Fils
Lot 97 Cognac TTG 3.0
product_description: Produced in Grande Champagne this Cognac is complex in flavour, it is powerful, original and fresh, but still shows the characteristics of more classic brandies. Bottled for La Maison Du Whisky’s Through The Grapevine series, this Cognac has aromas of apricots, citrus and sweet figs. The palate has notes of sweet and spicy candied ginger, strawberries and raspberries, and honey. The finish holds a more herbal note of thyme, alongside lighter floral notes.

product_name:
Camus 11 Year Old
Île de Ré TTG 3.0
product_description: Camus Ile de Re Fine Island Cognac is a delightful take on the classic Ile de Re Cognacs, bottled by La Maison Du Whisky for its Through The Grapevine series. Grown on the island, just of the coast of France’s Cognac region, the grapes used for making this spirit are very different from those grown on the mainland. Aged in lightly toasted oak barrels this Cognac has a sweet and fruity flavour profile, with aromas of caramel, peaches and mint on the nose. The palate holds notes of apricots, strawberries and oak, with a salty seaside element throughout.

product_name:
Camus 1973 Single Cask Cognac
Bons Bois
product_description:
A 1973 vintage Cognac from the legendary house Camus, which was created as an exclusive edition for Paris' La Maison du Whisky. This is a balanced, vibrant Cognac with intense floral, fresh fruit and vanilla notes, underscored by a backbone of baking spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Remi Landier
Lot 2005 Through The Grapevine Cognac LMDW
product_description: La Maison du Whisky bottled this Remi Landier Cognac as part of its Through The Grapevine series. The Cognac was aged in a 450-litre red oak cask and has a fruity, floral nose with more tropical notes on the palate, along with richer flavours of rum, coffee and honey.

product_name:
Vaudon Cask 78+80
Through The Grapevine Cognac LMDW
product_description: Full-bodied fragrance offers up a tempting trio of candied citrus peel, strong spice aromas and a touch of sweet vanilla. Following, we find a delightfully smooth palate where fresh orchard fruits and apple blossom dance with more vanilla on a supple honeyed undertow. All of this builds to a heady, floral finish – springtime in a glass with a sprinkling of chilli spice to keep you on your toes.

product_name:
Jean Fillioux Cognac
Cask 75 Through The Grapevine LMDW
product_description: This fruity, fresh bottling of Jean Filioux by the folks at La Maison Du Whisky highlights the light, energetic nature of good Cognac. Loud tropical fruit on the nose is tempered with time, brought down to earth with notes of pine bark, subtle clove and a distant touch of Christmas spice. Fruit carries well onto the palate with dark berries in abundance, hints of honey and a satisfying, wholesome mouthfeel. A wild success.

product_name:
Francois Voyer
Cask 88 Through The Grapevine Cognac LMDW
product_description: Early notes of strong flowers and spice on the nose open up to fresh, juicy fruits and guide us into a surprisingly creamy palate. Time on the tongue brings liquorice, dark sugar and a hint of earthy ginger before pushing floral flavours to the fore again for a ripe, blooming finish.

product_name:
Caol Ila 1995
20 Year Old Artist #7 LMDW
product_description: Part of French retailer La Maison du Whisky’s Artist series, this is a classic Caol Ila, aged for two decades. Expect textbook maritime notes, along with smoke, citrus and a touch of oiliness.

product_name: New Zealand Oamaruvian Cask Strength Double Wood
product_description: A cask strength New Zealand whisky, matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in French oak New Zealand wine casks, before being bottled in April 2018. Aromas of Port-soaked raisins, cherries, cloves, plums, pecans and almonds fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dried fruit, strawberries, almonds, nutmeg, liquorice and anise.

product_name:
New Zealand 1988 Single Cask
29 Year Old TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A rare single-cask release from closed New Zealand distillery Willowbank – the world’s southernmost distillery until its destruction in the late 1990s. Distilled in 1988 and bottled in 2017 exclusively for The Whisky Exchange, this is a rich, well-aged dram with all the fruity intricacy and deep-rooted wood influence one might expect from a whisky on the brink of its third decade. A fine, one-off bottling that won’t be around for long.

Tasting Notes (1)

Twice run through Jack Daniels’ trademark maple-charcoal filtration, Gentleman Jack is the statesman of the Jack Daniels range. Exhibiting an impressive mellow quality and a fullness of flavour at once bold and refined, Gentleman Jack is filled with flavours of fresh vanilla, sweet caramel and spicy oak – a universal favourite at the absolute peak of its maturity.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Legacy Sour Mash
Edition 3
product_description: A special limited-edition bottle of Jack Daniel's, celebrating a not-often discussed part of the whiskey's history: the days when it had a bright green and gold label. Back before 1904 this is what bottles of Jack looked like, although the distillery claim to have lost all records about why it looked like this. In the bottle, it's Old No.7, but at 43% ABV, giving it a more punch than the regular release. A must for collector's and fans of Jack Daniel's classic Tennessee style.
A giant of Canadian whisky, created in 1858 and spending six long years in oak before bottling for the smoothest possible flavour.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select
Tin Cage
product_description: A bottle of Jack Daniel's Single Barrel – a richer variation of Jack Daniels, with less sweetness and more power than the No.7 – presented in a stylish tin cage. A favourite in bars, this is a must for aficionados.

Michter's small-batch bourbon is named after a former 'oldest distillery in the USA', and is currently wowing the UK bar scene. Sweet, fruity and spicy, it packs in plenty of flavour.

Tasting Notes (2)

The sixth release in Jack Daniel's Master Distiller series is named after James Howard Bedford, who was Master Distiller at Jack Daniel's between 1988 and 2008, using his experience as a farmer as well as a distiller to create sweet and spicy whiskey.

The fifth edition of Jack Daniel's range of whiskey's honouring the company's master blenders. The fifth edition takes us all the way to the 1970s, and is bottled for the excellently named Frank Bobo. He helped build Jack Daniel's reputations through both the 70s and 80s, helping it to become the worldwide powerhouse it is today.
A mini of the cola-friendly American whiskey Jack Daniel's. The same familiar taste and quality, just even easier to carry on the move.

Originally released to commemorate the 120th anniversary of the opening of Jack Daniel's White Rabbit Saloon in Lynchburg, this special edition is now enjoying a more general release. The same great JD taste, but at a higher strength.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Legacy Sour Mash
Edition 2
product_description: The second edition of Jack Daniel's Legacy Sour Mash limited-edition whiskey features one of the very first predominantly black labels. In the bottle, it's Old No.7, but at 43% ABV it has slightly more punch than the regular release. A must for collectors and fans of Jack Daniel's classic Tennessee style.

product_name:
JP Wiser's Dissertation
Rare Cask Series
product_description: The next instalment in JP Wiser's limited release – and aptly-named – Rare Cask series. A rye-forward profile and a 46.1% ABV provide this whisky a thick, punchy profile full of sweet cereal flavours, rich toffee, plenty of oak spice and big clouds of airy vanilla floating overhead.

product_name:
Templeton Rye Signature Reserve
6 Year Old
product_description: A six-year-old rye whiskey from Templeton with aromas of red fruit and ginger, complemented by notes of honey, summer flowers and green rye spice throughout the palate.

product_name: Michter's US*1 Single Barrel Straight Rye
product_description:
This single-barrel rye whiskey from Michter's works a treat both neat and in cocktails. Peppery and spicy, this also displays refreshing orange notes, plus sweet toffee/butterscotch. Very moreish.

Tasting Notes (1) 

Please note


We cannot guarantee the specific barrel number or year of release of these bottles.

product_name:
Pike Creek 10 Year Old
Rum Finish
product_description: Pike Creek is regarded by many as among the best Canadian whiskies on the market. Now available in the UK after many years' absence, this 10 year old is finished in rum barrels.

There's a strong argument to be made for Jack Daniel's Old No.7 being the most recognisable whiskey on the face of the earth, and you don't get that kind of recognition without good reason.


Made to a recipe dating back more than a century, painstakingly filtered through maple charcoal for purity and flavour, and then matured in charred oak barrels, the classic JD's sweet and oaky flavour has inspired generations of drinkers to enjoy whiskey.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select Nosing Glass Pack
(45%)
product_description: A gift-pack from Jack Daniels, with a bottle of its Single Barrel Select bourbon and a nosing glass to enjoy this whiskey's robust and complex character.

Originally launched as a limited-edition travel-retail exclusive, Jack Daniel's No.27 Gold gained a wider release in Autumn 2015. Initially matured in virgin American white oak casks, it's been finished in maple-wood barrels and twice filtered though maple-wood charcoal, it's rich with extra notes of maple.

A miniature of Jack Daniel's Gentleman Jack. This is a mellower style of Jack, due to the fact is twice charcoal-mellowed, once before maturation and once after. Full bodied with fruity and spicy notes.

Tasting Notes (1)

A fragrant, sweet blended whisky from The Lakes Distillery, made with a combination of grain and malt Scotch whiskies from the Highlands, Speyside and Islay, as well as the The Lakes English whisky, finished in bespoke Moscatel wine casks. Aromas of jasmine, honeyed dates and orange blossom fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, manuka honey, orange and grapefruit throughout the palate.

A fruity, zesty and softly-smoky Japanese whisky, matured in mizunara oak casks. Aromas of orange peel, jasmine, soft cedar and coastal air fill the nose. The palate offers notes of earthy coffee, green apples, black tea and fresh herbs, with hints of cinnamon pastries and mango that linger in the finish.

A magnum bottle of Jack Daniel's best selling old no.7 Tennessee Whiskey, famous worldwide thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select
Miniature
product_description: A miniature bottle of JD's Single Barrel Select whiskey, matured in the highest racks of their warehouses where the temperature fluctuates the most to give it a more robust and complex flavour.
A blend of corn, malt and rye, this American whiskey is creamy with notes of butter, toasted marshmallows, fruit and exotic spice.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a French whisky from Version Française, this 2011 Eddu whisky has been made from buckwheat and matured in an ex-Cognac cask to create aromas of apple, pancakes and redcurrants that fill the nose, complemented by notes of tarte tatin, ginger, Breton cake, cinnamon, almond and exotic fruit throughout the palate.

A blended whisky from The Lakes Distillery, The One Port Cask Finish has been finished for a year in first-fill tawny Port casks, creating complex layers of rich fruit, warms spices and smoke on the nose. The palate offers notes of cherries, plums, nutmeg, black pepper and raisins that linger in the finish.

A bottling of The One blended whisky that has been finished in Pedro Ximénez and Oloroso sherry casks to add a layer of dried fruits and spices. The result is a stunning blend with notes of fresh ginger, toffee, nutmeg and wood smoke mingling with intensely fruity raisins. Creamier notes of vanilla and apples build to a lingering, complex finish.

A French whisky from Version Française, this 2011 Eddu whisky has been made from buckwheat and matured in an ex-Cognac cask to create aromas of apple, pancakes and redcurrants that fill the nose, complemented by notes of tarte tatin, ginger, Breton cake, cinnamon, almond and exotic fruit throughout the palate.

product_name: Jack Daniel's Legacy Edition Sour Mash
product_description: A special limited-edition bottle of Jack Daniel's, celebrating a not-often discussed part of the whiskey's history: the days when it had a bright green and gold label. Back before 1904 this is what bottles of Jack looked like, although the distillery claim to have lost all records about why it looked like this. In the bottle, it's Old No.7, but at 43% ABV, giving it a more punch than the regular release. A must for collector's and fans of Jack Daniel's classic Tennessee style.
A complex cask-strength American whiskey from Boondocks, this was aged for 11 years. Earthy and spicy with notes of cereal, milk chocolate and leather.

product_name:
Pike Creek 21 Year Old
Speyside Cask Finish
product_description: An innovative Canadian whisky that's been aged for 21 years and then finished in casks that previously held Scotch whisky from Speyside. It's far from a gimmick, however – taste it and you'll discover rich, fruity notes combined with warm spice, dry oak, prunes, hints of tobacco and a rich, honeyed butteryness. The Speyside finish has added depths of spice to what is already a pedigree whisky, and this is a fantastic dram for those with an adventurous palate.

product_name: Gooderham & Worts 17 Year Old Little Trinity Ltd Release
product_description:
A limited edition Canadian whisky bottled to commemorate the generosity of the distillery's founder, William Gooderham, who built a church next to his distillery so that his employees didn't have to pay the 'pay to pray' fees charged by churches elsewhere.


Gooderham's church was called Little Trinity and, fittingly, this whisky is a blend of three grains: corn, rye and wheat. The result is blissful layers of flavour, which range from green apple, menthol and apricot to cinnamon, toffee, oak and juniper. Sinfully good.
The Family Pack is a trio of Jack Daniels' miniature bottles, including Gentleman Jack and Single Barrel as well as the original Old No. 7.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Old No. 7
Small Bottle
product_description: A 20cl bottle of world-famous Jack Daniel's old no. 7. The same familiar taste and quality, just easier to carry on the move.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Old No.7
Half Bottle
product_description: A half bottle of Jack Daniel's best selling old no.7 Tennessee Whiskey, famous worldwide thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.

A terrific mix of sweet vanilla, warm popcorn, baking spice, blueberry and gentle oak notes, with hint of green herb. This 15-year-old Canadian whisky is a fantastic introduction to the JP Wiser's family – not to mention a great addition to your drinks cabinet. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Old No.7
Large T Shirt Gift Pack
product_description:
A great gift pack from Jack Daniel's that includes a bottle of the world-famous Old No.7 as well as a a Jack Daniel's T-shirt. The original all-conquering cola-friendly colossus, Jack Daniel's No. 7 commands a legion of fans worldwide, thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.


Please note


This product is only available with a large size T Shirt.

This is cask-strength edition of Kaiyo's Mizunara matured whisky. It's a rare beast, as there's not much Mizunara – Japanese oak – and only a tiny amount gets turned into whisky casks. It's worth the effort, as it adds a distinctly Japanese edge to the whisky, layering on incense-laden spiciness. Kaiyo go even further, shipping their casks out to sea for months before bottling to give them a gentle rock on the waves, getting even more flavour out of the wood.

A whisky for Canadian patriots and geography fans alike. This bottling of rich Canadian whisky, laden with citrus, vanilla, toffee and chocolate notes, celebrates the 200th anniversary of the use of the 49th parallel (the northern line of latitude) to denote the border between America and Canada.
Tatoosh Rye is made from a mashbill of 70% rye and 30% corn in Washington. A light yet complex rye with notes of spice, honey and pepper.
Known as 'the cowboy whisky', Pendleton is a range of Canadian whiskies. This is a 100% rye, made with Mount Hood spring water, this is sweet and spicy.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Old No.7
Half Litre
product_description: A 50cl bottle of the original all-conquering cola-friendly colossus, Jack Daniel's No. 7. It commands a legion of fans worldwide, thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.

A collaborative whiskey from High West, taking spirit from the USA and Scotland to produce a one-of-a-kind bottling.
