It's a blend of straight bourbon and rye, with high corn and rye mashbills respectively, with a peaty Scottish single malt. A superb combination of sweet corn, floral rye and smoky Scotch.
A litre bottle of the world's favourite American whiskey. Distilled to the same recipe for well over a hundred years in Lynchburg, Tennessee, it is superb as a long drink with cola.
A double magnum of the world's No.1 American whiskey, complete with an 'upside down' label so it's the correct way up when placed on an optic.
A very approachable blend of fine whiskies, Black Velvet is as smooth as the name would suggest and slips down almost alarmingly easily.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select Nosing Glass Pack
(47%)
product_description: A gift pack that includes a bottle of Jack Daniel's Single Barrel – a richer variation of JD, with less sweetness and more power than the No.7 – as well as a nosing glass. A favourite in bars, this is a must for aficionados.

product_name:
Canadian Club 6 Year Old
Distilled 1967 Bot.1970s

Sonoma County Black Truffle Rye
Half Bottle
product_description: This is the world's first black-truffle Rye whiskey. French Black Perigord truffles are steeped in spicy rye whiskey to create a spirit with a rich and creamy texture and notes of dates, mushrooms and honey. This will pair well with steak or blue cheese.

Old Punk is part of Corsair's experimental range. This is made by flavouring its whiskey with pumpkin, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and allspice, and then ageing it in American oak. A unique flavoured whiskey.

Tasting Notes (1)

A great looking bottle of Jack Daniel's Old No 7, with a tax stamp showing that it was bottled in the spring of 1960.


Please note


This is a collectible bottle. The whiskey is cloudy and we recommend that it not be consumed.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Crown Royal XR Extra Rare
LaSalle Distillery
product_description: A very special edition of Crown Royal released in 2012, XR was created using the last batch of rare whiskies from former owners Seagram's LaSalle distillery, which closed in 2003. This is a true one-off, unrepeatable bottling with a terrific reputation among fans of Canadian whisky.

Hibiki Japanese Harmony is a blend of Japanese malt and grain whiskies from Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. Presented in the brand's trademark 24-faceted bottle representing the Japanese seasons, this is light, approachable and moreish with enticing notes of orange peel and white chocolate.

Tasting Notes (2)

Johnnie Walker's most prestigious whisky. Probably THE most famous super-premium blend, made up of the finest old-aged malt and grain whiskies. The Cristal of the blended whisky world. Blue Label’s bold, multi-layered palate and silky delivery ensure that it sits unchallenged at the top of the Johnnie Walker pile.

Tasting Notes (2)

Johnnie Walker Gold Label was relaunched in 2012. Built around a core of single malt whisky from Clynelish, the Gold Label Reserve is a great addition to the line-up from master blender Jim Beveridge.

Tasting Notes (3)

Crested is the new name for Jameson's Crested Ten with an updated look, but the same blend. This is made with older aged Jameson with a high measure of pure pot-still whiskey in the mix, a fair proportion of which has been aged in sherry casks to add spicy sweetness.

Toki is a blended whisky from Suntory's three distilleries: Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. This is a round and sweet blend with a refreshing citrus character and a spicy finish.


'Toki' means 'time' in Japanese. Toki has a different composition to its sister blend, Suntory Hibiki, and its main components are Hakushu single malt and Chita grain whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old
product_description:
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable Scotch whiskies - and it's also one of whisky critic Jim Murray's favourite blends: 'If there is a silkier delivery on the market today, I have not seen it: this is sublime stuff...one of the world's most masterful whiskies back in all its complex glory'

Tasting Notes (2)

VAT 69 is a famous old brand of blended whisky, chosen by Sir Ernest Shackleton to accompany him on his Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition of 1914 'for medicinal and celebratory purposes', and also famously the favourite whisky of Captain Lewis Nixon of the 506th Parachute Infantry Regiment, immortalised in the book and TV series Band of Brothers.
One of the biggest names in the blending market, with over 6 million cases a year sold worldwide, Justerini & Brooks' blend never fails to deliver in style, quality and value for money.

Premium aged mix of some of Scotland's finest whiskies with an above-average proportion of malt and an extended ageing period producing a truly fine blend.

Tasting Notes (1)

A lovely gift set from Suntory, including a bottle of Toki whisky and a stylish highball glass. Toki is a blended whisky from Suntory's three distilleries: Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. This is a round and sweet blend with a refreshing citrus character and a spicy finish.


'Toki' means 'time' in Japanese. Toki has a different composition to its sister blend, Suntory Hibiki, and its main components are Hakushu single malt and Chita grain whisky.

An interesting twist on Johnnie Walker Black Label, Double Black was rolled out for general release in 2011 after a successful launch in travel retail. Double Black adds to the normal Black Label profile by including more Islay whisky and casks that have been heavily charred, giving a more intense flavour with a greater emphasis on smoke while keeping true to the sophisticated Johnnie Walker style.

Tasting Notes (3)

product_name: American Eagle Tennessee Bourbon 4 Year Old
product_description: A rich and creamy 4-year-old bourbon from American Eagle, the palate offers notes of toasted oak, vanilla, fudge, bittersweet orange and spicy white pepper.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Taster Pack (Red
Black Gold)
product_description: A Johnnie Walker tasting pack exploring three of its most iconic whiskies – Red Label, Black label and Gold Label Reserve.

A fantastic Japanese blend, made with aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's three distilleries. Spicy and sophisticated, this is great for catching people out at blind tastings. Recently awarded a Gold 'Editor's Choice' award from Whisky Magazine and picked up the top prize in its category at the World Whisky Awards 2010.

Tasting Notes (5)

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Blue Label
Small Bottle
product_description:
A 20cl bottle of Johnnie Walker's most prestigious whisky. Probably THE most famous super-premium blend, made up of the finest old-aged malt and grain whiskies. The Cristal of the blended whisky world. Blue Label’s bold, multi-layered palate and silky delivery ensure that it sits unchallenged at the top of the Johnnie Walker pile.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Blue Label
2 Glass Set
product_description:
A special gift pack of Johnnie Walker Blue Label, the crown jewel in the world's favourite range of blended Scotch whiskies. This sets comes with two tumblers and is packaged in a very handsome box.

Tasting Notes (2)

A rich and spicy rye whiskey, with one of highest rye ratios (95%) we've seen. Loaded with fruit and spice, it's a terrific rye for the price, and is just as tasty sipped neat as it is served in your favourite whiskey cocktail.

product_name:
Rittenhouse Bottled In Bond Straight Rye
100 Proof
product_description:
Very popular with rye aficionados, this must be tried by American whiskey enthusiasts. This complex, potent spirit is perfect for a rye Manhattan, and amazingly won 'World's Best American Whiskey' at the World Whisky Awards 2010, beating off competition from George T. Stagg.

Tasting Notes (1)
First produced in 1860 (when it was just 'The Grouse'), The Famous Grouse has been the No. 1 whisky in Scotland since 1980.

Legacy is a classic blended whisky from historic brand Something Special, with the malt component predominantly from Speyside. Sweet, complex and well balanced, this has notes of blackcurrant, raspberry, vanilla and caramel.

Formerly known as Platinum Label, this is a rich and refined blend of whiskies matured for at least 18 years that slips perfectly into the range just behind the iconic Blue Label.

Tasting Notes (4)

A special pot still whiskey-heavy version of Jameson. Black Barrel has lots of first-fill bourbon and sherry casks in the mix, giving it a much richer flavour than regular Jameson, with a strong sherried note.

Tasting Notes (2)

A spicy, sweet bourbon from Frey Ranch, made with a combination of corn, winter cereal rye, winter wheat and two-row barley grown in the Sierra Nevada Watershed. Aromas of orange, honey, cinnamon and candied peel fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, caramel, mint, banana, candy corn, hay and black pepper throughout the palate.
A miniature of the world's favourite Irish whisky, Jameson. One of Jim Murray's favourites, with 95 points in the Whisky Bible 2013.

A fruity, spicy Irish whiskey from Bushmills that has been matured in casks that previously held Dominican rum. Aromas of pineapple, mango and oak spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla custard, cream, caramelised pineapple and papaya throughout the palate.

product_name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Legendary Eight
product_description: A smooth, mellow whisky from Johhnie Walker, Legendary Eight is made with some of its rarest stocks from eight distilleries, including exceptionally rare whiskies from ghost distilleries. These distilleries are listed on the bottle and the box, with the whiskies coming from Oban, Blair Athol, Lagavulin, Teaninich, Port Dundas, Brora, Cambus and Carsebridge. Rich aromas of brown sugar, ripe fruit, green apple, lemon zest and soft peat fill the nose, complemented by notes of peaches, plums, stewed apples, dark chocolate and wisps of smoke that linger in the finish.

Hugely popular Irish blend, renowned for its affinity with ginger ale. The default springboard into the fascinating world of Irish whiskey, Jameson's quality has improved massively in the last 10-15 years and it's one of Jim Murray's favourites, with 95 points in the Whisky Bible 2013.

Tasting Notes (1)
Té Bheag, pronounced chey-vek, is a blended whisky with a high malt content. Rich with toffee notes and a light smokiness.

product_name: Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old Miniature
product_description: A miniature (plastic bottle) of the world's best-selling blended Scotch, Johnnie Walker Black Label

'Big, rounded, smooth. Full of crunchy maltiness. To drink this whisky is like biting into peanut brittle. Then toffee. Then liquorice flavours. 8.5/10' Michael Jackson, Whisky Magazine April 2000.


Big, rounded, smooth. Full of crunchy maltiness. To drink this whisky is like biting into peanut brittle. Then toffee. Then liquorice flavours. 8.5/10 Michael Jackson, Whisky Magazine April 2000
A bottle of a rich, dark, Irish blend, Black Bush contains a high proportion of triple-distilled single malt, aged in Oloroso sherry casks for around eight to 10 years before marriage with the grain.

Jameson Caskmates sees the reuse of old whiskey barrels. Nothing new in that, but in between, they've been used to age stout from Cork's Franciscan Well brewery. This has added notes of cocoa, coffee and butterscotch to this classic Irish whiskey.

Tasting Notes (1)
A mini bottle of Teacher's best-selling and long running blended Scotch whisky, Highland Cream, first introduced in 1884.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve
Glass Set
product_description: A lovely gift set from Johnnie Walker that includes a bottle of Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve as well as a pair of stylish glasses to enjoy your whisky in.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve
Bullion Bottle
product_description:
A limited edition gold-wrapped bottle of Johnnie Walker's Gold Label Reserve. Relaunched in 2012, it uses Clynelish as its core malt.

Tasting Notes (1)

A big and spicy rye from the folks at Templeton. A 95% rye mashbill, distilled in Indiana, with a lot of flavour that makes it a great sipping whisky, as well as being punchy enough for Old Fashioneds, Sazeracs and all of your other favourites.

Tasting Notes (1)

Another small-batch blend of fine rye whiskies distilled in a small copper pot still, this is a characterful, robust, smoky whisky with a pleasingly sweet palate.


Lot 40 is made at Hiram Walker Distillery in Canada, one of the largest spirits producers in North America.

A rich and chocolatey Irish whiskey from Teeling that has been finished in 200 Fathoms Imperial Stout casks from Galway Bay Brewery. Aromas of chocolate, rye spice, coffee and malt fill the nose, complemented by notes of creamy caramel, vanilla, orange, plum, chocolate biscuits and sweet malt throughout the palate.

Crisp, refreshing and unexpectedly smoky, Dewar’s Ilegal Smooth combines the defining flavours of two very different cultures to create something altogether more exciting. The first ever Scotch to be finished in ex-mezcal casks, this sweet and smoky dram is whisky as you’ve never tasted it before.

A limited-edition of Johnnie Walker Blue Label celebrating Johnnie Walker's 200th anniversary. This bottle features a limited-edition design, illustrating a visual journey of the world-famous whisky company since 1820.

A Perfect Measure sample of a blend from the king of independent Japanese distillers, Ichiro Akuto. In addition to whisky from his own Chichibu distillery, it also includes whiskies from America, Canada, Scotland and Ireland.

A small-batch edition of Cutty Sark, Prohibition celebrates the fact the brand was smuggled into America in the 1920s by Captain William McCoy. This is bottled at 50% and is presented in a black glass bottle with a cork seal, which was typical of bottles during the era.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old
2 Tumbler Glass Set
product_description: A special Johnnie Walker Black pack, providing a couple of solid Striding Man adorned tumblers to enjoy your whisky from.
A miniature of Johnnie Walker Red Label, first marketed as such in 1909. The world's most popular whisky, it is now sold in over 200 countries.
A miniature bottle of Famous Grouse. First produced in 1860 (when it was just 'The Grouse'), it has been the No. 1 whisky in Scotland since 1980.
Packaged in a traditional earthenware jug, this is a 100% straight corn whiskey distilled in Illinois and aged for three years.

A bottle of the 2013 relaunched Black Bottle. Owners Burn Stewart have decided to return the brand to its original 1879 roots, including the black glass that gave the blend its name. With less of a focus on Islay, there is less peatiness than hitherto, with the smoky flavours being balanced with increased fruitiness and elegance.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name: Willett's 4 Year Old Family Reserve Rye
product_description: A small-batch rye whiskey from Willet's, matured for four years in a handful of specially-selected casks. Layered aromas of cherry tart, cinnamon, baking spices and oak fill the nose. The palate offers notes of black cherries, burnt vanilla, baking spices and green rye.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve
200th Anniversary
product_description: In celebration of 200 years of Johnnie Walker whisky, Gold Label Reserve has been given a limited-edition new look. Built around a core of single malt whisky from Clynelish, this a great addition to the line-up from master blender Jim Beveridge.
The 2020 relaunch of the best-selling whiskey in the Republic of Ireland, Power's Gold Label has a spicy potstill character and is aged between 5 and 6 years in Bourbon casks.

A sweet, tropical blended Irish whiskey, this Tullamore D.E.W. has been finished in Caribbean rum casks. Aromas of vanilla, oak, citrus, ripe bananas and delicate spices mingle on the nose, and the palate offers notes of caramel, banana bread, dates and raisins.

Too often pitched as opposite extremes on the Scotch whisky flavour spectrum, peat smoke and sweetness can actually work together remarkably well. This fact is exemplified in Sweet Peat from Johnnie Walker, which blends powerful peat and citrus flavours with sweet Speyside character and a luscious sherried note. The result is a flavour profile full of rich caramel and vanilla flavours, a light spiciness and wisps of warming wood smoke.

Bushmills is a very traditional distillery and its rare to see a new expression – this was the first to appear for almost five years! It's a sweet and buttery dram with lots of vanilla and cream, as you'd expect from its maturation in bourbon casks, with lots of first-fill in the mix.

product_name:
John Walker & Sons Private Collection
2015 Edition
product_description:
The second bottling in the John Walker & Sons Private Collection series, continuing the themes of the incredibly limited Directors' Collection and offering these small batch editions of Johnnie Walker to a wider audience. This edition, titled 'Rare Fruit Character', focuses on the fruity flavours within the Johnnie Walker range, with the 29 casks that make up the blend chosen to emphasise that part of the classic Walker character.

Tasting Notes (1)
A mini bottle of Bushmills's no age statement Original blended Irisih whiskey.

product_name:
Royal Salute 21 Year Old
Blue Ceramic Miniature
product_description: A miniature of Royal Salute's 21 year old blended Scotch whisky packaged in blue ceramic.

'The blend for grown-ups, for people who have made their rites of passage and are ready to enjoy their success. Sweet, but not cloying. Buxom, but not overblown. Balanced. 9/10.' Paul Pacult in Whisky Magazine April 2000

Amahagan World Malt Edition No.3 is a Japanese malt whisky from Nagahama distillery, that has been finished in Mizunara wood. Aromas of orchard fruits, juicy oranges, sweet caramel and fragrant oak fill the nose, complemented by notes of Terry's Chocolate Orange, dark chocolate and citrus throughout the palate.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker 18 Year Old
Glass Set
product_description: A lovely gift set from Johnnie Walker, including a bottle of Johnnie Walker 18 Year Old and a pair of stylish glasses.
A sweet and spicy bourbon from Sadler's, Peaky Blinder has aromas of cinnamon, raisins and bananas on the nose, while the palate offers notes of Christmas cake, pecans, toffee and pastry.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ghost and Rare
Glenury Royal
product_description: The 2019 addition to Johnnie Walker's Ghost and Rare series focusses on the spirit and character of closed distillery Glenury Royal. Combining grain whisky from Cameronbridge distillery with rare single malts from Glen Elgin, Inchgower and Glenkinchie, Ghost and Rare balances Glenury Royal's fruity, sweet notes of apple and apricot with dark fruits, bitter chocolate and nuts, as well as creamy toffee and butterscotch flavours from the grain whiskies.

The second release in Jameson Caskmates range, finished this time in casks that once held zesty IPA. The combination adds further layers of hop fruitiness to the whiskies already fruity character as well as a touch of citrus, floral notes and some balancing bitterness. Perfect for a boilermaker – sip of IPA, sip of Jameson Caskmates, repeat.

A Chivas Regal edition that pays homage to Japanese whisky makers and whisky drinkers. This is a blend of malt and grain whiskies, some of which have been married in Mizunara oak: Japanese oak that is rare and highly regarded for its impact on whisky.
Now sporting the 'triple-matured' moniker, this is Whyte & Mackay's big-selling entry-level blended whisky. High quality and a great way to start working your way up through the rest of their range.
Famous Grouse Smoky Black was renamed from Black Grouse at the end of 2015. This blend is based on peated Islay malts, and offers 'reassuring smoothness with aromatic, peaty flavours'.

Tangle Ridge is made from 100% Candian rye, aged for 10 years in oak, blended with small amounts of sherry and vanilla, before a marrying period in ex-bourbon barrels. A mellow and sweet whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)

The Irishman Founder's Reserve was the first blend created by Bernard Walsh. A combination of 70% single malt and 30% single pot still whiskeys, it's triple distilled and aged in bourbon casks. Jim Murray awarded it 93 points, calling it 'a quite wonderful blend'.

Tasting Notes (1)

The second creation of Cutty's master blender Kirsteen Campbell, following up the rich and unctuous Tam O'Shanter with something all the more eleegant - a fantastic mix of tropical fruity flavours with a hint of sherry spice.

product_name: Royal Salute 21 Year Old Signature Blend
product_description: One of the jewels in the Chivas crown, Royal Salute was created to celebrate the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. This 21 Year Old is a robust and sophisticated whisky, with fruity aromas and delicate floral spices. It is presented in a unique porcelain flagon, painted with a sapphire glaze reminiscent of the gems set within the Imperial State Crown.

Johnnie Walker Red Label was launched in its current form by brothers George and Alexander Walker in 1909, though it had existed as Walker's Special Old Highland Red Label for some years previously. Alexander blended a type of whisky which is more suited to mixing with soda than the heavier, more old-fashioned whiskies, and named it after his grandfather, who had started the family business in 1820. Today it is the world's most popular whisky and is sold in more than 200 markets world-wide.

Tasting Notes (2)

Despite the fact that the label is quite clearly a pale yellow colour, Dewar's White Label this remains a hugely popular blend, especially Stateside. Dewar's whiskies have won more than 400 awards and medals in over 20 countries.

Tasting Notes (1)

Named for the historic ship, Cutty Sark is a blend that's been around since 1923. It has whisky from Glenrothes at its core along with whisky from all over Scotland to give a rounded blend with a little bit of smoke.

Enormously popular blend that has come on in leaps and bounds over the last ten years. Bell's signature malt is from Blair Athol, with contributions from the likes of Caol Ila, Glenkinchie, Dufftown and Inchgower.

product_name: Starward Ginger Beer Cask Projects #5 Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of batch number five of Australian distillery Starward's Projects series. Sourced from the nearby Boatrocker brewery, Starward has used casks that previously held fiery ginger beer to finish their whisky, creating sweet notes of crystalised ginger, cinnamon, caramelised banana and fiery root ginger.

A rich and complex blended Scotch whisky from John Walker & Sons, Celebratory Blend honours the history of the one of the biggest names in whisky. The palate offers notes of marzipan, cinnamon, nutmeg, dried fruit, roast walnuts and soft peat, with hints of black pepper lingering in the finish.

A Danish rye whisky from Stauning, Bastard is made with locally-sourced grains and is distilled in a flame-heated pot still. After three years in Virgin American oak casks, it was transferred to ex-Oro de Oaxaca mezcal casks where it spent six months, before being bottled in August 2020. Aromas of sweet pipe tobacco, smoke, raisins, oranges, oak and oatcakes fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, dried fruit, cinnamon, shortbread and brown sugar throughout the palate.

A rich Danish rye whiskey from Stauning, made with a combination of local rye and barley, and matured in virgin American oak barrels. Aromas of freshly-baked rye bread, wine gums and pepper fill the nose, complemented by notes of dried fruit, ripe cherries, vanilla and citrus throughout the palate.

product_name: Two Stacks Peated Single Malt Stout Cask
product_description: A peated Irish whiskey from Two Stacks that has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-imperial stout casks, creating a complex, well-balanced character. Aromas of honeydew melons, sweet barley, rhubarb, peach, toffee and soft peat smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of honey, dry peat, white peaches, dark chocolate and creamy vanilla throughout the palate.

product_name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Rare Side of Scotland
product_description: A limited-edition Blue Label blended whisky from Johnny Walker, Rare Side of Scotland features illustrations from Glasgow-based design studio Timorous Beastie that celebrates the beauty of Scotland's flora and fauna. Mellow and rounded aromas of dry smoke and sweet raisins fill the nose, with notes of hazelnuts, honey, rose petals, orange and aromatic smoke on the palate.

Chivas Regal's 15-year-old blended whisky, luxuriously fruity and sweet thanks to careful cask selection, including some whisky that has been finished in Grande Champagne Cognac casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

The second Farmstock release from WhistlePig, the second step on the journey to producing a whiskey entirely grown, distilled and matured on site at the eponymous farm. This release is a vatting of 32% WhistlePig farm rye whiskey aged for 2-2.5 years, 45% MGPI rye aged for 5-6 years and 23% Alberta Distillers Canadian rye aged for 10 years. The WhistlePig rye gives a fresh and spicy kick to the older whiskey, which plays a supporting role, providing an elegant backdrop for the zesty spirit to dance on.

Tasting Notes (1)

The 15-year-old version of Togouchi's blended whisky. A combination of whiskies from Canada and Scotland, which are blended together and aged in a Japanese railway tunnel. Nutty, chocolatey and spicy.
Hankey Bannister Original is a light, sweet and subtle blend with notes of honey and spice.
A miniature bottle of Nevis Dew, produced by the same company behind the Ben Nevis single malt. All whisky used for this blend is guaranteed to be at least 12 years old.
A litre bottle of equally massively popular blended whisky Famous Grouse. Created in 1860, it has been Scotland's most popular Scotch since the 1980s and still is, as of the 2010s.

The revived version of the famous blend from the now-deceased Seagram's conglomerate. The 'VO' apparently stands for 'Very Own' as the blend was initially conceived for the private use of the Seagram family.

A stunning 12 year-old blend from Hibiki, some of the whisky has been part-matured in plum liqueur casks. Lovely malt from Hakushu and Yamazaki, plus some aged grain from Chita, this terrific Japanese blend picked up the top prize in its category at the World Whisky Awards 2010.

Tasting Notes (1)
A miniature bottle of Tullamore Dew – a resoundingly popular Irish blend, particularly in overseas markets, where it is second only to Jameson. Very approachable.
A mini bottle of one of the world's favourite blended Scotch whiskies, Chivas Regal.
A miniature of Black Bottle blended whisky.
A miniature bottle of popular blended Scotch whisky, Bell's

Tullamore Dew is a resoundingly popular Irish blend, particularly in overseas markets, where it is second only to Jameson. Very approachable.

Tasting Notes (1)
Grant's award winning flagship blend, first created in 1898 by William Grant and these days based around grain whisky from Grant's own Girvan distillery.
Nevis Dew Special Reserve is a blended whisky containing a proportion of malt from Ben Nevis Distillery, who produce the blend.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of limited-edition blended whisky from Compass Box, Rogues' Banquet is a blend of a refill hogshead, a recharred barrel, recharred hogsheads and grain whisky matured in a first-fill bourbon barrel. The palate offers notes of softened tropical fruits, spicy ginger and creamy pastry that linger in the finish.

product_name: WhistlePig PiggyBack 6 Year Old Rye Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a six-year-old rye whiskey from WhistlePig – PiggyBack is made with 100% rye and matured in American oak barrels for six years before being bottled at 96.56 proof. Aromas of cinnamon, black pepper, grapefruit and tangerine fill the nose, complemented by notes of cocoa, cardamom, leather, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla throughout the palate.

Writers Tears Double oak marries both single malt and single pot still whiskies that have been matured in American oak casks and French oak Cognac casks from France's Allary Cooperage. Aromas of stewed fruits, earthy vanilla and apple crumble fill the nose, complemented by notes of white peaches, lychee, lemon peel, grapes and dark chocolate throughout the palate.

A well-balanced blended Irish whiskey from West Cork Distillers, Black Cask is aged in first-fill bourbon casks for three years and finished for a further year in heavily charred bourbon casks. The palate is a balance of black pepper spice, creamy vanilla, fiery ginger and caramel, with hints of orange lingering in the finish.

Blended from up to 40 different single malt and grain whiskies, each aged individually and again once married together, all before being finished in the finest Caribbean ex-rum casks, Dewar’s Caribbean Smooth is an easy-drinking and impressively flavourful whisky.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of spicy, sweet bourbon from Frey Ranch, made with a combination of corn, winter cereal rye, winter wheat and two-row barley grown in the Sierra Nevada Watershed. Aromas of orange, honey, cinnamon and candied peel fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, caramel, mint, banana, candy corn, hay and black pepper throughout the palate.
An unusually delicate rye whiskey from FEW, infused with 8 Immortals Oolong tea, creating notes of peach, honey and dragon fruit alongside grass, white pepper and ginger throughout the palate.

A bold and flavourful blend from Compass Box that pays tribute to the blenders of the late 19th century. The palate offers notes of soft fruits, ripe peaches, plums, baked apples and vanilla, as well as toasted oak spice.

product_name: Johnnie Walker Blue Year of the Ox
product_description: A limited-edition bottling of Johnnie Walker Blue Label celebrating Chinese New Year and the Year of the Ox. The bottle features artwork from award-winning artist Shirley Gong, with the ox symbolising prosperity, growth and good fortune.

product_name:
JJ Corry The Hanson Sample
Batch 2
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the second batch of JJ Corry The Hanson, bottled in 2020, is a blend of three casks of grain whiskey from different distilleries in Ireland. The result is a bright, fruity whiskey with notes of rich oak, smooth vanilla, toast, apples, pineapple, lively citrus and rhubarb.

The second batch of JJ Corry The Hanson, bottled in 2020, is a blend of three casks of grain whiskey from different distilleries in Ireland. The result is a bright, fruity whiskey with notes of rich oak, smooth vanilla, toast, apples, pineapple, lively citrus and rhubarb.

This oaky, complex rye whiskey has been double-matured in toasted oak casks, creating aromas of baking spices, orange peel and warm cinnamon on the nose. The palate offers notes of caramel and toasted coconut, hazelnut, pecan, vanilla and cinnamon that linger in the finish.
A classic rye whiskey from Sagamore Spirit, with aromas of vanilla, caramel and baking spices on the nose. The palate offers notes of candied orange peel, clove, nutmeg, walnut and brown sugar.

A rich and nutty 15-year-old blended whisky from Dewar's, The Monarch is a combination of whisky matured in both bourbon and sherry casks. Balanced aromas of sherry spice, green apple peel and roasted nuts fill the nose. The palate offers notes of walnut, fresh malt, sultanas and chewy vanilla toffee.

product_name:
Royal Salute 29 Year Old
PX Sherry Cask Finish
product_description: A limited-edition 29-year-old blended whisky from Royal Salute, matured exclusively in Pedro Ximénez sherry casks. Well-rounded and full, it offers notes of oranges, liquorice, sandalwood, honey, ripe plums, treacle and toffee.

A deliberate divergence from tradition, this is a big, bold bourbon built to satisfy your sweet tooth. Chocolate, butterscotch and hints of banana simmer down to a finish sprinkled with coffee, nuts and lashings of maple syrup. It's a sundae in a whiskey glass, and we love it.

A Canadian whisky created to celebrate the spirit of the American cowboy. Made by Hood River Distillers in Oregon, Pendleton Midnight is a blend of three- to six-year-old Canadian whiskies, including that aged for more than six years in American brandy barrels, which is brought to bottling strength by the addition of glacier-fed spring water from Mount Hood in Oregon.


Floral, fruity and buttery, this has notes of peaches, toffee, sultanas, warming spices and nuts.

Kakubin Yellow Label is Suntory's flagship blended whisky. Produced since 1937, its name means 'square bottle'. A blend of bourbon-cask whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, this is a classic example of lighter Japanese whisky and is great in a highball with soda.

product_name:
John Walker & Sons Private Collection
2016 Edition
product_description:
The most complex edition to date, 2016 is third bottling in the John Walker & Sons Private Collection series, continuing the themes of the incredibly limited Directors' Collection and offering these small batch editions of Johnnie Walker to a wider audience. This edition, titled 'Fine Honeyed Notes', focuses on the sweeter flavours within the Johnnie Walker range, with some of the 100 casks coming from four closed grain distilleries – Caledonian, Cambus, Carsebridge and Port Dundas.

Tasting Notes (1)

Crown Royal Northern Harvest Rye is made with 90% rye. This is gently spicy with soft pepper, vanilla and butterscotch notes.

Tasting Notes (1)
Bank Note is a 5-year-old blended Scotch from independent bottler A.D. Rattray. A mix of 40% malt whiskies from Speyside and Highlands, with 60% grain from the Lowlands
A litre bottle of Scots Bard blended whisky, named for Scotland's national poet - Robert Burns.
An easy drinking whisky from the folks behind Sheep Dip, allegedly named for being 'as soft as a pig's nose'. It's a blend with a high malt content and a youthful, fruity edge.
A well-known blend, reputedly named after a gregarious travelling sales rep for the distillery who made sure that everyone who crossed his path tried a glass.

A rich and chewy entry in the Jameson range, with three styles of pot still spirit carefully balanced to produce a complex whiskey with spice, fruit and elegant oak.

Tasting Notes (1)
Grain whiskey reserved for Bushmills Original is slowly matured for a minimum of five years in American oak casks before blending with Irish Single Malt to produce this popular whiskey.

Old Smuggler is a long running blended whisky, first bottled back in 1835. Named in honour of the whisky smugglers who traded around the Scottish islands back in those days it's still popular today, especially in Argentina and Belgium(!).
A bottling of Queen Anne blended whisky from the 1980s, first produced in the 1880s and now increasingly hard to find.

product_name:
Haig & Haig 12 Year Old
Bot.1944 Spring Cap
product_description: This stock came from a large parcel we purchased from the USA. All the bottles were in original wooden cases from rotation 1944. A truly superb whisky that has a high malt content. The whiskies inside this blend were distilled in the early 1930s and the liquid is truly superb.

Blended from more than 50 single malts (with particular emphasis on Miltonduff and Glenburgie) as well as 4 single grain whiskies. Ballantine's Finest is a smooth, satisfyingly modern blend, now picking up serious momentum in overseas markets under owners Chivas Brothers.


Please note


There are various presentations of this limited release, so the bottle you receive may not look exactly as photographed.

A smooth, well-balanced deluxe blend with the mellowness expected from a top-quality brand. Each whisky has a minimum age of 12 years, selected to combine all the strengths and subtleness of Scottish whisky at its best.
A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 100% straight corn whiskey distilled in Illinois and aged for three years.

Another brand with a long and illustrious history, named after a famous Edinburgh hostelry. Containing around 40% malt whisky, White Horse has a pleasing honeyed palate accompanied by peaty undertones. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name: Bushmills Caribbean Rum Cask Finish Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a fruity, spicy Irish whiskey from Bushmills that has been matured in casks that previously held Dominican rum. Aromas of pineapple, mango and oak spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla custard, cream, caramelised pineapple and papaya throughout the palate.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of an unusually delicate rye whiskey from FEW, infused with 8 Immortals Oolong tea, creating notes of peach, honey and dragon fruit alongside grass, white pepper and ginger throughout the palate.

product_name:
Amahagan Edition No 2
Red Wine Finish
product_description: The second release of Amahagan World Malt from Nagahama Distillery in Japan, Edition No.2 has been finished in ex-red wine casks. Aromas of sweet malt, digestive biscuits, raisins, plums, strawberries and raspberries fill the nose, complemented by notes of cranberries, toasted oak, cherries, cinnamon, black pepper and floral honey throughout the palate.

product_name:
Whyte & Mackay 15 Year Old
Select Reserve

product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of Peter Dawson Special Blended Scotch Whisky from the 1980s – an well-priced introduction to how blends tasted a few decades ago. Peter Dawson owned Auchnagie distillery and built Towiemore, both now lost, and also bottled whisky from Ord up until the 1980s. In the 1920s, the company joined the Distillers Company Ltd and became the name behind a selection of blended whiskies, including this Peter Dawson Special.

product_name: Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve Sample
product_description: Johnnie Walker Gold Label was relaunched in 2012. Built around a core of single malt whisky from Clynelish, the Gold Label Reserve is a great addition to the line-up from master blender Jim Beveridge. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name: Jeptha Creed Straight Four Grain Bourbon Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a sweet and spicy bourbon from Jeptha Creed, Straight Four Grain is made with a combination of 70% Bloody Butcher corn, 15% malted rye, 10% malted rye and 5% malted barley. Aromas of vanilla cream, geraniums, hydrangea, dried apricots, red berries, peach cobbler and blackberry jam fill the nose, complemented by notes of nutmeg, clove, toasted pecans and mint throughout the palate.

A full, smoky blended whisky from Compass Box, Glasgow Blend is a combination of whiskies matured in first-fill sherry butts, first-fill bourbon barrels, refill barrels and custom French oak casks to create a complex character. The palate offers notes of fruitcake, sweet spices, salty smoke and burning embers that linger in the finish.

A fruity, sweet Irish whiskey from Sailor's Home, The Journey is a combination of whiskies that have been matured in bourbon barrels and virgin American oak barrels, and finished in a combination of bourbon barrels and Jamaican rum casks. Aromas of fudge, coffee, vanilla custard and sweet apricot preserve fill the nose, complemented by notes of apple crumble, cinnamon and banana bread throughout the palate.

This whisky has been specially blended for the House of Lords, using a combination of bourbon and sherry cask whiskies from the Highlands, Islay and Speyside. The palate offers notes of raisins, dried apricots, heather honey and soft smoke that lingers in the finish.

A cask strength rye whiskey from Sagamore Spirit, this bold, complex whiskey is packed with flavour. Aromas of cinnamon, clove and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, black pepper, brown sugar and honey on the palate.

A gift pack including a bottle of the 2013 relaunched Black Bottle, as well as a tumbler. Owners Burn Stewart have decided to return the brand to its original 1879 roots, including the black glass that gave the blend its name. With less of a focus on Islay, there is less peatiness than hitherto, with the smoky flavours being balanced with increased fruitiness and elegance.

A straight rye whiskey from Bob Dylan's Heaven's Door range, finished in toasted oak cigar barrels from Vosges, France. It is full of orange peel, bright tropical fruit, coriander and spice notes and has already won a clutch of gold medals at spirits competitions over the past two years.


The distinctive artwork on the bottle is a replica of metalwork crafted by Bob Dylan at his studio, Black Buffalo ironworks.

A 10-year-old Black Bottle blended whisky, released in January 2020 after a decade in American oak casks – the first release from the brand in over 20 years. Aromas of honey, ripe fruit and vanilla burst through the nose, complementing rich notes of oak, soft fruit and smoky spice on the palate.

A half bottle of three-year-old single malt from New Zealand's Cardrona distillery, Just Hatched is a marriage of whiskies matured in ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks. The palate offers notes of borage flower, vanilla, oak spice and honey.

A limited-edition blended whisky from popular indie bottler and blender Compass Box, The Circle is a marriage of four different whiskies, matured in different types of casks. The core is a fruity, creamy whisky from Tamdhu distillery, that has been matured in a first-fill bourbon barrel, it is supported by sherry-matured whisky from Clynelish. A smoky edge is provided by whisky from Orkney, matured in a re-charred American oak hogshead, and a lighter element is found in a blended whisky, matured in custom French oak casks.

product_name:
WhistlePig Amburana Rye
12 Year Old TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A specially-selected whiskey bottled just for The Whisky Exchange. When we tried a sample of this rare amburana-matured whiskey, we immediately asked WhistlePig if we could have some as an exclusive, and after much begging they said yes. This 12-year-old Indiana-distilled rye whiskey was finished by WhistlePig in a a cask made of south-American amburana wood. It's very rarely seen in whisky-making, more commonly being used to age cachaca, and it adds a unique fragrant character to the whiskey that makes it like nothing else. A must-try for all fans of American whiskey.

Tasting Notes (1)

A rye whiskey bottled under the reinvigorated James E Pepper label. James's grandfather has a claim to having opened the first Kentucky Distillery in 1776, but the James Pepper brand really hit its height in the early part of the 20th century, although it had disappeared by the latter parts. It's now back with this bourbon-esque, fruity rye whiskey.

A mixture of corn, wheat and rye spirit, this bourbon is made by Reservoir distillery in Virginia. It has a smooth, sweet and well-balanced flavour, with aromas of vanilla and tobacco on the nose. The palate holds candied cinnamon, toasted oak and butterscotch.

Made with a 100% rye mash bill, this rye whiskey holds an intense, spiced profile without too much sweetness. The nose holds caramelised sugar, rye spice and citrus notes, and the palate brings out notes of dark chocolate, anise and spicy black pepper.

product_name:
Grand Old Parr De Luxe
12 Year Old Bot.1980s

product_description: An award-winning NAS blend from Ben Nevis which started life as a declaration of new beginnings at the turn of the millennium. A complex and full-bodied blend full of wafting vanilla atop a fresh, herbaceous foundation, Blue Label became a permanent fixture in the Ben Nevis range thanks to its persisting popularity.

Released in 2019, The Tweeddale Evolution Blend is a combination of classic Speyside whiskies and a sweet Lowland grain whisky. The oldest whisky in the Tweeddale range, Evolution has been matured for 28 years, creating aromas of juicy black fruits, lemon zest and butter-cream icing. The palate offers rich notes of fruit cake, blackcurrant, pears and cinnamon.

product_name:
Catoctin Creek Roundstone Rye
Cask Strength
product_description: This award-winning Virginian rye whiskey from Catoctin Creek is dark and rich, with plenty of spice in the form of aniseed and pepper. There’s also notes of toasty oak, toffee and candied citrus. Bottled at cask strength of 58%, a little water will unlock even more aromas and flavours.

This award-winning rye whiskey from Virginia’s Catoctin Creek offers plenty of spice, along with toasty oak, a hint of mint and ginger. Bottled at 92° proof (46% ABV) for more punch and robustness. Use this in place of bourbon for a spicier take on your favourite whiskey cocktails.

A 1980s bottling of Chivas Regal 12yo, still one of the best-selling blended whiskies in the world. These 1980s bottles still have the easy-drinking Chivas character, but have a bit more weight to them – an excellent place to start experiencing the style of old-school blended whiskies.
A subtly spicy blended whisky from Japan, with notes of orchard fruits and caramel.

The first release of Farmstock Crop from WhistlePig includes some whiskey distilled on the brand's own farm in Vermont. Mixed with whiskey distilled in Canada and Indiana, this is sweet and spicy with notes of caramel, cinnamon and baking spices.
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Rye is the brand's first new mash bill in 150 years. The use of 70% rye adds extra spice to notes of ripe fruit and toast.

product_name:
Rittenhouse Bottled In Bond Straight Rye Sample
100 Proof
product_description: This is a highly acclaimed rye from Rittenhouse. Rich and spicy with hints of orange and honey, this makes a superb Manhattan.

product_name:
Thomas H Handy Sazerac Rye
Bot.2014
product_description: The 2014 cask-strength rye-based release from Buffalo Trace's much anticipated annual Antique Collection series. Always highly regarded, the 2012 edition won World Whisky of the Year in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2013.

A blended Irish whiskey, Clontarf Classic was originally a 100% grain whiskey from Cooley, but these days the product has a very small amount of malt in it, with the grain supplied by Irish Distillers (top inside info from Jim Murray's Whisky bible there - JM gives it 86 points).

Sonoma County Rye is produced by the eponymous distillery in the town of Rohnert Park in California. Distilled in pot stills heated by direct fire, this is aged in American oak barrels and bottled unfiltered.
A miniature bottle of Robert Burns blended whisky from Arran distillery, which opened in 1995 and continues to go from strength to strength.

product_name:
Suntory Hibiki 12 Year Old
Half Litre
product_description: A 50cl bottle of Suntory's excellent Hibiki 12yo, the starting point of the Hibiki range. It's a fantastic example of a Japanese style blended whisky: sweet and perfumed. Along with grain from Chita and malt from Yamazaki they use some whisky matured in plum wine casks in the mix.

product_name:
Great King Street Artist's Blend
Compass Box Half Litre
product_description: The first in Compass Box's Great King Street range, named for the address of their Edinburgh office, kicking off their second decade in business. The Artist's Blend is a high-malt-content blend designed to be easy drinking and appealing to a wide range of consumers, from non-whisky drinkers and cocktail lovers through to single malt fanatics – this is full of Compass Box innovation and flair.
A no-age statement blended straight rye whiskey from Utah's High West Distillery Co., Rendezvous has already picked up a gold at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition.
Armorik Breizh is a blended whisky from the Warenghem distillery in Bretagne, France. The blend has a very high malt content of 50%.

product_name:
Tullamore Dew 12 Year Old
Special Reserve
product_description: A 12yo blended Irish whiskey from duty-free favourite Tullamore Dew, Special Reserve has been assembled from a mixture of bourbon and oloroso sherry casks.

A very handsomely-presented 21 year-old version of the excellent Antiquary deluxe blended Scotch. Comprised of malts from Speyside, Highland and a small amount from Islay and grain from the Lowlands.

Tasting Notes (1)
A miniature of Pig's Nose blended Scotch whisky. This is a blend of malts from Speyside, Islay and Lowland with grain from Invergordon. So called because the palate is as 'smooth as a pig's nose'.

Jim Murray was very taken with this recently-launched Chivas Regal 25yo, describing it thus: "beautiful delivery...unbelievably juicy and mouthwatering...unadulterated class...leaves you demanding another glass. Brilliant!"

product_name:
Haig & Haig 12 Year Old
Bot.1940s Spring Cap
product_description: A bottle of Haig & Haig Blended Whisky, presented in the dimple bottle. We estimate this was bottled in the 1940s.

An old bottling of one of the world's favourite whisky brands, Johnnie Walker's Red Label. We estimate this was bottled in the 1970s.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.

An extraordinary high-quality blend from maverick independent John Glaser, a man dedicated to the art of combining whiskies to produce an end result greater than the sum of its parts. If you wanted to convert someone who says they don't like whisky, you couldn't do much better than this. A must.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Cardrona Growing Wings 5 Year Old
Breckenridge Bourbon Cask
product_description: A milestone five-year-old malt from Cardrona on New Zealand’s South Island. This single cask release was drawn from a Bourbon barrel filled during the distillery’s first year of operation. It’s a rich, buttery dram with lots of American oak vanilla on the nose and stewed pears on the palate.

product_name: Dewar's 8 Year Old Caribbean Smooth Sample
product_description: Blended from up to 40 different single malt and grain whiskies, each aged individually and again once married together, all before being finished in the finest Caribbean ex-rum casks, Dewar’s Caribbean Smooth is an easy-drinking and impressively flavourful whisky. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Black Label
Extra Special Bot.1980s

Chivas Regal 18 Year Old
Black & Gold Label

product_description: A bold and fruity 23-year-old blended whisk from Ballantine's that offers aromas of vanilla, oak, apple, pears and peaches on the nose, complemented by notes of honey, apple blossom, heather, orange and vanilla throughout the palate.

product_name:
Grand Old Parr De Luxe
12 Year Old Bot.1990s Litre

Johnnie Walker Black Label
Extra Special Bot.1975

Whyte & Mackay 15 Year Old
Select Reserve

Bell's Royal Reserve 20 Year Old
Bot.1970s

Johnnie Walker Masters Ruby Reserve
40 Year Old
product_description: An impressive limited-edition blended whisky from Johnnie Walker, Masters Ruby Reserve is a combination of just eight 40-year-old casks, hand-selected by master blender Jim Beveridge OBE. Rich aromas of toffee, caramelised apples, dark chocolate, plums, pink peppercorn and sea salt fill the nose, followed by notes of smouldering driftwood, cocoa nibs, brambles, blackcurrants, pears and maraschino cherries throughout the palate.

product_name:
Cardrona Growing Wings 5 Year Old
Oloroso Sherry Cask
product_description: A single cask whisky from New Zealand distillery Cardrona, celebrating five years since the distillery laid down its first spirit. Bottled from a single oloroso sherry butt, Growing Wings is a sweet whisky with notes of honey, sweet flowers and cream.
A three-year-old straight rye whiskey from Boondocks, matured in virgin American oak casks to create layers of caramel, vanilla, toffee, fresh grass and white pepper throughout the palate.

product_name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Barbados Rum Cask Finish
product_description: A limited-edition Irish whiskey from Two Stacks that was initially matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks, before being finished in a single ex-Barbados rum cask. The palate offers notes of candied walnuts, orange peel, vanilla and toasted oak throughout the palate.

product_name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Sauternes Cask Finish
product_description: A limited-edition Irish whiskey from Two Stacks that was initially matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks, before being finished in a single French oak cask that previously held Sauternes wine from Bordeaux. The palate offers notes of honeysuckle, cinnamon, nutmeg and crystalised ginger.

product_name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Tawny Port Cask Finish
product_description: A rich, well-balanced blended Irish whiskey from Two Stacks Blenders Cut range, this whiskey has been finished in French oak casks that previously held a vintage Tawny Port. The palate offers notes of figs, red berries, cinnamon and ginger that linger in the finish.

product_name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Apricot Brandy Finish
product_description: A limited-edition Irish whiskey from Two Stacks, initially matured in a combination of sherry and bourbon casks, as well as virgin oak casks, before being finished in a French oak cask that previously held sweet apricot brandy. The palate is rich and nutty, with notes of hazelnuts, walnuts and dried fruit on the palate, leading to toffee, cinnamon and dried apricots that linger in the finish.

This blended Irish whiskey from JJ Corry has been finished in ex-mezcal and ex-Tequila casks for seven months. Named for the Batallion San Patricos – a group of Irishmen who fought for Mexico in 1846, this is a complex whiskey with notes of rich vanilla and herbal agave throughout the palate. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

Released towards the end of 2010, The John Walker is an ultra-premium expression of Johnie Walker Blue Label, crafted using some of the very oldest whiskies available from Diageo's vast maturing stock - including some very old whiskies from distilleries long since closed including Cambus and Glen Albyn, alongside traditional Johnnie Walker cornerstones such as Cardhu and Talisker. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name: JJ Corry Banner County Blend Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a very limited-edition blended Irish whiskey from JJ Corry, bottled in summer 2019.

The second batch of JJ Corry The GaelIrish whiskey, made with a blend of 60% malt whiskey and 40% grain whiskey and matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and sherry casks. Aromas of shortbread, peaches and cream and sweet grass fill the nose, complemented by notes of lemon drizzle cake, honeycomb, rye bread and thyme throughout the palate.

product_name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Cask Strength
product_description: A sweet and spicy cask strength blended Irish whiskey from Two Stacks, The Blenders Cut is made with a combination of grain, malt and pot still whiskies, including a small amount of peated malt whiskey, matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-oloroso sherry casks.

product_name:
Amrut Greedy Angels 10 Year Old
Peated Rum Finish
product_description: A rich, smoky Indian single malt whisky from Amrut's Greedy Angels series, matured for 10 years and finished in an ex-rum cask, before being bottled in October 2019. Woody aromas mingle with smoky peat, sweet spice and marmalade on the nose, developing into sour cherry, cocoa and sweet vanilla. The palate offers notes of butterscotch, candied citrus fruit and tropical fruits, followed by camphor, soft smoke and rum-soaked raisins.
A rare bottle of James Buchanan's 'Royal Household' blended whisky, bottled for the Japanese market in the 1980s.
A Perfect Measure sample of St Andrews Scotch whisky.

product_name: Cardrona Just Hatched Single Malt Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of three-year-old single malt from New Zealand's Cardrona distillery. Just Hatched is a marriage of whiskies matured in ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks. The palate offers notes of borage flower, vanilla, oak spice and honey.

A triple distilled blended whiskey from Belfast's Kirker & Greer, a marriage of both grain and malt whiskies that have been rested in first-fill bourbon casks. Shamrock has aromas of toffee apples, buttery croissants, brown sugar, marmalade and white flowers. The palate offers notes of caramel milk chocolate, honeyed apples, white peppers and creamy vanilla.

product_name:
Black & White De Luxe
Bot.1950s Spring Cap

Johnnie Walker Blue Label
Mexican Warriors

The Brown Derby Private Stock
Bot.1940s

Dewar's White Label
Bot.1980s Gallon Bottle

product_description: A sample bottle of 1930s release Dewar's White Label from our Perfect Measure range.

product_name:
Black & White 12 bottles with Wooden Case
Bot.1950

Baxter's Barley Bree
Extra Special Bot.1950s

product_description:
This rare bottle of 12-year-old Ballantine’s blended Scotch was bottled, we estimate, in the 1980s and originally exported to Italy. It has now returned from its European tour and offers a chance to try Ballantine’s whisky from a time when the distillery used more malt in its blends and had a smokier profile.


Ballantine’s was founded in 1827 by George Ballantine, who was just 19 at the time. The company was awarded a Royal Warrant from Queen Victoria in 1895 and is famous for its square bottles, which it first produced during Prohibition to ensure that businessmen could secrete them in their briefcases.

product_name:
The Perspective Series 25 Year Old
Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description:
A fruity, spicy 25-year-old blend from Berry Bros. & Rudd's Perspective series, this whisky brings together two art forms – whisky-making and photography. Soft aromas of autumn berries, fresh citrus and honey fill the nose, while the palate offers notes of fresh berries, ripe plums, cinnamon, nutmeg and honeycomb.


Each whisky in the series is represented by a piece from photographer Lindsay Robertson, depicting Scotland's dramatic and beautiful landscapes. The 25-year-old features a moody image of the Cuillin mountain range on Skye.

product_name:
Whyte & Mackay 25 Year Old (Prior To 1962)
Bot.1980s

Johnnie Walker Black Label
Extra Special Bot.1970s

product_description:
Hibiki has led the world of Japanese blended whisky since its creation in 1989, and this very-limited-edition release celebrates its 30th birthday.


The 30th-anniversary edition has bottle art inspired by a traditional kimono pattern, embellished with tabane noshi – tied bundles of strips that have long been a symbol of cherished gifts.


A must-have bottle for fans of Hibiki and Japanese art, created to be the perfect gift.

product_name:
Bell's De Luxe 12 Year Old
Bot.1960s

product_description: An very rare bottle of Ballantine's 25-year-old bottled in the 1950s for the US market only.

First produced in 1860 (when it was just 'The Grouse'), The Famous Grouse has been the No. 1 whisky in Scotland since 1980. This particular bottled was produced some time around the 1950s.


This bottle was originally a US import.


Please note


The fill level, as displayed in the photograph.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Haig's Gold Label
Bot.1950s Spring Cap

Last Drop Distillers 1971 Blended Scotch
Release No.10

Scotland's Ripe Old Age 27 Year Old
Bot.1950s

Scotland's Ripe Old Age 27 Year Old
Bot.1950s

King George IV
Bot.1950s Spring Cap

Long John Special Reserve
Bot.1970s 226cl (2 Quarts)

John Dunbar Extra Special 15 Year Old
Bot.1933

product_description: The flagship whiskey of Virginia's Catoctin Creek – Roundstone Rye is the state's most awarded rye whiskey. Distilled from locally sourced organic ingredients at the Purcelville distillery, it's an old-fashioned rye whiskey with heaps of spice and toffee as well as a touch of citrus.

product_name:
Dewar's Half Gallon
Spring Cap Bot.1950s

Catto's Gold Label
1953 New Zealand Royal Visit

Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old
Extra Special Bot.1980s
product_description: A 1980s' bottling of Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 year old, the entry in the JW range most loved by whisky fans. A mixture of Islay smoke and mainland complexity it's still popular to this day, and this 1980s' edition shows that while it still maintains the same character, it's definitely changed over the years.

Once blended, this elder expression from Dewar’s is decanted into oak casks for further maturation before finishing yet elsewhere. The result of all this to-and-fro? A sophisticated and elegant whisky which truly thrives on the tongue: fresh fundaments of rich apple and apricot are lifted by thick floral notes and honey battles smoke for dominance in a slow, heady finish.

product_name:
Bells Old Brown Decanter
LVS 1989 Banquet
Royal Salute 30 Year Old + Hip Flask
product_description: A limited edition of blended Scotch whisky Royal Salute, with packaging created by London-based interior designer Afroditi Krassa, known for her work on restaurants such as Dishoom, Itsu and Heston Blumenthal's Perfectionists' Café. Included in this pack is a porcelain flask, funnel and wooden serving tray, alongside the porcelain bottle of Royal Salute. The design was inspired by the ancient art form of crystalline glazing.

A higher intensity bottling from the Walsh distillery as part of their premium Writers' Tears range. Only 5280 bottles have been produced for 2017, offering notes of vanilla, honey, ginger, butterscotch and apple. The perfect gift for anyone with a novel languishing in a drawer.

Tasting Notes (1)

A rare 25 year old blend only given to staff at Seagram. The 25 Year Club was a group of Seagram's employees who had been at the company for 25 years or more. Seagram's was dissolved in the early 2000s, but when operational their portfolio of distilleries included Strathisla, Glen Grant, Longmorn and Glen Keith, which reflects the high quality of this truly delicious and fruity old blend.

An old bottle of Ballantine's, bottled in 1975 and an excellent example of a 1970s blended whisky. Still popular more than four decades later, Ballantine's 17 is a go-to whisky for Whisky Bible writer Jim Murray for good reason.

A bottle of long-running blend Islay Mist from the 1970s. This is a punchy eight-year-old dram from the days that it was blended and bottled by D Johnston & Co, the owners of Laphroaig. We suspect there might be a medicinal tang to this whisky...

product_name:
Harrods 21 Year Old
Atlantis Crystal Bot.1980s 3 Litre

WhistlePig 12 Year Old Marriage
Old World Cask Finish
product_description: WhistlePig 12 Year Old Rye Whiskey is aged in three types of cask from the 'old world'. 63% is aged in Madeira casks, 30% in Sauternes and 7% in Port. The spicy rye combines perfectly with the sweet flavours from the casks.

An intriguing bottle of whisky from the 1950s, bottled for Mitchell & Butlers. Now a large pub management company, this was from before the merged with Bass and were better known as a brewer than a runner of bars.
HM the King & HRH the Prince of Wales

The third release of Compass Box Double Single is a blended whisky made from 72% single malt, a 19-year-old Glen Elgin, and the remainder an older parcel of Girvan single grain. The result is a complex and rich, sweet and vanilla-led whisky that makes both a superb aperitif and after-dinner drink.

Tasting Notes (1)
Akashi Red is made at the Eigashima (aka White Oak) distillery, which was founded in 1888. Produced by Akashi, this is a light and fruity whisky with notes of peach, almond and grape.
A collaboration between FEW and rock band The Flaming Lips, this is a rye-heavy whiskey with notes of spice, oranges, and quince, with a herbaceous backbone.

product_name:
Thomas H Handy Sazerac Rye
Bot.2016
product_description: Thomas H Handy is the rye release in Buffalo Trace's Antique Collection. Sweeter and not as warming as the high strength would suggest, this is full of spicy flavours, along with toffee and honeyed raisins.
Hankey Bannister's 12 Year Old is aged exclusive in bourbon casks. The result is a medium-bodied whisky with notes of sweet vanilla and a hint of smoke.
King George V
A historic bottling of Glenrosa blended whisky bottled by Brown & Park of London and Glasgow. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1940s.
This bottle of Fleet Street blended whisky was produced in the 1950s and released for the American market.
Chivas Regal Extra was a 2015 addition to the core range. The blend includes extra sherry-cask-matured whisky, resulting in a sweet and fruity blend.

product_name:
Chivas Regal 25 Year Old
Bot.1930s George V
product_description: A very old original bottle of Chivas Regal 25 Year Old in the unusual 1.13-litre size favoured in the UK at the time. A bona fide collector's item, this is a beautiful piece of whisky history that we estimate dates from the early 1930s.
A very old bottle of Gilbey's Spey Royal blended Scotch whisky which, we estimate, dates from the 1940s.
An old bottling of Ballantine's 17 Year Old. We estimate that this was bottled sometime in the 1970s.

product_name:
Bell's Prince Charles Visit to Cherrybank Garden
Small
product_description: A very rare Bell's decanter commemorating Prince Charles's visit to Cherrybank Gardens in 1989.

The Dublin Liberties is a blended Irish whiskey from Quintessential Brands. Inspired by the eponymous area of the Irish capital, this has been aged in bourbon casks and is filled with notes of caramel, Christmas cake and pepper.

Tasting Notes (1)
Early Times is a Kentucky bourbon from the Brown-Forman portfolio. With a high percentage of corn in the blend, Old Reserve is light and sweet with rich caramel notes.
An Bell's Hawaii ceramic decanter. It was made by Wade and is finished in 22 carat gold. Launched as a Hawaiian duty free exclusive, this contains Bell's 12 year old whisky.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Black Label
Extra Special Bot.1970s
product_description: An old bottling of Johnnie Walker's ever popular Black Label. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.

product_name: Rough Rider Bull Moose Three Barrel Rye
product_description: Rough Rider Bull Moose is a rye whiskey from Long Island Spirits. With a mashbill of 95% rye and 5% malted barley, this is spicy, sweet and rich.
Old Harmony is a very rarely seen bottling of Johnnie Walker, released exclusively for the Japanese market.
An old bottling of Black & White with a spring cap. The brand was created by James Buchanan in the 19th century and we estimate this bottle dates from the 1950s.

Arran's blended whisky is the only one endorsed by The Robert Burns World Federation. Light with a hint of smoke, this contains malt from the Island distillery itself.

Tasting Notes (1)
A special edition decanter from Dimple, filled with their 12 year old blended whisky and released in honour of Botswana's 20th anniversary – the country became independent on 30 September 1966.

product_name:
Grand Old Parr De Luxe
12 Year Old Bot.1980s Litre
product_description: An old litre bottle of Grand Old Parr De Luxe. This was bottled at 12 years of age in, we estimate, the 1980s.

product_name:
Haig & Haig 12 Year Old
Bot.1940s Spring Cap

product_description: James Oliver Rye is aged in heavily charred (alligator-charred) casks for four years. Bottled in Oregon, it displays classic rye whiskey spiciness.
An old bottling of Ballantine's 12 year old blended Scotch whisky. We estimate that this was bottled sometime in the 1970s.
An old bottling of Ye Old Drury blended Scotch whisky, a brand owned by Edouard Robinson & Co of London. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1960s..

product_name:
Grand Old Parr De Luxe
Bot.1950s Spring Cap
product_description: A 1950s bottling of Grand Old Parr De Luxe blended Scotch whisky, closed with a spring cap.
An intriguing bottle of whisky, this blended whisky has been selected by Robertson & Baxter of Glasgow and bottled at a whopping 106 proof (60.57% abv).

product_name:
Dan Macfarlane's Royal V.O.V
10 Year Old Bot.1940s
product_description: An old bottle of Dan Macfarlane's Royal V.O.V blended Scotch whisky. This was bottled at 10 years of age which, we estimate, was in the 1940s.
An old bottling of Ballantine's 17 year old blended Scotch whisky. We estimate that this was bottled sometime in the 1980s.

product_name:
Dewar's White Label
8 Year Old Bot.1940s
product_description: An old bottling of Dewar's White Label, bottled at 8 years of age. Still a huge brand today, especially in the USA, it was created by John Dewar in 1846. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1940s.
An old bottling of Chivas Regal's popular 12 year old. Consistently in the top three brands in terms of whisky sales worldwide, we estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.

An old bottling of Gilbey's Spey royal blend, bottled at the Glen Spey distillery in, we estimate, the 1970s.


Please note


This bottle has a torn label as shown in the photograph.

An old bottling of Gilbey's Spey royal blend, bottled at the Glen Spey distillery in, we estimate, the 1970s. This bottle was produced for the Italian market, where Cinzano of Torino were the importers.
A very rare bottle of the old King George IV blend with a pretty golden label and the popular spring cap closure. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1950s.

product_name:
Haig's Gold Label
Bot.1940s Spring Cap
product_description: An old bottle of the Haig's Gold Label blended whisky. The brand was established by John Haig in the early 19th century. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1940s.

product_name:
Haig's Gold Label
Bot.1950s Spring Cap
product_description: An old bottling of Haig's Gold Label blended whisky, released back in the 1950s and closed with a spring cap.
An old bottling of ever-popular Teacher's, which we estimate dates from the 1970s and is complete with its then trademark gold cap.
An old bottling of Johnnie Walker Red label which, we estimate, dates from the late 1960s. First created in 1909, this non age statement whisky is the world's best selling Scotch.

Hankey Bannister Heritage Blend was inspired by the find of a 1920s' bottle in perfect condition. Master Blender Stuart Harvey has recreated the style for the modern day – it's sweeter and peatier than their usual blend.

Tasting Notes (1)

An exceptionally limited release (just 100 bottles each year) of 40 year old blended whisky from Ballantine's. Each bottle is hand numbered – an incredibly complex whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)

A bottle of Black Bottle Whisky, the famously smoky, Islay-heavy blended whisky. We estimate that this was bottled during the 1960s.


Please note


This bottle has a stained label as shown in the photograph.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

An old bottle of Islay heavy blend Black Bottle. Sweet, smoky and very drinkable. This was bottled some time in the 1960s.


Please note


This bottle has a slightly worn label as shown in the photograph.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
An old bottling of Chivas Brothers' ever-popular flagship blend, Chivas Regal 12 year old, which, we estimate, dates from the 1970s.

An old bottle of Chivas Regal 12 year old blended whisky, one of the best selling brands in the world. The spiritual home of the blend is Strathisla distillery, one of the many malts contained within. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.

An old bottle of Chivas Regal 12 year old blended whisky, one of the best selling brands in the world. The spiritual home of the blend is Strathisla distillery, one of the many malts contained within. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.


Please note


This bottle has a low fill level as shown in the photograph.

product_name:
Lord Elcho 15 Year Old
Wemyss Malts
product_description: This 15 year old blended whisky is named to honour Lord Elcho, the eldest son of the 5th Earl of Wemyss and one of the current company owners' ancestors. This is a richly flavoured blended whisky and is bottled at 40%.
An old bottle of Dewar's Ancestor. One of the premium blends in Dewar's range, this contained a fair proportion of long-aged whisky. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.

A bottle of Alex Ferguson blended whisky, not to be confused with a similarly named expression carrying a certain ex football manager's face. This is a blend of Highland Malt and Scotch grain, which we estimate dates from the 1930s.

product_name:
Grand Old Parr De Luxe
Bot.1970s
product_description: A bottling of Grand Old Parr, which we estimate was bottled in the 1970s. Named after Thomas Parr, a gentleman who was reputed to have lived to the grand old age of 152, the bottle and box carry details of his dates and his interment.
A very old bottle of Gilbey's Spey Royal blended Scotch whisky which, we estimate, dates from the 1940s.
An old bottling of White Horse Blended whisky with the popular spring cap closure. We estimate that this was bottled in the 1950s and carries the royal warrant for Her Majesty The Queen.

product_name:
Stewart's Cream of the Barley 21 Year Old
Bot.1940s
product_description: An old bottling of Stewart's Cream of the Barley blended Scotch whisky, bottled at 21 years of age. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1940s.
An old bottling of Findlater's V.O. blended Scotch whisky, released at 10 years of age in, we estimate, the 1940s.
An older version of Grant's flagship Family Reserve blended Scotch whisky, released in the early 2000s.

An old bottle of Sandy Macdonald blended Scotch whisky. We estimate that this was bottled sometime in the 1950s.


Please note


The fill level on this item is low (as pictured).


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
A 1950s bottling of Gilbey's Special Export 8 year old blended whisky, wrapped up in a cloth bag.
A dark glass bottle of Something Special blended whisky that we think was released sometime in the 1950s.

product_name:
Grand Old Parr
Bot.1950s Spring Cap
product_description: A 1950s bottling of Grand Old Parr blended Scotch whisky, closed with a spring cap.

Literally 'son of the sea', Mac Na Mara is a whisky blended to be light with a tang of citrus.


Please note


This product has slight damage to the box.
An old bottling of Ballantine's 17 year old. We estimate that this was bottled sometime in the 1970s.

product_name:
Bulloch Lade Gold Label
Bot.1980s Half Bottle
product_description: A half bottle of Bulloch Lade's Gold Label blended scotch whisky, it has a sweet and smoky character. We estimate that this was bottled during the 1980s.
Sanderson's Gold, a blended whisky from the Diageo stable that's rarely seen in the UK. Named in honour of VAT 69 creator William Sanderson and bottled at the export strength of 43%

A half bottle of Peter Dawson Special Blended Scotch Whisky from the 1980s – an well-priced introduction to how blends tasted a few decades ago. Peter Dawson owned Auchnagie distillery and built Towiemore, both now lost, and also bottled whisky from Ord up until the 1980s. In the 1920s, the company joined the Distillers Company Ltd and became the name behind a selection of blended whiskies, including this Peter Dawson Special.
An old bottling of Long John blended whisky. We would estimate that this was from sometime in the 1960s.
A very rare old bottle of Bulloch Lade's blended whisky. This has the popular spring cap closure and, we estimate, dates from the 1950s.
A 1980s bottle of Teacher's, complete with trademark gold cap.

product_name:
Johnnie Walker Black Label
Extra Special Bot.1970s
product_description: An older presentation of Johnnie Walker Black Label Blended Whisky from the 1970s.
A 1970s bottling of Haig's iconic Gold Label blended Scotch whisky.

product_name:
Haig Gold Label
Bot.1960s Spring Cap
product_description: An old 1960s bottling of Haig's popular Gold Label whisky, presented in a tall bottle. Haig's other release from this time period were normally presented in short, squat bottles.
A 1970s US bottling of Chivas Regal's ongoing and ever popular 12 year old blended Scotch whisky.

product_name:
Hazelwood Janet Sheed Roberts
110th Birthday Edition
product_description: A very rare and special bottling produced by William Grant & Sons to celebrate the 110th birthday of Janet Sheed Roberts, the granddaughter of company founder William. The 1600 bottles were originally given only to staff and friends of the company and a few have since made their way into the wider whisky world.

product_name:
Ne Plus Ultra (Dewar's)
Bot.1940s Spring Cap
product_description: A very rare 1940s bottle of famous blender Dewar's prestige bottling, the Ne Plus Ultra - made, according to the label, with 'The very finest Scotch Whisky of Great Age'.
An old 1980s bottle of Ballantine's 12 year-old premium blended Scotch whisky.

product_name:
Bulloch Lade's Gold Label
Bot.1950s Spring Cap
product_description: A gorgeous old 1950s bottle of Bulloch Lade's Gold Label blended whisky in amazingly good condition.
An old, screwcap-topped bottle of Teacher's Highland Cream, still one of Scotland's largest selling blended whiskies. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.
An unusual bottle of Tullamore Dew from the 1970s, when having very light whiskey was what everyone wanted.
A very rare old bottle of the Gilbey's blend from the 1970s.
An unusually-shaped old bottle of the Gilbey's blend from the 1960s.

product_name:
Haig & Haig Five Star
Bot.1950s Spring Cap
product_description: A well-preserved 1950s bottle of Haig & Haig, this is the US import version 'Five Star' bottled at 43.4%.
A lovely old 1960s bottle of famous defunct blended whisky Sandy Macdonald's.
A 1960s bottling of 6 year old Famous Grouse. The brand has been Scotland's best selling whisky from back then until over 40 years later. At the time of writing it's still number one...

product_name:
Old Rarity Ceramic
12 Year Old Bot.1980s

product_description:
A very old bottle of Bushmills whisky from sometime in the 1960s, bottled after 9 years of maturation.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Bell's Royal Vat 12 Year Old
Bot.1940s
product_description: A very old and rare bottle of Bell's Royal Vat, which we reckon was bottled in the 1940s.

An old bottle of the much-loved Teacher's blend. First created by William Teacher in 1832, we estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.
A famous old blend, Antiquary is made by, and includes a large proportion of, Tomatin single malt.
A wonderful old bottle of Ballantine's 17yo blended whisky bottled at 43% alcohol for the US market. We estimate this whisky was bottled in the 1950s.

product_name:
