A gift pack of three miniature bottles of Inchmurrin single malt, including an 18-year-old and 12-year-old single malt, as well as the distillery's Madiera Wood Finish whisky.
A miniature of the first edition of Edradour Caledonia, the Oloroso single cask from 1997 chosen by Dougie Maclean, author of the song of the same name.

A no-age-statement whisky from Deanston bottled at 46.3%. This one is made up of young whisky which is decanted into new American oak casks for its final stages of maturation.

Tasting Notes (1)

Cruach-Mhona, gaelic for 'peat stack', a pile of drying peat bricks cut for fuel, is a departure from Bunnahabhain's usual style, adding in some peat to their normally unpeated spirit. Originally released solely into travel retail.
A herbaceous and biscuity triple distilled single pot still Irish whiskey from Hinch. The palate offers notes of tart fruits; plums and blackberries, with hints of zesty oranges and cinnamon spice.

product_name: Cardrona Just Hatched Bourbon Cask Single Malt
product_description: A three-year-old whisky from New Zealand's Cardrona distillery, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask before being bottled in October 2019. The palate is sweet and spicy, with notes of vanilla, honey, ginger, white pepper and oak spice.
A red wine finished entry in the Tullibardine, the 228 is named for the number of litres in the Burgundy cask that it spent the end of its maturation in before bottling.

product_name:
Imperial 28 Year Old Marriage
Single Malts of Scotland
product_description: A 28-year-old Imperial single malt from the closed Imperial distillery, this is a marriage of five ex-bourbon barrels, bottled as part of Elixir Distillers' Single Malts of Scotland Marriage range. Aromas of green leaves, strawberries and cream, incense, thyme and dusty books fill the nose. The palate offers notes of lychee, watermelon, myrrh, wood spice and elderflower cordial that linger in the finish.

Batch 3 of Glencadam's limited-edition 13-year-old single malt offers malty, floral aromas with hint summer fruits and subtle vanilla. The palate offers refined notes of ripe berries, peaches and apple, alongside sweet cream and oak spice that linger into the finish.
A miniature bottle of single malt whisky under the Robert Burns label from the Isle of Arran distillery, bottled to honour the ploughman poet.

Non Chill-Filtered is an interesting variant on Aberlour's usual 12 year old whisky, not only changing the proportions of different whiskies that are used to make the expression, but also leaving it un-chillfiltered. This means that it retains the full body and flavour of the whisky from the cask, although it may go cloudy if water is added or it gets cold.

Tasting Notes (1)

A sherried release from Highland Park, Dark Origins is a combination of 80% first fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry. A dark expression which fits in with the distillery's origins – founder Magnus Eunson being a smuggler who worked in the darkness of night.

Tasting Notes (2)

An elegant bottle of 12-year-old peated whisky from Spey, with a well-balanced sweet-and-smoky character. Aromas of creamy vanilla, fresh grapes and wood spice mingle with soft wisps of smoke on the nose. The palate offers notes of green apples, roasted nuts, ginger, white pepper and vanilla pods, with hints of bonfire smoke and dried fruit.

Dalwhinnie Winter's Gold is an innovative bottling from Diageo. Made using whisky distilled in the cold Scottish winter, it is intended to be served from the freezer, delivering richness and sweetness as the glass warms up. Honeyed with a hint of peat.

Tasting Notes (1)

Glen Moray's Classic range of bottlings always represent great value. This expression has been finished in port casks, adding sweetness and extra richness.

Tasting Notes (1)

Batch six of Balvenie's Tun 1509 series is a marriage of 21 casks, including refill sherry butts, ex-bourbon barrels and barrels previously used to finish Balvenie Double Wood, chosen by Malt Master David Stewart MBE. Each of these casks has been married in the Tun, which sits in warehouse 24, for three months before being bottled at the distillery. Rich aromas of soft brown sugar, toffee, blossom honey and ginger fill the nose, complimenting notes of maple syrup, candied orange, runny honey, vanilla and oak spice throughout the palate.

The peated entry in Glen Moray's Classic range of excellent-value Speyside whiskies. This is lightly spiced with notes of smoke and vanilla.

Tasting Notes (1)

Aberfeldy 16 Year Old was released in 2015 as part of The Last Great Malts series. Matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, this has lovely balance between sweetness and spiciness.

Tasting Notes (1)

A very interesting 2016 release from Benriach, this was made with peated barley and fully matured in quarter casks. The result is a peaty, nutty and spicy Speyside whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)
The 2018 release of the Macallan M Black Decanter, a rich and slightly smoky sherry-matured single malt presented in a specially-crafted black crystal decanter from Lalique.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old
Cask Strength Batch 011 Bot.2019
product_description: Batch 11 of Laphroaig's riotously popular small-batch edition of its 10-year-old single malt. Hard to find outside of the distillery, these whiskies are rightfully critically acclaimed, offering a punchy and intense take of the 10-year-old's medicinal and maritime character.
This 21-year-old Tomintoul boasts a floral, fruity, spicy character. This will gladden the hearts of fans of mature easy-drinking Speyside whiskies that don't cost the earth.

product_name:
Tomatin 18 Year Old
Oloroso Sherry Finish
product_description:
Relaunched in 2016, Tomatin 18 Year Old is finished in first-fill oloroso-sherry butts. This add notes of dark chocolate and citrus to honey and soft spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

The second release from the brand part-owned by David Beckham, Haig Club Clubman is the entry-level bottling. Aged entirely in bourbon casks which give sweetness as well as enticing vanilla and coconut notes, this is a superb alternative to Jack Daniel's with cola.

Distilled in 2006, this 13-year-old Isle of Jura single malt has been matured in a combination of American white oak, ex-bourbon and Chinkapin oak casks. This limited-release whisky is named after the 212 inhabitants of the Isle of Jura.

Beinn Dubh is a ruby-black whisky made at Speyside distillery. This special edition was launched in partnership with National Railway Museum to commemorate the return of LNER Class A3 4472, better known as Flying Scotsman, to the main line. Matured in charred casks, this is a rich whisky with notes of chocolate.

This edition of Glen Moray has been finished for eight months in sherry casks. This has added subtle notes of dark chocolate, orange and dried fruit to the distillery's classic light-bodied spirit.

Tasting Notes (1)

A blended malt, distilled in Scotland and matured in Burgundy, using sherry-seasoned oak. This French blended malt has rich fruity notes of dates, black cherries and raisins, alongside sweet baking spices.


Please note


The whisky is un-chillfiltered and therefore may appear slighly cloudy.

product_name:
Highland Park 2003
16 Year Old Daily Dram
product_description: A 2003 Highland Park single malt from indie bottler Daily Drams, matured in a single cask for 16 years before being bottled in 2019, as part of its The Nectar of The Daily Drams series.

product_name:
Glenallachie 8 Year Old
Koval Quarter Cask
product_description: Distilled at Glenallachie distillery, this Speyside single malt has been matured in American oak casks, before being finished in quarter casks that had previously held rye whiskey from Chicago's Koval distillery. The result is a rich, sweet single malt with a healthy hit of fresh rye-spice, notes of honey and butterscotch mingle with cinnamon, nutmeg and spicy, grassy flavours.

This lightly smoky whisky from Scapa was aged initially in American oak before being finished in ex-peated-whisky casks. The result is fruity and creamy whisky with notes of peach, vanilla, caramel and soft smoke.

product_name:
Blair Athol 12 Year Old Sample
Flora & Fauna
product_description: One of the highlights of the Flora & Fauna range, this 12-year-old Blair Athol is rich, sherried and spicy.

A Perfect Measure sample of Balblair 18 Year Old, the third whisky in the Balblair Collection. It has been matured in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in first-fill Spanish oak butts. The result is a charismatic single malt with a rich toffee and pear aroma, with a hint of warm spices and leather. The palate offers notes of ripe apricots and raisins balanced by toasted oak and vanilla custard, before a long, warming finish filled with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg.

A Perfect Measure sample of Balblair 12 Year Old, the first whisky in the Balblair Collection. It has been matured in a combination of double-fired American oak casks and ex-bourbon casks. The result is a whisky with a warm, complex character and a sweet, citrusy aroma. The palate offers notes of oranges, honey and cinnamon before a long, creamy finish with hints of vanilla and leather.

Balblair 18 Year Old is the third whisky in the Balblair Collection and has been matured in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in first-fill Spanish oak butts. The result is a charismatic single malt with a rich toffee and pear aroma, with a hint of warm spices and leather. The palate offers notes of ripe apricots and raisins balanced by toasted oak and vanilla custard, before a long, warming finish filled with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenburgie 1989
29 Year Old Berry Brothers and Rudd
product_description: This 29 Year Old Glenburgie single malt was distilled in 1989, before being aged in a single refill sherry butt and bottled by Berry Bros & Rudd in 2018.

product_name:
Glenfiddich 21 Year Old Gran Reserva Sample
Rum Finish
product_description: Glenfiddich 21 Year Old Gran Reserva is finished in rum casks for a period of four months, and is rightly considered one of the distillery’s best bottlings.
AnCnoc 24 Year Old has been aged in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks. Spicy and fruity with notes of candied orange, honey and leather.

A superb choice for any whisky lover this gift set contains a pair of glasses and a bottle of Glen Moray Classic – the distillery's entry level single malt. Aged for an average of seven years in ex-bourbon casks, of which a high percentage are first fill, this is easy drinking, honeyed and excellent value.

product_name:
Mortlach 25 Year Old
G&M Distillery Labels
product_description:
A rich, sherried Mortlach 25 Year Old with notes of crème brulee, orange marmalade, sultanas and dark chocolate. Bottled by Gordon & MacPhail from first fill and refill sherry casks, this is part of the new-look Distillery Labels series, which pays homage to the unique 'house' label given by the independent bottler to each distillery with which it works.

Tasting Notes (1)

An intriguing Old Pulteney that's part of the revamped range for 2018. This non-age-statement single malt has been finished in barrels that previously held peated whisky, giving it mellow smoke notes alongside the classic Pulteney character.

Tasting Notes (1)

The pinnacle of the Glenrothes new range is this decadent 25 Year Old, which was awarded the Chairman’s Trophy at the 2018 Ultimate Spirits Challenge. Aged in mostly first-fill sherry-seasoned casks, it has notes of tropical fruits, coriander seed and salted caramel.

Tasting Notes (1)
This gift set from Glen Scotia contains one miniature each of Double Cask, Victoriana and 15 Year Old. A great way to discover the range of this lesser-known Campbeltown distillery.

product_name:
Kilchoman Machir Bay Gift Pack
2 Tasting Glasses
product_description:
A gift pack edition of the Kilchoman's first ongoing bottling - Machir Bay. This young and peaty dram is accompanied by a pair of branded Glencairn glasses to help you share and enjoy this whisky from Islay's smallest distillery.


Machir Bay was selected by our customers as The Whisky Exchange Whisky of the Year 2017.

This limited-edition Edradour was aged in ex-bourbon barrels for almost 10 years, then spent a further 12 years in first fill oloroso sherry butts. The result is a single malt with notes of burnt almonds, apricots, raisins, coconut and a hint of chocolate.

A single cask release of Dalmore, selected by whisky veteran Lorne Mackillop and bottled for his Mackillop's choice range. Distilled in 1991 and botled in 2009, it shows off Dalmore's spirit in a way the official bottlings rarely do. Without a cloak of sherry, the whisky shines with fruity character and gentle spice.

The 2018 release of one of Glenfiddich's most lauded whiskies – the 30 Year Old. A selection of both Spanish oloroso and American bourbon casks, long-aged and married to show both the quality of the oak and the character of Glendiffich's soft and fruity spirit. A whisky that every Glenfiddich fan should try at least once.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Mortlach 20 Year Old
Cowie's Blue Seal
product_description:
The elegant oldie in the Mortlach range, channeling The Beast of Dufftown (the distillery's nickname) into a more refined form. Matured solely in sherry casks, the whisky has been crafted to match rich and dark sherry character against old, refined oaky notes. It's one to take time with, well-balanced and complex, with much more going on than you might expect.

Tasting Notes (2)

The second release in Highland Park's Viking Legend series. Found upon the bodies of slain warriors and thought to invoke the presence of Odin himself, Valknut will transport you to a roaring longhouse feast with its woody, smoky and spicy character.

Tasting Notes (1)

Matured in sherry casks, the majority of which were first-fill, this is a sweet and spicy whisky with notes of vanilla, fresh ginger and pear.


This 18-year-old whisky is part of The Soleo Collection: a range of five whiskies from Glenrothes, ranging from 10 to 25 years old, which pay homage to the grapes from which some sherries, such as Pedro Ximénez, are made.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Ledaig 12 Year Old
Smoky Gordon & MacPhail Discovery
product_description:
A 12-year-old Ledaig bottled for Gordon & MacPhail's Discovery range, which colour-codes bourbon-matured, sherry-matured and smoky single malts to help guide people through those three pillars of Scotch whisky tasting. This bottle sits firmly in the 'smoky' category with powerful notes of smoked meat and wood smoke, balanced by fresh citrus and chocolaty malt.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Glen Moray Fired Oak 10 Year Old
product_description: A 10-year-old Glen Moray that explores the effect of barrel char on whisky flavour. Aged in both ex-bourbon casks and virgin American oak casks that have been heavily charred, this has amplified notes of vanilla, spice and smoky oak.

product_name:
Macallan Boutique Collection
Taiwan Exclusive 2017 Release
product_description: A very special bottling of The Macallan, released originally for the distillery's boutique in Taiwan's Taoyuan international Airport in 2017. It's a combination of a select number of casks that were kept aside for visitors to Easter Elchies House, beside the distillery. It's a classic Macallan, with balanced spice and fruit, and a touch of charred oak on the finish. Very rare and a must for Macallan collectors.

product_name: Berry Bros & Rudd Islay Blended Malt
product_description:
The Berry Bros Classic Range is focused on showing the core flavours of regions and styles, and this Islay blended malt takes no prisoners – it's Islay through and through. From its punchily smoke nose to it's peaty palate, it's just what you want from a peated Islay dram.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Ardbeg Twenty Something
22 Year Old Embassy Release
product_description: A third delicious instalment in Ardbeg's Twenty Something series, this 22-year-old is an excellent example of Ardbeg’s rich, smoky character while simultaneously showcasing the distillery’s remarkable talent for producing light, fresh flavours. Matured exclusively in ex-bourbon casks, Ardbeg’s characteristically thick, tarry bassline mingles with vibrant tropical fruit notes, seamlessly-integrated spices and a fresh menthol aroma which melds with peat smoke in the long, breezy finish. At once weighty and playful, this whisky – distilled in 1996 during the distillery’s darkest time – is crafted as testament to the quality and tenacity of Ardbeg spirit. And boy is it tasty.

A complex dram that does even more than its name suggests. Matured in a combination of seven different types of oak – first bourbon and then a finish in each of Vosges, Jupilles, Les Bertranges, Allier, Tronçais, and Limousin casks. The result is spicy but run through with chocolate and fruit, thanks to wide range of flavours from the casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

Enter: a particularly exciting aroma – look out for a flourish of fresh spring flowers on the nose. The palate is deeper, with chocolate and coffee notes lifted by a touch of spice and opening up into bright cherry Bakewell flavours toward the end. A vibrant rye whisky which would sit comfortably at the base of a Manhattan.

The latest edition in Benromach's Wood Finish series, this single malt has been aged in first-fill bourbon then finished in Chateau Cissac wine casks from the Haut-Médoc region of Bordeaux. The result is notes of sweet vanilla, creamy milk chocolate, light peat smoke and a hint of tannin.

An 18-year-old Deanston single malt matured in first-fill bourbon casks. The distillery’s characteristically honeyed, fruity character is turned up to eleven and supplemented by the fresh tropical flavours, and rich, airy vanilla notes of American oak, all married and mellowed by a long, 18-year rest. Fantastic stuff.

Try this rich and sherried edition of Mortlach 16 Year Old Distiller’s Dram with our Perfect Measure sample. A mixture of first-fill and refill sherry casks give this whisky a broad sherry cask character, with aromas of raisins and apple pies, dark fruitcakes and rich spice develop slowly. The palate gives notes of brown sugar, apples, and sweet raisin, balanced by gentle barrel char and sharp orchard fruits.

A lightly-peated single malt from the Scottish mainland's northernmost whisky distillery, Morven puts a gently smoky spin on Wolfburn's fresh, fruity style. There are briny notes and a hint of honey here, too – a characterful and thoroughly tasty dram.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Highland Park 12 Year Old
Half Bottle
product_description: This Island single malt is one of Scotland’s gold-standard whiskies. Delicate heather-sweetness and a silky mouthfeel help create a stunning, golden dram.

product_name:
Bowmore 26 Year Old Wine Cask
Vintner's Trilogy Part 2
product_description:
The second in Bowmore's Vintner's Trilogy, this 26-year-old single malt has been aged in both bourbon barrels and wine barriques. The result is a dram with notes of oak-spiced smoke, salty dark chocolate and tropical fruits.

Tasting Notes (1)

Aged in oloroso sherry casks, this 15-year-old Tamdhu has aromas of apple pie, spiced currants and orange zest. The palate is full of juicy apricots, vibrant raspberries and bitter almonds, before a long finish full of malty biscuits and creamy sherry notes.

The Aberlour A'Bunadh range is a love letter to the distillery’s original style of whisky, made with 19th-century methods and matured solely in sherry casks.


Each small batch in the range is based on the contents of a bottle from the late 1800s which was allegedly discovered by workmen almost a century later and analysed in a lab – after the workmen had drunk most of it, of course.


Every limited-edition batch of this no-age-statement single malt is slightly different, but all are distinguished by a rich and sweet character thanks to their sherry incubation. This edition, Batch 59, is slightly lower in alcohol than its predecessors and delivers spice, orange and sherry on the nose, followed by cherry, ginger and chocolate flavours and a robust long finish.


In case you were wondering how to pronounce A’bunadh, a Gaelic word loosely translating to ‘original’, it’s ah-boon-arh.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old Cask Strength
Batch 009
product_description: The 2017 bottling of Laphroaig's annually released cask strength 10-year-old whisky – this is batch #9. Hard to find outside of the distillery, these whiskies are rightfully critically acclaimed, offering a punchy and intense take of the 10-year-old's medicinal and maritime character.

This limited-edition single malt from Ardbeg distillery – Drum – was released for Ardbeg Day, during Feis Ile 2019. Matured in ex-bourbon casks and rested in ex-rum casks, this is a funky, flamboyant whisky. The nose is full of ripe banana, pineapple, cocoa and woodsmoke aromas, with hints of fresh ginger, cinnamon and lavender developing slowly. The palate offers notes of black pepper, ginger, clove and liquorice, alongside dark chocolate, rich smoke and vanilla. An intensely smoky, fruity dram, Ardbeg Drum is the perfect way to celebrate Feis Ile.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Caol Ila 18 Year Old
Unpeated Special Releases 2017
product_description:
The oldest-ever whisky in the unpeated series from Caol Ila, an 18-year-old single malt with memorable fruitiness. Excellent as an aperitif and recommended to be served with a drop of water, this dram offers delicious aromas of lemon and egg custard, followed by flavours of freshly baked apple pies and a spiced pastry finish.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Lochside 1981
33 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: This Lochside 1981 was bottled by Gordon & Macphail for the 'Rare Old' series in 2015.

A Perfect Measure sample of the second whisky in the Balblair Collection, Balblair 15 Year Old is a full-bodied, velvety single malt that has been matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in first-fill Spanish oak butts. This creates a rich, sweet whisky with spicy aromas of honey, gingerbread and prunes. The palate is velvety-smooth and full of dark chocolate, tropical fruit and warm spice notes.

product_name:
Scarfes Bar 2001 Speyside
15 Year Old Macbeth
product_description: A limited-edition 2001 vintage single malt bottled by Speciality Drinks for Scarfes Bar, Rosewood Hotel. Matured in a single sherry butt for 15 years and bottled in June 2016.

product_name:
Glendronach 15 Year Old Revival Sample
Sherry Cask
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample of the ever-popular Glendronach Revival – a 15-year-old single malt matured in a combination of oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks.
This is the 57th batch of Aberlour's popular A'bunadh series. Matured in oloroso-sherry casks, this is big, rich and full of fruit-and-nut flavours.

product_name: Edradour 12 Year Old Caledonia Selection Glass Pack
product_description: A gift set for a special bottling of Edradour 12yo, named after Dougie Maclean's most famous song, Caledonia. This set comes complete with a pair of glasses for sharing the whisky.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2001 vintage of Lagavulin's Distillers Edition, bottled in 2017. By far the most popular of the series, this double-matured Lagavulin has had a finishing period in sweet, sticky Pedro Ximénez sherry casks. A whisky that never disappoints.

product_name:
Peat Full Proof Sample
Elements of Islay
product_description:
The first ongoing release from Speciality Drinks Elements of Islay series, Peat is a blend of single malts from across the island. Big and punchy, this is a full-throttle dram with notes of roasted fruit, smoke and roasted spice.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name: Michter's US*1 Single Barrel Straight Rye Sample
product_description: The single-barrel rye release from Michter's is great on its own or in cocktails. Easy drinking with notes of pepper, orange and toffee.
The original rye whisky, first created in 1796 by the eponymous Mr Hayden. This is spicy with notes of pepper and honey.

product_name:
Talisker Port Ruighe Sample
Port Finish
product_description: The punningly named Port Ruighe takes the classic whisky from Skye and finishes it in ruby-port casks, adding a rich fruitness and softness to tame Talisker’s peppery bite.
The 12-year-old is the entry-level offering from ~Old Pulteney. Rich and sweet with a maritime character and citrus notes, this is always popular.
A cask-strength Islay from Port Askaig, 100° Proof is loaded with sweet fruit, minerality and peat smoke. A benchmark Islay malt and a delicious everyday peaty dram.

product_name:
Isle of Jura Prophecy Sample
Peated
product_description: Prophecy is the heavily peated whisky from Jura. Rich, spicy and smoky, this is a great alternative to whiskies from neighbouring Islay.

product_name: Highland Park Ice 17 Year Old Sample
product_description: A 2016 limited-edition from Highland Park, aged for 17 years, mainly in bourbon casks. Crisp and fruity with notes of toast, honey, vanilla and smoke.

A big, rich, sherried 15-year-old from one of Speyside’s best distilleries. Full of Christmas-cake spice and dried fruit, this is one of the best-value malts on the market, and an absolute must for lovers of sherried whisky.

A 2005 Dalmore single malt, matured in a refill bourbon barrel for 13 years before being bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in July 2019, as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Floral aromas fight against citrus fruit and vanilla on the nose, while the palate offers notes of white chocolate, pepper, toasted cereal and dried banana, with hints of oak spice in the finish.
A miniature bottle of the sweet and spicy 13-year-old single malt from Craigellachie.

product_name: Method and Madness Wild Cherry Wood Finish
product_description: A limited-edition single pot still Irish whiskey from Method and Madness, matured in ex-bourbon and sherry casks, before being finished in wild cherry wood casks. Aromas of chopped ginger, pine needles, coconut and green leaves fill the nose, complemented by notes of garden herbs, black tea, cinnamon, nutmeg, black pepper and toasted hazelnuts on the palate.

The 2016 release of Glenfarclas 40 Year Old, presented in a box styled on the distillery's warehouse doors. This is a classic sherried Glenfarclas, with notes of Christmas cake, dark chocolate and orange.

product_name:
Tomatin 14 Year Old Miniature
Port Casks
product_description: Tomatin's 14 Year Old has been finished in tawny-port pipes, which adds notes of extra fruitiness, especially red fruits to the classic Highland notes of toffee and honey.

product_name:
Benriach 21 Year Old
Tawny Port Finish
product_description: A 21-year-old whisky from the creatively independent folks at Benriach in Speyside. This time they've finished the whisky in tawny-port casks, adding some rich vine fruit to the already fruity whisky.
Glen Moray is known for its excellent value-for-money whiskies. The 12-year-old release from this Speyside distillery is lightly toasty with notes of summer fruits, vanilla toffee and fresh herbs.

A smooth, juicy limited-edition Longmorn single malt, matured for 18 years in a combination of American oak barrels and hogsheads before being bottled As part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of sweet pear, ripe mango and creamy toffee mingle with orange marmalade on the nose, complemented by notes of fudge, oak and roasted nuts on the palate.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Tennessee Fire
Half Bottle
product_description: A special price-marked half bottle of Jack Daniel's Tennessee Fire. Combining the legendary No.7 with a fiery cinnamon liqueur, this is sweet and spicy with notes of vanilla. Best enjoyed on its own, slightly chilled.

product_name:
Laphroaig 1996
20 Year Old Masterpieces TWE Exclusive
product_description:
2016's Masterpiece bottling combines the popular elements of sherry-cask ageing and peated whisky. A hit at The Whisky Show, this has notes of tropical fruit, iodine, berry fruit and intense smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Loch Lomond Distillery 12 Year Old Miniature Gift Set
3x5cl
product_description: A gift pack with three miniature bottles of 12-year-old single malts from Loch Lomond, each finished in a different cask.

product_name:
Mortlach 1998
18 Year Old Signatory TWE Exclusive
product_description:
Mortlach is well known for doing very well in sherry casks, and this is a shining example. Deep natural colour and rich fruity flavour from the cask matches up with weighty texture and spice from the spirit. Selected by The Whisky Exchange team and bottled exclusively for us by Signatory. .

Tasting Notes (2) 

A monster of a Mortlach. Dave Broom, Scotchwhisky.com

product_name:
Glen Moray 2006
13 Year Old Madeira Cask Project
product_description: A 2006 Glen Moray single malt from the distillery's Cask Project series, matured in ex-Madeira casks for 13 years, before being bottled. Aromas of baked apple, pear, honey and soft spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of sultana, baking spices, brown sugar and cinnamon-baked apples.

The fourth batch of 2009 vintage Cask Strength single malt from Benromach, matured exclusively in first-fill casks. The palate offers notes of sherried raisins, dark forest fruits, dark chocolate, black pepper and clove-studded oranges.
A 1973 vintage whisky from Longmorn distillery, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in 2015, making this whisky approximately 42 years old. An excellent example of rich and sherried Longmorn.

A 15-year-old single malt from Tullibardine, matured exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks. Aromas of barley sugar, apple crumble, vanilla custard and delicate flowers fill the nose, followed by notes of honey nut cereal, creamy porridge, blackberry jam and vanilla sponge cake on the palate.

A higher-strength UK release of one of the three-strong core range introduced by Glenturret in 2015: Sherry Edition. Aged in both European- and American-oak sherry casks, this is elegant and sweet with spice, too.
Longmorn The Distiller's Choice is aged in a combination of hogsheads, sherry casks and bourbon barrels. A sweet and spicy whisky with notes of ginger and toffee.

product_name:
Peat – Full Proof
Elements of Islay
product_description:
Peat is the first ongoing release from Speciality Drinks' Elements of Islay series. A blend of single malts from around the island, this is a big, punchy 'full-throttle' dram with notes of roasted fruit, smoke and roasted spice.

Tasting Notes (2) 

This is some mega-smoky, almost pleasantly brutal peated whisky. 89 points. Serge Valentin, whiskyfun.com

Batch eight of Glengoyne Cask Strength single malt has been matured in a combination of sherry, bourbon and refill casks, creating a sweet, peppery character with notes of caramel, ginger and banana, biscuits and cinnamon on the palate.
Relaunched in 2020, Inchmurrin 12 Year Old is aged in a mixture of casks, including bourbon, refill and recharred wood. Light, grassy and floral.
The first release from Kingsbarns, owned by the Wemyss family. An elegant, fruity, and floral spirit, this is already showing great potential at just a few months old.

product_name:
Glengoyne The Legacy Series Chapter Two
Bot.2020
product_description: The second chapter in the Glengoyne Legacy Series has been matured in a combination of first-fill bourbon casks and refill sherry casks before being bottled in 2020. Sweet aromas of vanilla, banana, peaches, coconut, lime and mint fill the nose, complemented by notes of apple crumble, toast and honey, green grapes and sweet spices throughout the palate.
The Deveron is the new name for official bottlings of whisky from Macduff and was christened when the brand relaunched in 2015. This has notes of toffee apple, tobacco and cream.

A new presentation of Loch Lomond 18 Year Old single malt, released in summer 2020. Matured in American-oak casks, this 18-year-old whisky from Loch Lomond is full-bodied and rounded with notes of toast, cigar box, apple, gooseberry and light smoke.

product_name:
Talisker 2011
8 Year Old Rum Finish Special Releases 2020
product_description:
A very special Talisker, released as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2020. This has been finished in pot-distilled Jamaican rum casks, adding extra layers of flavour to the distillery's classic salt-and-pepper maritime notes. Rich, sweet and very tasty.

Tasting Notes (1)

A limited-edition 2008 Bunnahabhain, matured in a Manzanilla sherry cask until May 2020. The palate offers rich notes of raisins, sultanas, dried apricot, toffee and salted caramel that linger in the finish.
A magnum of Glenmorangie 10 Year Old. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky – medium-bodied and gently warming, with pleasant spicy notes.

A miniature of textbook Speyside from one of our favourite distilleries, Glenfarclas 10 year-old is a straw-gold, delicately light, sweet and malty dram leaving a long slightly spicy finish. Impeccably well-made, this is a whisky that always delivers in quality.

This is the second batch of Auchentoshan's Virgin Oak. Aged in new North American oak casks, this triple-distilled Lowland whisky is rich, spicy and complex.

Tasting Notes (1)
Macallan No.6 is comprised of whiskies aged in first-fill sherry casks. Presented in a six-faceted Lalique decanter, this is rich and sumptuous, with notes of fruit cake and orange.

A miniature bottle of the second edition of Evolution, the follow up to Revival. A limited release showcasing Glenglassaugh's spirit's interaction with ex-Tennessee whiskey casks, this was matured in barrels that used to contain George Dickel.

product_name:
Macallan 25 Year Old
Sherry Oak 2020 Release
product_description: The 2020 edition of Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak has been matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century before bottling. This creates aromas of orange, cinnamon, sherry and wood smoke on the nose, complemented by notes of dried fruit and crystalised ginger throughout the palate.

Lagavulin's popular limited edition Distiller's Edition, distilled in 1995, finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks, and bottled in 2013. An extra layer of sweetness soothes the rough edges of this much-loved dram.

Tasting Notes (1)
A old dumpy litre bottle of 12 year old Bowmore. This dates, we estimate, from the 1980s and carries the label for Morrison's Bowmore, before they were taken over by Suntory in 1989.

product_name:
Strathisla 2006
13 Year Old Sherry Cask Distillery Edition
product_description: A 13-year-old Strathisla single malt, matured in a first-fill butt for more than a decade and bottled in May 2019.

product_name:
Benriach The Smoky Twelve
12 Year Old Miniature
product_description: Benriach The Smoky Twelve is a whisky that focuses on the richer side of Benriach's spirit, as well as it's darker smokier side. Aged for 12 years in a combination of bourbon, sherry and marsala casks, the peat smoke is complimented by dried fruit and vanilla from the bourbon and sherry casks, and rich, sweet fruit from the marsala.

A 20cl bottle of Stiùireadair, a sherried release from Bunnahabhain intended as a partial replacement for the 12 Year Old. A typically creamy and coastal whisky with notes of caramel, nuts, dried fruit and hints of spice.

Cardhu Amber Rock is finished in American oak ex-bourbon casks, adding notes of vanilla and spice while retaining the brand's trademark soft and easy-drinking style.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 10-year-old Lagavulin single malt, originally released as a Travel Retail exclusive, this whisky has been matured in first-fill American oak casks. Aromas of rock salt, crunchy red apples, burnt sugar and savoury peat smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of roast almonds, spicy chilli flakes and waves of salty smoke throughout the palate.

A range of Craigellachie single malts was released for the first time in 2014. The distillery is known for its meaty character, and the 17-year-old is sweet and slightly smoky, with tropical fruit notes.

Tasting Notes (1)

Timorous Beastie is a blended malt from Douglas Laing, using only Highland whiskies including Dalmore, Glengoyne and Glen Garioch. This has the classic heathery Highland note.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Kingsbarns Balcomie Single Malt
Sherry Cask
product_description: A rich and fruity single malt from Kingsbarns in Fife, Balcomie is matured exclusively in ex-oloroso sherry butts, creating aromas of treacle, sultana, fruit cake, cinnamon, dark chocolate and raspberries on the nose. The palate offers notes of orange peel, sweet baking spices and pineapple upside-down cake that linger in the finish.

Arran 10yo is a medium-bodied, citrussy dram that shows an elegance and deftness of touch that belies the distillery's youth. Tasting the complexity and assurance of this youngster it is difficult to believe that the distillery only opened in 1995. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Glen Moray Madeira Cask Project 2006 Sample
13 Year Old
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2006 Glen Moray single malt from the distillery's Cask Project series, matured in ex-Madeira casks for 13 years, before being bottled. Aromas of baked apple, pear, honey and soft spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of sultana, baking spices, brown sugar and cinnamon-baked apples.

product_name:
Glengoyne 21 Year Old
Sherry Matured Small Bottle
product_description: A 20cl bottle of Glengoyne's 21 year old sherry matured whisky. Noticeably deeper than younger expressions, with delicious rich fruity and oaky notes - the darker colour and long finish are testament to the extra years in the sherrywood.

A rarely seen example of long-aged whisky from Dufftown, this 1985 vintage has been aged for 28 years, all spent in refill American oak. This was bottled as part of the Diageo's annual Special Releases for 2013 and is a fantastic example of what age can do to this quiet Speyside dram.

Tasting Notes (2)

A smooth, balanced single malt from one of Islay's most progressive distilleries - codename Br - showing off the distillery's early 1990s style. This is the fifth Br release in Elixir Distillers' Elements of Islay series.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Cask Speyside 10 Year Old
Bourbon Cask First Edition
product_description: Cask Speyside 10 Year Old is the first of its kind to be released by A. D. Rattray. Made at a mystery distillery, it has a classic Speyside character, with light, fruity notes of apples and vanilla.

Made exclusively with organic barley grown on Mid Coul Farms in Inverness, Bruichladdich The Organic 2010 is a fruity, sweet Islay whisky with an elegant island character. Aromas of melon, peach and apricot mingle with honey, lemon meringue pie, gorse, heather and tart gooseberries on the nose, atop a backdrop of rich malted barley. The palate initially offers notes of pear drops, vanilla fudge, chocolate and marzipan, before developing toasted rye bread, buttery popcorn, smooth caramel and toasted oak flavours. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

A 20cl bottle of 18 year old Glengoyne. The distillery claims to have the slowest distillation in Scotland. This bottling has notes of vanilla and apples with a luxurious richness due in part to its high proportion of first-fill sherry casks.

Tasting Notes (2)
A Perfect Measure sample bottle of Deanston 12 Year Old, matured in ex-bourbon barrels, leaving notes of vanilla, apples and caramel throughout the palate.

product_name:
Cream Gin
Worship Street Whistling Shop
product_description: A small batch gin produced originally for London's Worship Street Whistling Shop, an excellent cocktail emporium where they have been experimenting with old recipes and spirits. This is a London Dry Gin that uses fresh cream as a 'botanical', with interesting results.

product_name:
Bowmore 1980
30 Year Old Queen's Visit to Distillery
product_description: A very special Bowmore from a hogshead filled on August 9th 1980, the day that Queen Elizabeth II visited the distillery. Cask #5774 was acquired by Jim Howat, then Chairman of Morrison Bowmore and was left in his will to the JTH Charitable Trust he created with his wife Christine. Designed and bottled in 2011 by Morrison Bowmore as a special limited edition for the charitable trust yielding 156 bottles at a natural strength of 46.7%.

Ledaig 18 Year Old is a fruity, peaty whisky from Tobermory, finished in sherry casks, balancing sweet, floral aromas with rich smoke and sea salt on the palate. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

The late 2012 release under Bruichladdich's Octomore label, peated to a fairly astounding 169ppm. Expect fire from the cask strength and lots of smoke, but also some elegance hiding behind the fireworks. As ever the producer's notes (below) are well worth a read.

Tasting Notes (1)

A certified organic single malt from Benromach, Contrasts was distilled in 2012 and matured in virgin American oak casks before being bottled in 2020. Aromas of vanilla, ripe peaches, orange zest, toasted malt and green apples fill the nose, complemented by notes of black pepper, butterscotch, freshly-ground coffee, dried banana and garden herbs throughout the palate.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2020 Edition of Macallan Classic Cut, carefully crafted by Macallan whisky maker Polly Logan using a combination of sherry-seasoned European oak casks and ex-bourbon American oak casks. Aromas of vanilla, candied orange peel, honey, sultanas and fresh oak fill the nose, complemented by notes of fresh ginger, juicy orange, honey, vanilla and fresh oak that linger in the finish.

A smoky 2009 vintage single malt from Benromach, matured in ex-bourbon oak and bottled in 2020 it has aromas of vanilla, honey, smoked meats, apricot, lemon and soft tobacco on the nose. The palate offers notes of black pepper, strawberries, orange, aniseed and billowing bonfire smoke.

A cask strength Islay single malt from Morrison Scotch Whisky Distillers Mac-Talla range, Mara reflects the maritime character of this Hebridean island, surrounded by the Atlantic sea. The palate offers notes of smoked meat, charred oak, salty driftwood and smouldering peat, with hints of dried seaweed, beach bonfires and rock salt that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Tennessee Honey Liqueur
Litre
product_description: A litre bottle of Jack Daniel's phenomenally popular Tennessee Honey whisky based liqueur. A surprise at first, balancing the sweetness of many honey liqueurs with a delicate spice and the whisky, it's worryingly moreish.
A very stylish gift pack containing a bottle of the splendid Edradour 10yo from Scotland's smallest distillery, along with two branded Glencairn glasses from which to enjoy it.

product_name:
Dewar's 12 Year Old
The Ancestor Double Aged
product_description: Dewar's 12 year old blend, called 'Double Aged' due to the 6 months of marrying in oak casks that the whisky does after initial maturation and blending. Dewar's is one of the world's most awarded whiskies, recently winning the Monde Grand Gold across their range.

The second 20yo Glenkinchie bottled for Diageo's Special Releases is, like the first, a small batch from refill American oak casks. This is an equally enjoyable dram, in our opinion a bit better, although it definitely needs a drop of water to get going.

Tasting Notes (1)

What do you get if you take traditional Longmorn character and mature it for around fifteen years in a combination of first fill sherry hogsheads and refill bourbon casks? Well, this: wafting sheets of warm spice and rich, tart orange; fruit cake and creamy milk chocolate; deep woody notes and a distant hint of aniseed in the shadows. Layered, complex, wholesome and really quite tasty.

A 15 year-old expression of Singleton of Dufftown, Diageo's easy-drinking Speysider. This is a mix of European and American oak casks, producing a smooth, sweet, approachable style and a spicy, drying finish.
A set of miniatures of the products of Wales' Penderyn distillery. This set comprises 1 x 5cl each of Penderyn Welsh whisky, Merlyn cream liqueur, Brecon Gin and Five vodka.
A quarter bottle of the hugely popular Edradour 10yo single Highland malt.
Kudos to Tomintoul, who are clearly listening to their customers - this 14yo has been bottled at 46% without being chill-filtered. A big thumbs-up.

A fruity, floral Tamnavulin single malt that has been matured in Cabernet Sauvignon red wine casks, creating layers of orchard fruit, lime blossom, marmalade, cinnamon, poached pear and almond on the nose, complemented by notes of nectarines, damson plums, gingerbread, red berries and ripe bananas throughout the palate.

Made with the finest local ingredients, Bladnoch Vinaya has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks to create a sweet, refreshing character with aromas of summer flowers, grass and boiled sweets on the nose. The palate offers notes of fresh green apples, milk chocolate and white pepper that linger in the finish.

A quarter-bottle of the splendid Clynelish 14yo. Complex and spicy, this is perfect for hip flasks during long walks in cold weather. If you've never tried the malt from this brilliant distillery, now's the time to take the plunge.

Tasting Notes (1)

Glencadam 15 has gone from strength to strength since a packaging facelift in 2009, at which time the strength was upped to 46% by owners Angus Dundee, who took over the distillery from Allied in 2003. An undersung distillery that is now starting to stretch its wings with some very good value for money whiskies.

The initially controversial 16yo official expression of Scapa is now winning people round with a jump in quality after a few wobbly years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12yo via the short-lived 14yo. Orkney's less shouted about (but still lovely in its own way) malt whisky has found its feet.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Balmenach 2006
14 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 2006 Balmenach single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for 14 years, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of its Old Malt Cask series. Sweet aromas of vanilla and strawberry jam fill the nose, complemented by notes of shortbread, crystalised ginger and sweet malt throughout the palate.

product_name:
Loch Lomond 12 Year Old
Small Bottle Glass Set
product_description: A lovely gift set from Loch Lomond that includes a bottle of Loch Lomond 12 Year Old – a highland single malt that has been aged in three types of cask: bourbon, refill and recharred. Fruity with notes of pear, lemon, vanilla and biscuits.
A long-aged distillery-bottled Bowmore, a large proportion of the casks used to assemble this 25yo are ex-sherry, giving sweetness and depth to this complex, fruity Islay malt.
A mini bottle of peachy whisky delight, Southern Comfort. Made from grain spirit and peaches, this is superb as a long drink with lemonade.

A limited-edition 2008 Tomatin single malt from the distillery's French Collection that has been finished in Monbazillac wine casks. The result is aromas of maple syrup, freshly-brewed espresso and cinnamon-baked apples that fill the nose, complemented by notes of milk chocolate, honeycomb, walnuts and maple syrup throughout the palate.
An excellent value 21yo Aberfeldy, showcasing the richer end of the Highland spectrum with plenty of sherry influence.

A special edition of Douglas Laing's Big Peat Islay blended whisky, Peatrichor was bottled to celebrate Feis Ile 2021 and is named for Islay's rainy climate and earthy scents of the island. Aromas of damp soil, sea salt and new leather fill the nose, complemented by notes of earthy peat, hints of citrus and medicinal herbs throughout the palate.
A litre bottle of 16-year-old single malt from Fettercairn, made with chocolate malted barley and matured in American oak ex-bourbon casks, with a subtle influence from sherry and port casks.

An increasingly hard to find bottling, as it was discontinued a while back, from the closed and now redeveloped Rosebank distillery. A victim of the early 1990s downturn in the whisky market and producer of some beautiful whiskies.
A miniature bottle of Glenfarclas's high-strength sherry monster, the 105. Packed full of rich fruit and ripe for a few drops of water – a little goes a long way.

A terrific full-blooded Speysider, oozing complexity with plenty of spice, sweet fruits, heather and balanced oak interplaying with the malt. A highly-respected whisky with a loyal following.


Please note


There are slight scratches on the gift box.


This is an old and rare bottling. Care must be taken when attempting to remove the cork stopper. Cork is a natural product, and where it forms part of the stopper, we cannot guarantee that it will have maintained its original condition. Unfortunately we cannot be held liable for any corks being broken upon opening.

A very endearing, subtle malt with a strong whiff of peat, this is a curious but superb marriage of different Japanese malts – and it really delivers. Brilliant.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 2006 Graigellachie single malt from independent bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single ex-sherry butt for 14 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its First Editions series. Aromas of milk chocolate and summer berries fill the nose, complemented by notes of apples, salted caramel, chocolate biscuits and black pepper throughout the palate.

product_name:
Deanston 1996
25 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 1996 Deanston single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for quarter of a century, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Old Malt Cask series. Aromas of caramel, custard, orange oil and oaky smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of marzipan, cherry, vanilla, dry smoke and orange throughout the palate.

product_name:
Speyside 1995
25 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 1995 Speyside single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for quarter of a century, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Old Malt Cask series.
A half bottle of Glenmorangie's ever popular 10 year old - a perfect introduction to the world of Single Malt Whisky.
The only distillery bottling of Glenlossie, other than a Manager's Dram. Almost all of their whisky goes into Diageo's blends, which is a shame as this is a classic spicy Speysider.

A small bottle of Cragganmore's excellent 12 year old, perfect for sampling or filling a hip flask

Tasting Notes (1)

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2009 Bunnahabhain single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single first-fill sherry butt for 11 years, before being bottled as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Croftengea 2007 Sample
13 Year Old North Star Series 014
product_description: A sample of heavily peated Croftengea from Loch Lomond distillery in the southern Highlands. This release by North Star Spirits was matured in a single refill hogshead and bottled at 13 years of age. Expect salted caramel, black peppercorns, and thick smoke.
A 3cl Perfect Measure of Cragganmore Distiller’s Edition, aged for 12 years and finished in Port casks. Nice and jammy with orange, cocoa, and cherry with on the palate.

product_name:
Caol Ila 2005 Sample
15 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice for TWE
product_description: A Perfect Measure of our exclusive Caol Ila from Gordon & MacPhail. Bottled from a single Sherry cask, this shows lots of baked apples, sultanas, and toasted oak on the palate, with soft smoke that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glenrothes 2005
15 Year Old Sample Old Particular Purim Edition 2021
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 2005 Glenrothes single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single sherry butt for 15 years, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of its Old Particular Purim Edition.

product_name:
Old Rhosdhu 1994 Sample
27 Year Old Coopers Choice
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 1994 Old Rhosdhu single malt from indie bottler The Vintage Malt Whisky Company, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for almost three decades before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Coopers Choice series.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2012-vintage Port Charlotte Islay Barley heavily-peated single malt from Bruichladdich, made using barley from eight farms on Islay. Aromas of lemon, apple sauce, pears, summer flowers, chocolate-covered coconut, burnt heather, muddy peat and vanilla fill the nose. The palate offers notes of milk chocolate, black pepper, freshly-baked scones, honey, earthy smoke, apricot, cream and warm, sandy beaches that linger in the finish.

A 2007-vintage Speyside single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, made at a mystery distillery and matured in a single butt for 14 years, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

product_name:
Loch Lomond 25 Year Old
Lee Westward Single Cask
product_description: A 25-year-old single malt from Loch Lomond, made in collaboration with 2020 Race To Dubai winner Lee Westwood. Matured in a refill American oak hogshead for quarter of a century, it reflects the 25 European Tour wins that Westwood has achieved, and offers aromas of sweet vanilla fudge and ripe pineapple on the nose. The palate holds notes of ripe peach, crispy apples, caramel and toasted oak, with hints of ginger and cinnamon lingering in the finish.

Made exclusively with barley harvested from near Kingsbarns in East Fife, this is a clean, complex Lowland single malt. The nose offers notes of banana, pineapple, red berries and a slight herbal note.The palate is light, fruity and floral, with notes of toffee, custard tarts and redcurrants, plus an undercurrent of ginger.

Mannochmore's delicate and fragrant entry into the Flora and Fauna range. One of the only bottlings you'll find with their name on the front.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 2013-vintage Port Charlotte Islay Barley from Bruichladdich, made with barley grown by seven Islay farmers in 2012. Matured in a combination of ex-American whiskey casks and ex-wine casks from France's Pessac-Léognan region, it offers aromas of orange zest, earthy peat, banoffee pie, digestive biscuits, cherry, apricot and melon that fill the nose. The palate is full of almond, coconut, caramel, peat and vanilla notes, complemented by a medley of summer fruits, heathery smoke and oaky spice.

product_name: Horse With No Name Bourbon Infused with Habanero
product_description: An oaky, spicy bourbon, Horse With No Name is made with a combination of yellow dent Texas corn, soft red winter wheat and six-row distiller's malt, and infused with habanero chillies.

product_name:
Balvenie 12 Year Old
Double Wood Small Bottle
product_description:
A 20cl bottle of Balvenie's popular 12 Year Old DoubleWood. The double maturation by finishing in first-fill European oak sherry casks adds complexity. The first maturation softens and adds character, with the finishing in sherry casks adding depth and fullness of flavour.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Old Pulteney 1982
37 Year Old Gordon & MacPhail Private Collection
product_description: A 1982 Old Pulteney single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill hogshead before being bottled in December 2020 as part of its Private Collection.

product_name:
Macallan 30 Year Old
Sherry Oak 2021 Release
product_description: The 2021 release of Macallan 30 Year Old Sherry Oak is a rich, complex single malt matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry casks. Aromas of clove-studded oranges, nutmeg, raisins, plums and walnuts fill the nose, complemented by notes of dried fruit, oranges, sherry-soaked raisins, soft wood smoke and nutmeg throughout the palate.
A young and peaty single malt whisky from an unnamed Islay distillery, this has garnered praise for its straight-to-the-point smoky flavour.
A 2007 Glen Ord single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of hogsheads for 13 years, before being bottled in June 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

A 1992-vintage Islay single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, made at a mystery distillery and matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for 28 years, before being bottled in April 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

A relaunched Singleton, this time from Dufftown, to replace the now-defunct Singleton of Auchroisk. This smooth, mellow dram is designed to attract new drinkers to the malt category.

Tasting Notes (1)

A spicy, sweet single malt from Singleton of Dufftown, matured for 25 years in a combination of American and European oak casks. Aromas of tropical fruit, baking spices and honey fill the nose, complemented by notes of ginger, pears, pineapple, passionfruit and apple throughout the palate.

A sweet and citrus-forward single malt from Singleton of Dufftown, matured in a combination of American and European oak casks for 21 years. Aromas of honey, ginger, orange, sherry-soaked peaches, oranges and crunchy red apples fill the nose, complemented by notes of red berries, stewed fruit, treacle toffee, burnt orange and boiled sweets throughout the palate.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2019 release of the ever-popular Old Pulteney 25 Year Old – matured for a quarter of a century and finished in ex-sherry casks. The palate offers rich notes of toffee, vanilla, raisins and figs, as well as bitter dark chocolate and spicy pepper flavours that linger in the finish.

After maturation in 100% American oak casks, this Auchentoshan 18 years is a significant step up in quality and complexity from the Classic and 12 yrs expressions.

Tasting Notes (1)
A miniature of Tomintoul's peated spirit, a bit different to their usual spicy Speysider.
A stunning aged dram from Tullibardine, the top of their relaunched 2013 range. Honey, spice and fruit packed in with cream toasted oak.

A 5cl miniature of Glenglassaugh Revival, the first readily available Single Malt released entirely using spirit distilled after the reopening of the distillery in 2008. Revival was finished in first fill Oloroso sherry butts for 6 months and shows the potential this distillery is showing.

AnCnoc 18 Year Old has been matured in a combination of oloroso sherry and bourbon casks, all of which were second-fill barrels. An aromatic and sweet Highlander.

Tasting Notes (2)

The opening salvo of the Glenlivet range, named in honour of the distillery's founder, George Smith. It's classic Glenlivet, with a creamy and fruity character bolstered by the use of first-fill American oak to mature some of the whisky.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Ardmore Traditional Cask
Gift Boxed Miniature
product_description: A miniature of young peated Highlander from the excellent Ardmore distillery, which has been finished in quarter casks to speed up maturation. Gold Medal in its category at the World Whisky Awards 2010.
A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 2008 vintage single malt from Glencadam, matured in a single first-fill bourbon cask for more than a decade, before being bottled in February 2020.

product_name:
Edradour 2008 Sample
12 Year Old Natural Cask Strength
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2008 Edradour single malt from the distillery's Natural Cask Strength series, matured in a single cask for 12 years, before being bottled in November 2020.

product_name:
Ruadh Maor (Peated Glenturret) 2012
8 Year Old Carn Mor
product_description: A 2012 Ruadh Maor single malt from indie bottler Carn Mor, this peated whisky was distilled at Glenturret and matured in a single refill sherry hogshead for eight years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Strictly Limited series.
A 2009 Glenlossie single malt from indie bottler Carn Mor, matured in a hogshead for a decade, before being bottled as part of its Strictly Limited series.

product_name:
Glen Moray 2005
16 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 2005 Glen Moray single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single refill barrel for 16 years, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Old Malt Cask series. Aromas of almond croissants, apple turnovers and aniseed fill the nose, complemented by notes of sweet pastry, raspberry jam, peaches, ginger and toasted marshmallow throughout the palate.

A 2006-vintage single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, made at a mystery Orkney distillery and matured in a single refill hogshead for 15 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its First Editions range. Aromas of salted caramel, cookie dough and garden herbs fill the nose, complemented by notes of milk chocolate, sea salt, pink peppercorns and buttery crumpets throughout the palate.

Created in conjunction with top bartenders, this is the first Glenmorangie made for mixing. With delicious notes of pear, vanilla, orange and fudge, this is ideal for serving as a long drink with your favourite mixer.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glencadam Miniature Gift Pack
10, 15 and 21 Year Old
product_description: A gift pack from Glencadam containing a miniature bottle each of the 10, 15, and 21-year-old expressions.

The sixth release of Br in the Elements of Islay series was distilled in 1992 and bottled in 2015 making this a 23 year old malt. This is light and fresh, showing the distillery's classic mix of coastal character and orchard fruits.

Tasting Notes (1)

A collection of the 2021 Kinship collection from independent bottler Hunter Laing, released in celebration of the Feis Ile festival. The whiskies included in this set are a 1989 Bunnahabhain single malt, 1991 Bruichladdich single malt, 1980 Caol Ila single malt, 2001 Ardbeg single malt, 1997 Laphroaig single malt and a 1987 Bowmore single malt.

product_name:
Finlaggan Old Reserve
Small Batch Islay Malt
product_description: A mystery Islay single malt from an unnamed distillery, purported by many to be Lagavulin, which somehow seems a little unlikely to us. That said, this is a terrific dram for the money and likely to appeal to frugal peatheads.

product_name:
Blair Athol 12 Year Old
Flora & Fauna
product_description: A great, but sadly neglected, Highlander, Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. This expression has always tended towards the chunky, sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.

A miniature bottle of Glengoyne's 12 year old, first launched in 2009. Despite being a Highland malt, this whisky would have been aged in the Lowlands as the maturing warehouses are across the border on the other side of the road.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1996
23 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice
product_description: A 1996 Glen Grant single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill hogshead for more than two decades, before being bottled in February 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of lemon sherbet, pear and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of toasted oak, green apple, menthol and lemon peel throughout the palate.
Glen Moray 15 Year Old has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks. A rich, sweet and full-bodied whisky with notes of spiced dark chocolate and butter toffee.

product_name:
Tomintoul 30 Year Old
Robert Fleming 30th Anniversary 2nd Release
product_description: A smooth, rich 30-year-old Tomintoul single malt that has been finished in ex-Pedro Ximenez sherry oak and bottled in December 2020 in celebration of Master Distiller Robert Fleming's 30th anniversary as manager of the distillery.

A 1997 Glenrothes single malt from independent bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for more than 20 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its First Editions series. Aromas of vanilla custard, apples, pears and mint fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla caramel, toffee apples, oak spice and hints of orange zest throughout the palate.

A 1990 Isle of Jura single malt, distilled on December 5th 1990 and filled into American white oak ex-bourbon barrels, where it was matured for 26 years, before spending a further three years in Amoroso oloroso sherry butts. Aromas of peaches, cinnamon, mango, liquorice and marzipan fill the nose, complemented by notes of blackberries, raspberries, apple pie, gooseberries and vanilla custard throughout the palate.
A 1999 Edradour single malt, matured for 21 years and finished in a Bordeaux wine cask, before being bottled in November 2020.
Tláth is a non-age-statement release from Tomintoul. Aged exclusively in bourbon barrels this is sweet with notes of toffee, vanilla, white pepper and nutmeg.
A 2012 Caol Ila single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for eight years, before being bottled in March 2021 as part of its Provenance series.

product_name:
Caol Ila 2000
15 Year Old Unpeated Special Releases 2016
product_description:
The Diageo Special Releases 2016 edition of unpeated Caol Ila, yet again shot through with a hint of smoke. It's a mixture of American- and European-oak-matured whisky, adding some richness to Caol Ila's nutty unpeated spirit.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Dailuaine 16 Year Old Sample
Flora & Fauna
product_description: the only official bottling of Dailuaine is rich and sweet with notes of fruit and spice.
This gift set is a great way to try the Talisker range. It contains a miniature each of Skye, Storm and 10 Year Old. Three coastal whiskies from the Isle of Skye distillery.

A fruity, smoky 30-year-old single malt from Benraich, matured in a combination of bourbon barrels, sherry casks, virgin oak casks and Port casks from the Duoro Valley. The result is aromas of mellow smoke, stewed plums, orange, walnut and cinnamon-dusted hot chocolate that fill the nose, complemented by notes of dark fruit, Manuka honey, milk chocolate, raisins and smoky honey throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glen Moray Port Cask Finish
Glass Set
product_description: Glen Moray's Classic range of bottlings always represent great value. This gift set contains two glasses and a bottle of the expression which is finished in port casks, adding sweetness and extra richness.

product_name:
Caol Ila 1988
32 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice
product_description: A 1988 Caol Ila single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill hogshead for more than three decades, before being bottled in January 2021.

product_name:
Linkwood 1973
39 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1973 Linkwood single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured for 39 years.

A limited-edition 2008 Tomatin single malt from the distillery's French Collection that was finished in Rivesaltes wine casks. Aromas of toasted hazelnuts, sweet barley and soft fruits that fill the nose and are echoed throughout the palate.

product_name:
Lagavulin 12 Year Old
17th Release Special Releases 2017
product_description:
The 15th incarnation of Lagavulin 12 in the Diageo Special Releases, a testament to the sheer likeability and complexity of this whisky. Its relative youth compared to the phenomenally popular Lagavulin 16 can be misleading: this Islay whisky is rewardingly diverse, with smoke and fruit melded into minerality. Expect swirling layers of smoke, liquorice, charred meats and green tones of apple and sweet pear.


This cask-strength whisky has been created from refill American Oak hogsheads, each at least 12 years old.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Tormore 1992
26 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 1992 Tormore single malt from independent bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single cask for more than a quarter of a century before being bottled in 2019.

The waves of fruit and smoke in this peated Glenglassaugh are amplified by a period of extra maturation in ruby port pipes. Expect peppery dark fruits, beguiling smoke and hints of sea salt.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Benrinnes 2009
11 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2009 Benrinnes single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single cask for 11 years before being bottled in 2021.

product_name: New Zealand DoubleWood 16 Year Old Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 16-year-old New Zealand whisky that has been matured in ex-bourbon barrels for six years, before spending a further 10 years finishing in French oak New Zealand wine casks. Aromas of blackberries, stewed fruit and cocoa fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of maple syrup, rich red berries and honey.

product_name:
Cu Bocan Creation 1
Stout & Moscatel Cask
product_description: The first release in the Cu Bocan Creation series, this Highland single malt has been matured in a combination of imperial stout casks from Black Isle Brewery and Bacalhoa Moscatel de Setubal wine casks. It has a complex character, with notes of tobacco, coffee, leather and green herbs, balanced by sweet marmalade, dried fruits and melted butter.

A lightly-peated Highland single malt, made at Tomatin distillery, matured in a combination of ex-bourbon, ex-sherry and virgin oak casks. Distilled every winter in small batches, it offers notes of vanilla, cinnamon, apples, raisins and delicate citrus above a background of soft peat smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)
A 2010 Caol Ila single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for a decade, before being bottled in December 2020 as part of its Provenance series.

product_name:
Jura 18 Year Old
Red Wine Finish
product_description:
Softly smoky and packed with rich fruit flavour, Jura 18 sits at the top of the Jura range. Aged for 18 years in bourbon casks before a finish in red wine casks, this carefully balances the distillery's soft smoke with weighty flavours from the casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Blackstrap Cove Double Cask
Gibraltar Distillery Co.
product_description: A smooth and fruity single malt whisky from Gibraltar Distillery Company, aged in a combination of bourbon barrels and Pedro Ximenez casks.

A 30-year-old Islay single malt from Peat's Beast, this full-bodied, intense whisky was made at a mystery distillery. The palate is a balance of peat smoke, salty sea air, dried seaweed, lemon, toffee, heather and garden herbs that linger in the finish.
A 2000 Braeval single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single refill butt for 21 years, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A 2000 Caperdronich single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for 20 years, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A 2008 Old Pulteney single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, finished in an ex-sherry butt and bottled after 12 years as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Allt-a-Bhainne 2000
20 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 2000 Allt-a-Bhainne single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, finished in a single sherry butt, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

The fourth entry in the Edition range, this release focuses on the structure of the distillery's trademark weighty style, as well as celebrating the opening of Macallan's incredible new distillery. It is a well-balanced dram, constructed to show the best of each cask type selected to create the whisky: European and American oak refill butts and hogsheads, as well as butts, puncheons and hogsheads specifically from Vasmya, Diego Martin, Jose y Miguel Martin and Tevasa.

A 1992 Jura single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a refill hogshead for almost three decades before being bottled in January 2021 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of honeysuckle, green apples and milk chocolate fill the nose, complemented by notes of watermelon, pear, black pepper and almond throughout the palate.
A fruity, soft single malt from Tamnavulin that has been finished in German Pinot Noir red wine casks.

Macallan 18yo Fine Oak is matured in a combination of Bourbon & Sherry Oak Casks. This range has been around for a few years now and seems to have weathered the storm it caused amongst the faithful when it was initially released. This one is probably the pick of the (Fine Oak) bunch.

New for 2018, Old Pulteney's 18 Year Old is aged in both ex-bourbon and Spanish oak casks. This is an intense and warming incarnation of the beloved maritime malt.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 15-year-old expression of Old Balantruan, the peated line from Tomintoul distillery. Bottled at 50% ABV, this is a laid-back beast of a whisky; big peat smoke rolls around the mouth along with softer Speyside flavours – vanilla, toffee and a touch of woodiness.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Old Potrero 18th Century Style Rye Spirit
product_description: An excellent rye from Old Potrero, this is a truly exceptional and unique example of rye whisky as it was originally made in the 18th Century.

product_name:
Arran Machrie Moor Cask Strength
Peated
product_description:
A cask-strength version of The Arran's peated Machrie Moor single malt - a whisky crafted to encapsulate the rugged and myth-strewn landscape of the island of Arran. Bottled at 56.2%, the sharp citrus notes and brooding peat smoke last easily into the lingering finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Moray 2006 Sample
14 Year Old Sauternes Cask
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a festive 2006 Glen Moray single malt, matured for 14 years in five ex-Sauternes casks creating aromas of dark chocolate, coffee, toffee, Seville oranges and oaky vanilla on the nose. The palate offers notes of salted caramel, vanilla cream, sweet raspberries, dark chocolate, coffee and Seville orange, with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg lingering in the finish.

product_name:
Glen Elgin 2010 Sample
10 Year Old Single Cask Nation
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 2010 Glen Elgin single malt from indie bottler Single Cask Nation, matured in a single ex-bourbon hogshead for a decade. Aromas of lemon, white chocolate, vanilla and caramel fill the nose, complemented by notes of pine needles, kiwi, meringue and grapefruit.

The 2005 vintage of Balblair is a light, fruity and refreshing dram that's typical of the Highland distillery's style. Matured in casks that previously held bourbon, this single malt has notes of toffee and vanilla alongside orchard citrus and ground spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Glen Garioch 15 Year Old Sherry Cask
product_description: Glen Garioch 15 Year Old has been aged in oloroso sherry casks and has a sweet and fruity character. The nose opens with dark berries and dried fruits, followed by sweet vanilla notes and a slight tartness. The palate is thick and full bodied, giving notes of dried fruits and cinnamon spice. A hint of heather honey appears before a long woody finish, with gentle spices throughout.
A 2010 Ledaig single malt from independent bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single bourbon barrel for nine years before being bottled in July 2020 as part of its Provenance series.

product_name:
Secret Orkney 2005
15 Year Old The Cooper's Choice
product_description: A 2005 Orkney single malt from indie bottler The Vintage Malt Whisky Company, made at a mystery distillery on Orkney and matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for 15 years before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Coopers Choice series.

product_name:
Glen Keith 1993
26 Year Old Signatory for TWE
product_description:
Matured in a single hogshead for more than a quarter of a century, this 1993 Glen Keith single malt was bottled by Signatory Vintage in August 2019, exclusively for The Whisky Exchange's 20th Anniversary.

Tasting Notes (1)

The second whisky in the Bowmore Vault Edition series showcases the distillery's smoky character and balance of sea salt and sweet fruit flavours. Aromas if peat, ash, toffee, leather and sea salt mingle with herbal hints of thyme, rosemary and mint on the nose. The palate offers notes of sweet sherry, sticky fruits, barbeque smoke and volcanic ash, with an undercurrent of smouldering driftwood.

Glendronach Traditionally Peated is a fruity, smoky single malt created to highlight the effect of adding peat at the end of the kiln fire rather than the start. The result is a warm, earthy smoke that complements aromas of toffee, treacle, dark honey and sweet barley on the nose. The palate offers notes of burnt orange and treacle over a blanket of cloves and smoked brambles.

product_name:
Glencadam 1999
20 Year Old PX Sherry Cask
product_description: A 1999 single malt from Glencadam, matured in a Pedro Ximenez sherry butt for two decades, before being bottled in February 2020. Aromas of buttered toast, caramel and sultanas fill the nose, complemented by notes of dried fruit, crystalised ginger, fudge and liquorice throughout the palate.
A 2007 vintage single malt from Tomintoul, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for 12 years, before being bottled in January 2020.

Glencadam Reserva Aldalucia pays homage to the relationship between Glencadam distillery and the famous sherry-producing region of Jerez in Andalucia, Spain. Made from a selection of sherry butts from Glencadam's dunnage warehouses that were married with bourbons casks and finished in carefully selected oloroso sherry casks from Andalucia.
A smoky, tropical whisky from Smokehead, matured in ex-rum casks, that offers notes of medicinal peat, sweet caramel, burnt pineapple and caramelised bananas.

product_name:
Glenturret 10 Year Old Peat Smoked
2020 Maiden Release
product_description: A sweet-and-smoky 10-year-old single malt from Glenturret, this peated whisky is part of Glenturret's 2020 Maiden Releases. Aromas of lively citrus and mellow peat fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, oak, lemon, orange and smouldering embers on the palate.

product_name:
Linkwood 10 Years Old
 Reserve Cask - Parcel No.4
product_description: A 10-year-old Linkwood single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a small selection of casks before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Reserve Cask series Parcel 4. Aromas of green melon, freshly-cut hay, ripe barley, apple and blackcurrant fill the nose, with hints of butterscotch in the background. The palate offers notes of barley sugar sweets, under-ripe pears, nettle soup, crunchy red apples, sea salt and black pepper that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glen Moray Classic Range Miniature Gift Set
4x5cl
product_description: A lovely gift pack from Glen Moray that explores the Elgin Classic Range. This gift set includes a miniature bottle of Glen Moray Classic single malt, Glen Moray Classic Sherry Cask Finish, Glen Moray Classic Port Cask Finish and Glen Moray Classic Peated single malt.
A 2010 Edradour single malt, matured for a decade in a single sherry butt before being bottled in September 2020.
The 2020 Distillers Edition single malt from Cragganmore was distilled in 2008 and matured for 12 years before being bottled in 2020.

A 2010 Edradour single malt from the distillery's Straight From The Cask series, matured in a single sherry butt for a decade before being bottled in November 2020.
