Rich, fruity aromas of raisins, dates, cinnamon and cloves fill the nose, complemented by notes of tobacco leaves, dark chocolate, black cherries and plums throughout the palate.
A 2002 Longmorn single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for 18 years, before being bottled in October 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Bunnahabhain Toiteach A Dha
Small Bottle
product_description: A small bottle of the first peated whisky in Bunnahabhain's core range. Like the limited edition Toiteach that came before it, Toiteach A Dha (which means 'smoky two' in Scots Gaelic) is a smoky single malt with a sherry twist. Matured in both bourbon and sherry casks, with a higher sherry influence than Toiteach, this is a delicate mix of smoke and sweet sherry fruit.

A 2009 Bunnahabhain single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single first-fill sherry butt for 11 years, before being bottled in November 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

Created by master distiller Robert Fleming to be the perfect partner for the world's finest cigars, Tomintoul Cigar Blend is made with a combination of peated and un-peated whisky and matured in oloroso sherry butts from Andalucia in Spain. Aromas of dried fruit, cinnamon spice, pecan pie and soft smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of chocolate-covered raisins, butter toffees, brambles, oak spice and smouldering logs throughout the palate.
A 2009 Ardmore single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of ex-bourbon barrels for 11 years, before being bottled in December 2020.

A very special whisky from Benriach, Smoke Season is its smokiest whisky yet. While Speyside isn't well known for making peaty whiskies, Benriach have been doing so for years and Smoke Season shows off not only the smoky side of its spirit, but also uses both ex-bourbon and virgin-oak casks to add layers of creaminess and spice.

product_name:
Glenburgie 1975
45 Year Old Berry Bros Exceptional Casks
product_description: A 1975 Glenburgie single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single hogshead for more than four decades, before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Exceptional Cask series. Aromas of old leather, cigar boxes and rich dried fruit fill the nose, complemented by notes of tropical fruit, beeswax and tobacco leaves throughout the palate.

product_name:
Springbank (Hazelburn) 1998
22 Year Old Sherry Cask North Star
product_description: A 1998 Hazelburn single malt distilled at Springbank from indie bottler North Star Spirits, matured in a sherry hogshead for 22 years before being bottled in November 2020. Aromas of caramelised almonds, golden syrup and marzipan fill the nose, complemented by notes of ginger flapjacks, chocolate praline and raspberry jam throughout the palate.

product_name:
Caperdonich Peated 25 Year Old
Secret Speyside Batch 2
product_description: A smoky, peated Caperdronich from Secret Speyside, matured in a single hogshead for a quarter of a century before being bottled. Aromas of ripe green apples, sweet, heathery smoke and salty seaweed fill the nose, complemented by notes of stewed pears, bonfire smoke and soft peaches throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glenlivet 2006
14 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 2006 Glenlivet single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single first-fill sherry butt for 14 years, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

A 2007 Edradour single malt from the distillery's Ibisco Decanter series, matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years before being bottled in September 2020. Chocolatey aromas of bourbon biscuits, oaky vanilla and caramel fill the nose, complemented by notes of peppery oak, vanilla fudge and chocolate-covered raisins throughout the palate.

product_name:
Angels’ Nectar 11 Year Old Cairngorms 2nd Edition

Single Cask
product_description: The second release of 11-year-old limited-edition Speyside single malt from Angels' Nectar, released to support environmental and community projects in the Cairngorms National Park. Matured in a single cask, it offers notes of brandy butter and dried tropical fruit on the palate.

product_name:
Caol Ila Unpeated 2005
15 Year Old Old Particular
product_description: A 2005 Caol Ila single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for 15 years before being bottled in October 2020 as part of its Old Particular series. Aromas of salty driftwood, cured meats and aromatic herbs fill the nose, complemented by notes of orange, lemon shortbread, charred oak and juicy mango throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glen Elgin 2008
12 Year Old Single Malts Of Scotland
product_description: A 2008 Glen Elgin single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a single hogshead for 12 years, before being bottled in January 2021 as part of its Single Malts of Scotland series.

A heavily-peated 2011 Port Charlotte single malt from Bruichladdich, PAC:01 has been matured in ex-American whiskey casks for six years before being finished in ex-Pauillac red wine casks for a further two years before bottling. Aromas of clove, ginger, chocolate, toasted malt, toffee, coconut and vanilla mingle with melon, citrus, plums and raisins on the nose, alongside rich waves of salty peat smoke. The palate offers notes of dried fruit, marzipan, earthy peat, seaweed, orange and salted caramel that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Arran 23 Year Old Drumadroon Point
Explorers Series Vol.4
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the fourth release in Isle of Arran Distillers Explorers Series, Drumadoon Point is a 23-year-old single malt, inspired by the sandy beaches, grassy hills and boulders of Drumadoon Point, home of the picturesque Shiskine Golf Club. Matured in sherry puncheons from Jerez, Spain, for more than two decades, creating aromas of sweet red apples, rich malt, fresh pastries and roasted walnuts that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon baked apples, dark chocolate, star anise and dried fruit that linger in the finish.

A lovely gift pack containing a bottle of Glenrothes 12 Year Old single malt and a pair of stylish tumblers to enjoy it with. Aged solely in sherry-seasoned casks, this Speyside whisky has notes of vanilla, melon, banana and cinnamon.

product_name:
Benriach The Twenty One
21 Year Old
product_description: An sweet, smoky and elegant 21-year-old single malt from Benriach that is made with a combination of peated and un-peated spirit and matured in a combination of bourbon barrels, sherry casks, virgin oak casks and Bordeaux red wine casks. The result is aromas of berry compote, wild honey, crunchy apples, spicy oak and delicate smoke that fill the nose, complemented by notes of grape, dark chocolate, smoked pine nuts, caramelised pear and honey smoke throughout the palate.

product_name:
Bunnahabhain Stoisha 2014
5 Year Old Daily Dram
product_description: A 2014 Bunnahabhain Stoisha single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured in a single hogshead for five years before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Daily Drams series. Aromas of bonfire ash, smoked bacon, iodine, vanilla and cookie dough fill the nose, complemented by notes of stewed fruits, grapefruit, cherries, tobacco leaves, mint and thick bonfire smoke throughout the palate.
A 2005 vintage Knockando single malt that was matured for 15 years, creating notes of rich fruit, sweet spices and toasted almonds throughout the palate.

Introduced to replace the beloved Nikka 12 Year Old, Tailored is a blend that includes malt whisky from Nikka's Yoichi and Miyagikyo distilleries as well as its Coffey Still grain. The whisky balances soft fruity notes with bitter notes of dark chocolate and citrus zest. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Mortlach 15 Year Old
G&M Distillery Labels
product_description: A 15-year-old Mortlach single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail's Distillery Labels Collection.

A 2009 Miltonduff single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of bourbon barrels for 11 years, before being bottled in March 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

This whisky comes from the Zuidam distillery who very much take a farm to glass approach to their production. All the rye coming out of here are really to class. This three-year-old has a gentle spice with notes of candied orange, black pepper, cinnamon and plenty of orchard fruits.

This 1995 vintage Fettercairn has been aged for 25 years in a pair of hogsheads. Showing off the distillery's natural character, this was bottled by indie bottler Signatory as part of the Cask Strength Collection in April 2021.
A gift pack of three miniature bottles of Aberfeldy's core range - the 12 year old, 16 year old and 21 year old.

product_name:
Linkwood 2009
11 Year Old Small Batch Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2009 Linkwood single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a refill hogshead for 11 years, before being bottled in 2021. Aromas of peach, banana, melon and toasted oak fill the nose, complemented by notes of fruit salad, orange, grapefruit and vanilla throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glengoyne 12 Year Old
Time Keeper Gift Set
product_description: A gift set from Glengoyne that includes a bottle of Glengoyne 12 Year Old single malt and a stylish Glencairn tasting glass.

Made with the finest local ingredients, Bladnoch Vinaya has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks to create a sweet, refreshing character with aromas of summer flowers, grass and boiled sweets on the nose. The palate offers notes of fresh green apples, milk chocolate and white pepper that linger in the finish. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

The 2021 release of Bladnoch 11 Year Old single malt has been matured exclusively in ex-bourbon casks. Aromas of honeydew melon, buttery pastries, lemongrass and pine needles fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla ice cream, caramel sauce, grass, cinnamon, honeycomb and nutmeg throughout the palate.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the first whisky in the Glen Grant Rothes Chronicles series. Cask Haven is a full-bodied single malt that has been matured in first-fill bourbon and sherry casks, creating notes of vanilla, black pepper, ginger, lemon and lime throughout the palate.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a celebratory release from Speyburn to commemorate the 18th anniversary of Bobby Anderson’s position as distillery manager. This single malt, aged for 18 years in American and Spanish oak casks, has aromas of toffee and sugared almonds, as well as tropical fruits on the nose. The palate holds flavours of rich dark chocolate, toffee and a touch of citrus, with plenty of smoke throughout. The finish is long and smoky, with a sweeter honeyed edge.

A miniature of 15-year-old Glenallachie single malt, matured in a combination of Pedro Ximenez and oloroso sherry casks, creating a smooth, rich character. Aromas of raisins, butterscotch and sweet spices fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of dark chocolate, orange peel, banana, raisins and caramel.
The Flora and Fauna release of 10 year old Auchroisk. Until the 2010 release of a 20 year-old, this was the only generally available distillery bottling from this young distillery.

product_name:
Glenallachie 2008 Sample
10 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2008 Glenallachie single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single cask for a decade, before being bottled in 2019.

product_name:
Strathmill 12 Year Old Sample
 Flora & Fauna
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of Strathmill 12 Year Old from the Flora & Fauna series.

product_name:
Aultmore 9 Years Old

Reserve Cask - Parcel No.4
product_description: A nine-year-old Aultmore single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a batch of six barrels and bottled in 2020 as part of its Single Malts of Scotland Reserve Cask series. Aromas of freshly-baked cinnamon roles mingle with poached pears, candy apples, autumn leaves and red cherries on the nose. The palate offers notes of custard cream biscuits, milky tea, coconut, hazelnut chocolate and caramel, with a bold splash of mango bursting through.
The award winning Ileach single malt whisky, sourced from an unnamed Islay distillery, bottled at cask strength.
Matured in first-fill sherry casks for 21 years, this Benromach single malt offers notes of cinnamon, Seville orange, raspberry, honey and soft smoke throughout the palate.
A miniature bottle of Glenfiddich 18 year old. Matured in a mixture of Spanish oloroso casks and American oak for a rich and fruity whisky.
A mini bottle of Old Pulteney's reliable coastal 12 year old single malt whisky.
A little-seen, high-strength Glenfiddich 15yo, this version is normally only available at the distillery itself.

The second batch of AnCnoc Peatheart, from the Knockdhu distillery in the Highlands, is again made using barley peated to 40ppm. It offers a mix of soft smoky and juicy fruit notes, balanced by a touch of sweet fudge.

Tasting Notes (1)

A Perfect Measure sample of the 2019 release of Highland Park 30 year Old, a whisky that shows off quite how well the distillery's spirit ages. It's run through with Highland Park's classic heathery smoke, gentle and softened with age, as well as the trademark chocolate and caramel notes.

product_name:
Deanston 2002
17 Year Old Organic PX Finish
product_description: A limited-edition 2002 Deanston single malt, matured in a Pedro Ximenez cask for 17 years before being bottled in 2020. Aromas of dried fruit, raisins and dates fill the nose, complemented by notes of caramel, maple syrup, candied peel and sherry-soaked raisins on the palate.

A mini of the Bowmore 18 year-old, which replaced the 17 year-old expression in 2007. Probably the most maritime Bowmore we've tried, very kippery.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Blair Athol 1988
31 Year Old Daily Dram
product_description: A 1988 Blair Athol single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured in a single cask for more than three decades, before being bottled in 2020 as part of its The Nectar of The Daily Drams series.
A 1997 Ardmore single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured in a single cask for 22 years before being bottled in 2020 as part of its The Nectar of The Daily Drams series.

product_name:
Ardbeg Traigh Bhan 19 Year Old
Batch 2
product_description: The second batch of Arbeg Traigh Bhan 19 Year Old, released in September 2020, is a single batch whisky that offers aromas of sweet wood smoke, vegetal fennel, tea leaves, charcoal and toast on the nose. The palate offers notes of salty peanuts, medicinal smoke, lime juice, smoked pineapple, aniseed, tar and peat smoke that linger in the finish.

A limited-edition 25-year-old Macallan single malt, distilled in 1993 and matured in a single sherry hogshead until being bottled in October 2018. The palate offers notes of clove-studded oranges, cinnamon, plums and dried fruit.

A well-aged and elegant expression for Dalwhinnie, released as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2020. It was matured in refill hogsheads for 30 years, creating a crême-brulée-tinged whisky that's run through with fruit, herbs and spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 30-year-old single malt from Loch Lomond, released in 2020 after three decades in American oak casks and being finished in oloroso sherry casks. Aromas of honey-glazed peaches, melons, vanilla and cinnamon fill the nose, complemented by notes of crisp green apples, toffee, ripe pineapple, ginger and nutmeg that linger in the finish.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a complex, smoky Bowmore from Elixir Distillers' Elements of Islay series, made with whiskies from 2001 and 2003, aged in ex-bourbon barrels and sherry butts for at least 16 years. Aromas of grapefruit, smoky charcoal, baked lemons, under-ripe mango and lime juice fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, candied limes, sea salt, papaya, kiwi and buttered samphire.
A peated single grain whisky from Loch Lomond that offers notes of soft fruits, creamy vanilla, heathery peat and wisps of smoke.

product_name:
Royal Brackla 20 Year Old
Moscatel Double Cask
product_description: Laid down in 1998 and bottled in 2019 at 52.9% ABV, this 20-year-old Royal Brackla has spent an impressive 11 years of its life in a Moscatel wine cask. The result is a symphony of sweet fruits, almonds and aromatic floral notes. Limited to just 192 bottles.

This award-winning 16-year-old single malt from BenRiach distillery has fruit and flora at its heart, layered with rounded honey sweetness, orchard fruit and bourbon-cask character. Speyside depth married beautifully with a light freshness; a well-balanced and fruity Speysider, exemplary of its style.

A longer aged whisky from Cardhu, staying in the cask for 18 years for a richer and more complex flavour. The 18 Year Old retains Cardhu's soft, approachable style, but adds notes of rich fruit, leather and chocolate to the mix.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Keith 21 Year Old
Secret Speyside
product_description: A nutty, fruity Glen Keith single malt from Secret Speyside, matured in a combination of specially-selected barrels and butts for 21 years. Aromas of peaches, ripe pears, runny honey and vanilla toffee fill the nose, complemented by notes of orchard fruits, marzipan and lemon zest throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glenfiddich Malt Master's Edition
Sherry Cask Finish
product_description: Glenfiddich's Malt Master Brian Kinsman was the first to double-mature a Glenfiddich whisky in two different casks (although shorter finishing periods in more than one kind of casks has of course been done several times before). This whisky has been matured for some time in traditional oak casks before finishing its maturation in sherry casks.

The 2019 edition of Highland Park 25 Year Old single malt has been matured in a combination of ex-sherry and ex-bourbon casks, creating layers of fruit and vanilla to the palate, amid waves of smoky peat.
A 2005 Girvan single grain whisky from indie bottler Asta Morris, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for 13 years, before being bottled in 2020.

product_name:
Balvenie
Doublewood 12 & 17 Year Old, Caribbean 14 Year Old 3x5cl
product_description: A set of 3 miniatures comprising one each of Balvenie's Doublewood 12 year old, Doublewood 17 year old and the deliciously fruity Caribbean cask 14 year old.
A miniature bottle of Tominotul's 12 Year Old. A recently-introduced variant from the under-appreciated distilelry, this has been finished in an Oloroso sherry cask and is soft, sweet and creamy.

A complex, smoky Bowmore from Elixir Distillers' Elements of Islay series, made with whiskies from 2001 and 2003, aged in ex-bourbon barrels and sherry butts for at least 16 years. Aromas of grapefruit, smoky charcoal, baked lemons, under-ripe mango and lime juice fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, candied limes, sea salt, papaya, kiwi and buttered samphire.

product_name:
Glenfiddich 19 Year Old
Age of Discovery Red Wine
product_description: Commemorating the 1831 voyage of Charles Darwin in HMS Beagle, this is the third release in the Age of Discovery series from Glenfiddich. Aged for 19 years, including a finishing period in South American red-wine casks, it's a rich, warm and spicy whisky.

Glen Grant 12 Year Old was added to the core range in 2016. The only release regularly seen in the UK was previously the 10 Year Old, so this is a welcome addition to the distillery's range. Light and fruity with notes of apple pie, caramel, vanilla and subtle spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 1995 Glen Grant single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of ex-bourbon barrels for more than two decades, before being bottled in March 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

Macallan Enigma was released as a part of the Quest Collection, aged exclusively in European oak sherry casks from a single cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain. Enigma is intensely fruity and oaky, with aromas of raisins, vanilla, sweet pears and cinnamon. The palate holds more raisin and wood spice notes, followed by ginger, cinnamon and oak. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Tomatin 12 Year Old
Bourbon & Sherry Casks
product_description:
A 2016 replacement for the previous sherry-finished expression, this Tomatin 12 Year Old has been aged in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks. The result is a sweet whisky with notes of apples, citrus and sweet spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

The Lustau edition from Redbreast highlights the use of sherry casks on the Irish spirit. This was finished in first-fill oloroso-sherry butts for a year, resulting in a creamy whisky with notes of liquorice, marzipan and dark fruits.

Tasting Notes (1)

A limited-edition trio of single malts from Glenlivet, each offering a unique take on Glenlivet's signature smooth and fruity style. Released without tasting notes, each set comes with a QR code that will take you to a secret website that explores the character and flavours of the Glenlivet Spectra set.

A zesty, sweet single malt from Caperdronich, matured in a single barrel for 21 years before being bottled as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of orange zest, lemon curd and barley sugar fill the nose, complemented by notes of poached pear, creamy vanilla and summer blossoms throughout the palate.


Caperdonich distillery was dismantled in its entirety back in 2011, making it not only closed, but firmly lost. As part of the Secret Speyside series, no fewer than six individual bottlings of Caperdonich single malt whiskies are now available to buy.

product_name:
Glendronach 18 Year Old Allardice Sample
Sherry Cask
product_description: Glendronach's 18-year-old whisky has been fully matured in sherry casks. The result is a rich and spicy whisky with notes of dark chocolate, orange and toasted nuts.
This limited-edition eight-year-old Lagavulin was released to celebrate the distillery's 200th anniversary. Sweet and rich, this has notes of mint chocolate, honeyed fruit and smoke.

product_name:
Aberfeldy 15 Year Old Sample
French Red Wine Cask Finish
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of limited-edition 15-year-old single malt from Aberfeldy, finished in French red wine casks from Pomerol, creating a fruity, honeyed character.

The ongoing cask-strength addition to Tomatin's core range. Aged in a combination of bourbon and oloroso-sherry casks, this allows the distillery's spirit to shine through, along with notes of golden syrup, ginger, malt and marzipan.

product_name:
Glen Elgin 12 Years Old
Reserve Cask - Parcel No.3
product_description: A small-batch Glen Elgin single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, distilled in 2007 and matured in four hogsheads for 12 years before being bottled as part of the third parcel of its Reserve Cask series. Aromas of apple cider, warm custard, figs, grapefruit, rosemary-seasoned sweet potatoes and maple-glazed pecans fill the nose. The palate offers notes of cardamom, clementine, vanilla cream, sticky toffee pudding and strawberry coulis that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Caol Ila 35 Years Old
Director's Special
product_description: A single cask Caol Ila single malt from Elixir Distillers' Director's Special series that has been matured for 35 years before being bottled. Aromas of sawdust, softly smoking embers, tart green apples and barbecued meat fill the nose, complemented by notes of candied hazelnuts, freshly-baked bread, millionaire's shortbread and ripe pears throughout the palate.

An elegant and floral 33-year-old Islay single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, Islay Violets has been finished in ex-Cognac casks, accentuating its floral character. Aromas Parma violets, jasmine, lemon peel, geranium and smoky, burning sage fill the nose. The palate offers notes of violet petals, rosemary, soft oak spice, juniper, pine and rosewater, with hints of pink grapefruit and Champagne cocktails that linger in the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

Introduced in 2010, after cask strength versions in 2004 and 2005, this is the first officially-bottled Caol Ila 25yo to be bottled at 43%. Well-aged and elegant, with restrained smoke and a rich mouthfeel

product_name:
Benrinnes 2007
11 Year Old Rest & Be Thankful
product_description: A 2007 Benrinnes single malt, matured for 11 years in an ex-bourbon hogshead before being bottled by Rest & Be Thankful Whisky Co. in 2019.
A single cask Ledaig single malt, made in 2007 and matured in a single sherry cask before being bottled by indie bottler Rest & Be Thankful in May 2019.

A single malt Irish whiskey from Glendalough, made using a traditional pot still and finished in virgin Irish oak casks. The result is a malty, sweet whiskey with notes of honey, oak and ginger on the palate.

Machrie Moor is named for a peat bog on the island's west coast where, according to legend, the giant Fingal kept his favoured pet dog. Now inducted into The Arran's core range, this whisky continues to capture the island's rugged and myth-strewn landscape: peat smoke and grass are lifted and given life by vanilla and a touch of sharp citrus.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Dalmore Port Wood Reserve Gift Set
product_description:
The fruit of Dalmore's experiments with casks from around the world, this port wood reserve marries Dalmore's weighty whisky with thick port-cask fruit and spice. Matured first in American white oak bourbon casks, it is then finished in port pipes from W&J Graham before being bottled. Creamy and fruity with controlled sweetness. This gift set includes two Dalmore tumblers.

Tasting Notes (1)

This Speyside single malt has been matured in a combination of American oak casks and a variety of sherry casks. This is a fruity, rich whisky with aromas of raisins, orange and vanilla. The palate offers notes of dried fruits, warm spices and rich caramel.

Made exclusively with organic barley grown on Mid Coul Farms in Inverness, Bruichladdich The Organic 2010 is a fruity, sweet Islay whisky with an elegant island character. Aromas of melon, peach and apricot mingle with honey, lemon meringue pie, gorse, heather and tart gooseberries on the nose, atop a backdrop of rich malted barley. The palate initially offers notes of pear drops, vanilla fudge, chocolate and marzipan, before developing toasted rye bread, buttery popcorn, smooth caramel and toasted oak flavours.

A bourbon from Yellow Rose distilling with a rebellious streak, Outlaw is made with 100% Texas yellow corn and is matured in small American oak barrels. The palate is full-bodied and warm, with notes of vanilla and caramel mingling with black pepper spice.

product_name:
Caol Ila 1997
18 Year Old Cask #449 Master's Cask

Bowmore 19 Year Old
French Oak Wine Barriques
product_description: A 19-year-old single malt from Bowmore that has been matured in first-fill Chateau Lagrange wine barriques, creating layers of juicy berries on the nose, alongside candied ginger, salted caramel and freshly-baked muffin aromas, complemented by notes of white chocolate, savoury smoke, sea salt, orange peel and sticky plum jam throughout the palate.

product_name:
Aberfeldy 15 Year Old
French Red Wine Cask Finish
product_description: A limited-edition 15-year-old single malt from Aberfeldy, finished in French red wine casks from Pomerol, creating a fruity, honeyed character.

product_name:
Caperdonich 18 Year Old Peated
Secret Speyside
product_description:
A bold and smoky peated single malt from Caperdronich, matured in a single barrel for 18 years before being bottled as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of bonfire smoke, poached pears and hot tar fill the nose, complemented by notes of baked apple pie, smouldering driftwood, orange zest and aromatic smoke throughout the palate.


Caperdonich distillery was dismantled in its entirety back in 2011, making it not only closed, but firmly lost. As part of the Secret Speyside series, no fewer than six individual bottlings of Caperdonich single malt whiskies are now available to buy.

product_name:
Glenlivet 2007
13 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory for TWE
product_description:
A big, well-sherried whisky from Glenlivet, selected by The Whisky Exchange team and bottled by Signatory Vintage exclusively for us. It was distilled on 10 April 2007 and spent 13 years in a first-fill sherry butt before bottling on 1 May 2020. The result is a full-on kick of sherry cask, which doesn't lose Glenlivet's more delicate fruity character.

Tasting Notes (1)

Batch 2 of the Speyside Distillery's first-ever peated whisky, SPEY Fumare is matured in ex-bourbon barrels, adding layers of creamy vanilla to the rich peat smoke. Aromas of toffee apples, smoked herbs, malt cereal, honeyed nuts and flapjacks fill the nose. The palate offers notes of vanilla custard, stewed apples, caramelised brown sugar, toasty oak and rich peat smoke.
Another outstanding bourbon from Kentucky Distillers, makers of Noah's Mill. Handmade in very small batches and aged in charred oak barrels.

product_name:
Ballechin 2005
14 Year Old Sherry Cask TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A 2005 Ballechin single malt bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange in May 2020 after 14 years in a second-fill sherry hogshead.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Buffalo Trace White Dog Straight Rye
product_description: An unaged rye spirit from Buffalo Trace Distillery, White Dog Rye Mash pays homage to the first spirits made by settlers in America, known as White Dog, which would later become whiskey. The palate is fresh and green, with spicy rye notes and sweet, creamy cereals.

product_name:
Tormore 1995
24 Year Old Xtra Old Particular
product_description: A 1995 Tormore single malt, matured in a single refill hogshead for more than two decades, before being bottled by Douglas Laing in September 2019, as part of its Xtra Old Particular series.
Smokehead is a popular single Islay malt from Ian Macleod distillers. Debate has raged over the identity of the distillery which supplies the whisky for Smokehead. We know, but we're not telling.

With a full complex aroma combining fruit and spices similar to a fruit cake, Glenfarclas 30yo is an extraordinarily deep spirit, warm and rich leaving a lingering fruit and nut chocolate feel on the palate. Try it for yourself with this miniature, which comes in its own petite presentation box.
A miniature bottle of the classic Glenfarclas 21 Year Old, which offers rich notes of sherried fruit, nutmeg, almond and a sweet vanilla smokiness.

The 16th release of Glenfiddich's series of incredible 40-year-old whiskies, bottled in 2019. Vatted from a selection of excellent casks as well as the saved remnants of previous year's vattings. Incredibly complex with notes of fruit cake, dates, raisins and stewed apples.

product_name:
Benriach The Smoky Ten
10 Year Old Miniature
product_description: The Smoky Ten is a fruity whisky that shows-off the darker, lesser-known side of Benriach's whisky: peaty and smoky spirit. This brings together bourbon and virgin-oak casks with Jamaican-rum casks, for a fruity, smoky and spicy dram.

product_name:
Highland Park 2003
16 Year Old Sherry Cask TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A limited-edition 2003 Highland Park single malt bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange after 16 years in a single first fill sherry butt.

Tasting Notes (1)

A unpeated 1992 Bruichladdich single malt selected by Speciality Brands and bottled by Elixir Distillers, exclusively for the UK, after 26 years in a single hogshead. Aromas of ripe pineapple, salted caramel sponge cake and dusty dunnage warehouses fill the nose. The palate offers lively notes of rhubarb, mint, green apples and tart citrus, with hints of juicy pineapple and peppery spice.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the elegant oldie in the Mortlach range, channeling The Beast of Dufftown (the distillery's nickname) into a more refined form. Matured solely in sherry casks, the whisky has been crafted to match rich and dark sherry character against old, refined oaky notes. It's one to take time with, well-balanced and complex, with much more going on than you might expect.

product_name:
Glen Elgin 1995
23 Year Old Single Malts of Scotland
product_description: A 1995 Glen Elgin single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a single hogshead for more than two decades before being bottled in November 2019 as part of its Single Malts of Scotland series. Aromas of vanilla wafers, barley sugar, milk chocolate and jellybeans fill the nose. The palate offers notes of doughnuts, lemon shortbread, pineapple upside-down cake and pepper.

Released to commemorate 100 years since the passing of their co-founder, this limited-edition Irish whiskey from Egan's was initially matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in XO Cognac casks. The palate offers a balance between creamy vanilla, malty cereals and sweet apricot notes.

Matured in a combination of American-oak and sherry casks, this 18-year-old whisky from Glen Moray is superb value for money. With a lovely complexity and notes of heather honey, warm spice and butter toffee, this is a whisky that has to be tried. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Glenmorangie 10 Year Old Original
Giraffe Edition
product_description: A bottle of Glenmorangie 10 Year Old Original presented in a stylish giraffe print tin. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago. Medium-bodied and gently warming, with pleasant spicy notes.

An 18-year-old single malt from Aultmore that offers aromas of cereal, fruit salad, vanilla, peach and grapefruit on the nose, complemented by notes of biscuits, orange blossom, white grapes and garden herbs throughout the palate.

product_name:
Loch Lomond 2010 Sample
10 Year Old TWE Exclusive
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 2010 Loch Lomond single malt exclusive to The Whisky Exchange, after a decade in a single first fill bourbon barrel. It's focused around fruity flavour, with everything from the special wine yeast used to ferment it to the unique straight-necked pot stills creating and concentrating estery fruity notes. Aromas of baked apple, custard, vanilla, flapjacks and pine needles fill the nose, followed by notes of pear drops, peppermint, apple skin, brambles, black pepper and buttery pastry throughout the palate.
A 2007 vintage Edradour single malt from the distillery's Ibisco Decanter series, matured in a first-fill bourbon barrel for 13 years, before being bottled in January 2021.
A triple pack of miniatures of Tomintoul single malt. The set comprises one mini each of the 10yo, 16yo and 21yo. This will make a delightful gift.

product_name:
Blair Athol 2008
12 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 2008 Blair Athol single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, finished in a single ex-sherry butt and bottled after 12 years as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Glen Moray 21 Year Old
Port Wood Finish
product_description: Part of the distillery's core range, this 21 Year Old has been matured in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in Port casks, creating a fruity, sweet character. The palate offers notes of blackcurrants and liquorice, balanced by caramel, toffee and chilli-chocolate.

The 2020 release of Highland Park 21 Year Old single malt is a combination of three distinct cask types – first-fill sherry hogsheads, ex-bourbon casks and refill casks – ensuring a rich, full-bodied character. The palate offers a medley of sun-ripened oranges, fresh ginger, vanilla cream, heather honey, aromatic peat smoke and toasted oak that linger in the finish.

A limited-edition 2008 Tomatin single malt from the distillery's French Collection that has been finished in Sauternes wine casks. Aromas of peach, apricot and rich Manuka honey fill the nose, complemented by notes of coconut, ginger and peaches in syrup throughout the palate.
A 1999 Ardmore single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail, bottled in 2018 as part of its Distillery Labels series.
A gift set including a bottle of 18-year-old Tomintoul single malt, as well as a pair of branded glasses so that you can enjoy a dram with a friend.

product_name:
Macallan 30 Year Old Sample
Sherry Oak 2018 Release
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2018 release of Macallan 30 Year Old Sherry Oak. Deliciously smooth, with dried fruits, sherry, orange and wood smoke.

product_name:
Macallan 1979 Sample
18 Year Old Gran Reserva
product_description: A truly classic sherried Macallan, this 1979 is regarded as the best of the highly-sought-after Gran Reserva series released in the 1990s to showcase the extreme end of sherried whisky from the distillery. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Macallan 10 Year Old Sample
Full Proof Bot.1980s
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 10-year-old Macallan Full Proof, produced for the Italian market sometime in the late 1980s.

product_name:
Linlithgow 1975 Sample
26 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 1975 Linlithgow single malt, bottled by Douglas Laing as part of its Old Malt Cask series.
Perfect Measure sample bottle of Glenesk bottled in the 1980s at 12 years of age. Used as the base malt to VAT 69, the distillery closed in 1985 and was also seen bottled under the Hillside name.

product_name:
Caol Ila 2010
10 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 2010 Caol Ila single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single refill sherry butt for a decade, before being bottled in April 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Clynelish 1995
23 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: Made in 1995 at Clynelish distillery, this Highland single malt has been matured in a single refill sherry butt for 23 years, before being bottled by Signatory Vintage in June 2019 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

Formerly known as Rock Oyster, Rock Island is Douglas Laing's blended malt based on whiskies from the Islands, specifically Jura, Islay, Arran and Orkney. Rich with a smoky and maritime character.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Bunnahabhain 10 Year Old
G&M Discovery Range
product_description: Made at Bunnahabhain distillery, this Islay single malt has been matured for 10 years before being bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of its Discovery range. Sweet aromas of vanilla and toffee mingle with peat smoke and sea salt on the nose. The palate offers notes of lemon zest, candied lime, liquorice and rich bonfire smoke.
Matured for 27 years in a single bourbon hogshead, this Auchroisk single malt was bottled as part of Valinch & Mallet's Lost Dram Collection.

product_name:
Caol Ila 40 Year Old
Bot.2019 Kinship
product_description: Made at Caol Ila distillery, this Islay single malt spent four decades in a refill American hogshead, before being bottled by Hunter Laing for the 2019-release of its Kinship Collection. Mellow aromas of vanilla and oak mingle with white flowers, fresh citrus and salty sea breeze. The palate offers notes of rich nuts, sherbet lemons, creamy vanilla and spicy oak,

product_name:
Mortlach 2007
13 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 2007 Mortlach single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single cask for 13 years, before being bottled in May 2021.

A combination of peated and unpeated whisky, AD04.21:03 has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks. Aromas of brine, burnt orange peel and glacier mints fill the nose, complemented by notes of salty cashews, peanut brittle, deep fried bananas and smouldering driftwood throughout the palate. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Blair Athol 11 Year Old Sample
Reserve Cask Parcel 5
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2009 Blair Athol single malt from independent bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a batch of five ex-bourbon hogsheads for 11 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Single Malts of Scotland Reserve Casks series. Aromas of fruit-and-nut milk chocolate, shortbread biscuits, cinnamon and buttery spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of ginger snaps, honey-chocolate truffles, caramelised cashew nuts, aniseed and sticky fudge throughout the palate.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a limited-edition Kilchoman single malt that is made with a combination of Pedro Ximenez-matured whisky and whisky that has been finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. The palate offers notes of citrus, berries, Manuka honey and salty peat smoke that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Royal Brackla 18 Year Old Sample
Palo Cortado Finish
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of an elegant 18-year-old single malt from Royal Brackla that has been finished in Palo Cortado sherry casks, creating layers of sweet dried fruits and warm spices throughout the palate.
A 1997 Ardmore single malt, matured for 22 years before being bottled in 2019 by indie bottler Daily Dram, as part of its The Nectar of The Daily Drams series.
A 2008 Teaninich single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of hogsheads for 13 years, before being bottled in June 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

A mini bottle of Bowmore's 12 year old. A medium peated malt from Islay, this also has notes of pepper to balance the iodine notes. A delightful introduction to Islay malts.

Tasting Notes (1)

A miniature bottle of pretty much the only expression of Speyburn on the market until 2008. The 10 year old may now have stable mates but it still keeps its place as the easy drinking centre of the range. Speyburn continues to gather quiet momentum in the wake of updated packaging and 2012's World Whisky Award win for the 25 year old.

The 2019 release of the ever-popular Old Pulteney 25 Year Old has been matured for a quarter of a century and finished in ex-sherry casks. The palate offers rich notes of toffee, vanilla, raisins and figs, as well as bitter dark chocolate and spicy pepper flavours that linger in the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

Distilled in 2006 at Glenburgie distillery, it spent 14 years in four first-fill bourbon barrels before being bottled in November 2018 for Gordon & MacPhail's Connoisseur's Choice series. Rich aromas of vanilla, green apples and white chocolate on the nose lead the way for notes of cracked black pepper, apple pie, stewed pear and stem ginger throughout the palate.
A mini bottle of the delightfully gentle Tomintoul 16yo Speyside single malt.

Port Askaig 28 Year Old was bottled by Elixir Distillers, from a small, specially selected batch of refill American oak hogsheads. Complex, coastal and peaty, this Islay single malt has herbal aromas of mint, smoked tea leaves and pine, alongside almonds, tropical fruits and vanilla. The palate offers notes of orange peel, custard and cinnamon, alongside salty, savoury notes.

Tasting Notes (1)
A miniature bottle of the soft, gentle Speyside single malt from the Tomintoul distillery.

This indulgent, full-bodied Balblair 25 Year Old is the final whisky in the Balblair Collection, and has been matured in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in Spanish oak butts. This has created an elegant single malt with ripe apricot, liquorice and toasted oak aromas. The palate offers notes of chocolate praline, orange oil and fresh tobacco leaves, before a warm, smooth finish with hints of dark chocolate and blood oranges.

Tasting Notes (1)

The second whisky in the Balblair Collection, Balblair 15 Year Old is a full-bodied, velvety single malt that has been matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in first-fill Spanish oak butts. This creates a rich, sweet whisky with spicy aromas of honey, gingerbread and prunes. The palate is velvety-smooth and full of dark chocolate, tropical fruit and warm spice notes.

Tasting Notes (1)

This 19-year-old single malt from Glencadam was distilled in 1998 and matured in a single Pedro Ximenez sherry butt before being bottled in September 2018. This rich and spicy single malt has notes of dried fruits and warm spices.

This 2003-vintage Glencadam was matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for 14 years, before being bottled in September 2018. A rich and spicy Highland single malt, it has sweet vanilla notes and oak spices throughout the palate.

This 2004-vintage Tomintoul has been aged exclusively in a single oloroso sherry butt for 13 years, before being bottled in September 2018. A rich, fruity Speyside single malt, only 858 bottles were released worldwide.

A cracking malt from a great, but criminally underexposed distillery, Mortlach has a rich, complex, spicy sherried character and deserves far wider recognition. This looks set to change, with owners Diageo now pushing Mortlach into the spotlight with some new bottlings.

Pretty much the only expression of Speyburn on the market until 2008. The 10 year old may now have stable mates but it still keeps its place as the easy drinking centre of the range. Speyburn continues to gather quiet momentum in the wake of updated packaging and 2012's shock World Whisky Award win for the 25 year old.

Matured in a single refill hogshead for 39 years, Benromach 1977 is a smooth and sweet single malt with an elegant, refined character. The palate holds notes of ripe bananas, lively passion fruit and citrus, with dried tobacco and toasted oak leading to a light, fresh menthol finish. Only 225 bottles have been released worldwide.
A miniature of the recently-repackaged Glencadam 15yo Highland single malt. The expression has got better and better since it was relaunched in 2009.
A mini of the Auchentoshan Three Wood. Aged in North American Bourbon casks and finished firstly in Spanish Oloroso sherry casks and then in Pedro Ximenez casks for good measure..
A miniature of Auchentoshan's light, approachable 12 year old triple-distilled single malt scotch whisky.
A 30-year-old Glenturret single malt with a complex, sweet character that offers notes of dark toffee, milk chocolate, almonds, liquorice, anise, cinnamon and caramelised bananas.

Glenmorangie Allta is a limited-edition single malt released to mark the 10th anniversary of Glenmorangie’s Private Edition series. The yeasty, biscuit-y nose gives way to an archetypal Glenmorangie palate rich with floral flavours and zesty citrus, augmented by notes of freshly-baked bread, a light menthol freshness and a long, earthy finish.


Allta, which means ‘wild’ in Scots Gaelic, is made using a previously-undiscovered strain of local yeast growing on the barley near the Glenmorangie distillery. This yeast has been used to ferment the barley on which it grew before distillation, lending the spirit not only a distinctive flavour, but an undeniable sense of place.

A collaboration between Reservoir Distillery and Ardent Craft Ales brought to life this distilled IPA. This spirit, distilled from the beer, has been aged in virgin oak and ex-bourbon casks, but hasn’t lost that bright, hoppy character of the original IPA. The nose holds aromas of wildflowers, vanilla, oak and citrus, and the palate holds smooth notes of black tea, flowers and hops. The finish is long and lingering, with a gentle, peppery spiciness.

product_name:
Glenlivet 15 Year Old French Oak Reserve
Miniature
product_description: A miniature bottle of the Glenlivet 15yo French Oak Reserve. The whisky is so called as part of the blend is finished in Limousin French Oak, one of the first distilleries to do so.
A miniature bottle of Kilchoman's Machir Bay, named for the 3 mile beach near the Distillery.

A wonderful gift pack that will enable the recipient to discover the new whiskies from Jura. This 12-year-old whisky, which comes with two branded glasses, is the core of the island distillery's new range, and offers notes of gentle smoke, spice and dark fruit. The single malt was aged in bourbon casks for 12 years, followed by a brief spell in casks that previously held oloroso sherry – just the thing to give it extra flavours of raisins, milk chocolate and citrus.

The oldest expression from Redbreast so far, this is a combination of malted and unmalted barley matured in a mixture of bourbon barrels and first-fill oloroso casks, resulting in a rich and complex whiskey.

Tasting Notes (2)

A sample bottle of Old Pulteney Huddart, this non-age-statement Highland single malt has been finished in casks that previously held peated whisky. Huddart has a mellow, smoky flavour alongside the classic Old Pulteney maritime character. The palate also holds notes of vanilla, honey and rich caramel.

The 2001 vintage of Caol Ila's entry in Diageo's Distillers Edition range, taking their regular smoky malt and finishing it in sweet Moscatel-wine casks for an extra depth of sweetness.

Tasting Notes (1)

Ardmore Legacy was introduced in 2014 as a replacement for Traditional. A mix of 80% peated and 20% unpeated malt, this is full-bodied, dry and spicy.

Tasting Notes (2)
A 2015 release as part of the Last Great Malts series, Royal Brackla 12 Year Old is finished in first-fill Oloroso sherry casks and is light and spicy with notes of vanilla and black pepper.

product_name:
Aberfeldy 21 Year Old
Festive Gift Box
product_description: A Christmas edition of Aberfeldy's best-selling 21-year-old Speyside single malt. A rich and decadent whisky with plenty of sherry influence, it's just the thing for drinking in cold weather and makes for a perfect festive dram.

Glencadam Origin 1825 is was initially matured in American-white-oak bourbon barrels and then finished in oloroso-sherry butts. The result is a sweet, spicy and floral whisky with notes of bananas, pears and soft spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Bunnahabhain 11 Year Old
Sherry Gordon & MacPhail Discovery
product_description:
An 11-year-old Bunnahabhain bottled as part of Gordon & MacPhail's Discovery range, the intention of which is to help people identify and navigate what G&M considers three central pillars of Scotch whisky tasting: sherry maturation, bourbon maturation and smokiness. This bottle sits firmly in the 'sherried' camp, with plenty of stewed fruit, vanilla fudge and lingering spice.

Tasting Notes (1)
The 2016 relaunch of Tomatin Legacy has been aged in a combination of bourbon barrels and virgin-oak casks. The rest is a whisky brimming with notes of vanilla, marshmallow, pineapple and lemon.

One of the first pair of entries in the Glenfiddich Experimental Series – a whisky finished in casks seasoned with India Pale Ale. The Speyside Craft Brewery created a special beer which was aged in ex-Glenfiddich casks for a month before they were returned to the distillery and filled with whisky for a three-month finishing period. The result is a vibrant and fruity dram.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Tomatin 18 Year Old
Oloroso Sherry Finish
product_description: A miniature of Tomatin 18 Year Old – finished in first-fill oloroso-sherry butts. This add notes of dark chocolate and citrus to honey and soft spice.
A 1990s bottle of the Dalwhinnie 15yo, one of the gentlest drams around, and a great beginner whisky. A founder member of Diageo's Classic Malts selection.

A bold, creamy 15-year-old whisky from Speyside's Speyburn distillery, matured in both American and Spanish oak casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

John Crabbie’s legendary whisky company has been given a new lease of life and is to start producing whisky again in their new Edinburgh distillery. In the meantime they have launched a series of whiskies from various distilleries – this 12-year-old single is from an undisclosed Island distillery. Grassy, malty notes and a long smoky finish.

A mystery Orkney from indie bottlers A.D. Rattray, this limited edition was matured for 18 years in ex-bourbon casks for a fresh, slightly spicy whisky full of orchard fruit flavours balanced wonderfully with distinctive coastal notes of brine, and a light wisp of smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 15-year-old Tomintoul, this has all the hallmarks of 'the gentle dram' – easy-drinking, malty sweetness with light, nutty notes – with the addition of that Peaty Tang; a light peatiness, manifesting here as woody smoke, and all run through with a fresh mineral note. Very nice indeed.

A flavourful 18-year-old whisky from Glen Scotia, one of only three remaining distilleries in Campbeltown. This single malt, introduced in September 2017 and finished in oloroso sherry casks, offers abundant notes of sea spray, vanilla toffee and spiced fruits. The finish lingers, with spiced raisin and a touch of honeyed nuttiness.

Tasting Notes (1)

The first official bottling from the re-opened Glen Keith distillery in Speyside, which was revived in 2013 and whose spirits normally appear in blends such as Chivas Regal and 100 Pipers. This new, no-age-statement whisky is a gentle dram with notes of poached pears, honeycomb and vanilla toffee.

Aberlour is already one of our favourite distilleries thanks to the excellent a'bunadh. Introduced in 2008, this 18 year old is now one of the stars of the range: rich and fruity, with a great textured mouthfeel.

The pinnacle of the Bunnahabhain range, aged for 40 long years: a piece of distillery history. A combination of casks 'found' in the warehouse by the master blender (as is so often the case), these long-aged whiskies were vatted to create this rich, deep and complex dram. A showcase of the best of Bunnahabhain.

Tasting Notes (1)

A peated Islay single malt from Ian Macleod distillers, bottled at cask strength. Intense notes of peat smoke are accompanied by brine, citrus, vanilla, porridge oats and toffee. One for, as the bottle suggests, the smoke-heads.

A 12-year-old Tomatin finished in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks to create a delicious, fresh dram. Expect big orchard fruit flavours with citrus high notes and a flash of spice in the finish.

Tun 1509 is a limited-edition release from Balvenie where malt master gets to pick some of his favourite casks and marry them together to create his ultimate Balvenie. Batch 5 is a vatting of 29 casks: bourbon barrels, sherry butts, sherry hogsheads and refill American oak casks. The result is a rich and fruity dram, balancing spice and dark sherry-cask character against elegant oak.

A long-aged Ardmore, distilled in 1998 and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of their Distillery Labels series. This series celebrates the long-lasting relationships that the independent bottler has with the distilleries for which is created unique 'house labels'.

product_name:
Clynelish 1995
22 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory for TWE
product_description: This 22-year-old Clynelish was bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange by Signatory Vintage. Fully matured in a refill sherry butt, this Highland single malt has a rich and fruity character, with notes of vanilla and toasted oak.

product_name:
Green Spot 1991
26 Year Old Marsala Cask TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A very special bottling, selected by and exclusive to The Whisky Exchange: a single cask of 26-year-old Green Spot pot still whiskey, distilled at Midleton and filled into cask on 18 October 1991. It was initially matured in bourbon and sherry casks, before the spirit was reracked into a single Marsala butt for further maturation. The result brings together the fresh fruit flavours of bourbon-cask maturation with the richer dried fruit notes you get from sherry casks, and stirs them both together with fragrant Marsala and classic Irish pot-still fruit and spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

Macallan Enigma was released as a part of the Quest Collection, aged exclusively in European oak sherry casks from a single cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain. Enigma is intensely fruity and oaky, with aromas of raisins, vanilla, sweet pears and cinnamon. The palate holds more raisin and wood spice notes, followed by ginger, cinnamon and oak.

A revitalised Fettercairn, focusing on the distillery's fruity character. Matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years, this is packed with tropical flavour without losing the distillery's weightiness and gentle gingery spice.

Tasting Notes (2)

A Glenrothes 12 Year Old in classic style: fruity and sweet. Aged solely in sherry-seasoned casks, this Speyside whisky has notes of vanilla, melon, banana and cinnamon.


This 12-year-old whisky is part of The Soleo Collection: a range of five whiskies from The Glenrothes, ranging from 10 to 25 years old, which pay homage to the grapes from which some sherries, such as Pedro Ximénez, are made.

Tasting Notes (1)

The Mitchell's Spot whiskeys have always had an affinity for wine, and this Green Spot shows that off even further. Rich and spicy triple-distilled pot-still whiskey from Midleton is initially aged in bourbon and sherry casks before being finished for 12 months in casks that used to hold rich red Zinfandel wine from the famed Chateau Montelena in California's Napa Valley. Montelena was bought by Irishman Jim Barrett in the 1970s, and this release celebrates the shared heritage of his wine and Midleton's fine whiskey. It's rich and spicy, with layers of marzipan and toasted oak on top of the pot-still fruit and weightiness.

product_name:
Bowmore 18 Year Old
Deep and Complex
product_description:
Originally exclusive to travel retail, this 18 Year Old Bowmore is, as the name suggests, a 'deep and complex' Islay single malt. Matured in oloroso and Pedro Ximénez sherry casks, it has rich notes of chocolate, peat-smoke roasted coffee, orange peel and treacle toffee.

Tasting Notes (1)

Made using barley grown in a single field, in a single year, at Octomore farm, less than a mile from Bruichladdich, and matured entirely on Islay, and even bottled on the island, Octomore 10.3 offers a profile firmly rooted in terroir, supporting the weight of its 114ppm phenol count. Aged in ex-bourbon casks for six years, it offers aromas of earthy peat smoke, lemon drops, thyme, sea salt, vanilla and fudge, with a sharp, medicinal edge. The palate offers notes of salt, honey and lemon, developing pear, gooseberry and oak atop a backdrop of heavy peat smoke.

product_name:
Miltonduff 10 Year Old
Sherry Cask G&M Discovery Range
product_description:
One of the starting points for whisky fans digging into Gordon & MacPhail's whiskies, the Discovery range is all about pulling apart the flavours of Scotland. This Miltonduff is part of the Sherry category, showing, as you'd expect, big sherry character thanks to 10 years of maturation in sherry casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

A rich, robust whisky with layers of vanilla, butterscotch, spice, raisins, heather, cherries and honey. This 18-year-old Speyside single malt is one of four whiskies released as part of GlenAllachie's new core range for 2018 – the first released since the distillery changed hands in 2017.

Tasting Notes (1)

A full-flavoured Strathmill, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of the inaugural Cask Strength Connoisseurs Choice range. This is a bit weightier than your average Strathmill – usually a lighter whisky that's key in producing J&B's blend – with the bourbon cask adding some creaminess while letting the spirit develop fruity flavours.

Tasting Notes (1)

The 1995 vintage has a special place in Glenrothes history – it was the first laid down by the distillery specifically with the intention of being released as a single vintage bottling. This 2016 edition continues the work of previous releases, showcasing the distilleries honey and fruit character.

The first entry in Diageo's Special Releases for northern Speysider Inchgower, part of the 2018 edition of the range. Aged for 27 years in refill American-oak hogsheads, this is a great example of the distillery's fruity and salty spirit – it's by the coast and the distillers swear the sea gives the spirit its salty tang.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Berry Bros & Rudd Speyside Blended Malt
product_description:
One of the first releases in the Berry Bros Classic Range, this Speyside blended malt whisky is all about the classic Speyside character: honey, soft spice and fruit.

Tasting Notes (1)

At only three-years-old 10.4 is the youngest whisky in the Octomore series and was distilled in 2015 from the 2015 harvest. Peated to 88ppm and matured in 28 heavily-toasted virgin Limousin oak casks create a layer of dry fruit and vanilla on the palate, alongside oak spice and rich smoke.

Aberlour's Casg Annamh has been matured in a trio of casks – European oak sherry casks and two types of American oak casks. The result is a fruity, sweet whisky with notes of toffee, dried fruit, cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger throughout the palate.

product_name:
Benriach The Original Ten
10 Year Old
product_description: A classic combination combined with Benriach's fruity spirit makes for a great tasting and easy-drinking whisky. Bourbon and sherry casks give this ten-year-old whisky layers of fruit and sweet vanilla, while virgin oak gives an extra kick of spice.

The second edition of Glenrothes 1992. The first addition was released in 2004 and malt master John Ramsay held back a number of casks for a further stint of maturation. 10 years later, the whisky was deemed ready, and a selection of refill-sherry and American-oak hogsheads were vatted together to create this intense and fruity dram.

This 2007 vintage Distillers Edition from Glenkinchie has been finished in amontillado-sherry casks for an extra burst of rounded flavour. This was aged for more than a decade before being bottled in 2019.

February 2010 marked an extraordinary achievement for Nikka, as their Taketsuru 21yo scooped the title of 'World's Best Blended Malt Whisky' at the World Whiskies Awards for the third time in four years. Bravo, Nikka!.

A rich and fruity Islay single malt from Bunnahabhain, matured for 12 years in ex-sherry casks, creating aromas of dried fruit, sweet flowers, oak spice and rich smoke on the nose. The palate offers notes of roast hazelnuts, vanilla, caramel, raisins and dates that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1964
50 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
A rich, sweet and fruity Glen Grant that's been sitting in a single sherry hogshead since 1964. Flavours are complex, ranging from white pepper, grapefruit and dark chocolate to strawberry and ripe banana with the addition of water. This single malt was bottled in February 2015 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Rare Vintage series.

Tasting Notes (1)

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of an organic single malt whisky from Nc'Nean, made with Scottish barley and matured in a combination of specially-selected red wine and American whiskey casks. The palate offers notes of lemon curd, poached peaches, juicy apricots and spicy white pepper.

Old Pulteney is known for its coastal, maritime character, and this 12-year-old bottling from the MacPhail’s Collection is no exception. Distilled in 2005, it was bottled in 2017 and has a lovely balance between fruit, spice and chocolate notes.

The 2020 release of Talisker's excellent 25-year-old whisky continues the reputation for greatness. Carefully balancing the distillery's seaside, salt and pepper character against elegant oak and delicate fruity notes, it's a masterclass in ageing with a delightfully old-fashioned air.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the second batch of single malt from Ardnamurchan distillery. AD/01.21:01 takes its name from the month and year it was bottled in – January 2021 – and the batch number for 2021. Made with a mix of peated and unpeated spirit, AD/01.21:01 has been matured in a combination of sherry and bourbon casks. Aromas of nutmeg, toffee apples, crème Brulee, Seville orange, honey and nougat fill the nose, complemented by notes of grapefruit, marmalade, ripe pear, peach and campfire smoke throughout the palate.

The Jewels of Scotland range from independent bottler Lombard is always highly sought after, and this 30-year-old example from Highland distillery Tomatin is a welcome addition. Aged for three decades in bourbon casks, it has matured gracefully, adding soft toffee and vanilla notes to Tomatin’s classic fruit and spice.

product_name:
Caol Ila 2008
9 Year Old Hidden Spirits
product_description: A young Caol Ila that packs a punch, this nine-year-old dram from Hidden Spirits’ Young Rebels series has a beguiling combo of clean lemon citrus with aromatic peatsmoke, creating a robust whisky that still retains its freshness.

A rich and fruity single malt from The Macallan 1824 series, with aromas of dried fruit, treacle pudding and sweet oak spice on the nose. The palate offers notes of ginger and nutmeg, followed by raisins, orange, sultana and clove.

A well-aged Bowmore matured in first-fill bourbon casks and originally released in 2017 exclusively in travel retail. Distilled in 1988 and aged for about 30 years, the whisky is quite different to the more usual sherry-cask matured Bowmores of this age, showing elegant maritime notes and flashes of stormy sea.

Glenglassaugh describe this single malt as 'like a sweet shop by the beach', referring to the candy and vanilla notes added to their coastal, peated whisky by the American virgin oak it's been finished in.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Port Charlotte PAC:01 2011 Heavily Peated Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a heavily-peated 2011 Port Charlotte single malt from Bruichladdich, PAC:01 has been matured in ex-American whiskey casks for six years before being finished in ex-Pauillac red wine casks for a further two years before bottling. Aromas of clove, ginger, chocolate, toasted malt, toffee, coconut and vanilla mingle with melon, citrus, plums and raisins on the nose, alongside rich waves of salty peat smoke. The palate offers notes of dried fruit, marzipan, earthy peat, seaweed, orange and salted caramel that linger in the finish.
A single-cask Glenlivet, bottled as part of their Blairgowrie series. Notes of rich fruits, sweet vanilla and soft caramel.

product_name:
Strathisla 1972
40 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
A rich, sweet dram distilled in 1972 and aged in sherry casks until 2013. Bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for their Rare Vintage series, this single malt offers notes of rum and raisin, hazelnut, dark chocolate and marzipan, with additional tropical and citrus fruits, plus cigar ash, when water is added.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glencraig 1976
40 Year Old Rare Reserve Signatory
product_description: A 1976 vintage whisky distilled at Glenburgie - the alternative name was used for spirit distilled with their Lomond stills, removed in 1981 effectively 'closing' Glencraig. This matured for 40 years in a bourbon barrel before bottling in January 2017.

product_name:
Kilchoman Machir Bay and Sanaig Gift Pack
2x20cl
product_description:
Know someone that loves Islay whisky? This pretty gift pack should be just the thing for them, containing as it does two small (20cl) bottles of Kilchoman's celebrated single malts.


Sanaig is aged in both bourbon and sherry casks and has notes of toffee, smoke plums and dried fruit, while Machir bay is aged in bourbon and finished in sherry casks for a tempting combination of peat and sweetness.

product_name:
Edradour 2007 Sample
12 Year Old Natural Cask Strength
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 2007 Edradour single malt from the distillery's Natural Cask Strength Collection, bottled in October 2019 after 12 years in a single cask.

A fantastic way to dip a toe into the waters of smoky Islay whisky. Port Askaig 8 Year Old is a flavourful single malt that balances warming smoke, honey and zesty fruit flavours, making this miniature both a great introduction to peaty whisky and a tasty treat for existing Islay fans.
A 2011 Edradour single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single cask for a decade, before being bottled in July 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

product_name:
Edradour Ballechin Double Malt
8 Year Old
product_description: How to make a lightly peated whisky at Edradour? Combine one sherry butt of unpeated Edradour with three bourbon barrels of heavily peated Ballechin. Aged for eight years, this has notes of dark chocolate, praline and smoke.
A 20cl bottle of Kilchoman's Sanaig. Aged in a combination of oloroso-sherry and bourbon casks, this shows excellent balance between peat smoke and sweet citrus flavours.

This incredible sherried Bunnahabhain is the sixth release in Blackadder's Statement series. Distilled in 1990 and aged in a single butt for 22 years, this combines the classic unpeated Islay spirit with dark chocolate flavour from the wood.


Please note


Blackadder's Raw Cask series is unfiltered, and the bottles have a natural sediment.
Dun Bheagan released this 27-year-old Bunnahabhain in 2017. Distilled in October 1989 and aged in a pair of hogsheads, 427 bottles were produced.

A bottling of single malt whisky from the Isle of Arran distillery bottled to honour Scotland's favourite son, the bard himself, Robert Burns. Bottled at 43% and created to be malty and sweet with a 'spicy twist on the finish'.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Linkwood 1987
26 Year Old Blackadder Statement No.9
product_description:
Linkwood is one of Diageo's workhorse distilleries, with most of its production used for blends. This single cask was distilled in 1987 and aged for 26 years before being bottled for Blackadder's Statement series in September 2013.


Please note


Blackadder's Raw Cask series is unfiltered, and the bottles have a natural sediment.

product_name:
Blair Athol 1993
23 Year Old Sherry Cask Special Releases 2017
product_description:
A superlative example of Blair Athol, one of the Highlands’ most under-appreciated distilleries. Characterised by Blair Athol’s signature nutty, spicy character, this cask-strength single malt is full of candied peel, baked apples, chocolate and fruit-cake flavours.


This limited-edition 23-year-old whisky has been aged in ex-sherry European oak casks, resulting in a rich, full-bodied dram in quintessential Blair Athol style. A great choice for fans of sherry-aged whisky and the first time the distillery has been included in Diageo’s Special Releases.

Tasting Notes (2)

An, unsurprisingly, amber-coloured dram from Macallan, part of the colour-named 1824 Series. It's matured in sherry casks and chosen to be more fully flavoured than the Gold but more restrained than the Sienna. A great example of what Macallan can do with good-quality oak.

Tasting Notes (1)

This gift set contains a bottle of peated entry in Glen Moray's Classic range of excellent-value Speyside whiskies, and a pair of glasses. This is a lightly spiced whisky with notes of smoke and vanilla.

There's particularly sweet nectar in this independent bottling of Tormore 28 Year Old. Whisky hummingbirds will experience notes of caramelised banana, vanilla, baking spices and almonds, alongside a long, sweet finish.
The first ever peated whisky from the Speyside distillery. Fumare (Latin for smoky) is sweet and fruity with notes of apples, mixed herbs, smoke and a coastal character.

Samsara is the no-age-statement release from the reborn Bladnoch distillery. This is sweet with notes of plum, vanilla and citrus.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Highland Park Fire 15 Year Old Sample
product_description: The second release in Highland Park's series celebrating Viking Legends, Fire follows on from the popular Ice. Gently smoky with notes of vanilla, citrus and spice.

A 1997 vintage whisky from Glen Garioch. Although no age is stated, this has been bottled in 2012 which makes it around 15 years old. This shows the distillery's trademark fruitiness, and is bottled at cask strength.

Tasting Notes (1)
Suntory Torys Classic is a light and easy-drinking Japanese spirit. Due to being below 40% abv, this cannot be called a whisky in the EU, but is still made from a blend of malt and grain.

product_name:
Bruichladdich The Classic Laddie
2 Glass Pack
product_description:
A gift pack containg a bottle of Bruichladdich's The Classic Laddie Scottish Barley and a pair of glasses. It is made entirely from Scottish-grown barley, trickle distilled and then matured in American oak. The distillery class it as the signature bottling. This has an enticing mix of creaminess and salinity.

Tasting Notes (1)

Celebrate the bard of Scotland with this commemorative gift pack from the Isle of Arran distillery. Alongside a bottle of their malty, sweet, spicy Robert Burns whisky, created in the poet's honour, you'll receive a matching tasting glass – perfect for toasting on the 25th January, or any other night for that matter.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Dailuaine 1997
22 Year Old Signatory for TWE
product_description:
Matured for 22 years in a single hogshead, this 1997 Dailuaine was bottled by Signatory Vintage in August 2019, exclusively for The Whisky Exchange's 20th anniversary celebrations.

Tasting Notes (1)

A miniature of Scallywag from Douglas Laing. A blend of Speyside malts, including Mortlach, Macallan and Glenrothes aged in a combination of sherry and bourbon casks, this is a rich and complex vatting.

product_name:
Four Roses Small Batch Limited Edition
Bot.2016
product_description: 2016's release of Four Roses Small Batch Barrel Strength is selected by the master distiller from the best barrels in the warehouses. Rich and spicy with an underlying sweetness.

Matured in ex-sherry casks for 12 years, this rich, elegant Tamdhu holds aromas of cinnamon rolls, orange candy, fresh oak, raisins and faint traces of mint. The palate offers notes of banana, raspberry jam, malty biscuits and toasted oak, before developing into ground cinnamon, dried fruit and Scottish tablet flavours that linger in the finish.

From the brand that makes the peatiest whiskies in the world, this has been matured in various types of cask, including some ex-wine examples, for a minimum of seven years. This is extremely smoky with exceptionally balanced fruit flavours, and a very long finish.

Re-released in autumn 2019 with a new look, Arran Quarter Cask has been matured in first-fill ex-bourbon barrels for seven years before being finished in American oak quarter casks for a further two years. A full-bodied single malt, it balances aromas of creamy vanilla and cinnamon against bold, peppery spice. The palate offers notes of honey, coconut, pineapple and vanilla, alongside black pepper, ginger and oak spice.

A gift set from Laphroaig, including a bottle of the peaty, spicy Laphroaig Lore, matured in a combination of quarter casks, sherry casks and reused peated casks. It also includes a pair of Laphroaig glasses.
Tomintoul 16 Year Old is a soft an approachable whisky with notes of nuts, apples and pears.
Royal Brackla 16 Year Old is finished in first-fill oloroso-sherry casks, adding spice to sweetness and a hint of smoke.

Only released in 2015 as part of Aberfeldy's relaunched range, the 16 Year Old has already won many fans. Part matured in bourbon casks which have added sweetness, with the sherried element offering spiciness.

Tasting Notes (1)

A limited-edition single malt from Tomintoul, Seiridh was matured in American oak ex-bourbon casks before being finished in first-fill oloroso sherry casks from Andalucia, Spain. Rich aromas of sultana, butterscotch and candied pecans fill the nose. The palate offers notes of sweet dried figs, Christmas cake and cedar spice, developing hints of chocolate-covered raisins, dried fruit and liquorice that linger in the finish.
A 14-year-old single malt from Loch Lomond, released in 2020, that offers notes of raisins, dates, cinnamon and ginger.
Part of Glenturret's 2020 Maiden Release, this Triple Wood single malt has been matured in a combination of European and American oak ex-sherry casks, as well as ex-bourbon casks.

The youngest age-statement release in the Port Askaig range of single malts from undisclosed Islay distilleries, this eight-year-old whisky is warming and smoky with notes of limestone, liquorice and dark peat.

Tasting Notes (2)

The standard-strength release of Elements of Islay's Peat. Bottled at 45%, this has the same classic Islay character as Full Proof – notes of fruit, spice and smoke – but with less power that makes it a great introduction to Islay whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Talisker 10 Year Old Dry Bag Gift Set
product_description: A lovely gift set from Talisker, including a bottle of Talisker 10 Year Old single malt and a Talisker dry bag.

Luceo is part of Dalmore's Fortuna Merita collection originally released for travel retail. Matured in Apostoles-sherry casks, this displays the classic distillery notes of cherries and toffee, along with nuts and ginger.

product_name:
Tomatin Miniature 3-pk
12 Year Old, Legacy, 14 Year Old
product_description: An excellent set of miniatures showing off the revitalised range of Tomatin single malts. Pack contains one mini each of the 12yo, 14yo and Legacy expressions.

product_name:
Glenfiddich 21 Year Old
Gran Reserva Rum Finish Small Bottle
product_description: A 20cl bottle of Glenfiddich 21 Year Old, finished in rum casks for around four months to add extra layers of sweetness and complexity.

product_name:
Macallan Estate Reserve
Ernie Button Capsule Collection
product_description: A special edition of Macallan's Masters of Photography series, adorned with artwork by Ernie Button. Estate Reserve was launched for the travel-retail market and contains a high proportion of whisky aged in Spanish-oak sherry casks.

Lp comes from the south of Islay from a distillery known for its richness of flavour. Lp7 combines the modern ashy style with some older fruit-driven spirit, resulting in a great deal of complexity and smoke. Serge Valentin of Whiskyfun.com scored it 89/100pts.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenlivet 18 Year Old Auchvaich
Single Cask
product_description:
A single cask from Glenlivet named Auchvaich. Aged for 18 years in cask 96404, this was bottled at a natural cask strength of 55.7% in March 2016.

Tasting Notes (1)

Gordon & MacPhail's warehouses continue to impress with this 1967 vintage Strathisla, matured for more than 35 years and with a fantastic (natural) colour. The distillery's classic sherried whiskies are rich and complex with notes of caramel, oranges and dried fruits.
A smooth, well-balanced South African single malt from James Sedgwick Distillery, Three Ships 12 Year Old is part of the distillery's Master Distiller's Private Collection.

A bold single malt with a tropical twist, Glenlivet Caribbean Reserve has been finished in casks that previously held Caribbean rum. Aromas of pear, red apple, overripe bananas and sticky honey fill the nose, complemented by notes of caramel, toffee, pineapple and mango throughout the palate.

product_name:
Tomatin 36 Year Old
Batch No.2 Rare Casks
product_description: Batch two of Tomatin's 36 Year Old has been aged in a combination of ex-bourbon and first-fill ex-oloroso-sherry casks. This is malt-led with notes of cloves, cardamom and vanilla.

product_name:
Midnight Moon Raspberry Moonshine
Junior Johnson's
product_description: The Johnson family has been making moonshine for 150 years.
