It has endured Prohibition, the odd brush with the law and Junior Johnson himself has even received a presidential pardon. Produced using a five-step filtration process, Midnight Moonshine contains raspberries soaked in 45% moonshine made from American corn. Try with ice and lemonade for a refreshing long drink.

product_name:
Benromach 10 Year Old
Note Book Gift Set
product_description: This gift pack contains a bottle Benromach's highly regarded entry-level 10-year-old whisky, a note book and a pencil, so you can 'enjoy a dram and share your thoughts'. A creamy and toasty whisky with light smoky notes.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a limited-edition Glenfarclas single malt, released in celebration of the distillery's 185th anniversary. Rich and sherried, this whisky offers notes of dried fruit, Christmas cake, baking spices and toffee throughout the palate.

The sixth release of Tempest – Bowmore’s cask-strength 10-year-old. Aged in first-fill ex-bourbon barrels, the emphasis is on tropical-fruit character. A peaty, smoky and fruity dram with great balance.

The Epicurean is part of Douglas Laing's Remarkable Regional Malts series and is a blend comprised exclusively of Lowland single malts. A delightful mix of sweet fruit and herbal flavours.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Royal Brackla 12 Year Old Sample
Sherry Finish
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a rich and fruity 12-year-old Royal Brackla single malt that has been finished in ex-oloroso sherry casks to create layers of rich fruit and spice throughout the palate.

The first release from the northernmost distillery on mainland Scotland, which began distilling on 25 January 2013 – having constructed new premises on the site of the old Wolfburn distillery in Thurso, Caithness, just a few months before. This inaugural release, of which just 875 bottles were available, is a three-year-old single malt aged in both bourbon and sherry. It features floral, fruit and malt aromas with a hint of peat, followed by sweet, nutty flavours and a smoky finish.
Glenturret's new core range, released in 2015, comprises three editions. This is the higher-strength UK release of Peated, a rare example of amoky whisky from the distillery – rich, sweet and smoky.
A 2007 Glen Elgin single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of hogsheads for 14 years, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.
A 2008 Linkwood single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of casks for 13 years, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

Bottled in 2015, this is the 1999 vintage of Lagavulin's Distillers Edition. By far the most popular of the series, this double-matured Lagavulin has had a finishing period in sweet, sticky Pedro Ximénez sherry casks. A whisky that never disappoints.

Tasting Notes (1)

A dense, heavily-sherried dram from a distillery now producing again after a six-year layoff. A malt best suited to after-dinner sipping.

Tasting Notes (1)

The only generally available distillery bottling from Inchgower, usually a key part of the Bell's blend. It's also not one that independents see much of, so this is one of your only chances to try the output from this quietly elegant distillery.

The perfect stocking-filler, and something any true malt fan would love to find in their hipflask - or a little treat for yourself? Brimful of coastal power and elegance, with the hallmark chilli and white pepper notes tantalising the tastebuds.

product_name:
Balvenie 12 Year Old
Single Barrel First Fill
product_description:
A 2013 addition to The Balvenie's range, as a younger sibling to the 15 Year Old single cask. This is exclusively matured in first-fill bourbon casks and each bottle is part of a batch that is at most 300 bottles - all taken from the same cask.

Tasting Notes (3)

A range of Craigellachie single malts was released for the first time in 2014. The distillery is known for its meaty character, and the 13-year-old is sweet, spicy and slightly smoky.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Death's Door New Make Spirit
2011 Harvest
product_description: A white dog from Death's Door, this is made with 80% wheat from Washington Island and 20% malted barley from Wisconsin. Aged in oak barrels for a short time to impart richness, this combines notes of vanilla, sweet fruit and mixed herbs.

Eirigh Na Greine is a limited-edition Bunnahabhain that combines the distillery's signature flavours of fruit and nuts, and hints of sea salt and smoke with rich, sweet spice from ageing in red-wine casks.

A very limited-edition smoky release from Macallan, Rare Cask Black is a marriage of around 100 predominently sherry-seasoned casks. Made using peated whisky – very rarely produced at the distillery – this has notes of dried fruit, nutmeg, ginger and smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)

Oban Little Bay is married in the smallest casks available at the distillery, 200-litre ex-bourbon barrels. This has resulted in a rich whisky with notes of stone fruit, spice and honey.

Tasting Notes (2)
The Deveron 12 Year Old is the opening salvo in the UK range. This single malt is made at Macduff distillery in the Highlands – light and sweet with notes of citrus fruit and spice.

After the success of the first release, the second bottling from Oc has been released by Speciality Drinks as part of the Elements of Islay series. Very peaty but with excellent balance and integration of fruit.

Stiùireadair is a sherried release from Bunnahabhain, intended as a partial replacement for the 12 Year Old. A typically creamy and coastal whisky with notes of caramel, nuts, dried fruit and hints of spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

Part of Diageo's Special Releases 2015. Lots of nutty cereal and almond notes, with mango and lemon tart. Very moreish.

Tasting Notes (1)

A miniature bottle of the opening salvo of the Glenlivet range, named in honour of the distillery's founder, George Smith. It's classic Glenlivet, with a creamy and fruity character bolstered by the use of first-fill American oak to mature some of the whisky.

The 1998 vintage of Lagavulin's Distillers Edition. By far the most popular of the series, this double-matured Lagavulin has had a finishing period in sweet, sticky Pedro Ximénez sherry casks. A whisky that never disappoints.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Kininvie 1991
23 Year Old Batch 3 Half Bottle
product_description:
The third batch carry the distillery's name on the label, this 23-year-old Kininvie was distilled in 1991. With some sherry wood influence, this is rich and floral.

Tasting Notes (1)
Initially released for travel retail, Heartwood is a combination of whiskies aged in bourbon and oloroso sherry casks. Rich, fruity and sweet.

The higher strength release of Ardbeg Perpetuum, sold at the distillery only. Released in 2015 to celebrate Ardbeg's 200th anniversary, this is a blend of old and young whisky, matured in both bourbon and sherry casks, delivering the classic Ardbeg note of cured meats, smoke and sea spray.

The elegant and approachable Balblair 12 Year Old is the first whisky in the Balblair Collection and has been matured in a combination of double-fired American oak casks and ex-bourbon casks. The result is a whisky with a warm, complex character and a sweet, citrusy aroma. The palate offers notes of oranges, honey and cinnamon before a long, creamy finish with hints of vanilla and leather.

Tasting Notes (1)

One of the world's most famous liqueurs, Southern Comfort is made with American grain spirit and peaches and tastes great with traditional lemonade, or with vodka, orange & grenadine: the 'Alabama Slammer'.

Glen Scotia Victoriana has been bottled at cask strength and finished in heavily-charred oak casks. Victoriana has notes of richly-spiced fruit, vanilla and oak throughout the palate, followed by a gently smoky finish.
A miniature bottle of Torfa, a 2014 release from Glenglassaugh. Fully matured in ex-bourbon barrels and peated to 20ppm, this is the first peated whisky from this revived distillery.

One of the more eagerly anticipated releases of 2014, Ardbeg Kildalton was a limited release made from a marriage of smoky and creamy whisky aged in bourbon casks and spicier ones from first-fill and refill sherry casks. This is big, bold and complex.

Tasting Notes (2) 

Please note


There is some minor damage to the inside of the boxes, as shown in the photograph.
A 25-year-old release from Benriach made from a combination of whisky finished in new wood and sherry butts. This has been bottled for the export market at 46.8%.

product_name:
Bruichladdich Classic Laddie Scottish Barley
Small Bottle
product_description: A 20cl bottle of Bruichladdich's Classic whisky, made entirely from barley grown in Scotland and matured in American oak.

Matured in a small number of ex-sherry casks and American oak casks, Glenfiddich Grand Cru has been finished for four months in a combination of first-fill and second-fill French oak casks that have been used to ferment wine that will eventually become a famous sparkling wine. The palate offers notes of creamy vanilla, brioche, pear sorbet and white grapes, complimented by aromas of freshly-baked bread, apple blossom and lemons.

Tasting Notes (1)

The long-awaited UK release of Knob Creek Rye. Not as spicy as many ryes, this is a great in-between release, sitting between a high-rye bourbon and a pure rye to give the best of both worlds.

Tasting Notes (1)

A sample of Port Charlotte 10 Year Old, a heavily peated whisky made by the independently minded folks at Bruichladdich distillery on Islay. The resulting whisky is big and peaty with a maritime tang.
The 2020 presentation of Loch Lomond 12 Year Old has been aged in three types of cask: bourbon, refill and rechared. Fruity with notes of pear, lemon, vanilla and biscuits.
Yukon Jack Wicked Hot Liqueur is a combination of blended Canadian whisky with cinnamon flavours.

A miniature bottle of a fruity, clean and polished malt with a touch of honey and spice, Aberfeldy 12 Year Old is an excellent introduction to this Highland distillery. Aberfeldy's main claim to fame is as the heart of the excellent Dewar's blend but whiskies like this are putting it firmly in the spotlight.

Octomore 11.3 Islay Barley is a five-year-old single malt made with barley grown on Octomore farm on Islay. Grown close to the Atlantic Ocean, this barley offers a unique terroir and soft, salty notes reminiscent of a sea breeze on a sunny day. Matured in ex-American whiskey casks from Jim Beam, Jack Daniels, Heaven Hill and Buffalo Trace for five years, it offers notes of orange blossom, apricot jam, summer flowers, dry smoke and smouldering heather throughout the palate.

A unique whisky from Glenmorangie – everything about The Taghta was designed by consumers: the finishing cask, the name and the label design. Taghta (pronounced tuh-tah) is Scots Gaelic for 'chosen' and the whisky was finished in ex-Manzanilla casks.

Tasting Notes (2)

A salty, smoky Islay single malt from Morrison Scotch Whisky Distillers Mac-Talla range, Terra is a classic example of whisky from this remote Hebredean island. The palate offers notes of wood smoke, salty sea spray, heather, seashells and savoury peat that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Port Charlotte 2012
Islay Barley Heavily Peated
product_description: A 2012-vintage Port Charlotte Islay Barley heavily-peated single malt from Bruichladdich, made using barley from eight farms on Islay. Aromas of lemon, apple sauce, pears, summer flowers, chocolate-covered coconut, burnt heather, muddy peat and vanilla fill the nose. The palate offers notes of milk chocolate, black pepper, freshly-baked scones, honey, earthy smoke, apricot, cream and warm, sandy beaches that linger in the finish.

This 25 year old Strathmill – the first appearance of the distillery in the Special Releases range – is the lightest in style of this year's line-up. Aged in refill American oak, it's sweet and creamy with the distillery's trademark grassiness.

Tasting Notes (1)

White Rhino Rye is the first release from Vulson, a collaboration between Domaine des Hautes Glaces in the French Alps and Xavier Padovani of Experimental Cocktail Club. Made from organic rye, grown, malted and distilled on site, it's sweet, fruity and spicy.

Tasting Notes (3)

product_name:
Royal Brackla 12 Year Old
Sherry Finish
product_description: A rich and fruity 12-year-old Royal Brackla single malt that has been finished in ex-oloroso sherry casks to create layers of rich fruit and spice throughout the palate.

The 1997 Knockando Master Reserve 21-year-old single malt is a fruity, spicy whisky with aromas of nutmeg, cinnamon, dark chocolate and dried fruit on the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon-baked apple, raisins, toasted oak and roast nuts that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glenlivet 14 Year Old
Conglass Single Cask
product_description: This single cask bottling of Glenlivet is named for Conglass Water, a meandering stream that flows through Tomintoul, a few miles from the Glenlivet distillery. It's a light and summery 14yo dram, with creamy toffee notes.

product_name:
Mortlach 2010
11 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 2010 sherry-finished Mortlach single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured for a total of 11 years including 15 months in a sherry butt, before being bottled in April 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

A limited-edition Glenfarclas single malt, released in celebration of the distillery's 185th anniversary. Rich and sherried, this whisky offers notes of dried fruit, Christmas cake, baking spices and toffee throughout the palate.

A big bottle of Jack Daniel's very tasty honey whiskey liqueur. With a real honey taste, rather than just over the top sweetness, it balances whisky, sugar and floral character to create a great tasting liqueur. A secret favourite of our blog team...

product_name:
Caol Ila 2007
13 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice
product_description: A 2007 Caol Ila single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, finished in an ex-Hermitage wine cask and bottled in April 2021, at 13-years-old, as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of fruitcake, cherries and sweet smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of smoked meats, summer berries, toasted almonds and bonfire embers throughout the palate.

An old distillery bottling of Strathisla. The distillery is the spiritual home of the Chivas Regal range of blends, which is where most of its output ends up. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.

The 1997 vintage of Lagavulin's Distillers Edition bottled in 2013. By far the most popular of the Distiller's Edition series, this double-matured Lagavulin has had a finishing period in sweet, sticky Pedro Ximénez sherry casks. A whisky that never disappoints.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Kilchoman 2007 Sample
13 Year Old Bourbon Cask TWE Exclusive
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2007 Kilchoman single malt bottled in February 2021 exclusively for The Whisky Exchange after 13 years in a single ex-bourbon cask. Aromas of baked-hay, Golden Delicious apples, lemon bon-bons and roasted corn on the cob fill the nose, complemented by notes of barbecued meats, orchard fruits, green chilli and cacao nibs throughout the palate.

Taking its name from the Gaelic for ‘dawn’, Moch is a wonderful newcomer from Caol Ila and is a must-try for fans of this outstanding distillery. Lighter in style than the standard 12yo expression, Moch is a fantastic easy-drinking dram.


Caol Ila Moch is the first single malt from the distillery to be selected entirely on the basis of its taste, rather than age, cask wood, strength or finish.


The nose is creamy and lemony, before a silky-smooth medium-bodied palate that still packs a peaty punch. The finish is dry, sooty and very more-ish.


Moch was available initially only to the Friends of the Classic Malts exclusively from The Whisky Exchange. We think it's the best FOCM release in years and a very exciting addition to the Caol Ila family.

Tasting Notes (4)
A 20cl bottle of Oban 14 year old from the Western Highlands. A great little gift for any malt fan, or a pocket size treat for yourself.

One of the most eagerly anticipated bottlings of the 2013 Diageo Special Releases (and in our view the best looking) is this 1985 vintage Talisker. Aged for 27 years in refill American Oak, this shows off the intensity that Talisker can offer, both in terms of flavour and complexity.

Tasting Notes (2)

The eagerly-anticipated 13th release from cult closed distillery Port Ellen. Always the most sought-after of Diageo's Annual Special Releases, this usually sells out worldwide within 24 hours and we expect this year to be no different.

Tasting Notes (2)

To make Dalmore King Alexander III, Master Distiller Richard Paterson selected a range of differently aged malts matured in a mixure of French wine casks, Madeira drums, sherry butts, Marsala barrels, port pipes and bourbon barrels from Kentucky. A remarkable feat of blending.

Tasting Notes (1)
A set of three 20cl bottles showcasing Glenfiddich's most popular releases - the elegant 12 year old, solera aged 15 year old and classic 18 year old.

product_name:
Edradour 12 Year Old
Caledonia Selection Sherry Cask
product_description:
A special bottling of Edradour 12yo, named after Dougie Maclean's most famous song, Caledonia. This is the first in what will be an ongoing series from Edradour.

Tasting Notes (1)
This is the relaunched version of Bunnahabhain 18yo, having ditched the caramel colouring and chill-filtration and upped the strength to 46.3%. A triumph for 'naturalist' whisky drinkers.

First released in summer 2014, Ballechin's 10 year old is the first ongoing release for Edradour's peated malt, after eight releases in The Discovery series.

Tasting Notes (1)

Bottled in 2012, this 1996 edition of Lagavulin's Distillers Edition (probably the most sought after in the range) combines the regular rich, peat smoke that the distillery is known for with a finishing period in sweet Pedro Ximenez sherry casks for even more depth of flavour.

Tasting Notes (1)
A miniature of Glen Scotia Double Cask, which starts its life in first-fill bourbon barrels, before being finished in Pedro-Ximenez-sherry casks. Notes of spicy fruit and vanilla.

product_name:
Strathisla 1969
44 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & Macphail
product_description:
A long aged bottling of Strathisla from independent bottling veteran Gordon & Macphail, whose warehouses are filled with impressive number of treats like this. Clocking in at over 40 years old and packed full of sherry fruit and spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

Jack Daniel's Tennessee Fire has been eagerly anticipated ever since its 2014 US release. Combining the legendary No.7 with a fiery cinnamon liqueur, this is sweet and spicy with notes of vanilla. Best enjoyed on its own, slightly chilled.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Honey Liqueur Miniature
product_description: A mini bottle of Jack Daniel's massively popular Honey liqueur, blending together Old No.7 and honey for a spicy spirit that's great on its own, over ice or in cocktails.

A rich, elegant single malt that's part of Old Pulteney's new range for 2018. This 15-year-old single malt has been matured in both ex-bourbon and Spanish oak casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

A rich sherry-influenced single malt from Bunnahabhain, An Cladach has sweet aromas of dried fruit, caramel and rich sherry. The palate offers creamy, smooth notes of roast nuts, baking spices, sherry and briny coastal undertones.

The first edition of Old Ballantruan with an age statement, bottled after 10 years. It's made at Tomintoul using heavily peated barley and is bottled at a solid 50% ABV.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Benriach 25 Year Old
Authenticus Peated Malt
product_description:
A 25 year old from Speyside's Benriach, made using their peated spirit and sat at the top end of the age range for their peated whisky. This is the follow-up to the much-vaunted Authenticus 21yo and is claimed by the producers to show herb, honey and tropical fruit flavours alongside the smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)

A miniature bottle of Tobermory 12 Year Old, matured exclusively in ex-bourbon casks. It has a fruity, spicy character with aromas of honey, vanilla, ripe oranges and delicate flowers. The palate offers notes of apples, lively citrus and tropical fruits, followed by creamy toffee, floral honey and a salty, seaside undertone.

A deluxe Royal Lochnagar, with a high proportion of long-aged sherried malt in the mix. Selected Reserve has a rich, fruity palate with notes of dried fruit, rich spices, roasted coffee beans and dark chocolate, a good after-dinner dram.
Part of the distillery's 2020 packacking refresh, Loch Lomond Original is the entry-level bottling from this Highlander. Elegant yet full bodied with a hint of peat.

product_name: Buffalo Trace White Dog 3 Bottle Set
product_description: A set of three half bottles of white dog (unmatured whiskey) show-casing Buffalo Trace's 3 main spirit recipes. Along with the already released Mash #1 there is also Wheated Mash, used to make WL Weller and Pappy Van Winkle, and Rye Mash, used to make Sazerac. An interesting insight into the development of whiskey in the cask and an increasingly popular cocktail ingredient.
A miniature bottle of Glenfiddich 12 Year Old, one of the world's best selling single malts - light and easy-drinking stuff loved by millions.
Lagavulin's popular limited edition Distiller's Edition, distilled in 1995 and finished in Pedro Ximinez sherry casks. An extra layer of sweetness soothes the rough edges of this much-loved dram.

product_name:
Royal Lochnagar
Selected Reserve Sherry Cask Bot.1990s
product_description: A 75cl version of the presentation of Royal Lochnagar's prestigious Selected Reserve, which was phased out around 2008. A very drinkable sherried dram.

product_name: Ardnamurchan AD04.21 Paul Launois Release Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of limited-edition single malt from Ardnamurchan. AD04:21 was initially matured in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in casks that previously held Champagne from Paul Launois's vineyard in Mesnil-sur-Oger. Aromas of fresh croissants, strawberry jam, melted butter, melon, nougat and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of strawberry tart, apple strudel, black pepper, orange bitters and sweet cream throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glenallachie 2005 Sample
15 Year Old Sherry Butt
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 2005 Glenallachie single malt that has been matured in a sherry butt for 15 years, before being bottled in February 2021. Aromas of mocha coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, almonds, nutmeg and ginger fill the nose, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, cinnamon, ginger, orange zest and nutmeg throughout the palate.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2021 release of Kilchoman Loch Gorm single malt – a vatting of 24 oloroso sherry butts filled in 2011 and 2012. Fruity and smoky, the palate offers notes of salty smoke, raisins, dates and oak spice that linger in the finish.
A 2007 Knockando single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of hogsheads for 13 years, before being bottled in June 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

Glengoyne is one of the only Scottish whiskies to be distilled from completely unpeated malt - the malt is allowed to dry naturally before fermentation and distillation begin, resulting in an elegant, medium-bodied style.

Long known as 'the gentle dram' Tomintoul 16yo is soft and nutty, with a pleasant richness. A Gold Medal winner at the International Wine & Spirits Competition (IWSC), this is a cracking dram for the money.
A miniature of Edradour's regular 10 year old bottling.

An old 1990s Connoisseurs Choice bottling of Glenugie 1967 by Gordon & Macphail.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

This is the 2010 version of Ardbeg Supernova, and no doubt will be hoping to follow on from the success of last year's edition, which scooped Scotch Whisky of the Year from Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2010.
A miniature bottle of 10 year old whisky from the Isle of Aran distillery, only distilling since 1995 and already producing a range of excellent drams.

A fruity, clean and polished malt with a touch of honey and spice, Aberfeldy 12 Year Old is an excellent introduction to this Highland distillery. Aberfeldy's main claim to fame is as the heart of the excellent Dewar's blend but whiskies like this are putting it firmly in the spotlight.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Isle of Jura 1965
26 Year Old Stillman's Dram
product_description:
An old Isle of Jura 1965 released in the early 1990s as part of Whyte & Mackay's now-defunct Stillman's Dram series.

Tasting Notes (1) 

Please note


There are some scuff marks to the boxes.

A delicious Talisker 30yo, one of the highlights of this year's Special Releases. Very, very drinkable, with plenty of character but a restrained, elegant tone after three decades of mellowing in the wood.

A peated Speysider from Tomintoul, this has been bottled at 50% abv and at this price is well worth a look for peatheads looking for something a bit different.

Tasting Notes (2)

One of the now-legendary 1972 Broras bottled by Diageo as part of the Rare Malts series, that really kick-started the explosion of interest in this lost distillery. 1972 is regarded by experts as a miracle year for Brora, and this particular version won Brora expert Serge Valentin's highest ever score, with 97 points. Enough said.
An old 1980s bottling of the little-known (and rather underrated) Speysider Tamdhu.

A top-quality packaging update (farewell, stags!) for this Founder's Reserve Glen Garioch which has been bottled at 48% and priced very sensibly. A very welcome return to form for a distillery with enormous potential.

A 12yo Highlander from Glengoyne, famed for their unpeated single malt. Glengoyne is always very pure in style, allowing their high-quality, easy-drinking whisky to shine in its natural state.

Tasting Notes (1)
A miniature bottle of Glen Garioch's tasty 12 year old whisky. Introduced to the core range in late 2012, this is a mix of ex-bourbon and sherry casks.
A special release of Lagavulin 1995 bottled at 48% for the Friends of the Classic Malts in 2008 from first fill European oak sherry casks.

This Port Askaig 25yo is a medium-bodied elder statesman, with the oak rounding out delicious citrus flavours. Best appreciated with a drop of water.

Tasting Notes (1)

The Astar bottling from Glenmorangie is a second incarnation of the much-loved Artisan cask bottling from several years ago. A massive dram, with huge spices - a drop of water is the sensible option.

Tasting Notes (2)

Renaissance is the final instalment in a quartet of whiskies bottled to mark Ardbeg’s resurrection and subsequent return to form after being purchased and re-opened in 1997, following a six-year hibernation. The first ten-year-old bottling of the distillery’s ‘new’ spirit, this is as potent an expression of Ardbeg whisky as you’re likely to find – a must for collectors and connoisseurs.

Tasting Notes (2)

The second coming of the Dalmore Cigar Malt, relaunched in an eye-catching red box. Fans of the previous edition will definitely want to get their hands on this.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenesk 1974
30 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description:
An old bottling from Douglas Laing of Glenesk, a little-seen malt from a distillery closed in 1985.

Tasting Notes (1)
Glen Scotia Double Cask starts its life in first-fill bourbon barrels, before being finished in Pedro-Ximenez-sherry casks. Notes of spicy fruit and vanilla.

Talisker super-premium releases from Diageo have been uniformly excellent. This is no disappointment - a bit more sherry influence has made this an absolute cracker. Roars across the palate, then caresses the tastebuds on the finish.

Tasting Notes (2)

A miniature of a 2015 addition to the range, this 25-year-old Tomintoul would have been distilled around 1990, when the distillery was owned by Whyte & Mackay. In the hands of Angus Dundee since 2000, the brand has been marketed as 'The Gentle Dram' and its reputation continues to grow.

A fascinating independent bottling of a malt little known in the mainstream but treasured by connoisseurs. This expression, from 1975, is one of the few remaining old-school Glen Gariochs, meaning that it is very noticeably more peaty than modern distillery expressions. The whisky was originally bottled in 1990, but the stock was forgotten about and so it has only recently been released with new packaging.
The first official bottling of Tamnavulin for more than two decades, Double Cask has been finished in sherry butts. The result is a whisky with notes of dried orange, ginger and wood spice.

A single malt created by distillery manager, John Campbell, to honour the master craftsmen who have shaped Laphroaig over the past two centuries. This single malt was first left to rest in first-fill, over-charred ex-bourbon barrels, before being transferred to large, new European oak hogsheads – which have never been used by Laphroaig until now.


The 1815 combines notes of peat smoke, toasted fruits and oiled wood.

Tasting Notes (1)

A vatting of top-quality Highland malts that undergo a unique secondary maturation in American casks capped with new French Oak heads, adding an extra layer of spicy flavour and complexity. The result is fruity and rich with clove and vanilla notes.

Tasting Notes (1)
The old presentation of this much-loved Highlander.

The entry point to Jura's range and the start of a metaphorical journey through the flavours of the island's only distillery. Softly smoky, with citrus and orchard-fruit notes. A great place to start your exploration of Jura.

Tasting Notes (1)

A well-balanced entry in the Jura range, made up of both smoky and unpeated whisky matured in bourbon casks and finished in sherry, adding darker notes to the soft smoke and fresh fruit of the distillery's whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)

Released in 2004, this beautifully orchestrated Talisker 25yo has a full, generous palate, with hot spices balanced by delicious shortbread & syrupy notes. A really awesome malt from a remarkably reliable distillery.

Tasting Notes (1)
The only official bottling from Strathmill, more usually known as the producer of the core of the J&B blends.
An overlooked malt that has passed to Pernod Ricard as part of the Chivas Brothers portfolio, Strathisla 12yo is highly-regarded by blenders and connoisseurs of its fruity sherried style.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old
Cask Strength Batch 012 Bot.2020
product_description: A smoky, complex bourbon barrel matured whisky from Laphroaig, this is the 12th edition of the Islay distillery's ever-popular Cask Strength 10 Year Old single malt. Bottled in February 2020, aromas of sweet biscuits, smoked cedar and Manuka honey mingle with pipe tobacco, old leather, candle wax and hints on vanilla on the nose. The palate offers notes of burnt oak, barbecued marshmallow, toffee, sea salt and Belgian caramel waffles, as well as roasted coffee beans, sticky toffee pudding and white pepper, wrapped in waves of peat smoke.

Zesty oak and warm peat smoke top notes, with sweet undertones, reminiscent of fresh nutmeg and toasted almonds. Faintly salty. Laphroaig 15yo is a smoother and more elegant elder sibling to the robust 10 year-old.
The 3th release of Lagavulin 12 year old, released annually as part of Diageo's Special Releases collection. Younger and therefore slightly fresher and more fiery than the 16 year old.

The infamous Loch Dhu - 'Black Lake'. It has polarised whisky drinkers, with many lovers and haters out in the wild, and has become immensely collectible. A bit of a strange whisky, but one that's worth trying at least once.
A miniature of Glenfiddich's 15 year old, matured using a system similar to the Spanish sherry solera.

A 2006 Distillers Edition Oban single malt, finished in Montilla Fino sherry casks and bottled in 2020. Aromas of dates, sugared almonds, ginger, oak and waxy orange peel fill the nose, complemented by notes of chocolate digestives, ginger biscuits, pecans, salty sea breeze and juicy sultanas throughout the palate.
A 1997 Glenrothes single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single cask for 24 years, before being bottled in April 2021 as part of its Decanter Collection.

product_name:
Glen Spey 12 Year Old
Flora & Fauna
product_description: The only official bottling from Glen Spey, with most of the whisky going into J&B blends.
An exceptionally complex 27yo The Glenrothes from the 1973 vintage, bottled in July 2000. Rich and deep, with hints of orange peel.
A 1975 vintage Glenmorangie, bottled in 2003. The whisky spent at least its last 4 years of maturation in casks that previously held Hermitage red wine.

One of the last official bottlings of Glenglassaugh from former owners Edrington Group before the distillery changed hands, this 19yo was distilled in 1986, the year the distillery was mothballed, and appeared on our shelves in 2006.
A very interesting dram, the only Speysider to be triple-distilled like a Lowland malt or Irish whiskey, but with a lot more body and character than either of those styles. Impressive stuff.

A 2002 distillery bottling of 1970 Bruichladdich matured for about 31 years. This has gone down as one of the best Bruichladdichs in modern memory - a 95 from Whisky Fun's Serge Valentin (and listed as his favourite expression from the distillery), a pile of superlatives in posts across the internet and a quick 'Amazing!!' when we just mentioned it on Twitter.
Glen Elgin 12yo is a top-quality malt, highly sought-after for blends. This is a little-seen single malt expression that represents great value for money.
One up from their standard 10-year-old bottling, the 12 Year Old has two more years in the cask and is a step closer to the sherry-heavy older expressions.

A delicious no-age-statement dram from Glenmorangie, some of the spirit in Signet has been made using a unique heavily roasted chocolate malt that really beefs up the rich flavours. The packaging is impressive, too.

Tasting Notes (1)
Smokehead is a popular single Islay malt from Ian Macleod distillers. Debate has raged over the identity of the distillery which supplies the whisky for Smokehead. We know, but we're not telling.

The second of the three extraordinary Oloroso cask 1964 Bowmores released in the mid-1990s. Like the first batch, this release was of 2000 bottles, and originally retailed on the high street for around £80(!). A much higher proportion of casks filled in the 1960s were sherry, and Black Bowmore is proof of the quality of some of those casks. With an almost unfathomable concentration and intensity of flavour, and perfect balance of fruit, peat and power, this whisky deserves the frequently overused 'legendary' tag and has assumed almost mythic status amongst whisky collectors and aficionados.

The ever-popular Auchentoshan 3 Wood is matured initially in bourbon casks before being finished in Oloroso then Pedro Ximénez casks for an extra layer of rich, sweet fruitiness.

Tasting Notes (1)

A smart packaging job for this distillery-bottled expression of Benromach 10yo, which has been a big hit since its introduction in late 2009. Well done to G&M for making the standard release strength 43%.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Powers John's Lane 12 Year Old
Single Pot Still
product_description:
A single pot still incarnation of Powers whisky, named for the now-defunct old Powers distillery. This is a very classy whiskey made using a combination of bourbon and oloroso-sherry-cask-matured spirit.

Tasting Notes (2)
Cardhu is known for being an easy-drinking and sweeter style of whisky. Gold Reserve has been aged in toasted oak casks, which has led to notes of toffee apples.
A 1 litre bottle of 12 year old Aberlour, matured in oloroso casks for 12 years. A big sherried whisky that picked up a silver medal at the International Spirits Challenge in 2010.

The 1991 edition of Glenmorangie's Grand Vintage single malt has been created from an unusual combination of whisky finished in red Burgundy casks and whisky finished in oloroso sherry casks. These two distinctive spirits, combined with a small amount of whisky aged in new toasted oak, were married for around four months before bottling, and the result is a finely balanced and richly fruity single malt that will surprise those sceptical about the cask combination.


The 1991 Grand Vintage is part of Glenmorangie’s Bond House No.1 Collection, a series of vintage whiskies that celebrates the largest of the distillery’s traditional 19th century warehouses. Bonded Warehouse No.1 was transformed into Glenmorangie’s impressive new still house in 1990.

Tasting Notes (1)

Scapa Skiren is a 2015 release from the Orkney distillery. Aged in first-fill American oak casks, this is creamy and sweet with notes of tropical fruit and heather.

Tasting Notes (1)
A reinvigorated release from Tullibardine, upping the quality of presentation as well as their whisky. This bourbon barrel matured dram is packed with vanilla and spice.

product_name:
Green Spot
Leoville Barton Bordeaux Finish
product_description:
A special edition of Green Spot, this was aged initially in a combination of bourbon- and oloroso-sherry casks before being finished for up to two years in barriques from famed Bordeaux winery Château Léoville Barton. A sweet blend of orchard fruit and spicy flavours.


Spot whiskeys originated in Dublin in the 1800s, Mitchel & Sons gained a reputation for producing the finest single pot still whiskeys, marking casks with coloured dots to signify aging potential.

Tasting Notes (2)

One of the first pair of entries in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series, Project XX started as a whisky created by the distillery's 20 brand ambassadors – each selected a cask and master blender Brian Kinsman combined them to create the template for this 47%, non-chill-filtered whisky. It's a mix of sherry casks, bourbon casks and more, with a rich and spicy character.

Tasting Notes (1)

The first peated whisky in Bunnahabhain's core range. Like the limited edition Toiteach that came before it, Toiteach A Dha (which means 'smoky two' in Scots Gaelic) is a smoky single malt with a sherry twist.


Matured in both bourbon and sherry casks, with a higher sherry influence than Toiteach, this is a delicate mix of smoke and sweet sherry fruit.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Balvenie 14 Year Old
Week of Peat Story No.2
product_description:
This 14-year-old heavily-peated single malt is the second whisky in the Balvenie Stories collection – a sweet and smoky whisky that balances earthy peat smoke with the distillery's characteristic citrus edge. Gentle peat smoke, delicate flowers and sweet butterscotch fill the nose, while the palate initially offers notes of sharp citrus, blossom honey, creamy vanilla and rich, earthy peat.


The Balvenie Stories collection is designed to bring to life the tales of 'character, endeavour and craft' of those at Balvenie through the generations. The Week of Peat is inspired by the tradition, started in 2002, of distilling peated malt for only one week every year.
Whisper Dry is Vya's lighter and less herbaceous sister to the Extra Dry. More than fifteen herbs are used including linden, orris and elecampane. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

A 21-year-old single malt from Tobermory distillery that has been finished for three years in an oloroso sherry butt, imparting rich, sweet aromas of clove-studded oranges, dark chocolate, vanilla and oak that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of prunes, walnuts, dark chocolate, nutmeg and Caramac bars, with hints of cinnamon and leather lingering in the finish.

Inspired by Scotland's history of importing casked port during the 19th century, Glendronach Port Wood has been finished in port casks from Portugal's Douro Valley for three years. The result is a rich, fruity whisky with sweet aromas of summer berries, cherry blossom and sweet honeysuckle, and a spicy ginger edge. The palate offers notes of apple crumble, wild berries and sweet gingerbread.

Tasting Notes (2)

An elegantly sherried Tormore from indie bottlers Gordon & MacPhail. This edition of 255 bottles was drawn from a single refill Sherry cask laid down in 1991. Expect a rich, Christmas-y dram with toffee and raisins on the nose and a palate full of chocolate orange and cinnamon. It’s bottled at cask strength and like all entries in the Connoisseur’s Choice range comes without added colour or chill-filtration.

A very limited release by independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail. After 33 years, American oak hogshead #3052 yielded just 121 bottles of this mature and dignified Strathisla. It shows lots of the distillery’s signature fruitiness with pears, bananas and lemon drops while light spiciness adds depth and structure.
A 2008 Glenlossie single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of hogsheads for 12 years, before being bottled in June 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.
A 2009 Glendullan single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of hogsheads for 11 years, before bein bottled in June 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

A 2006 Glenlossie single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of ex-bourbon barrels for 14 years, before being bottled in April 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A 1997 Glen Keith single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for 23 years, before being bottled in November 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

A 1995 Glen Grant single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of ex-bourbon barrels for 23 years, before being bottled in February 2019 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

Glenmorangie's Nectar d'Or is finished in Sauternes casks. This is sweet and spicy with notes of ginger, nutmeg lemon meringue and honeycomb.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 1991 Scapa single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single first-fill bourbon barrel for almost three decades, before being bottled in December 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of zesty citrus, rich vanilla, marzipan, poached pear, apples and malty cereal fill the nose, complemented by notes of honeydew melon, pineapple, white pepper, roasted nuts and soft herbs throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glen Moray 2005
Tokaji Cask Warehouse 1 Release
product_description:
A 2005 Glen Moray single malt, finished in ex-Tokaji wine casks, creating aromas of sugared almonds, caramel, freshly-baked gingerbread and toffee on the nose. The palate offers notes of sweet malty biscuits, warm bread, maple syrup, pecans, marzipan and freshly-baked croissants.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Balvenie 10 Year Old
Bot.1980s Founder's Reserve

Isle of Jura 2007
14 Year Old First Editions
product_description: A 2007 Isle of Jura single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single sherry butt for 14 years before being bottled in 2021 as part of its First Editions series. Aromas of crème brulee, vanilla custard and gingerbread fill the nose, complemented by notes of fudge, vanilla shortbread, buttery pastry and toffee apples throughout the palate.

A nutty, sweet whisky cream liqueur from the folks at Spirit of Yorkshire Distillery, combining English single malt whisky with Yorkshire dairy cream. The palate offers notes of milk chocolate, cookie dough, raisins, hazelnuts, orange oil and vanilla that linger through the finish.

A 2013 Bunnahabhain Staoisha single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of casks for seven years, before being bottled in June 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

The Speyside representative of the Classic Malts series is rich and spicy, with a very satisfying complexity and well-sherried backbone.

Tasting Notes (2)

Immensely popular Glenfiddich variant. Using a Solera system common in the maturation of quality sherry, 15yo malt from three different types of casks is married together in a wooden vat, which is constantly topped up to ensure the quality is maintained.

Tasting Notes (1)
A miniature bottle of Isle of Jura 10yo – an accessible, easy-drinking malt. Medium-bodied with a delicate sweet palate, with a hint of brine developing on the finish. A great introductory malt.
The first bottling of Tomintoul to be released after it changed hands in 2000, it's a rounded dram with fruit and toffee, and a peppery finish.

Long known as 'the gentle dram' Tomintoul 16yo is soft and nutty, with a pleasant richness. A Gold Medal winner at the International Wine & Spirits Competition (IWSC), this is a cracking dram for the money.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Glentauchers 2010
11 Year Old Sherry Cask Carn Mor
product_description: A 2010 Glentauchers single malt from indie bottler Carn Mor, matured in first-fill sherry butts for 11 years, before being bottled as part of its Strictly Limited series.

product_name:
Glen Ord 2012
8 Year Old Carn Mor
product_description: A 2011 Glen Ord single malt from indie bottler Carn Mor, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for eight years before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Strictly Limited series.

product_name:
Macduff 2007
14 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 2007 Macduff single malt from independent bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for 14 years, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Old Malt Cask series. Aromas of juicy peaches, vanilla and honeysuckle fill the nose, complemented by notes of apples, caramel, ginger, white pepper and straw throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glen Keith 25 Year Old
Secret Speyside
product_description: A mellow, spicy Glen Keith single malt from Secret Speyside, matured in first-fill American oak barrels for quarter of a century before being bottled in June 2019. Aromas of toffee apples, ginger and marmalade fill the nose, complemented by notes of gooseberry jam, vanilla custard, cinnamon-baked-apples and dried apricots throughout the palate.
A 1993 Tullibardine single malt from indie bottler Thompson Bros, matured in a single cask for almost three decades.

product_name:
Lochindaal 2010
10 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2010 Lochindaal single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for a decade before being bottled in 2021. Aromas of vanilla, camphor, cloves, damp wool and peat smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of peach, apple, lime, smoke and gingerbread throughout the palate.

A quarter bottle of Dalwhinnie 15yo, the Highland representative in Diageo's Classic Malts series. Dalwhinnie 15yo is a good introduction to the delights of single malt whisky - elegant, smooth and medium-bodied with a light, fruity palate and a whiff of heather on the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

We assume that this new no-age-statement peated Tomintoul must be similar to the Old Ballantruan but at a reduced strength. Either way, at this price it must be worth a punt for peatheads.

Tasting Notes (1)
Glenmorangie have redesigned their miniature bottle of the 10 year old to resemble its larger self.

A replacement for Glengoyne's 17yo that appeared in their revamped range in late 2012. A mix of refill sherry casks and a generous slug of first-fill sherry-matured whisky.

Tasting Notes (2)

Released in early 2013, Talisker Storm has all the warm, smoky, peppery characteristics we all love in the standard Talisker 10yo - but they've been turned up a notch, with more smoke, more spices, and a bigger-than-ever flavour explosion.

Tasting Notes (3)

A 1989 Balblair single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill hogshead for more than three decades, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of green apples, lime zest and coconut fill the nose, complemented by notes of peach, honeycomb, black pepper, marzipan and baking spices throughout the palate.

product_name:
Miltonduff 1989
31 Year Old Sherry Cask Connoisseurs Choice
product_description: A 1989 Miltonduff single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill sherry hogshead for over 30 years, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of is Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of clove, clementine and stewed fruit fill the nose, complemented by notes of baked apples, dates, marmalade and orange zest throughout the palate.

product_name:
Singleton of Auchroisk 1976
Bot.1980s Jug Set

product_description:
Cask Islay is a small batch release from A.D. Rattray from an undisclosed distillery on the island. A whisky that will entice both Islay fans and be a great place for neophytes to start.

Tasting Notes (1)

Auchentoshan American Oak was introduced in 2014 to replace the Classic. Matured exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a vanilla-rich and fruity whisky.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Caol Ila 13 Year Old
Smoky G&M Discovery Range
product_description:
The Gordon & MacPhail Discovery range examines the core flavours at the heart of Scotch single malt whisky, and this is the headline of the Smoky side of things. A 13-year-old Caol Ila from the island of Islay, this is as typical a dram as you can get from the island, packed with sweet fruit and dark peat smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Midleton Silent Distillery 46 Year Old
Chapter Two
product_description: The second release in the Midleton Very Rare Silent Distillery Collection is a 46-year-old single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1973 and matured in a single third-fill bourbon barrel. Aromas of apples, pears, lemon, oak spice, hazelnuts and worn leather fill the nose, complemented by notes of sweet red berries, star anise, ginger, malt and grapefruit throughout the palate and lingering in the finish.

product_name:
Redbreast 12 Year Old Cask Strength
Batch B1-20
product_description: Batch B1-20 of Red Breast's 12-year-old single pot still Irish whiskey has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon barrels and ex-sherry butts. Aromas of exotic fruits, orange, dried apricots, sultana and woody spices fill the nose and are echoed throughout the palate.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 2007 Hazelburn single malt, matured for 13 years in a combination of sherry and bourbon casks, creating aromas of lemon cheesecake, vanilla, biscuits and zesty citrus that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of peaches, red apples, vanilla, honey, orange and aniseed that linger in the finish.
A 2010 Ballechin single malt, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for a decade before being bottled in April 2021 as part of its Straight From The Cask series.

product_name:
Benriach 2000
20 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 2000 Benriach single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single refill sherry butt for two decades before being bottled in April 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Blair Athol 2008
12 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 2008 Blair Athol single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single sherry hogshead for 12 years, before being bottled in April 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

A full 60% abv, yet the sweet, rich, spicy distillery character is still very much in evidence. A very small drop of water is recommended to open up the flavours.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 1988 Glenlossie single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured for more than three decades in a refill sherry hogshead before being bottled in January 2021 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series.
A 2010 Dailuaine single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single sherry butt for a decade, before being bottled in March 2021 as part of its Provenance series.

One of our all-time favourite malts, Talisker 18 Years Old is a masterpiece from one of Scotland's greatest distilleries, and was named 'Best Single Malt Whisky in the World' at the World Whiskies Awards in 2007. Stunning balance of peat, spice and sweetness.

Tasting Notes (5)

An easy-drinking Talisker, taking the distillery's classically rugged character and softening it out, while maintaining the smoky and sweet notes the distillery is known for. More approachable, but still definitely Talisker.

Tasting Notes (3)

product_name:
Benriach The Twenty Five
25 Year Old
product_description: A mellow, smoky 25-year-old single malt from Benriach, made with a combination of peated and un-peated spirit and matured in a combination of sherry casks, bourbon barrels, virgin oak casks and Madeira Island wine casks. The result is aromas of smoked apricots, dark chocolate covered cherries and hazelnut toffee that fill the nose, complemented by notes of baked apples, cinnamon, toasted oak, orange and smoky caramel throughout the palate.

A 1988 Scapa single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill bourbon barrel for more than 30 years, before being bottled in December 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of dark honey, citrus and rich malt fill the nose, complemented by notes of black pepper, pear, tangerine, exotic fruits and charred oak throughout the palate.
Formerly carrying a vintage, Knockando's ongoing bourbon-cask bottling has now been released as a 12 year old. Light and fruity with spicy hints.

product_name:
Mortlach 12 Year Old
The Wee Witchie
product_description:
The entry point of the Mortlach range, combining both ex-bourbon- and ex-sherry-matured whisky to balance the distillery's traditionally weighty, dried fruit character against fresh fruit and vanilla notes. The result is a success, combining the best of both of these worlds while still showing off the meaty Mortlach spirit.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Mannochmore 1993
27 Year Old Carn Mor Celebration of the Cask
product_description: A 1993 Mannochmore single malt from indie bottler Carn Mor, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for 27 years, before being bottled in March 2021 as part of its Celebration of the Cask series.

product_name:
Orkney 2007
12 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2007 Orkney single malt from independent bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, made at a mystery distillery and matured for 12 years in a single cask, before being bottled in 2019.

product_name:
Linkwood 2006
12 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2006 Linkwood single malt from independent bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single cask for 12 years, before being bottled in 2018.

product_name:
Aultmore 2010
9 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2010 Aultmore single malt from independent bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single cask for nine years before being bottled in 2019.

product_name:
Linkwood 1966
54 Year Old Private Collection Sherry Cask G&M
product_description: A 1966 Linkwood single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a first-fill sherry hogshead for more than half a century, before being bottled in December 2020 as part of its Private Collection. Aromas of rich fruitcake, orange zest, cinnamon and nutmeg fill the nose, complemented by notes of white pepper, blackcurrant, raspberry, dark chocolate and Seville orange throughout the palate.

product_name:
Royal Brackla 18 Year Old
Palo Cortado Finish
product_description: An elegant 18-year-old single malt from Royal Brackla that has been finished in Palo Cortado sherry casks, creating layers of sweet dried fruits and warm spices throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glen Moray 2008
12 Year Old Small Batch Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A small-batch 2008 Glen Moray single malt from independent bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single barrel for 12 years, before being bottled in 2021.

product_name:
Glenfiddich Fire and Cane
Experimental Series #04
product_description:
Think you know peaty whisky? Think again. The fourth in Glenfiddich's much-admired Experimental Series is a marriage of their rarely-seen peated whisky with unpeated bourbon-aged single malt, all of which is finished in Latin rum casks.


The result is a surprisingly sweet and smoky dram that blends rich caramel and spice notes with fresh green fruit and soft pillowy smoke. A worthy continuation of the series that's very interesting to pair with different types of food – try it with spicy sausage or ice cream, for example.

Tasting Notes (1)

Exclusively matured in ex-bourbon barrels and distilled at Isle of Arran Distillers' Lochranza distillery, Arran Barrel Reserve is a fresh, light single malt released in autumn 2019. Aromas of citrus and vanilla mingle with lively apple and delicate sea breeze on the nose, while the palate offers notes of sweet fruits, warm spices, citrus, creamy vanilla and charred oak. Try drinking this whisky neat, with a splash of water or as part of a cocktail.

product_name: Highland Park Spirit of the Bear
product_description: A rich and fruity single malt from Highland Park, Spirit of the Bear is inspired by the legend that before battle Vikings would wrap themselves in bearskins to take on the strength and power of the bear. Matured in a combination of sherry-seasoned European oak, American oak and refill casks, it offers notes of brambles, dark chocolate, creamy vanilla, orange zest, freshly-ground nutmeg and aromatic peat smoke.

product_name:
Glen Scotia Tasting Set (Double Cask and 15 Year Old)
2x20cl
product_description: A set of two small bottles of single malt from Glen Scotia distillery, featuring Glen Scotia Double Cask and Glen Scotia 15 Year Old.

product_name:
Loch Lomond 12 Year Old
Small Bottle
product_description: Loch Lomond 12 Year Old has been aged in three types of cask: bourbon, refill and rechared. Fruity with notes of pear, lemon, vanilla and biscuits.

product_name:
Cu Bocan Creation 2
Shochu & Virgin Oak Cask
product_description: The second release in the Cu Bocan Creation series, this Highland single malt has been matured in a combination of Japanese Shochu and virgin oak casks. It has a rich yet lively character, with notes of juicy pears, sweet limes and freshly-baked pastry, alongside maple syrup, toasted walnuts and warm spices.

A 1988 Glenburgie single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill hogshead for more than three decades, before being bottled in December 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series.
A 2012 Fettercairn single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for eight years, before being bottled in March 2021 as part of its Provenance series.
A 2007 Macduff single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, finished in a Pedro Ximenez sherry butt before being bottled in August 2020 as part of its Old Particular series.
A 2007 Glenlossie single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single refill hogshead for 12 years, before being bottled in February 2020 as part of its Old Particular series.

product_name:
Tomatin 36 Year Old
Batch No.7 Rare Casks
product_description: The seventh batch of 36-year-old single malt from Tomatin distillery has been matured in a first-fill oloroso sherry butt, creating layers of rich fruit and spice throughout the palate.
A 1997 Dailuaine single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for 23 years before being bottled in November 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Benriach 2000
20 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 2000 Benriach single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, finished in a single ex-sherry butt and bottled at 20-years-old as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A 1996 Glenallachie single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for 23 years before being bottled in December 2019 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

A 1997 Linkwood single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for more than two decades before being bottled in June 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

A 1995 Glenburgie single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for a quarter of a century before being bottled in November 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A 1995 Glen Elgin single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for 24 years before being bottled in June 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A 1996 Strathmill single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of hogsheads for 23 years before being bottled in March 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Glenfiddich 8 Year Old

Straight Malt Bot.1960s

product_description: The tenth release of Kilchoman 100% Islay, bottled in 2020, has been made using barley grown on a single farm on Islay, and uses whisky that was distilled in 2007, 2009 and 2010. Sweet aromas of citrus on the nose are followed by cooked apples and pears, cinnamon and mildly spiced peat smoke on the palate.

product_name:
Lindores Abbey MCDXCIV Sample
Commemorative First Release
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the inaugural single malt from Lindores Abbey, MCDXCIV Commemorative First Release has aromas of vanilla, caramel, crunchy apples, pear drops and toffee that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dried fruit, citrus, cream, vanilla and oak spice that linger in the finish.

'Rounded yet delicate. Apples again, tingly spiciness. Fills and perfumes the mouth. Delicious…a classic example of a relatively light and fragrant whisky that has real complexity and a gorgeous feel. 8/10' Dave Broom, Whisky Magazine, Nov 2002
 
Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Springbank 1969
27 Year Old Sherry Cask #2383 Signatory

product_description: A miniature bottle of the relaunched Deanston 12 Year Old, previously famous as the whisky used in the much-missed Wallace whisky liqueur. This has a fresh, floral nose, a light palate and gently sweet maltiness.

product_name:
Glendronach 21 Year Old Parliament
Sherry Cask
product_description:
A 2011 release to fill a gap in the rapidly expanding Glendronach range and named for the Parliament of rooks that live in the trees near the distillery. A tasty combination of sherry matured whiskies, both Oloroso and PX, perfect for sherry-heads.

Tasting Notes (2)
A miniature bottle of 10 year old from the Isle of Mull. Ledaig is the peaty spirit distilled at the Tobermory distillery and it's packed full of heavy, smoky flavour.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
18 Year Old Sherry Cask Old Malt Cask

product_description:
A much-loved single malt, Cardhu is an easy-going, charming Speysider. This is has been aged for longer than the regular 12 year old expression, and the extra three years combine the distillery's characteristic orchard fruit, barley sugar malt and cake spices with richer tropical fruit and vanilla notes.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Lagavulin 16 Year Old
Bot.1980s White Horse Litre

product_description:
Laphroaig Lore is a 2016 addition to the distillery's range. Made up of whiskies aged in a combination of quarter casks, sherry casks and reused peated casks. This is rich and classically peaty with a spicy chili bite and a long, sweet aftertaste.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Macallan Through The Ages Tasting Set
6x3cl
product_description:
Macallan is – by some distance – the most sought-after whisky by collectors, and it’s easy to see why, with its luxurious drams that are aged in sherry casks to add a rich layer of spicy complexity. This tasting selection includes not only the flagship releases, but also some very special sold-out bottlings.


This set contains a 3cl each of: 12 Year Old Double Cask | Estate | Rare Cask | Rare Cask Black | Sherry Oak 18 Year Old 2020 Release | Sherry Oak 25 Year Old 2020 Release.

product_name:
Deanston 2008
11 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory for TWE
product_description:
Matured in a single first-fill sherry butt for 11 years after it was distilled in 2008, this Deanston single malt was bottled by Signatory Vintage in August 2019, exclusively to celebrate The Whisky Exchange's 20th Anniversary.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Aberfeldy 1991 Sample
28 Year Old Single cask Nation
product_description: A 1991 Aberfeldy single malt from indie bottler Single Cask Nation, matured in a single bourbon hogshead for 28 years. The palate offers notes of vanilla, creamy cereals, rich malt and sweet fruit. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Edradour 2008
11 Year Old Sherry Cask TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A 2008 Edradour single malt bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange in May 2020 after 11 years in a first-fill oloroso sherry cask.

Tasting Notes (1)

The new presentation of an interesting entry in the Arran Cask Finishes range, with the spirit spending the last few years of its maturation in a Sauternes sweet wine cask. Expect some sweet grapey notes as well as some tasty woody spice.

product_name:
Blair Athol 1995
25 Year Old Xtra Old Particular
product_description: A 1995 Blair Athol single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single sherry butt for a quarter of a century, before being bottled in December 2020 as part of its Xtra Old Particular series. Aromas of rich spices, charred oak and brown sugar fill the nose, complemented by notes of honeycomb, peaches in syrup, ripe bananas and green apple throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glenmorangie 12 Year Old
Malaga Cask Finish
product_description: A limited-edition 12-year-old single malt from Glenmorangie, matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in casks that previously held one of the rarest fortified wines in the world - Malaga Dulce. Bottled in August 2020, the palate offers notes of honey, cinnamon, dried apricots and crystalised ginger.
The 2020 release of Talisker Distillers Edition was distilled in 2010 and matured in oak casks until it was bottled in 2020.

Clynelish is the successor to the now-silent Brora, built opposite the original distillery and producing a top-quality rich, smoky dram. One of the best entry-level proprietary bottlings available from any distillery.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Blair Athol 2009
11 Year Old The Cooper's Choice
product_description: A 2009 Blair Athol single malt from indie bottler The Vintage Malt Whisky Company, matured in a single sherry cask for more than a decade before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Coopers Choice series.

product_name:
Mannochmore 2009
12 Year Old The Cooper's Choice
product_description: A 2009 Mannochmore single malt from independent bottler The Vintage Malt Whisky Company, matured in a single refill sherry cask for 12 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Coopers Choice series.

product_name:
Clynelish 1965
28 Year Old Sherry Cask #666 Signatory

product_description:
A fruity and spicy release from Aberlour, this 16 year old has been matured in a combination of sherry butts and first-fill bourbon casks. Jim Murray scored it 94.5/100 in his 2015 Whisky Bible, describing it as 'a malt of unbridled magnificence'.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Orkney's Finest 1999
21 Year Old Old Particular
product_description: A 1999 Orkney single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, made at a mystery distillery on Orkney and matured in a single refill hogshead for 21 years before being bottled in August 2020.

To create Xpedition Oak, Talisker sent some barrel staves off on a trans-Atlantic journey with adventurer James Aiken, who single-handedly followed the same route travelled by the teams in Talisker’s 3264-mile rowing challenge. These staves were then inserted into 10 casks of whisky aged for more than four decades, creating a unique finishing process that further infused the whisky with the spirit of the sea. Each bottle - of which there are 1830 in homage to the foundation date of the distillery - is packaged with a piece of these staves.

Tasting Notes (1)

Part of Dewar's The Last Great Malts range launched in 2014, this 12-year-old Aultmore is the first release from the distillery for a few years and is elegant, light and fruity.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
Bot.2007 Cask #2851 Berry Bros & Rudd

Port Ellen 1977
Bot.1991 Cask #2017 Gordon & MacPhail

product_description:
100° Proof is a punchy Islay single malt from Port Askaig. With notes of sweet fruit, peat smoke and minerality, this is a benchmark Islay whisky and a great everyday peaty dram at this price.

Tasting Notes (2) 

Excellent young sweet peat. Extremely simple, very good. Serge Valentin, whiskyfun.com

product_name: Method and Madness Single Pot Still
product_description:
Ever tried a whisky aged in chestnut wood before? We thought not! This also spends time in bourbon and sherry casks, adding layers of Christmas spices and tropical fruit. Absolutely delicious.

Tasting Notes (1)

The core of the Jura range, aged for 12 years in bourbon casks and then finished in Oloroso sherry. The result blends the distillery's characteristic gently smoky character with sweetness, spice and dark fruit. A great introduction to Jura.

Tasting Notes (1)

The flagship in GlenAllachie's new core range, released in July 2018. Matured in a mixture of virgin oak, oloroso sherry and Pedro Ximénez sherry casks, this has sweet flavours of honey, marzipan, bananas and butterscotch.


Prior to 2017, when the distillery was acquired by master distiller Billy Walker, GlenAllachie whisky was most commonly found in blends.

Tasting Notes (1)

An advance of seven years on 2018's Special Releases Talisker, this is a big, sooty, earthy single malt run-through with lashings of ripe citrus and treacle sponge, and plenty of warming spice. Plenty of heft and darkness to be found here, alongside classic, coastal Talisker character for purists to revel in.

Tasting Notes (3)
The second batch of Kilchoman UK Small Batch single malt has been matured in a combination of bourbon, oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks.
The 2020 Distillers Edition single malt from Caol Ila, distilled in 2008 and matured until it was bottled in 2020.

A 1988 Tomatin single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill hogshead for more than three decades before being bottled in January 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of orange zest, desiccated coconut and honeysuckle fill the nose, complemented by notes of marzipan, passion fruit, apple, malt and toasted almonds throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glencadam 2008
11 Year Old First Fill Bourbon Cask
product_description: A 2008 vintage single malt from Glencadam, matured in a single first-fill bourbon cask for more than a decade, before being bottled in February 2020.

A 2006 vintage single malt from Glencadam, matured in a single Port pipe for 13 years, before being bottled in January 2020. Aromas of poached pear, plums, orange peel and coffee beans fill the nose, complemented by notes of Jammy Dodgers, cedar wood, dark chocolate, leather and red berries throughout the palate.

A 2005 Glencadam single malt, matured in a single sherry butt for 14 years and bottled in January 2020. Aromas of ripe banana, summer berries, raisins and milk chocolate fill the nose, complemented by notes of nougat, dried fruits, sherry sweetness and soft spices throughout the palate.

product_name:
Tomintoul 1998
22 Year Old Caroni Rum Cask
product_description: A 1998 vintage Tomintoul single malt that has been matured in a single Caroni rum cask for more than two decades, before being bottled in March 2020.
A 19-year-old Tomintoul single malt, distilled in 2000 and matured in a single Pedro Ximenez sherry butt before being bottled in February 2020.
A 19-year-old Tomintoul single malt, distilled in 2000 and matured in a single Port pipe before being bottled in January 2020.

A 1994 vintage single malt from Tomintoul, matured in a single sherry butt for a quarter of a century before being bottled in January 2020. Aromas of caramel, plums, vanilla custard and brambles fill the nose, complemented by notes of walnuts, nougat, cherries, prunes, caramel and raisins throughout the palate.

product_name: Isle of Raasay Single Malt Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the first ongoing release of single malt whisky from Isle of Raasay Distillery. This is a lightly-peated whisky that was matured in a combination of first-fill rye whiskey barrels, fresh Chinkapin oak and first-fill Bordeaux red wine casks. Aromas of cherries, lemon cheesecake, mineral smoke and cinnamon fill the nose, complemented by notes of toffee apples, salted butter, seeded brown bread and butterscotch throughout the palate.

One of the world's best-selling malts, Glenfiddich 12yo's famous triangular bottle is a fixture in practically every bar on the globe. Light and easy-drinking stuff loved by millions.

Tasting Notes (1)

A whisky coming into its prime. This 15-year-old single malt, which spends its final three years in oloroso sherry casks, is elegantly balanced between this sherry influence and the distillery's fruit and peat characteristics – including a siren-like whisper of tropical fruit that will delight fans of older-style Bowmore. Now is the time to try Bowmore 15 Year Old, which reflects the best of the distillery's output from around the new millennium.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Highland Park 18 Year Old
Viking Pride
product_description:
The 2017 relaunch of one of our all-time favourites, this has to be one of the most consistently excellent malt whiskies of the past 10 years. Showered with awards and praise from all quarters, it was named as 'Best Spirit in the World' by F Paul Pacult of the Spirit Journal. Unfailingly excellent, especially after a good meal.


Pacult wrote: 'After 25 years' experience, it fits my profile of what makes a perfect whisky, which is to say it's totally in harmony, there are no rough edges and everything is melded together brilliantly.'

Tasting Notes (2)

An elegant, well-rounded 2007 Glenrothes from Specialites Dumagin J. Fils, initially matured for 11 years in a refill hogshead, it was finished for a further two years in a Ratafia Champenois cask before being bottled in August 2020.

The oldest release from Littlemill distillery to date, Testament was distilled in October 1976 and matured in a number of casks, including American oak hogsheads and oloroso sherry hogsheads, before being bottled in December 2020. Aromas of green apples, grapefruit, elderflower and ginger fill the nose, complemented by notes of pineapple, peach, dried orange peel, vanilla and soft brown sugar throughout the palate.
A miniature of Bunnahabhain's reinvented 12 year old, bottled at 46.3%.
One of the best-known Islay whiskies, Lagavulin 16 Year Old is a classic example of the island's style. Rich and smoky with notes of tobacco, cereal, kippers and tea.

Originally released to commemorate the distillery's 200th anniversary, this eight-year-old has now been added as a permanent addition to the core range. Big and smoky, with sweet spice that becomes apparent with a drop of water.

A 14-year-old single malt from Aberlour, matured in a combination of oloroso sherry casks and first-fill American oak casks. The result is aromas of cloves, cardamom, toffee, milk chocolate and orange zest on the nose, complemented by notes of black cherries, mocha coffee and fresh mint throughout the palate.

product_name:
Ledaig 2009 Sample
10 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample of 2009 Ledaig single malt indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of Batch Four of Kilkerran's heavily peated single malt. This whisky was matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, creating aromas of sea salt, sweet peat smoke, toasted marshmallows, wild heather and smouldering bonfire embers that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of heavy peat smoke, rich malt, digestive biscuits, liquorice root, honey and seaweed.

product_name:
Longrow Red 10 Year Old Sample
Malbec Finish
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 10-year-old Longrow Red single malt that has been matured in ex-bourbon barrels for seven years, before spending three years in refill Malbec wine barriques. Aromas of vanilla fudge, butterscotch, stewed rhubarb and grape juice fill the nose, complemented by notes of delicate peat smoke, red apples, black cherries, vanilla, sugar-coated almonds and earthy tobacco throughout the palate.

A 1987 Longmorn single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill hogshead for more than three decades before being bottled in November 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of pineapple, orange and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of toasted malt, roast nuts, caramel and chilli throughout the palate.

A 1986 Glenlivet single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill sherry hogshead for more than three decades before being bottled in March 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of stewed pears and cinnamon mingle with toasted oak on the nose, complemented by notes of strawberries, raspberries and liquorice throughout the palate.

Introduced to Glen Garioch's standard range in late 2010, this 12yo is a mix of ex-bourbon and sherry casks, and like the other distillery bottlings since the revamp, has been bottled at a feisty 48%. A real charmer.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Tomatin 1967
33 Year Old Bot.2000 Sherry Cask Scottish Castles

Royal Brackla 10 Year Old
Flora & Fauna

product_description:
Very reliable quality Speyside from a distillery founded in 1840. Glen Grant is one of the world's best-selling single malts and is particularly popular in Italy.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Macallan 12 Year Old Triple Cask Matured
product_description: Formerly known as Fine Oak, Triple Cask is part of the 2018 relaunch of the Macallan range. This has been aged for a total of 12 years in a combination of sherry and bourbon casks.

Bowmore 12yo has a place in many hearts as Islay's 'medium-peated' malt. A pronounced iodine character with plenty of pepper, the current 12yo bottling is a welcome return to the classic Bowmores of the 1960s and '70s, with the emphasis on tropical fruit and smoke. A deserved runner-up in our Whisky of the Year 2014-15 blind tasting.

Tasting Notes (2)

This Auchentoshan 12-year-old expression replaced the old 10 year-old when the range was totally revamped. Elegant and refined, with those classic Auchentoshan notes of vanilla and almonds.

Tasting Notes (1)

Introduced in 2010, after cask strength versions in 2004 and 2005, this is the first officially-bottled Caol Ila 25yo to be bottled at 43%.
