It's nice to see growing recognition for this excellent distillery, and this is a very welcome addition to the official range, with a rich, gentle mouthfeel and restrained, coal-esque phenols.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
Bot.1980s Selected for Weatherford

product_description: Peaty whisky from Tobermory on the Isle of Mull, named after a previous incarnation of the distillery. Maritime and smoky, this rivals some of the Islay drams for power, and the 10 year old balances the intensity of youth with rounded, well-aged spirit.

An early 2013 addition to Talisker's range, taking their classic Skye whisky and finishing it in ruby port casks, rounding the edges and bringing in rich, fruity sweetness.

Tasting Notes (3)

product_name:
Port Ellen 12 Year Old
Wilson & Morgan
Cardrona Just Hatched Bourbon Aged Cask Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of three-year-old whisky from New Zealand's Cardrona distillery, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask before being bottled. The palate is sweet and spicy, with notes of vanilla, honey, ginger, white pepper and oak spice.

product_name:
Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban 14 Year Old
Port Finish
product_description: A full-bodied, silky-smooth single malt from Glenmorangie, finished in a Quinta Ruban port cask, creating a rich chocolate flavour. Gentle aromas of Seville oranges and walnut build into rich dark chocolate, sandalwood and spicy pepper. The palate initially offers notes of mint chocolate, walnuts and orange develop into Turkish delight and summer flowers.

A guide to the evolution of the modern bartender, Matt Whiley's The Modern Cocktail explores the history of cocktail making as well as offering more than 60 cocktail recipes from some of the world's most famous bars.
A cocktail book unlike any other, Fever Tree: The Art of Mixing puts the focus on key mixers including tonic, lemonade, ginger ale and cola.

A 2010 Caol Ila single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured for a decade in a pair of ex-bourbon barrels, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

product_name:
Inchfad Heavily Peated 2005
15 Year Old The Cooper's Choice
product_description: A heavily peated Inchfad single malt from The Vintage Malt Whisky Co., matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for 15 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Cooper's Choice series.

A 2006-vintage island single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, made at a mystery distillery on Orkney and matured in a single refill sherry butt for 15 years, before being bottled in June 2021 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

Laphroaig 10yo is a full-bodied, smoky gem, with a residual sweetness and a hint of salt amid the seaweedy, peaty characters before a long warming finish. A classic dram.

Tasting Notes (1)
A mini bottle of Highland Park's gold standard malt.
A mini bottle of Laphroaig's ever-popular 10 year old.

A second entry into the 'Spot' range, aged for 12 years and made up in part from spirit matured in Malaga casks for a sweet and moreish dram.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Allt-a-Bhainne 1996
23 Year Old Berry Bros Small Batch
product_description: A 1996 Allt-a-Bhainne single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in an ex-bourbon barrel for more than two decades before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Winter Releases. The palate offers notes of vanilla, coconut, cinnamon baked apples, melon and shortbread that linger in the finish.

Bruichladdich's Scottish Barley is made entirely from Scottish-grown barley, trickle distilled and then matured in American oak. The distillery class it as their signature bottling.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Port Ellen 10 Year Old
Bot.1970s Signatory

Oban 13 Year Old
Manager's Dram Sherry Cask

product_description:
Rare Old was introduced in 2014 as the opening entry in the revamped Mortlach range, combining bourbon- and sherry-matured whisky to create a spicy, rich and flavoursome dram that shows off the distillery's excellent spirit.

Tasting Notes (1)

Laphroaig Select is aged in a combination of Oloroso sherry butts, American white oak (we suspect some of this is virgin oak), hogsheads seasoned with Pedro Ximenez, quarter casks and first fill bourbon casks. This results in a restrained and toned down version of this Islay classic.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Springbank 1969
25 Year Old Bot.1995 Sherry Butt Wilson & Morgan

product_description:
Originally released in France, Sanaig was given a wider release in 2016. Aged in a combination of oloroso-sherry and bourbon casks, this shows excellent balance between peat smoke and sweet citrus flavours.

Tasting Notes (1)
Kilchoman's ongoing Machir Bay is a vatting of whisky matured in first-fill bourbon casks for around six years, married and then finished in oloroso sherry butts before bottling.

product_name:
Springbank 1969
28 Year Old Sherry Cask #2382 Signatory

product_description: A 2012 Tullibardine single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured for eight years before being bottled.

product_name:
Linkwood 2009
11 Year Old Single Malts Of Scotland
product_description: A 2009 Linkwood single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a single hogshead for 11 years, before being bottled in January 2021 as part of its Single Malts of Scotland Series.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1953
48 Year Old Sherry Cask Private Collection G&M

Longmorn 1973
27 Year Old Sherry Cask #3962 Signatory

Strathisla 15 Year Old
Bot.1980s Gordon & MacPhail

product_description:
A rich and sherried expression from Mortlach that's will always be compared to the fan-favourite 16-year-old Flora & Fauna bottling. This is more balanced than that discontinued dram, with a mix of first-fill and refill sherry casks giving a wider range of sherry-cask character, from rich and dark dried fruit to plump and juicy berries.

Tasting Notes (2)

A big Benriach, taking the distillery's fruity spirit and adding layers of rich and dark flavour to it. Aged for 12 years in bourbon, sherry and port casks, it's a spicy dram with loads of dried fruit and soft spice.

A very popular Highland dram, with banana and sweet citrus fruit notes alongside a faint whiff of brine. A winner at the World Whisky Awards 2010 and a perennial favourite.

Tasting Notes (1)

A favourite expression in the Dalmore stable, this 15-year-old is elegant and smooth, with lipsmacking texture and the flawless balance one would expect from blending maestro Richard Paterson.

Tasting Notes (2)

A 1997 Glenburgie single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single first-fill sherry butt for 22 years, before being bottled in February 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of toffee and raisins, grapefruit and oak fill the nose, complemented by notes of red berries, dark chocolate, cinnamon and sweet malt throughout the palate.

product_name:
Strathisla 1967
35 Year Old Cask #1325 Ducan Taylor

product_description: A tad less peaty than early bottlings, the classic Ardbeg 17yo is still a great whisky, but is sadly becoming very thin on the ground as demand increases and supply runs low - it's now a good few years since owners Glenmorangie discontinued it. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

product_name:
Old Pulteney 2008
12 Year Old Daily Dram
product_description: A 2008 Old Pulteney single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured for 12 years before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Daily Drams series.

Introduced to the Benromach line-up in 2015, this lusciously rich Speyside single malt is a fruity, chocolatey and lightly smoky dram that will delight fans of traditional styles.


Matured in a mixture of ex-sherry casks and ex-bourbon casks, with a greater emphasis on sherry than the Benromach 10 Year Old, this is a charming reflection of Speyside both past and present.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Fettercairn 1998
Celebration of the Cask Carn Mor
product_description: A 1998 Fettercairn single malt from indie bottler Carn Mor, matured in a single bourbon barrel for 22 years, before being bottled in October 2020 as part of its Celebration of the Cask series.

product_name:
Caol Ila 22 Year Old
Feis IIe 2019 Sherry Cask

product_description: A 2010 Ardmore single malt from indie bottler Hidden Spirits, matured in a single cask for a decade, before being bottled in 2020.

This lip-smacking 12yo AnCnoc (formerly Knockdhu) is a top-quality proponent of the non-sherried Speyside style, showing polished malt and a delicious spiciness throughout a warm, complex palate and lasting finish.

product_name:
Tomintoul 30 Year Old
Robert Fleming 30th Anniversary 1st Release
product_description: A limited-edition 30-year-old single malt from Tomintoul, celebrating Robert Flemming's 30th anniversary as Master Distiller at Tomintoul. Initially matured in a bourbon cask, it has been finished in an oloroso sherry cask for a decade, before being bottled in February 2020.

One of the most famous malts in the world. Glenlivet 12yo has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

Tasting Notes (2)

The new Glencadam 10yo, released at the end of 2008 by (relatively) new owners Angus Dundee. This is styled as 'The Rather Delicate Highland Malt'. Unchilfiltered, with no colouring and bottled at 46% - this is what we like to see.

A 2010 Aultmore single malt from indie bottler Hidden Spirits, matured in a single first-fill bourbon cask for a decade, before being bottled in 2020. Aromas of vanilla, bread, apples, apricots, pear and crème caramel fill the nose, complemented by notes of coconut, pineapple, honey and toasted oak throughout the palate.

This historic single pot still Irish whiskey used only to be available in Dublin grocer Mitchell's, but now has spread across the world to huge acclaim. A delightful combination of fruit, toffee and malt.

Tasting Notes (1)

The first addition to Ardbeg's ongoing range for a decade when introduced in 2017, An Oa is a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

Tasting Notes (2)
Ledaig 18 Year Old is a fruity, peaty whisky from Tobermory, finished in sherry casks, balancing sweet, floral aromas with rich smoke and sea salt on the palate.

A sumptuous single pot still whiskey with a great degree of ageing, Redbreast 15 is richer, earthier and stronger than its 12 year old sibling. An essential part of any whiskey-drinker's education.

Tasting Notes (2)

A vibrant young Laphroaig whose maturation has been accelerated by ageing in quarter casks. This shows soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through. A terrific whisky and great value.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Glenmorangie Lasanta 12 Year Old
Sherry Cask Finish
product_description:
Glenmorangie's Lasanta is aged for 12 years, and is finished in a combination of oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks and is said to mean 'warmth and passion' in Gaelic.

Tasting Notes (1)

Matured exclusively in ex-bourbon casks, Tobermory 12 Year Old has a vibrant, fruity and spicy character with a subtle, salty edge. This Hebridean single malt has sweet, honeyed aromas of vanilla, ripe oranges and delicate flowers. The palate offers notes of fresh citrus, apples and tropical fruits, followed by creamy toffee, floral honey and a subtly, salty undercurrent.


Launched in 2019, Tobermory 12 Year Old takes centre-stage in the new core range from the distillery. After a two year hiatus as the distillery underwent extensive refurbishments, Tobermory has introduced new bottlings, inspired by the colours of the Isle of Mull.

Exclusively matured in sherry hogsheads from Jerez, Spain, Arran Sherry Cask is an elegant single malt with rich layers of fruit and spice. Aromas of ripe figs, black cherries, cinnamon, crystalised ginger and raisins fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of dark chocolate, figs, mandarins and baking spices.

Named after the dark, stormy coves of Campbeltown’s west shores, the Gauldrons is a marriage of some of the finest Campbeltown malts and is bottled by Douglas Laing in very small batches. The nose holds a salty quality with sweet caramel and a hint of peat smoke rounding it out, and the palate is warming and rich, with notes of sugar, barley and oak developing into spices, smoke and a salty-sweet caramel flavour in the finish.

product_name:
Distillery 291 11 Month Old Rye Spirit
Boutique-y Rye
product_description: Distillery 291 is from Colorado where they employ a very unique process in their rye production called the El Paso County Process. They take the stillage of IPA beer and add it to the mash. This is a big punchy rye spirit with plenty of attitude, you get notes of hay and dried apricot, behind lies Christmas cake spices and a note of green mango.
A 2004 Ledaig single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured for 15 years before being bottled in 2019 as part of its Daily Drams series.

product_name:
Glen Elgin 2008
12 Year Old Daily Dram
product_description: A 2008 Glen Elgin single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured for 12 years, before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Daily Dram series.

product_name:
Royal Brackla 2009
11 Year Old Daily Dram
product_description: A 2009 Royal Brackla single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured for 11 years before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Daily Drams series.
A 1997 Caperdronich single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured for 23 years before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Daily Drams series.
A 2007 Glenlossie single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured for 12 years before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Daily Drams series.

An organic single malt whisky from Nc'Nean, made with Scottish barley and matured in a combination of specially-selected red wine and American whiskey casks. The palate offers notes of lemon curd, poached peaches, juicy apricots and spicy white pepper.

product_name:
Daftmill 2009 Sample
Summer Batch Release 2020 Release
product_description: The 2009 Summer Batch Release from Daftmill has matured in a first-fill oloroso sherry cask and three ex-bourbon casks until it was bottled in 2020. Aromas of tropical fruit, cola cubes, dried figs and cigar box fill the nose, complemented by notes of lemon zest, toffee, biscuits and freshly-baked gingerbread. Try it now this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1967
Bot.1986 Sherry Cask Berry Bros & Rudd

product_description:
The second iteration of Ailsa Bay single malt, replacing the version released in 2016, is both peatier and sweeter than its predecessor. It has, however, gone through the same micro-maturation process as the first edition - one that sees the spirit first filled into smaller-than-average bourbon casks for six to nine months, a process which accelerates maturation before it is then transferred into more traditional casks for several years.


Ailsa Bay Sweet Smoke has notes of damp heather, vanilla oak, creamy toffee and candied orange peel.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Scotia 1991
28 Year Old Blackadder Statement No 33
product_description:
A 1991 Glen Scotia single malt from indie bottler Blackadder, matured in a single hogshead for 28 years before being bottled in October 2019 as part of the Blackadder Statement series.


Please note


Please note: This whisky is completely unfiltered. This may cause a buildup of oils and particulates from the cask, which will be present in the bottle.

A 2008 Glenallachie single malt from indie bottler Asta Morris, matured in a single sherry butt for 11 years before being bottled in 2020. Aromas of peaches, baked apples and oranges fill the nose, complemented by notes of apple pie, sugar cookies and honey, with hints of rubber lingering in the finish.

product_name:
Glen Moray 1996
23 Year Old Asta Morris
product_description: A 1996 Glen Moray single malt from indie bottler Asta Morris, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for 23 years, before being bottled in 2019. Aromas of red fruits, sweet spice and peppery oak fill the nose and are echoed throughout the palate.

product_name:
Lochside 1981
19 Year Old Refill Sherry Murray McDavid

Glenlivet 22 Year Old
The Ashworth Opulent Blenders Eclecticism
product_description: An incredibly rare Glenlivet distilled in 1974, specially selected by Chivas Brothers, and bottled by hand at 22 years of age on 2nd September 1996 to mark the occasion of the retirement of John B. Ashworth OBE, at the time Chivas Brothers' s Scottish Production Operation Manager.

Part of the Macallan Master Decanter series, the 2020 edition of Macallan M is presented in its traditional Lalique-crafted crystal decanted. The unusual, geometric design is as individual and complex as the whisky inside.

product_name:
Singleton Glendullan Reserve
Game of Thrones House Tully
product_description:
The ancestral home of House Tully, Riverrun, sits at the junction of the Red Fork of the Trident and the Tumblestone River. The ruling Lord of the Riverlands, House Tully embodies the power and ferocity of the rivers it sits between. Using the power found in their positioning, House Tully forged strong alliances and built a history of honour, family and duty. Built along the banks of the River Fiddich, Glendullan Distillery originally relied on the waters it lay beside, using a water wheel to power the entire distillery. Like the Tullys themselves, this single malt can benefit from a splash of water, opening up flavours of green apple, honey and sweet vanilla.


Aged in ex-bourbon casks, this single malt has a light straw shimmer and a heady opening of Madagascan vanilla on the nose, followed by hints of clove spice. On the palate the initial drive is fresh green apples, then the clove flavour from the nose is there, but accompanied by warm cinnamon notes. The finish slips into a red berry flavour with vanilla and a hint of cherry bakewell.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Imperial 1989
30 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 1989 Imperial single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single cask for three decades before being bottled. Aromas of honey, lemon, vanilla custard, orange and apple juice fill the nose, complemented by notes of green apples, gooseberries and soft wood smoke on the palate.

product_name: The Singleton of Glen Ord 38 Year Old
product_description:
A limited-edition Singleton of Glen Ord single malt that was matured in a combination of refill sherry and ex-bourbon casks for almost four decades. Aromas of green apples and ripe pears, honeysuckle, cinnamon and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla fudge, cinnamon buns, peaches oak spice and crunchy apples throughout the palate.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenfarclas 21 Year Old
95 Proof TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A rich and fruity 21-year-old Glenfarclas single malt bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange after 21 years in oloroso sherry seasoned oak. The result is aromas of cherries, blackcurrants and dates, mingling with shortbread, orange and earth on the nose. The palate offers notes of nutmeg, clove, cinnamon, mint chocolate, gingerbread and warm toast that linger in the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)
The 68th release in Aberlour's A'Bunadh range - small batch bottlings of oloroso-sherry aged single malt - which as usual offers tasty notes of dried fruit, sherry, dark chocolate and spice.

A mini bottle of Ardbeg's massively popular 10 year old whisky. A perfect intro to the world of peaty Islay drams, with waves of smoke, sweetness and peat.

Tasting Notes (1)

A long-aged release from Glenturret, created as part of the invigorated distillery's new range by legendary blender Bob Dalgarno.


A sophisticated single malt from Glenturret, released as part of the 2020 Maiden Releases after 30 years in ex-sherry casks. The palate is delicate and fruity, offering notes of oak, nutmeg, dried fruit and plums that linger in the finish.

A miniature of Balvenie's 12yo DoubleWood. This is finished in fresh sherry casks for an extra layer of richness and complexity.

Tasting Notes (1)

As a replacement for the much-loved 1990 Airigh nam Beist, Ardbeg Corryvreckan had some pretty big shoes to fill, but the good news is that this is a belter, winning World's Best Single Malt Whisky at the World Whisky Awards 2010 and Best No Age Statement Scotch from Jim Murray's Whisky Bible.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenlivet 1981
36 Year Old Sherry Finish TWE Exclusive
product_description:
Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange, this hand-picked, single cask 36 year-old is a colossus of long-aged Glenlivet complexity, having spent its final 6 years in a sherry butt. The nose is an alluring, aromatic maze of cocoa, dried fruit, pastry and subtle oak. It’s just as enchanting on the tongue, where fresh apple and cinder toffee battle spice for dominance of a tempered citrus and oak landscape. All is reconciled in a finish full of gentle liquorice and mild cinnamon, with more rich, dark fruit to walk us out.

Tasting Notes (2)

This whisky was created to show the effect that soil, climate, geographic orientation and natural influences can have on a whisky’s flavour profile. Distilled from barley grown on six farms in both western and central Islay, this whisky has a flavour unique to the island. A sweet and fruity spirit, this single malt also holds a refreshing saline quality that cuts through flavours of apples, gooseberries, vanilla and citrus.

product_name:
Williamson 2005 Islay Blended Malt
12 Year Old The Cooper's Choice
product_description: A 2005 Williamson Islay blended malt from indie bottler The Vintage Malt Whisky Company, matured in a single bourbon cask for 12 years, before being bottled in 2018 as part of its Cooper's Choice series. Aromas of savoury peat smoke, damp seaweed and antiseptic fill the nose, complemented by notes of sweet malt, citrus, ginger, tar and heavy smoke throughout the palate.

product_name:
Laphroaig 1990
28 Year Old The Cooper's Choice
product_description: A 1990 Laphroaig single malt from indie bottler The Vintage Malt Whisky Company, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask before being bottled in 2019 as part of its Cooper's Choice series.

A 15-year-old Glenallachie single malt, matured in a combination of Pedro Ximenez and oloroso sherry casks, creating a smooth, rich character. Aromas of raisins, butterscotch and sweet spices fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of dark chocolate, orange peel, banana, raisins and caramel.

product_name:
Octomore 10.3 Sample
6 Year Old Islay Barley
product_description: Made using barley grown in a single field, in a single year, at Octomore farm, less than a mile from Bruichladdich, and matured entirely on Islay, and even bottled on the island, Octomore 10.3 offers a profile firmly rooted in terroir, supporting the weight of its 114ppm phenol count. Aged in ex-bourbon casks for six years, it offers aromas of earthy peat smoke, lemon drops, thyme, sea salt, vanilla and fudge, with a sharp, medicinal edge. The palate offers notes of salt, honey and lemon, developing pear, gooseberry and oak atop a backdrop of heavy peat smoke. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
100 Proof TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A fruity Glenfarclas single malt bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange after 15 years in sherry-seasoned oak. The result is sweet aromas of crème brûlée, raisins, toffee and vanilla custard on the nose, complemented by notes of blackcurrant jam, liquorice, sticky ginger cake, fudge, fruitcake and speculoos biscuits.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Edradour 2009
12 Year Old Natural Cask Strength
product_description: A 2009 Edradour single malt from the distillery's Natural Cask Strength series, matured in a single sherry cask for 12 years, before being bottled in May 2021.

This indulgent, full-bodied Balblair 25 Year Old is the final whisky in the Balblair Collection, and has been matured in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in Spanish oak butts. This has created an elegant single malt with ripe apricot, liquorice and toasted oak aromas. The palate offers notes of chocolate praline, orange oil and fresh tobacco leaves, before a warm, smooth finish with hints of dark chocolate and blood oranges. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Glenlivet 1974
22 Year Old Bot.1988 Hart Brothers

Dailuaine 16 Year Old
Sherry Cask Flora & Fauna
product_description: A delicious bottling from Dailuaine. Big, rich, sweet and smoky, with a very smooth mouthfeel and plenty of fruits and spices.

product_name:
Glen Moray 1994 Sample
25 Year Old Port Finish
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of limited-edition 1994 Glen Moray single malt that has been matured for more than two decades and finished in Port-seasoned oak.

product_name:
Singleton of Dufftown 1985 Sample
28 Year Old
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a rarely seen example of long-aged whisky from Dufftown, this 1985 vintage has been aged for 28 years, all spent in refill American oak. This was bottled as part of the Diageo's annual Special Releases for 2013 and is a fantastic example of what age can do to this quiet Speyside dram.

product_name:
Tomatin 2006
13 Year Old Fino Sherry Cask
product_description: A 2006 Tomatin single malt, finished in a pair of fino sherry butts and bottled at 13-years-old, creating a nutty, spicy character.

A relaunch in fancy packaging for Deanston's single malt, previously famous as the whisky used in the much-missed Wallace whisky liqueur. Trivia snitched from the Malt Whisky Yearbook: Deanston is the only distillery in Scotland that is self-sustaining for electricity, being equipped with a dam and a turbine.

Tasting Notes (1)
A 2009 Benrinnes single malt from indie bottler High Spirits, matured for 11 years before being bottled in November 2019 as part of its Master of Magic series.
A 2007 Linkwood single malt from indie bottler High Spirits, matured for 12 years before being bottled in November 2019 as part of its Master of Magic series.
A 2008 Aultmore single malt from indie bottler High Spirits, matured for 11 years before being bottled in November 2019 as part of its Master of Magic series.

A 1959 Glenfarclas single malt matured in a single ex-sherry hogshead for six decades before being bottled in November 2019 in a bespoke hand-made Glencairn crystal decanter. Rich aromas of Christmas cake, orange, cinnamon and dark chocolate fill the nose, complemented by notes of Christmas pudding and brandy butter, clove, nutmeg and orange throughout the palate.

A rich and sophisticated 1988 vintage Jura single malt from the distillery's Vintage Series. Initially matured in ex-bourbon oak and finished in ex-Port casks, it offers aromas of red berries, ripe plums, creamy vanilla and fresh citrus that are echoed throughout the palate.

product_name:
Springbank 1979
13 Year Old Sherry Cask Sam's Wine Warehouse

product_description: A miniature bottling of Macallan's no-age-statement entry level malt, matured in sherry casks and showing that age is not the only measure of a whisky.

Copper Dog is a Scotch whisky that sums up all that is good about Speyside. A combination of eight single malts, Copper Dog is deliciously fruity with a hint of honey and spice.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Miltonduff 2007
11 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2007 Miltonduff single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single cask for 11 years, before being bottled in 2019.

product_name:
Dufftown 2009
9 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2009 Dufftown single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured for nine years and bottled in 2019. Aromas of soft fruit, green grass, warm toast, honey and melon fill the nose, complemented on the palate by notes of toasted oak, liquorice, blackcurrant and lively citrus.

product_name:
Highland Park 1997
21 Year Old Xtra Old Particular
product_description: A 1997 Highland Park single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in s single refill hogshead for 21 years, before being bottled in March 2019 as part of its Xtra Old Particular series.

Matured in refill casks for 13 years before a long finish in Gonzalez Byass ex-oloroso sherry casks, Tobermory 23 Year Old liberally layers sherry-rich fruitcake flavour atop Tobermory's trademark citrus notes, creamy mouthfeel and slight, salty tang. The spiritual successor to the hugely-popular – now discontinued – 15 Year Old, this bold, yet refined, dram is sure to be a hit with fans of sherry-matured whisky.

An untamed young single malt from Ardbeg, Wee Beastie has spent five years in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks before being unleashed. Fresh, herbal aromas of pear, cracked black pepper, pine needles, vanilla and honey-glazed ham mingle on the nose with aniseed, green apple, leather and coffee. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, hot tar, smoked bacon, aniseed and eucalyptus that liner in the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

An all-time classic, Glenfarclas 25yo is the epitome of long-aged sherried Speyside, gorgeously smooth and silkily-textured, with rich, generous flavours of fruitcake, hazelnuts, dried fruit and a hint of dark chocolate and coffee. A thoroughly delightful dram.
A 21-year-old Allt'A Bhainne single malt from The Distillery Reserve Collection, matured in a second-fill barrel for more than two decades and bottled in June 2019.

product_name:
Talisker Pure Malt Over 8 Year Old
Bot.1960s

Macallan 30 Year Old
Sherry Oak 2020 Release
product_description: Matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry casks from Jerez, Spain, the 2020 release of Macallan 30 Year Old Sherry Oak is a rich and spicy single malt with aromas of clove-studded orange, nutmeg and toasted oak on the nose. The palate offers notes of dried fruits, sherry and oak, with cloves, cinnamon and citrus lingering in the finish.

product_name:
Highland Park 12 Year Old
Viking Honour
product_description:
Highland Park 12 Year Old remains one of the gold- standard malts for other distillery bottlings to aspire to. With a delicious sweetness (heather-honey is their preferred description) and a warming, silky mouthfeel, this is a whisky that never lets you down. "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky". Michael Jackson, Michael Jackson's Malt Whisky Companion

Tasting Notes (3)

product_name:
Glendronach 15 Year Old Revival
Sherry Cask
product_description:
The revived Glendronach Revival: a whisky whose original incarnation was so popular that we drank all of it. It's back with a new recipe thanks to master blender Rachel Barrie, combining both oloroso and PX casks into a rich sherry-monster that's packed with spice and fruit. We don't think it's going to disappear of the shelves again, but when it comes to Glendronach 15 Year Old, we always recommend stocking up.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Braes Of Glenlivet 1979
15 Year Old Sherry Cask Whyte & Whyte

product_description: A 1997 Tomatin single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured for 23 years and bottled in 2020 as part of its Daily Drams series.
A 1997 Ledaig single malt from indie bottler The Nectar, matured in a single cask for 22 years, before being bottled in 2020 as part of its Daily Drams series.

Double Cask Gold is the new name for Gold as part of Macallan's relaunched range introduced in 2018. Aged in a combination of first fill and refill sherry casks, it is designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.

Tasting Notes (3)

product_name:
Caol Ila 1989
30 Year Old Edition #5 The Kinship
product_description: A 1989 Caol Ila single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single cask for three decades before being bottled as part of its Kinship series for Virtual Feis Ila 2020.

product_name:
Bunnahabhain 1989
30 Year Old Edition #4 The Kinship
product_description: A 1989 Bunnahabhain single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single cask for three decades before being bottled as part of its Kinship series for Virtual Feis Ila 2020.

product_name:
Highland Park 1989
30 Year Old Edition #1 The Kinship
product_description: A 1989 Highland Park single malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single cask for three decades before being bottled as part of its Kinship series for Virtual Feis Ila 2020.

Macallan is known for ageing its whiskies in sherry casks and the Double Cask range, of which this 15 year old single malt is a part, explores what happens when whisky aged in two types of sherry-seasoned oak is combined. Matured in both European and American oak casks, this smooth single malt has notes of dried fruits, orange zest, melted chocolate, oak spice and honey.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Coleburn 1972
47 Year Old Gordon & MacPhail 125th Anniversary
product_description: A 1972 Coleburn single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill sherry puncheon for almost half a century before being bottled in 2020 in celebration of its 125th anniversary.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1972
26 Year Old Sherry Cask Hart Brothers

product_description: A Lowland single malt whisky from Lindores Abbey that has aromas of vanilla, caramel, crunchy apples, pear drops and toffee that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dried fruit, citrus, cream, vanilla and oak spice that linger in the finish.

An additional period of maturation in 30 year-old port pipes has given this aged Balvenie an extra level of depth and concentration of flavour, adding potent fruit and smoke notes to the silky-smooth full-bodied palate. Rich, indulgent, after-dinner Speyside at its best.

Tasting Notes (3)
Glenfarclas 10yo is a straw-gold , delicately light, sweet and malty dram leaving a long slightly spicy finish. Always impeccably well-made, this is a whisky that always delivers in quality.
An elegant nose, faintly sweet, scented with apple and wood. Glenfiddich 18yo is a robust and full-bodied single malt whisky, yet remains remarkably soft, rounded and long lasting.
A 2002 Deanston single malt, matured in Marsala wine casks, creating notes of cinnamon, apricot, ginger and baked apples throughout the palate.

A 2005 Benriach single malt, matured in a single rum barrel for 14 years, before being bottled in 2019. A smoky, fruity whisky, it has aromas of sweet peat, smoked meats, apple and vanilla on the nose. The palate offers notes of barbecued pineapple, cedar smoke, pink peppercorns and spicy oak that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Lagavulin 12 Year Old
18th Release Special Releases 2018
product_description:
A triumphant entry for one of the annual Diageo Special Releases regulars – the Lagavulin 12 has only missed the very first edition in 2002. 2018's is sweeter than the past few years, with all of the smoke and seaside character that these bottlings are known for.

Tasting Notes (1)

A favourite of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert, being conveniently situated close by Balmoral Castle. Royal Lochnagar was originally a key ingredient in VAT 69, but most production is now for single malts.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name: Glen Scotia 11 Year Old Sherry Double Cask Finish
product_description: An 11-year-old Glen Scotia single malt that has been matured in a combination of oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. The nose offers notes of toffee, ripe plums and spices, complemented by notes of vanilla, raisins, sultanas, salted butter and baking spices throughout the palate.

A 2008 Dailuaine single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single sherry butt for 12 years before being bottled in April 2020 as part of its Old Particular series. Aromas of burnt wood, peanuts, almonds, spring flowers and shortbread fill the nose, complemented by notes of crystalised ginger, raisins, black cherries and blackcurrants on the palate.

product_name:
Tomintoul 1989
30 Year Old Xtra Old Particular
product_description: A 1989 Tomintoul single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for three decades, before being bottled in April 2020 as part of its Xtra Old Particular series.

A special-release of 1973 single malt from Fettercairn distillery, matured for 46 years and has been finished in tawny port pipes. Aromas of overripe bananas, toasted sourdough, fresh oranges, plums, dark chocolate and figs fill the nose. The palate offers notes of spiced pears, coffee, caramelised orange and liquorice, with hints of black cherries and plum lingering in the finish.
Replacing the 10 year-old as the main expression of the Lowland style in the Classic Malts range, this Glenkinchie 12yo is a bit fuller and more complex.

product_name:
Teaninich 2008
11 Years Old Single Malts of Scotland
product_description: A 2008 Teaninich single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a single refill hogshead for 11 years, before being bottled in August 2020 as part of its Single Malts of Scotland series. Aromas of freshly-cut hay, juniper berries, elderflower, kiwi and autumn leaves fill the nose, complemented by notes of butterscotch, grapefruit and strawberry ice cream throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glendronach 18 Year Old
Allardice Sherry Cask
product_description:
Glendronach Allardice 18yo (named after the distillery's founder) has been 100% matured in oloroso sherry casks. It has been at the centre of the distillery's range since its 2000's relaunch and remains one of the best sherry-focused 18-year-old whiskies on the market. Chewy and fruity, with layers of soft spice, and rich raisins and dates.

Tasting Notes (1)

Caol Ila 12 Year Old is of medium weight, but still packing plenty of potent phenols, this is a refined, powerful dram with a compensating oiliness. A balanced, peaty beauty..

Tasting Notes (3)

Rich and sherried 15yo malt from one of the best distilleries in Speyside. Aged for a little bit longer and bottled a little stronger for a more concentrated, richer flavour. As always, Glenfarclas remains one of the best-value malts on the market – a must for lovers of sherried whisky.

Tasting Notes (3)

Dalmore’s trademark style is luscious notes of orange, chocolate and spices, and the 18 Year Old bottling is a terrific example. Aged in both bourbon and sherry casks, it has seductive notes of vanilla, dark chocolate and candied orange on the nose, followed by a full-bodied, spicy palate of cinnamon and stewed fruit.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 2007 Speyside single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, made at a mystery distillery and matured for 13 years in refill sherry butts before being married and then bottled in June 2020 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

A 1977 single cask Benromach, matured for four decades in a single refill hogshead and bottled for the Benromach Distillery Visitor Centre in 2017. Presented in an elegant wooden case with copper accents, it offers notes of honey, tobacco, caramelised banana and butterscotch on the palate, with hints of black pepper, orange zest and oak spice lingering in the finish.

product_name:
Caol Ila 1988
31 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1988 Caol Ila single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured in a single refill sherry butt for 31 years before being bottled in January 2020 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series.

Glenmorangie Grand Vintage 1996 is a smooth, creamy Highland single malt matured in bespoke casks for 23 years before being bottled in 2019. Sweet, floral aromas of roses, carnations, coriander, orange, pear and creamy vanilla fill the nose. The palate offers notes of zesty oranges and lemons, vanilla fudge, ground ginger, cinnamon, oak spice and marzipan.

product_name:
Ardbeg 1973
Bot.1988 Fragments of Scotland Samaroli

product_description:
A giant leap forward for Bunnahabhain 12yo, this edition was launched in summer 2010 with a jump in strength to 46.3% and a declaration of no chill-filtration and no added colouring. The producers deserve enormous credit for giving punters what they want without jacking up the price too much and we earnestly hope that this will be a massive success. Bravo!

Tasting Notes (1)
A 1972 vintage release from popular highland distillery, Glenmorangie. This single cask was bottled in August 1994.

The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago. Medium-bodied and gently warming, with pleasant spicy notes.

Tasting Notes (2)

A 25-year-old single malt from Balvenie's Rare Marriages series, matured exclusively in European and American oak casks and married in a tun to create a fruity, elegant whisky. Aromas of autumn fruits, runny honey, crystalised ginger and oaky spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of toasted marshmallows, apple tart, cinnamon and fruit salad throughout the palate.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 23-year-old Longmorn single malt from Secret Speyside, matured in a combination of American oak barrels and hogsheads and bottled in 2019. Aromas of milk chocolate, oranges and sandalwood fill the nose, complemented by notes of lemon curd, crystalised ginger and baking spices throughout the palate.

Dalmore 12 is aged for the first nine years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, before half is transferred to ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Fever-Tree and Spirits Pairing Set
6x3cl plus Six Free Bottles of Fever-Tree
product_description:
There's much more to tonic than G&Ts and there's more to Fever-Tree than just tonic. This tasting set explores the world of the high ball, with six spirits, each paired with a different Fever-Tree mixer – six 3cl samples and six bottles of Fever-Tree. Includes Tio Pepe Sherry with Mediterranean Tonic, Barsol Torontel Pisco with Mediterranean Tonic, Hepple Gin with Naturally Light Tonic, Jeptha Creed Original Vodka with White Grape and Apricot Soda, Frey Ranch Bourbon with Smoky Ginger Ale and Lagavulin 16 Year Old with Madagscan Cola.


Please note


This set includes six 20cl bottles of Fever-Tree, which will show as free gifts in your basket.

The fruit of Dalmore's experiments with casks from around the world, this port wood reserve marries Dalmore's weighty whisky with thick port-cask fruit and spice. Matured first in American white oak bourbon casks, it is then finished in port pipes from W&J Graham before being bottled at a punch 46.5%. Creamy and fruity with controlled sweetness.

Tasting Notes (1)
A 2010 Aultmore single malt from indie bottler Valinch & Mallet, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for nine years before being bottled.

product_name:
Tomatin 36 Year Old
Batch No.6 Rare Casks
product_description: The sixth batch of 36-year-old single malt from Tomatin distillery has been matured in a combination of traditional oak casks and first-fill oloroso sherry butts. The palate offers notes of cardamom, vanilla and clove over a rich, malty background.

A fine drop of Ardbeg bottled at cask strength. A marriage of Ardbeg from bourbon barrels and sherry butts which gives a sweet and smoky finish to this malt. Uigeadail is the loch from which all Ardbeg water flows. An absolutely stunning whisky, and following the demise of Airigh nam Beist, this probably represents the best value in the core range.

Tasting Notes (2)

A malt whisky of unmistakable honey-rich maturity and depth. Glenlivet 18yo is the winner of 2 gold medals in the International Wine and Spirit Competition (IWSC) and remains one of the best-value expressions of sherried Speyside.

Tasting Notes (3)
A 2008 Tomatin single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail's Discovery series, bottled in 2019.

A celebratory release from Speyburn to commemorate the 18th anniversary of Bobby Anderson’s position as distillery manager. This single malt, aged for 18 years in American and Spanish oak casks, has aromas of toffee and sugared almonds, as well as tropical fruits on the nose. The palate holds flavours of rich dark chocolate, toffee and a touch of citrus, with plenty of smoke throughout. The finish is long and smoky, with a sweeter honeyed edge.
A Perfect Measure set that includes a combination of bourbon and rye whiskies, perfect for exploring the classic Old Fashioned cocktail.
The third batch of Tomatin's limited-edition 30-year-old Highland single malt has been matured in a combination of first fill bourbon barrels and refill hogsheads.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1953
63 Year Old Pagoda Sapphire Reserve (Gold) Magnum
product_description: A 1953 Glenfarclas single malt from the distillery's Pagoda series, Sapphire Reserve has been matured for more than six decades before bottling. Rich aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, blackberries and gooseberries mingle with clove, nutmeg and candied orange on the nose. The palate offers notes of clove-studded orange, sherried plums and raisins and rich Christmas spices that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1953
63 Year Old Pagoda Sapphire Reserve (Silver) Magnum
product_description: A 1953 Glenfarclas single malt from the distillery's Pagoda series, Sapphire Reserve has been matured for more than six decades before bottling. Rich aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, blackberries and gooseberries mingle with clove, nutmeg and candied orange on the nose. The palate offers notes of clove-studded orange, sherried plums and raisins and rich Christmas spices that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1953
63 Year Old Pagoda Sapphire Reserve (Silver)
product_description: A 1953 Glenfarclas single malt from the distillery's Pagoda series, Sapphire Reserve has been matured for more than six decades before bottling. Rich aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, blackberries and gooseberries mingle with clove, nutmeg and candied orange on the nose. The palate offers notes of clove-studded orange, sherried plums and raisins and rich Christmas spices that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Cardhu Gold Reserve
Game of Thrones House Targaryen
product_description:
One of the most resilient houses in the Seven Kingdoms, House Targaryen have survived a lot of trials and tribulations, often with the help of their fire-breathing dragons. The strength of will and fierce, unwavering determination of House Targaryen allowed Daenerys Targaryen to walk through fire and emerge at the head of the greatest army the known world has ever seen. Under the Targaryen banner she marched to claim the Iron Throne and bend her rivals to her will. The same fiery spirit and steely resolve fueled Helen Cumming and her daughter-in-law Elizabeth as they formed Cardhu Distillery in the male-dominated whisky world. This single malt celebrates legendary women, in the Seven Kingdoms and in Scotland, with a drink that is rich in flavour, dark and fruity with a spicy toffee edge.


The whisky's rich golden colour is accompanied by soft honey aromas with just a hint of toasted oak. Take a sip and you’re greeted by apple pie flavours, sweet baked fruit and buttery cinnamon, which quickly develop into a rich caramel with clove and malty biscuit flavours mixed throughout.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Inchgower 1997
22 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish Signatory
product_description: A 1997 Inchgower single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in bourbon hoogsheads for 22 years, before being finished in a single sherry butt for the final two years and was bottled in February 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A 1997 Glen Keith single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for more than two decades, before being bottled in March 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

A 1995 Glen Elgin single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for almost a quarter of a century before being bottled in March 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A 1997 Dailuaine single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a pair of hogsheads for 22 years, before being bottled in February 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

product_name:
Springbank 12 Year Old Cask Strength Sample
2021 Release
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2021 release of Springbank 12 Year Old has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon casks and ex-sherry casks, creating aromas of damp earth, sea salt, black pepper and pineapple that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of vanilla, fudge, salted caramel, milk chocolate and honeycomb that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1979
40 Year Old 9 Rogue Casks
product_description: A limited-edition single malt from Port Ellen that tells the story of nine casks uncovered from the four centuries old stocks of casks. Delicate, grassy aromas mingle with burnt orange, soft smoke, crème caramel, roasted coffee and peach compote on the nose. The palate offers notes of rich bonfire smoke, pipe tobacco, leather and oak spice.

A phenomenal Southern Islay single malt for the first-ever wave of whiskies in the Elements of Islay series. Ar1 is bursting with peat but with a delicious compensating sweetness. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

Released in 2019, this 30 year old is the second oldest core expression in the Highland Park range. Bottled at a lower strength than previous editions, it exudes notes of aromatic spices, dark chocolate orange and the characteristic fudge sweetness that one has come to expect from older Highland Park bottlings.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1956
Bot.2006 For Friends Edition No.2

Glenfarclas 1954
62 Year Old Pagoda Ruby Reserve (Gold Ed.)
product_description: A limited-edition 62-year-old single malt from Glenfarclas, released as part of its Pagoda Reserve Gold Series. Rich aromas of espresso coffee, dark chocolate, blackberry and gooseberry fill the nose, followed by cloves, nutmeg and candied orange. The palate offers notes of clove-studded oranges, sherries raisins, cinnamon and nutmeg that linger in the finish.

The new presentation of Arran Amarone cask finish, a sweet and fruity Island single malt that has been finished in Amarone whine casks. This resulted in notes of plums, cherries, cinnamon, liquorice and blackberries throughout the palate.

product_name:
Braes of Glenlivet 30 Year Old
Secret Speyside
product_description:
A sweet and fruity 30-year-old single malt from Braes of Glenlivet, matured in a single cask before being bottled in June 2019 as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of tropical mango and spicy root ginger fill the nose, accompanied by notes of juicy oranges, blackberry jam and marzipan throughout the palate.


Secret Speyside is a collection curated to showcase the lesser-known side of Speyside Scotch whisky – well-aged drams from distilleries which have, through choice or under-appreciation, continued to fly under the radar for so many years.

product_name:
Braes of Glenlivet 25 Year Old
Secret Speyside
product_description:
A sweet and fruity single malt from Braes of Glenlivet, matured for a quarter of a century in a single first fill barrel before being bottled in June 2019 as part of the Secret Speyside collection. Aromas of marmalade and ripe melon fill the nose, complemented by notes of creamy fudge, sweet coconut and juicy peaches on the palate.


Secret Speyside is a collection curated to showcase the lesser-known side of Speyside Scotch whisky – well-aged drams from distilleries which have, through choice or under-appreciation, continued to fly under the radar for so many years.

A creamy, fruity single malt from Caperdronich, matured in a single first-fill barrel for a quarter of a century before being bottled as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of blackcurrant jam, milk chocolate, pear and hazelnut fill the nose, complemented by notes of cinnamon and ripe blackcurrant on the palate.


Caperdonich distillery was dismantled in its entirety back in 2011, making it not only closed, but firmly lost. As part of the Secret Speyside series, no fewer than six individual bottlings of Caperdonich single malt whiskies are now available to buy.

product_name:
Caperdonich 21 Year Old Peated
Secret Speyside
product_description:
A fruity, smoky single malt from Caperdronich, matured in a single barrel for 21 years before being bottled as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of soft peat, bonfire ash and juicy oranges fill the nose, complemented by notes of herbal tea leaves, cool mint and wisps of peat smoke throughout the palate.


Caperdonich distillery was dismantled in its entirety back in 2011, making it not only closed, but firmly lost. As part of the Secret Speyside series, no fewer than six individual bottlings of Caperdonich single malt whiskies are now available to buy.
A tiny distillery in Perthshire is home to Edradour, one of Scotland's most endearingly different malts. Delicious honey notes complimented by an oily mouthfeel and a stylish finish.
A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 1984 vintage Tomatin aged in a single bourbon cask for more than 30 years. Cask 6207 yielded 207 bottles as a strength of 44.5%.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1970
31 Year Old Cask #1045 Adelphi

Glen Grant 1970
31 Year Old Cask #1036 Adelphi

Caol Ila 12 Year Old
Small Bottle
product_description: A quarter-bottle of Caol Ila 12yo, equally at home in golf bags, on winter walks or during wet weekends at the seaside.

A sweet and spicy liqueur from Stolen X, Rock & Rye is made with aged American rye whiskey, raw honey and orange peel. Try using this liqueur to make a spicy, citrus-forward cocktail or serve it on its own, over ice.

product_name:
Glenallachie 9 Year Old
Rye Cask Finish
product_description: A nine-year-old single malt from Glenallachie's Wood Finish series that was initially matured in American oak barrels before being re-racked and finished in Kentucky rye whiskey casks, adding a spicy edge to its character. Aromas of cinnamon, honey, treacle and orange peel fill the nose. The palate offers notes of stewed spices, honey-glazed pastries, butterscotch, treacle, orange zest and ginger.

product_name:
Highland Park 1972
27 Year Old Cask #1682 Adelphi

Highland Park 1972
24 Year Old Cask #1658 Adelphi

Glenfarclas 25 Year Old
Bot.1970s For Stately Occasion

Inchfad 2005
14 Year Old Cask Vatting C Dully
product_description: A 2005 Inchfad single malt from indie bottler C Dully, distilled at Loch Lomond distillery and matured in a trio of casks for 14 years. The palate is rich and oily, with notes of peat smoke and juicy fruit lingering into the finish.

product_name:
Macallan 12 Year Old
Sherry Cask Bot.1990s

product_description: The 2008 Winter Release Daftmill single malt was distilled between February and April 2008 and matured in first-fill ex-bourbon barrels before being bottled in 2020. Aromas of vanilla, cinnamon custard, peaches, beeswax and apricot jam fill the nose, complemented by notes of spicy oak, caramel, praline, banana and dried ginger throughout the palate. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

For peat lovers, Ardbeg 10 Year Old is probably the highest-quality 'entry-level' single malt on the market, and the distillery many Islay connoisseurs would choose as their favourite. A whirlwind of peat and complex malty flavours.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Aberlour 12 Year Old
Double Cask Matured
product_description:
Aberlour is always a good choice - one of the best value Speyside malts around. This double matured version is a mix of traditional oak and sherry casks and is rich and fruity with delicious Christmas cake notes.

Tasting Notes (1)

A well-balanced single pot still Irish whiskey, Redbreast 12 Year Old has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, creating a sweet-and-spicy character. The nose holds aromas of sweet fruit, toasted oak and warm spices, and the palate offers notes of buttery hot-cross-buns, dried fruits, baking spices and spicy oak.

Tasting Notes (4)

product_name:
Zuidam Millstone 2008
10 Year Old French Oak
product_description: A 10-year-old Dutch single malt from Millstone, made by Zuidam Distillers, that has been matured in French oak casks.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1974
31 Year Old Duncan Taylor

product_description: Distilled in 1956 and matured for almost two decades, this Highland Park single malt was bottled in 1974 and is presented in the distillery's historic dumpy bottle.

product_name:
Strathisla 1969
36 Year Old Sherry Cask The Cooper's Choice

Glen Grant 1967
Bot.2001 Berrys' Own Selection

Strathisla 1967
Bar Metro Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail

Linkwood 2007
12 Year Old Reserve Cask - Parcel No.2
product_description: A 2007 Linkwood single malt from Parcel No.2 of Elixir Distillers' Reserve Cask series, matured for 12 years in four hogsheads before being bottled in 2020. Aromas of tangy citrus and garden herbs mingle with lemon curd and black pepper on the nose. The palate offers notes of runny honey, raspberry leaf, Earl Grey tea and maple syrup.

product_name:
Glenburgie 1998
21 Year Old Single Malts of Scotland
product_description: A 1998 Glenburgie single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a single hogshead for more than two decades, before being bottled in December 2019 as part of its Single Malts of Scotland series.
A small bottle of Glenfiddich's 15 year old whisky - perfect for trying it out before deciding which Glenfiddich to buy at full size.

product_name:
Ledaig Rioja Cask Finish
Sinclair Series
product_description: The first release in Tobermory distillery's Sinclair Series, this smoky Ledaig single malt has been made with heavily-peated barley and finished in hand-selected Rioja casks. Aromas of Turkish Delight, candied orange peel, leather, black pepper and dark chocolate fill the nose, complemented by notes of almond, raspberries, vanilla, cinnamon and freshly cut grass on the palate over rich waves of savoury peat smoke.

product_name:
Highland Park 1966
Bot.1981 Berry Bros & Rudd

Miltonduff 2009
9 Year Old Artist Collective 3.5 LMDW
product_description: A 2009 Miltonduff single malt from French indie bottler La Maison du Whisky, matured in a first-fill bourbon barrel for nine years before being bottled as part of its Artist Collective series. Aromas of apples, pears, acacia honey, banana and passion fruit mingle with black pepper, chilli, rosemary and honeysuckle on the nose. The palate offers notes of mustard seeds, acacia honey, poached pears, cocoa, barley malt and savoury porridge.

Matured for 18 years in first-fill American oak casks, this Glen Moray single malt has a sweet, sophisticated character with aromas of caramelised apples, vanilla, toffee and toasted oak spice on the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon-baked apple, vanilla, raisins, toasted oak and baking spices that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Lagavulin 9 Year Old
Game of Thrones House Lannister
product_description:
One of the oldest, and richest, dynasties in the Seven Kingdoms, House Lannister will do anything to retain its power and influence over the Iron Throne. Their ferocious intent is aptly represented by the clawing lion of House Lannister’s banner which demonstrates that, if you cross them, you will hear the violent roar of House Lannister which has left many houses in ruins.


Lagavulin 9 Year Old is a roaring single malt that leaves an intensely smoky flavour in every sip. The golden liquid recalls the Lannisters’ riches and comes from being exclusively matured in first fill ex-Bourbon casks. The nose is characteristic of Lagavulin and bursts with sweet smoke, with a slightly zestier, maritime scent than other expressions. On the palate it opens with smoky, caramelised banana, burnt marshmallow and vanilla, fading into a salted caramel finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

Dalwhinnie 15yo is a good introduction to the delights of single malt whisky – elegant, smooth and medium-bodied, with a light, fruity palate and a whiff of heather on the finish. Part of Diageo's Classic Malt range.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Oban Bay Reserve
Game of Thrones Night's Watch
product_description:
The brothers of the Night’s Watch take an oath and pledge their lives to protect the Seven Kingdoms and guard them from the terrors that lie beyond the ancient barrier of ice, The Wall, from their base at Castle Black. There lies a frozen wasteland which, legend has it, is inhabited by giants, wildlings and the Night King and his army of White Walkers who bring with them the long night. Just like Castle Black, Oban Distillery sits at the foot of a steep cliff that overlooks the bay, the frontier between the West Highlands and the Islands of Scotland. The richness of the whisky is balanced with a woody, spicy dryness that would keep even the Night’s Watch warm in winter.


On the nose this Oban has aromas of hay and tangy savoury aromas, but calms into cocoa and Morello cherries. On the palate there are instant flavours of dark berry pie and liquorice. Toasted oak joins the fray, and citrus and cloves add a lighter touch. The finish brings back those cherries and dark fruits, alongside a hint of savoury.

product_name:
Balvenie 12 Year Old
Sweet Toast Of American Oak
product_description:
A creamy, sweet single malt, The Sweet Toast of American Oak is the first whisky in the Balvenie Stories collection. Finished in heavily-toasted virgin American oak casks from Kentucky, it is even fruitier than normal. Sweet, malty aromas of fudge, citrus and oaky vanilla mingle with spicy ginger and warm cinnamon on the nose. The palate initially offers notes of candied orange peel, vanilla toffee and butterscotch, developing slowly into flavours of melted brown sugar, blossom honey and rich oak spice.


The Balvenie Stories collection is designed to bring to life the tales of 'character, endeavour and craft' of those at Balvenie through the generations.
Distilled in 2009 at Teaninich distillery and matured in a single ex-bourbon hogshead for a decade, this Highland single malt was bottled in May 2019 by indie bottler Rest & Be Thankful.

product_name:
Macallan 18 Year Old Double Cask
2020 Release
product_description:
Made by blending 18-year-old whisky from European and American oak casks, both of which are seasoned with sherry, this is a warming, sweet single malt and the pinnacle of Macallan's Double Cask range.

Tasting Notes (1)

The 2005 Lagavulin Distillers Edition was bottled in 2020 after a decade and a half naturation. By far the most popular of the series, this double-matured Lagavulin has had a finishing period in sweet, sticky Pedro Ximénez sherry casks. A whisky that never disappoints.

product_name:
Blair Athol 12 Year Old
Flora & Fauna
product_description:
A great, but sadly neglected, Highlander, Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. This expression has always tended towards the chunky, sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.

Tasting Notes (1)
A 2009 Edradour single malt, matured in a single sherry cask for 12 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Natural Cask Strength series.

product_name: East London Liquor Co & Sonoma Distilling Co Blend Sample
product_description: A collaboration between East London Liqueur Co. and Sonoma Distilling Company's Adam Spiegel, this London Rye whisky has been matured in a variety of casks, including ex-peated whisky casks and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. Aromas of honey, brandy-soaked cherries, almond butter, hay and honeysuckle fill the nose. The palate offers notes of black pepper, dried apricots, candied cherries, coffee and porridge. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the ninth release of Kilchoman 100% Islay, released in 2019, has been made using barley grown on a single farm on Islay, and uses whisky that was distilled in 2007 and 2009. Sweet aromas of lemon meringue pie, apricots, juniper and wild herbs mingle on the nose, and the palate offers notes of vanilla, briny peat, dark maple syrup, lemon tarts and rich bonfire smoke.

product_name:
Glenfiddich Grand Cru Sample
23 Year Old
product_description: Matured in a small number of ex-sherry casks and American oak casks, Glenfiddich Grand Cru has been finished for four months in a combination of first-fill and second-fill French oak casks that have been used to ferment wine that will eventually become Champagne. The palate offers notes of creamy vanilla, brioche, pear sorbet and white grapes, complimented by aromas of freshly-baked bread, apple blossom and lemons. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

A massive success as the island representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malts' series, Talisker 10yo's profile keeps increasing as more fans discover its intense coastal spicy, peaty character. A truly elemental malt.

Tasting Notes (2) 

Always a benchmark. 90 points. Serge Valentin, whiskyfun.com

The Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series, Oban 14yo is a superb, full-blooded fruity malt with a whiff of heather and more than a hint of smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
23 Year Old Douglas Of Drumlanrig

product_description: A combination of Highland and Speyside malt whiskies, Angel's Nectar Original has a sweet character with aromas of vanilla, stewed apples and fruit syrup on the nose, and notes of heather honey, lemon and baking spice throughout the palate. The name is in reference to the ‘Angel’s Share’, an attempt to retain all the liquid lost to the heavens.

Arran 10yo is a medium-bodied, citrussy dram that shows an elegance and deftness of touch that belies the distillery's youth. Tasting the complexity and assurance of this youngster it is difficult to believe that the distillery only opened in 1995. A great achievement.

A 14-year-old Balvenie which finished its maturation in casks which had previously held Caribbean rum. Expect vanilla and toffee notes as the rum contributes extra sweetness to the flavours.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Macallan 1989
30 Year Old XOP The Black Series
product_description: A 1989 Macallan single malt, matured in a single refill hogshead for three decades before being bottled by Douglas Laing in October 2019, as part of its Xtra Old Particular The Black Series.

product_name:
Bruichladdich 1988
The Untouchable 30 Year Old Rare Cask Series
product_description: A 1988 Bruichladdich single malt, from the distillery's Rare Casks series, The Untouchable has been matured for three decades in a combination of refill bourbon casks and refill squat hogsheads. Floral aromas of dried hay, buttercups, primroses and coconut oil burst through the nose, followed by vanilla fudge, porridge with golden syrup, sweet citrus, sherbet, apricot and caramel. The palate initially offers notes of coconut, pink grapefruit, granola, malt and toast, slowly developing oak spice, pipe tobacco and fudge, with ripe pineapple, mango and mint building towards the finish.

One of the classic after-dinner malts, Balvenie Doublewood's extra complexity and richness are a result of a second maturation in fresh sherry casks. Great stuff.

Tasting Notes (3)

product_name: Laphroaig 10 Year Old Sherry Oak Finish
product_description:
A rich and smoky 10-year-old single malt from Laphroaig that has been finished in oloroso sherry casks, creating a rich, full-bodied character. Aromas of TCP, Manuka honey, clove, smoked bacon, leather and pine tar fill the nose, complemented by notes of treacle, wax, toffee, maple syrup, dark chocolate, pine needles, chestnut honey and rich peat smoke throughout the palate.

Tasting Notes (2)

The 18 year old has always been one of the best of Glenmorangie's core range and, in common with all Glenmo's offerings these days, it really looks the part. Picked up the top prize in its category at the World Whisky Awards 2010.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Balvenie 1962
56 Year Old DCS Compendium Chapter 5
product_description: A 1962 Balvenie single malt from Chapter 5 of the DCS Compendium, hand-selection by Malt Master David Stewart and representing the year that he started at William Grant & Sons. Bottled after more than five decades in a single European oak hogshead, this whisky has aromas of sweet dried fruit, apricots and delicate cinnamon spice. The palate is rich and velvety, with notes of toffee, honeycomb, vanilla, orange peel and ginger, that fade into a citrussy, spicy finish.

The fifth Chapter in Balvenie's DCS Compendium is a selection of casks that represent David Stewart's time in the industry and reflect his skill in choosing casks destined for greatness. These five single malts represent some of the milestone years throughout David's career, including a Fino sherry cask from 2001 and a 1962-vintage single malt.

Originally a limited edition to celebrate the distillery's 200th anniversary, Laphroaig 16 is now a small-batch occasional release. It takes the distinctive medicinal, seaside character of Laphroaig's spirit and gives it a few extra years to mellow out and calm down, creating a rich and smoky whisky with more complexity and an elegance that's not often seen elsewhere in the Laphroaig range – spicy peat smoke with well-worn leather and soft, sweet vanilla.

A very rare Ardbeg Double Barrel set, containing two single cask Ardbegs distilled in 1974 bottled at cask strength and packaged in hand-blown bottles with sterling silver labels.


The leather case made by Purdey and Sons includes an oaken Omas fountain pen , a leather-bound notebook to record tasting notes, and eight sterling silver cups. A whisky treasure chest!

A well-balanced whisky from Glenlossie, one of Speyside's hidden gems. This 1975-vintage dram was matured for 44 years before being bottled by Hunter Lang for the Old & Rare range. It's a fruity whisky, with tropical and ripe orchard fruit notes running through from the nose into the palate, before picking up a touch of nuttiness in the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Elgin 1975
44 Year Old Old & Rare
product_description:
A waxy, honeyed Glen Elgin, bottled by the team at Hunter Laing for the Old & Rare range. Distillery in 1975 and bottled at 44 years old, it's a long-aged whisky packed with old and elegant notes. However, despite the long time in cask, it still has a fresh and fruity core with a pinch of citrus zestiness.

Tasting Notes (1)

A gentle but complex whisky from Dufftown in the heart of Speyside – maybe the most important town in Scottish distilling. This 1975-vintage whisky was bottled at 44 years old by Hunter Laing for the Old & Rare range, and the years have allowed the spirit to become mellow and easy-drinking with loads of character. Orchard and citrus fruit are balanced by soft sweetness and lingering oaky spice – a dram to savour.

Tasting Notes (1)

A tropical-tinger, golden dram from Dailuaine, distilled in 1973 and bottled at an impressive 46 years old by Hunter Laing from the company's oldest stocks of whisky for the Old & Rare range. While Dailuaine is more often for its weighty character, this whisky shows off the fruitier and more tropical side of the distillery, with fresh fruit carefully balanced against riper and richer fruit, and oaky spice. Complex and layered with flavour, it never loses its well-aged elegance.

A surprisingly fresh and fruity Teaninich, aged for 43 years before bottling by Hunter Laing for the Old & Rare range. This 1975-vintage whisky has spent four decades developing fruity notes as well as a gentle, well-balanced background of chocolate and caramel. A complex dram that reveals layers with time in the glass.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Laphroaig 1998
20 Year Old Peaty Artist #9 SIG for LMDW
product_description: A 1998 Laphroaig from the ninth release of La Maison du Whisky's Artist series, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for two decades before being bottled in 2019. Heady aromas of hyacinth, ash, candied lemon, chocolate and acacia honey fill the nose, over hints of gooseberry and blackcurrant. The palate offers notes of black truffle, earthy peat, coal dust, sea salt, Havana cigars and grated ginger.

product_name:
Ballechin 2010
5 Year Old Peaty Artist #9 SIG for LMDW
product_description: A 2010 Ballechin single malt from French indie bottler La Maison du Whisky, matured in a single first-fill bourbon cask and bottled as part of the ninth-edition of its Artist series. Over a layer of rich peat smoke it has aromas of cut hay, mint, camphor, sea salt, coconut milk and vanilla on the nose, developing into rosemary, sage and soot. The palate offers notes of orange zest, vanilla, liquorice, aromatic peat, dark chocolate, pears and Mirabelle plums.

product_name:
Glen Grant 15 Year Old
Bot.1970s 100 Proof Gordon & Macphail

product_description:
Deliciously smooth, with rich dried fruits and sherry, balanced with woodsmoke and spice. Described by F Paul Pacult, the renowned international whisky writer, in his book Kindred Spirits as 'simply the best 12 Year Old single malt around'.

Tasting Notes (2)

Macallan 12 Year Old Double Cask has been aged in a combination of American oak and ex-sherry casks. This is a rich whisky which combines fruity citrus and caramel with spicy ginger and nutmeg.

Tasting Notes (1)
An old bottling of Knockando 12-year-old whisky, distilled in 1966 and bottled in 1979.
A 1960 vintage Highland Park single malt, matured for 17 years before being bottled in 1977 in the distillery's old dumpy bottle.

A legendary limited-edition Bowmore single malt, distilled in 1965 and matured in a single oloroso sherry cask for more than half a century, before being bottled at cask strength. Fragrant fruits, bees wax and dark chocolate fill the nose, alongside aromas of jasmine, raisins and apricots.

The third single malt to be released for Glenlivet's Winchester Collection, a series of 50-year-old single malts, this Speyside whisky has been matured for half a century in a single American oak cask. Aromas of apricot jam, ripe peaches and toasted almonds fill the nose, while the palate offers notes of creamy vanilla, orange, milk chocolate and delicate oak spice.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1983
14 Year Old The Cooper's Choice

product_description:
Port Charlotte's long-awaited 10 year old, rich and smoky whisky made by the independently minded folks at Bruichladdich distillery on Islay. PC, as it's known to its friends, is heavily peated to 40ppm, putting it up with Islay's other heavy hitters. The resulting whisky is big and peaty with a maritime tang – the Bruichladdich team would claim that it's because their warehouses are so close to the sea, we're still undecided. In the end, the most important thing is the taste: it's rather good.

Tasting Notes (1) 

Please note


Port Charlotte 10 Year Old has been crowned our Whisky of the Year 2021 - many thanks to everyone who voted!

The third in the Macallan Classic Cut series has been bottled at a slightly higher ABV of 52.9%. This sherry-matured whisky has aromas of orange zest, ginger, sultana and hazelnut, accompanied by flavours of gentle oak spice, orange zest and sweet ginger.

Made with barley smoked with cherry wood, mesquite wood and apple wood, this is a rich and oily American spirit with a distinctive smoky twang. Expect notes of apricot, apple, salty barbecue, toasted sugar and pastry, with a long savoury, smoky finish.


FEW is a craft distillery based near Evanston, Illinois.

The Islay representative in the 'Classic Malts' series is a deep, dry and exceptionally peaty bruiser. Probably the most pungent of all Islay malts, Lagavulin is not for the faint-hearted but inspires fanatical devotion in its many followers.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old
Cask Strength Batch 013 Bot.2021
product_description: A smoky, complex bourbon barrel matured whisky from Laphroaig, this is the 13th edition of the Islay distillery's ever-popular Cask Strength 10 Year Old single malt. Bottled in 2021, aromas of sweet biscuits, smoked cedar and Manuka honey mingle with pipe tobacco, old leather, candle wax and hints on vanilla on the nose. The palate offers notes of burnt oak, barbecued marshmallow, toffee, sea salt and Belgian caramel waffles, as well as roasted coffee beans, sticky toffee pudding and white pepper, wrapped in waves of peat smoke.

product_name: Kirker & Greer 16 Year Old Single Malt
product_description: A 16-year-old single malt whiskey from Belfast's Kirker & Greer, matured exclusively in first-fill ex-bourbon casks. Aromas of vanilla custard, banana, stewed apple, honey and vanilla fudge fill the nose. The palate offers notes of chocolate cake, vanilla cream, tropical fruit and caramelised apples, alongside a hint of dry oak spice.

product_name: Kirker & Greer 10 Year Old Single Grain
product_description: A 10-year-old single grain whiskey from Belfast's Kirker & Greer, matured in first-fill bourbon casks. Aromas of grassy oak, vanilla fudge, banana bread and runny honey fill the nose. The palate offers notes of toffee popcorn, caramelised banana, pineapple, cinnamon and creamy vanilla.

Matured in a combination of refill hogsheads and butts for three decades, this Dalwhinnie single malt is an elegant addition to Diageo's 2019 Special Releases. Aromas of raisins, leather, lemon and cinnamon-baked apples mingle with mint, grape jelly, honeysuckle, spring meadows and hay. The palate offers notes of summer flowers, vanilla toffee, delicate oak spice and slices of apple and pear, followed by zesty lemon, candied flowers, grystalised ginger and buttery shortbread biscuits.

Tasting Notes (4)

A 1979 Tamnavulin single malt, matured in a combination of first-fill sherry butts and bourbon barrels for 39 years, before being bottles for the distillery's Vintage Collection. Aromas of Mediterranean oranges, figs, almonds and freshly-baked ginger cake fill the nose. The palate offers tropical notes of pineapple, roasted coffee and Black Forest fruits.

product_name:
Glen Scotia Victoriana Cask Strength
Miniature
product_description: A miniature of Glen Scotia Victoriana, bottled at cask strength and finished in heavily-charred oak casks. Victoriana has notes of richly-spiced fruit, vanilla and oak throughout the palate, followed by a gently smoky finish.

product_name: Douglas Laing Remarkable Regional Malts 10 Year Old
product_description:
A 10-year-old blended malt from Douglas Laing, made with whiskies produced across all of Scotland, created to celebrate the indie bottler's 70th anniversary. Aromas of orange boiled sweets, liquorice, toast with honey and driftwood fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of butterscotch, peppery peat smoke, chocolate buttons and brown sugar.


The label features the characters from Douglas Laing's regional malts, including Big Peat, the Scallywag, the Timorous Beastie, the Epicurean, the Rock Oyster and the spider from the Gauldrons, and part of the tube it comes with twists so that you can make them swap heads.
A 2006 Glenlossie single malt from indie bottler Daily Dram, matured in a single cask for 12 years before being bottled in 2019, as part of its The Nectar of The Daily Drams series.

product_name:
Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1954
12 Year Old Bot.1966

Old Fettercairn 1967
