30 Year Old Crioch Aibhne

product_description: The 2019 release of Westland Garryana, a fruity, spicy American whiskey from Westland distillery, finished in Garryana oak casks. Aromas of honey, vanilla cream, milk chocolate, wood smoke, raspberry compote and nutmeg fill the nose, accompanied by notes of savoury rye bread, clove, summer flowers and dry oak throughout the palate.

product_name:
I W Harper Gold Medal
6 Year Old Bot.1960s
East London Liquor Co & Sonoma Distilling Co Blend
product_description: A collaboration between East London Liqueur Co. and Sonoma Distilling Company's Adam Spiegel, this London Rye whisky has been matured in a variety of casks, including ex-peated whisky casks and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. Aromas of honey, brandy-soaked cherries, almond butter, hay and honeysuckle fill the nose. The palate offers notes of black pepper, dried apricots, candied cherries, coffee and porridge.

product_name:
Laphroaig 15 Year Old
Bot. Late 1980s F & C Import (Cinzano)

Glenrothes 8 Year Old
Bot.1970s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A beautiful bottle of Glenrothes 8-year-old bottled in the 1970s by Gordon & Macphail

product_name:
Teaninich 2007
12 Year Old Single Malts of Scotland
product_description: A 2007 Teaninich single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a single refill butt for 12 years before being bottled in November 2019 as part of its Single Malts of Scotland series. Aromas of magnolia blossoms, dandelion, wild grains and buttermilk pancakes fill the nose. The palate offers notes of homemade vanilla custard, lime zest, green tea and orange.

product_name:
Very Old Fitzgerald 1950
12 Year Old Bot.1962

Teaninich 2007
11 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: This Highland single malt from Teaninich distillery was made in 2007 and matured in a single cask for 11 years, before being bottled in 2019 by Berry Bros & Rudd.

product_name:
Laphroaig 30 Year Old
The Ian Hunter Story
product_description: The 2019 release of Laphroaig's Ian Hunter series is a creamy, smooth 30-year-old single malt, filled with Laphroaig's characteristic peatiness. Matured exclusively in American white oak barrels, this Islay whisky celebrates the legacy of Ian Hunter, the last member of the Johnston family to own and manage Laphroaig distillery. Sweet aromas of manuka honey, light peat smoke, cooked apple, rosemary and vanilla mingle with lemon peel and orgeat on the nose. The palate offers notes of black pepper, garden herbs, cedar wood, kumquat, rich peat smoke and gorse flowers, before developing a sweet note of custard creams and vanilla pods.

product_name:
Loch Lomond 2002 Christie Kerr
Red Wine Finish
product_description: This 2002 Loch Lomond single malt has been matured in American oak casks before being finishing in French oak Pinot Noir casks from Kerr Cellars. A fruity, spicy whisky, the palate offers notes of green apple, kiwi, lime, ginger and red berries.

A limited-edition single malt from Tomatin, matured in a collection of 21 casks laid down over the past five decades, including casks that previously held Scotch whisky, bourbon and sherry, as well as re-charred French oak casks. Aromas of sweet pastry, wood shavings, cooked fruit and floral coconut fill the nose. The palate offers notes of Christmas cake, malt syrup, red berries, tropical fruits and wax.

The second whiskey in Egan's Legacy series, this Irish single malt has been matured in ex-bourbon casks, before being finished in Banyuls wine casks from the Catalan Pyrenees. Aromas of rich chocolate mingle with dried fruit and warm spices on the nose, and the palate offers notes of baked peaches, apricots, clotted cream and hints of cassis.
A limited-edition Yoichi single malt, released to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Miyagikyo Distillery, made with a combination of casks from across these five decades.
A limited-edition Japanese single malt released to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Miyagikyo Distillery, made with a combination of casks from across these five decades.

Matured for over three decades in American white oak bourbon barrels, this 1989 Rare Vintage Jura single malt has an exotic character with aromas of honeyed pears, freshly-baked bread, ripe bananas and vanilla cake. The palate offers notes of peaches in syrup, cinnamon, toffee apples and sweet white chocolate.

product_name:
Cragganmore 1966
Bot.1980s Cask Strength Gordon & MacPhail

Mortlach 1969
50 Year Old Private Collection Sherry Cask G&M
product_description: A 1969 Mortlach single malt from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail, matured for half a century in a first-fill sherry butt before being bottled in October 2019 as part of its Private Collection.
A 1988 Miltonduff single malt, matured in a single refill bourbon barrel for three decades, before being bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in June 2019, as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series.

A 31-year-old Karuizawa single malt, matured in a single sherry cask for more than three decades before being bottled by Elixir Distillers exclusively for The Whisky Exchange's Karuizawa Geishas series. The bottle features a label designed by our creative director Raj Chavda, paying homage to the exquisite, inaccessible beauty of the meiko on her way to become geisha.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 36-year-old Karuizawa single malt, matured in a single sherry cask for more than three decades before being bottled by Elixir Distillers exclusively for The Whisky Exchange's Karuizawa Geishas series. The bottle features a label designed by our creative director Raj Chavda, paying homage to the exquisite, inaccessible beauty of the meiko on her way to become geisha.

Tasting Notes (1)
A rich and fruity English single malt from Cotswolds distillery, matured in an ex-peated whisky quarter cask, creating a delicate smokiness throughout the palate.
A 2004 Glenburgie single malt that was bottled in 2019 as part of Gordon & MacPhail's Distillery Labels Collection.

The 2019 release in Amrut's series, Kadhambam means 'mixture' or 'combination', and this Amrut certainly lives up to its name: a vatting of normal and peated Amrut that started life in ex-oloroso casks before being transferred first into brandy casks, then into rum casks (both the rum and brandy having been produced at Amrut also). A curious mixture, but it works. This is a unique and thrilling whisky.

The cask-strength edition of Old Deer – the unpeated release from Switzerland's Langatun distillery. The high ABV has been tempered by the use of triple distillation. Matured in a combination of Chardonnay and sherry casks, this is a malty style of whisky.

A very rare single cask of Benromach 1973, limited to just 66 bottles. Bottled in 2019 having been matured in a refill hogshead, this has notes of exotic fruits with hints of ginger, dark chocolate and dried tobacco.

A limited-edition single malt from Brora, released in 2019 to celebrate the distillery's 200th anniversary, ahead of its reopening in 2020. Matured for 40 years in American oak hogsheads, this Highland single malt is rich and smoky, with aromas of treacle, ripe figs, raisins and peat smoke throughout the nose. The palate offers notes of rich fruit, dried figs, dates, white pepper and earthy peat smoke.

Yushan Signature Sherry Cask single malt has been made at Nantou distillery in Taiwan and is named after the highest mountain on the island. Delicate floral notes mingle with ripe apricot, orange, warm baking spices, sultanas and vanilla on the palate.

A tribute to the highest mountain in Taiwan, Yushan Signature is a single malt whisky from Nantou distillery that has been matured exclusively in ex-bourbon casks. The palate is delicate and sweet, with notes of creamy vanilla and white flowers.

product_name:
Arbikie Highland Rye 4 Year Old
Release 2
product_description: The second release of Scottish rye whisky from Arbikie distillery, distilled from a combination of Aranted Scottish rye, Viscount wheat and Odyssey malted barley, before being matured in a combination of charred American oak casks and ex-Armagnac barrels. The palate offers sweet notes of sticky dates, dried apricot and vegetal caraway.

A blended malt whisky from Douglas Laing, Rock Island 10 Year Old is a smoky, maritime blend that combines whiskies from Islay, Arran, Orkney and Jura. The palate offers notes of bonfire embers, gentle smoke, orange peel and waves of sea salt.

product_name:
Tormore 1988
30 Year Old Kreuzritter Jack Wiebers
product_description: A 30-year-old Tormore single malt, distilled in 1988 and matured in an ex-bourbon cask, before being bottled in 2018 as part of Jack Weibers' Kreuzritter series.
Made in 2005 at Glentauchers, this Speyside single malt has been matured in a single cask, before being bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in 2019, as part of its Distillery Labels series.

The 2019 bottling of Dalmore 40 Year Old single malt is a rich and fruity single malt. The palate is rich and full, notes of coffee, sultanas, dates, gingerbread and maple syrup mingling together before a finish full of blood orange and coconut notes.

Grain of Truth is a peated single grain whisky from Tweeddale, made with 50% peated grain before being matured in ex-bourbon barrels. Grassy aromas of green apples, light smoke, lemon and lime, icing sugar and spicy oak fill the nose. The palate offers notes of sweet-and-smoky barbeque sauce, summer fruits, chocolate and caramel, followed by red berries, rich smoke and soft ash.

A young, smoky single malt from Elixir Distillers' Elements of Islay series, Oc6 offers aromas of sea salt, iodine, lemon, maraschino cherries, caramel and ginger. The palate gives notes of rich peat smoke, cracked black pepper, grapefruit, marmalade and rye bread.
A Perfect Measure sample of Highland Park Thorfinn, part of the Warrior series for travel retail. Thorfinn is big, bold and complex with notes of ginger, smoke and vanilla.

A Prefect Measure sample Highland Park, bottled at a remarkable 40 years old. They've done a good job on the presentation, too - extremely heavy box with proper hinges and magnetic closure, with a leather-bound booklet inside extolling the virtues of distillery and dram.
A Perfect Measure sample bottle of Talisker 8 Year Old from the 1980s.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1978 Sample
29 Year Old 8th Release (2008)
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the eighth release of Diageo's Port Ellen single malts, distilled in 1978 and matured for 29 years.

product_name:
Highland Park 1977 Sample
21 Year Old Bicentenary
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 1977-vintage Highland Park, released at 21-years-old to celebrate the bicentenary of the distillery in 1998.

product_name:
Convalmore 1984 Sample
32 Year Old Special Releases 2017
product_description:
A Perfect Measure sample of subtle, sweet and spicy Speyside single malt from closed distillery Convalmore. Predominant notes are all from the bakery: buttery pastry cases, green fruits and a little citrus, followed by intense brown sugar sweetness and spice. A characterful and well-balanced example of this little-known distillery’s style, long-aged in refill American oak hogsheads.


Convalmore was opened in 1894 just outside Dufftown, and closed for the final time in 1985 – a year after this whisky was distilled.

product_name:
Brora 1970 Sample
32 Year Old Old & Rare Platinum
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 1970 vintage Brora bottled by Douglas Laing as part of their Platinum Selection series. Closed in 1983, Brora bottlings are much in demand, especially great ones like this.
The original release in Paul John's regular range, Brilliance is unpeated, showing of the distillery's classic creamy texture and fruity spirit.

Matured in American oak wine barrels that have been re-charred to create extra-fruity notes in the spirit, this is a single-cask whisky with notes of melon, mango, citrus, vanilla, oak spice and dates.

product_name:
Tomatin 36 Year Old
Batch No.5 Rare Casks
product_description: Batch five of Tomatin's 36 Year Old has been aged in a combination of ex-bourbon and first-fill ex-oloroso-sherry casks. This is malt-led with notes of cloves, cardamom and vanilla.

product_name:
Seven Seals
Sherry Wood Finish Cask Strength
product_description: This sweet, spicy Swiss single malt from Seven Seals has been finished in ex-sherry casks and bottled at cask strength. The palate offers notes of toffee, gingerbread, roasted almonds, cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger.

A spicy, sweet Swiss single malt from Seven Seals, finished in ex-sherry casks to create dense aromas of toffee, sticky gingerbread, roasted almonds, salted caramel an Christmas pudding. These flavours are echoed on the palate, alongside toffee chocolates and lively orange notes.

product_name:
Seven Seals
Peated Port Wood Finish
product_description: This peated Swiss single malt has been finished in ex-port wine casks, creating a smoky, fruity whisky. The palate offers notes of rich peat smoke, raisins, sweet honey and oriental spices.
This Swiss single malt has been finished in ex-port casks, creating a complex combination of flavours, including honey, roasted nuts, gingerbread, honey and a hint of peat smoke.

product_name:
Dumbarton 1964
55 Year Old Xtra Old Particular
product_description: A 1964 Dumbarton single grain whisky from indie bottler Douglas Laing, bottled in January 2020 as part of it Xtra Old Particular series, after more than half a century in a single refill hogshead. Aromas of heather honey, maple syrup, caramelised apples and oak spice fill the nose. The palate offers lively notes of oak spice, ginger, nutmeg and milk chocolate, with delicate notes of poached pears, pistachios and marmalade on toast that linger in the finish.
A 1972-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 33 years in cask 14821, this was one of 156 bottled on May 23 2006.
A 1971-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 33 years in cask 8935, this was one of 219 bottled on May 5 2005.

A 41-year-old single malt from Talisker's Bodega series, this is the oldest whisky ever released from the Isle of Skye. It has been finished in Manzanilla sherry casks from Delgado Zuleta, creating a rich, fruity character alongside the distillery's signature coastal flavours. Salty, spicy aromas of apple crumble, salted caramel, dried fruits and salty smoke fill the nose. Initially the palate offers notes of pepper, wood smoke, fudge, raisins and smouldering driftwood, before developing chilli, peat smoke and caramel that linger in the finish.

The first release in Midleton's Very Rare Silent Distillery Collection is a 45-year-old peated Irish single malt matured in a third-fill sherry cask for more than four decades. Made in 1974 at the old Midleton distillery, before it closed later that year. Refined aromas of fresh leather, old oak, nutmeg, grapefruit, boiled sweets and toffee pennies fill the nose. The palate offers notes of tropical fruit, cinnamon, nutmeg, salted caramel and black cherries. This bottle is presented in a hand-crafted box from Irish designer John Galvin using up to 200-year-old wood from ancient reclaimed whisky vats.

product_name:
I W Harper Gold Medal
Bot.1960s

Rock Island 21 Year Old
Gift Box
product_description: Rock Island is Douglas Laing's blended malt based on whiskies from the Islands, specifically Jura, Islay, Arran and Orkney. Rich with a smoky and maritime character.

product_name:
Glenury Royal 1953
50 Year Old Sherry Cask

product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of Westland American single malt whiskey, made with locally grown and malted barley, and matured in lightly-toasted virgin American white oak casks. Fruity aromas of red berries, apples and pears mingle with creamy vanilla and brown sugar on the nose. The palate offers notes of baking spices, ripe fruit, sweet malt, tobacco, dark chocolate, oak spice and stone fruits that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Dalmore 1965 Set With Glass & Miniature
35 Year Old
Wilderness Trail Bottled In Bond Single Barrel Bourbon
product_description: A single barrel bourbon from Wilderness Trail, made with a high wheat mash bill and matured in virgin oak casks for at least five years, before being bottled in bond. The palate offers notes of buttery popcorn, toffee, caramel, cinnamon French toast and a hint of salt.

product_name:
Longmorn 1972
39 Year Old Van Wees Sherry Cask G&M

Longmorn 1968
43 Year Old Van Wees Sherry Cask G&M

Longmorn 1966
44 Year Old Van Wees Sherry Cask G&M

Longmorn 1964
46 Year Old Van Wees Shery Cask G&M

Highland Park 26 Year Old
Soren Solker
product_description:
A limited-edition single malt from Highland Park, this 26-year-old single malt has been made in collaboration with Danish photographer Soren Solker. Matured in a combination of sherry-seasoned American oak and first-fill bourbon casks, it is a rich, fruity whisky with notes of creamy vanilla.


This single malt comes presented in a limited-edition black bottle, and comes with a book containing 160 pages of photographs and narrative by Soren Solker of Highland Park, capturing what sets it apart from other distilleries and charting his 26-year career in photography.

Made in 1966 at Longmorn distillery, this Speyside single malt has been matured in a first-fill sherry butt for more than half a century, before being bottled in March 2019 for Gordon & MacPhail's Private Collection.

Made in 1954 at Mortlach distillery, this Speyside single malt spent more than half a century maturing in a single first-fill sherry puncheon, before being bottled in March 2019 for Gordon & MacPhail's Private Collection.

product_name:
Dallas Dhu 1969
50 Year Old Private Collection Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: Made in 1969 at Dallas Dhu distillery, this Speyside single malt has been matured in a refill sherry hogshead for half a century, before being bottled in 2019 for Gordon & MacPhail's Private Collection.

Made in 2006 at Strathmill distillery, this Speyside single malt has been matured in a first-fill bourbon barrel for more than a decade, before being bottled in April 2019 for Gordon & MacPhail's Connoisseurs Choice series.

product_name:
Ardbeg 1967
29 Year Old Sherry Cask #922 Kingsbury's

product_description: Matured in a single ex-bourbon hogshead for quarter of a century, this Glenlossie single malt has been bottled by Valinch & Mallet in 2019, as part of its Lost Dram Collection.

A blended malt whisky from Scottish indie bottler Wemyss Malts, Blooming Gorse is a marriage of two Highland whiskies that have been matured in a combination of 15 first fill bourbon barrels and four first fill bourbon hogsheads. A sweet, floral whisky, the palate offers notes of coconut, creamy vanilla and gorse flowers.

product_name:
Wemyss Malts Flaming Feast
Family Collection
product_description: A blended malt whisky from Scottish indie bottler Wemyss Malts, Flaming Feast is a combination of two highland whiskies that have been matured in a selection of ex-bourbon barrels, as well as a pair of shaved-toasted-recharred hogsheads. Sweet and smoky, the palate offer notes of rich peat, bonfire smoke, honey, floral heather and caramel, with an undercurrent of sea salt and burning driftwood.

product_name: Ardbeg 15 Year Old & Laphroaig 10 Year Old

product_description: Made at Bruichladdich distillery, this Islay single malt was matured in a single refill American oak hogshead for more than a quarter of a century, before being bottled by Hunter Laing for the 2019 release of its Kinship Collection. Sweet and salty aromas of soft fruits, heather honey, driftwood and oak fill the nose. The palate offers notes of heather honey, malted barley, sweet juicy fruit and salty seaweed.

Part of the second wave of whiskies from Waterford, Bannow Island 1.2 is made using barley grown on the extreme southern coast of County Wexford by Ed Harpur. Aromas of pears, green apples, salted toffee, toasted barley and vanilla on the nose, as well as vanilla, white grapes and white pepper. The palate offers notes of apple crumble, cinnamon, toffee, lime zest and ginger, followed by butterscotch, white grapes and white pepper.

Made in 1992 at Ardbeg distillery, this Islay single malt was matured in a single refill hogshead for more than a quarter of a century, before being bottled by Hunter Laing for the 2019 release of its Kinship Collection. Salty sea breeze aromas fill the nose, alongside earthy peat and crispy seaweed. The palate offers notes of rich toffee, marzipan, burning heather, sea salt, black pepper and lemon.

Made at Bunnahabhain distillery, this Islay single malt spent three decades in a refill sherry butt and a refill American oak hogshead, before being bottled by Hunter Laing for the 2019-release of its Kinship Collection. Warm, fresh aromas of dried fruits, sea breeze and rich oak fill the nose. The palate offers notes of succulent flowers, creamy vanilla, dried fruits and sea salt.

Ballykilcavan Edition 1.2 from Waterford is made with 100% Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in County Laois. Distilled in 2016 and matured in a combination French and American oak casks for three months longer than Edition 1.1.

A Swiss single malt from Langatun distillery, matured in a combination of ex-sherry and ex-Chardonnay casks, creating an elegant, complex character with notes of apricot, sultanas, plums, prunes and oak throughout the palate.

product_name:
Macallan 25 Year Old
Sherry Oak 2019 Release
product_description: The 2019 release of Macallan 25 Year Old. This sublime spirit enjoys a cult following in some of the finest hotels and bars in the world where demand for the precious malt continually outstrips supply.

product_name: Michel Couvreur Special Vatting Peaty Malt
product_description: A French blended malt from Michel Couvreur, matured in Burgundy in ex-sherry casks. This Special Vatting is a heavily peated blend with bold sherry flavours.

A French blended malt from Michel Couvreur, matured in Burgundy using sherry-seasoned oak. Candid is a buttery, rich blend, with notes of creamy apple crumble, raisins, earthy peat and freshly-baked bread.

product_name:
Tomatin 2011
7 Year Old Jack Wiebers Messe Limburg 2019
product_description: A 2011 Tomatin single malt from indie bottler Jack Wiebers, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for seven years before being bottled.

product_name:
Glen Keith 1995
Jack Wiebers Old Paddle Steamer
product_description: A 1995 bourbon cask-matured Glen Keith single malt, bottled in 2019 as part of indie bottle Jack Wiebers' Old Paddle Steamer series.

product_name:
Zuidam Millstone 1996
23 Year Old Oloroso Cask #18
product_description: A well-aged expression of Millstone Special Dutch single malt from Zuidam, matured in a single oloroso sherry hogshead for 23 years, before being bottled in November 2019.
A 1989 Inchgower single malt from indie bottler Daily Dram, matured in a single cask for three decades before being bottled in 2019, as part of its The Nectar of The Daily Drams series.
A smoky, maritime 2008 Ledaig single malt from Belgian indie bottler The Nectar, bottled in 2019 as part of its The Nectar of the Daily Drams series.

Distilled in 1953 at Strathisla distillery, this Speyside single malt was matured in a single first-fill sherry butt for more than half a century before being bottled for Gordon & MacPhail's Private Collection in January 2019. Sweet aromas of dried fruit, rich sherry and oak fill the nose initially, before hints of candied fruit, orange oil, baking spies and menthol develop. The palate initially offers mature oak spice, developing into notes of autumn berries, crystalised ginger, dark chocolate and aniseed.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1957
61 Year Old Private Collection
product_description: Distilled in 1957 at Glen Grant distillery, this Speyside single malt lay in a single refill sherry hogshead for more than half a century before it was bottled for Gordon & MacPhail's Private Collection in January 2019. Rich aromas of fruit, woody spice, leather and salted caramel initially fill the nose, before hints of dark chocolate and subtle sherry develop. The palate offers notes of dried fruits, figs, warm spices and oak, developing into sweet fudge, fresh menthol, rich malt and bitter oak, before a long, nutty finish.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1965
54 Year Old Private Collection
product_description: Made at Glen Grant distillery in 1965, this Speyside single malt has been matured in a single sherry hogshead for 54 years, before being bottled in March 2019 by independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, as a part of its Private Collection.

product_name:
Glen Elgin 2008
10 Year Old Vintage Casks #19 Mossburn
product_description: Distilled in 2008 at Glen Elgin distillery, this 10-year-old Speyside single malt was bottled in December 2018 by indie bottler Mossburn, and is the 19th whisky in its Vintage Casks series. Matured in a single cask, it has a sweet and spicy character, with notes of black pepper, caramel and oak spice.

product_name:
Mannochmore 2008
10 Year Old Vintage Casks #16 Mossburn
product_description: Made at Mannochmore distillery in 2008, this Speyside single malt has been matured in a single cask for 10 years, before being bottled in December 2018 for indie bottler Mossburn's Vintage Casks series.

product_name:
Old Oscar Pepper 1911
6 Year Old Bot.1917
product_description:
This Old Oscar Pepper, is a piece of American whiskey history, distilled at the original Old Oscar Pepper Distillery in 1911 and bottled just a year before it closed in 1917.


The Distillery was rebuilt in 1935 and bought in 1940 by Brown-Forman, where it now produces Woodford Reserve

A 44 Year Old Bunnahabhain single malt from indie bottler Elixir Distillers, matured in a single cask for more than four decades before being bottled as part of its Director's Special range. Aromas of plum wine, caramel sauce, quince, marshmallows and gingerbread mingle with wildflowers and sweet tea on the nose. The palate offers notes of fresh peppermint, damp oak, tangerine, heather honey, mango and tobacco that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Pete'Series Blended Islay Malt
Asta Morris
product_description: An Islay blended malt from Asta Clark, Pete'Series is rich, smoky whisky that has been matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. On the palate notes of dried dates, figs, raisins, honey jam and dark chocolate are wrapped up in heavy, earthy peat smoke.
Made at Deanston distillery in 1999, this Highland single malt has been matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for 19 years, before being bottled in 2019 by independent bottler Asta Morris.

A three-year-old Californian single malt whiskey from St George Spirits, inspired by Japanese and Scotch whiskies. This whiskey is matured in a combination of ex-bourbon casks and French oak ex-wine casks, and is filtered through maple charcoal before being finished in ex-umeshu casks. The palate is sweet and dry, with a delicate background of smoke and fruit.

product_name:
Rock Island Sherry Limited Edition
Douglas Laing
product_description: A limited-edition Rock Island blended malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, that is a marriage of whiskies from Islay, Arran, Jura and Orkeny, and matured in specially-selected Spanish sherry casks. The result is an earthy, smoky and floral whisky with notes of heathery peat, salty driftwood and sweet sherried raisins.

product_name:
Bowmore 1967
40 Year Old Bourbon Cask #4538 Premier Range

product_description:
Distilled in 2011 and matured for over seven years in a trio of ex-bourbon barrels, Pl6 has a rich, meaty character with notes of smoke, warm spices and rich earth.

Tasting Notes (1)

This 22-year-old Glenrothes single malt was distilled in 1996 and matured in a pair of hogsheads, before being bottled in March 2019 for Signatory Vintage’s Cask Strength Collection. The palate offers notes of caramel, apricots and warm spices.

product_name:
Nikka Yoichi 1987
23 Year Old Cask #112814 LMDW

product_description: Try one of the inaugural releases from Waterford in Ireland, a distillery dedicated to showcasing the character that different farms and their terroir can give to whisky. Ballykilcavan farm is in the middle of a wood, with rich soil and protection for wind perfect for growing barley. The resulting whisky is punchy and sweet, run through with fruit and spicy grain.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1980
Bot.1996 Cask #89 589 17 Dun Eideann

Glen Garioch 1975
Bot.1990 The Birds Moon Import

product_description: This is an old 12-year-old Knockando distilled in 1965 and bottle in 1977.

This 20-year-old Laphroaig single malt was distilled in 1998 on Islay and matured in a single refill sherry butt for two decades, before being bottled in Signatory Vintage as a part of its 30th Anniversary series. The nose is initially smoky. quickly developing into dark chocolate, sea-salt and floral aromas. The palate offers notes of red fruits, peonies and rich spices, before a herbaceous, chocolatey finish studded with mango.

product_name:
Caol Ila 1983
35 Year Old Signatory 30th Anniversary
product_description: Part of Signatory Vintage's 30th Anniversary series, this Caol Ila 35 Year Old was distilled in 1983 and matured in a single hogshead before being bottled in 2018. The nose is full of ginger, black pepper and delicate, smoky aromas that build into fresh citrus. The palate is caught between fruity and peaty notes, balancing fresh citrus against savoury peat, with black pepper, fresh ginger and delicate pear developing into a long, gentle finish.

product_name:
Glenlivet 1954
27 Year Old Sherry Cask Cadenhead's

product_description: One of the oldest Irish single malt whiskies ever released, Teeling 37 Year Old is the latest release in Teeling's Vintage Reserve Collection and was bottled in May 2020 after 37 years in a single ex-bourbon cask.

product_name:
Karuizawa 1967
42 Year Old Cask #6426 TWE 10th Anniversary
product_description: Here it is - an unboxed bottle of the legendary Karuizawa 1967 42yo from cask 6426. The oldest and most famous Karuizawa ever bottled when it appeared at the tail-end of 2009, we only ever had around 200 bottles of this one, and after Whiskyfun and Whiskynotes both gave it humungous 95 point scores, it sold out in a little over 24 hours.

product_name:
Littlemill 1990
Bourbon Barrel Malts of Scotland

St Magdalene 1964
18 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice

Bowmore 1968
37 Year Old Cask #3823 Duncan Taylor
Westland American Oak Single Malt Sample
product_description:
American Oak is Seattle-based distillery Westland's flagship release. Made with barley from Washington, this is rich and creamy with notes of chocolate custard, almond and bananas. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.


Seattle distillery Westland uses locally sourced ingredients to create American single malt whiskies that honour the tradition of American whiskey-making with a Pacific North West twist.

Hand-bottled from two Spanish oak hogsheads, Highland Park 50 Year Old is a fruity, spicy Island single malt with a big character. Resting quietly in the distillery’s most northerly warehouse for five decades, this whisky has notes of sweet dried fruits, dark Muscovado sugar and black cherries mingling with spicy nutmeg, cedar wood and gentle peat smoke. This whisky is presented in a hand-crafted oak box and comes with a specially-designed crystal decanter, encased in polished silver-plated metal.

product_name: Milk & Honey Classic Single Malt Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of robust, spicy single malt from Israeli distillery Milk & Honey, matured in a combination of bourbon, virgin oak and shaved, toasted and recharred casks. Aromas of red apples, peach and nectarine are joined by oak spice, beeswax and honey on the nose. The palate offers notes of nutmeg, oak, cloves, honeyed orange peel and apple that linger on the finish.

product_name:
Milk & Honey Wine Cask Sample
Elements Series
product_description: Red wine casks from Israel's finest wineries were used to mature this fruity, floral Israeli single malt from Milk & Honey's Elements series. Aromas of dried fruits, ginger, oak and floral coconut fill the nose, complemented by notes of redcurrants, plums, vanilla, oak and soft summer blossoms throughout the palate. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name: Westland Sherry Wood Single Malt Sample
product_description: Westland's sherried expression takes its inspiration from Scotch, but has an American feel. Rich and sweet with notes of maple syrup, raisins, cookies and stewed yellow fruits. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name:
Longmorn 1961
57 Year Old Private Collection Cask #512 Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
One of the oldest Longmorn single malts ever released, this 1961 vintage whisky was matured in a first-fill American oak sherry hogshead. For 57 years this cask sat in the warehouse, side-by-side with its European oak twin, until both were discovered by twins Stuart and Richard Urqhuart of Gordon & MacPhail, who were instantly captivated by the two whiskies, created from the same spirit but matured in different casks. A study in the effect of wood on whisky, these twin casks were bottled in 2018.


This single malt initially offers aromas of vanilla, charred oak and red fruits, before notes of orange, maple syrup and marzipan develop. The palate offers notes of bitter orange, lemons and tropical fruits, balanced by dark chocolate notes. Sweet notes of bananas, kiwis and raisins give way to herbal notes and a hint of smoke, all wrapped up in heavy oak.

product_name:
Longmorn 1961
57 Year Old Private Collection Cask #508 Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
One of the oldest Longmorn single malts ever released, this 1961 vintage whisky was matured in a first-fill European oak sherry hogshead. For 57 years this cask sat in the warehouse, side-by-side with its American oak twin, until both were discovered by twins Stuart and Richard Urqhuart of Gordon & MacPhail, who were instantly captivated by the two whiskies, created from the same spirit but matured in different casks. A study in the effect of wood on whisky, these twin casks were bottled in 2018.


This single malt initially has aromas of raisins, marzipan, orange and dark chocolate, before a fresh note of mint builds and softens into vanilla, maple syrup and cherries. The palate offers notes of roasted coffee, dark chocolate and hazelnuts balanced by sweet marzipan. Zesty citrus notes develop alongside dried fruits, buttery caramel, black pepper and toasted oak notes. The finish is smooth and creamy, plenty of fruit notes mingling with mature oak.

product_name: Wemyss Malts The Hive Cask Strength Batch No 002
product_description: A limited-edition release from independent bottler Wemyss Malts, part of their Batch Strength series. This is a blend of single malts from across Scotland that were chosen for their sweet, fruity characters to create a complex dram with aromas of oranges, honey, cinnamon and custard. The palate offers notes of waxy honeycomb, zesty oranges and toasted oats with a floral edge, before a long finish full of burnt toffee.

Sheestown 1.1 is a single farm origin Irish whiskey from Waterford, made with barley grown just outside of the historic town of Kilkenny. Matured in a combination of French and American oak casks. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

The 2020 release of Westland Garryana, a fruity, spicy American whiskey from Westland distillery, finished in Garryana oak casks. Aromas of honey, vanilla cream, milk chocolate, wood smoke, raspberry compote and nutmeg fill the nose, accompanied by notes of savoury rye bread, clove, summer flowers and dry oak throughout the palate.

A Single Farm Origin single malt Irish whiskey from Waterford, Sheestown 1.2 is made exclusively with barley grown by Phillip O'Brien in Sheestown, Kilkenny. Softly spiced aromas of cinnamon, black pepper and cooked pears fill the nose, complemented by notes of malted barley, vanilla, apples and caraway throughout the palate.

The second edition of Mackmyra Svensk Rök – meaning Swedish smoke – is inspired by the Swedish tradition of seasoning and preserving food by infusing it with juniper smoke. Amerikansk Ek has been matured in virgin American oak casks, creating prominent notes of vanilla and wild herbs amongst rich peat, juniper and tar.

Some of the finest whisky that we have tasted, the single malt in this bottle is Macallan 1938 that is utterly amazing old whisky, very autumnal, typical pre war style with honey, heather, stewed fruit, dried fruits, citrus orange. Bottled in the mid 1980s this whisky has been aged for around 45 years.

The second release of Ballymorgan Single Farm Origin Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford is made exclusively with barley grown by Robert Milne in County Wexford. Fruity aromas of orange, mango and treacle fill the nose, complemented by notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and fresh malt on the palate.

product_name:
Canada Dry Bourbon 6 Year Old
Bot.1957
Double Eagle Very Rare 20 Year Old Bourbon

Very Old Fitzgerald 1962
8 Year Old Bot.1970

Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1954
12 Year Old Bot.1966

Very Old Fitzgerald 1953
8 Year Old Bot.1961

Glen Grant 1948
70 Year Old Private Collection Release 3
product_description: The oldest release from the famous Glen Grant distillery, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for its Private Collection series, is a stunning 70-year-old Speyside single malt that has been aged in a single, first-fill sherry butt. Initially sweet on the nose, it has aromas of vanilla fudge, strawberries and raspberries, developing into waxy notes of orange peel and cinnamon sticks. The palate is smooth and subtle; sherry-soaked fruits mix with fresh orange zest and cardamom. A dry, herbal element develops and brings cracked black pepper and aniseed notes, then a delicate smoke carries through to a long, smooth finish.

The first release of Lakefield Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford is part of its Single Farm Origin range. Made with barley harvested in 2016, Lakefield 1.1 was matured in a variety of casks for three and a half years before being bottled. The palate offers notes of apple crumble, stewed rhubarb and clove that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Blue Hanger 11th Release Sample
Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 11th edition of Berry Bros & Rudd's blended Scotch malt series, Blue Hanger, is of a similar style to the 9th – less sherried than the early releases and with a touch of peat. A combination of eight casks – four hogsheads, three butts and a puncheon, including both peated and unpeated Bunnahabhain in the mix.

product_name:
Glendronach 1955
Bot.1980s Crystal Decanter Gordon & MacPhail

Glenburgie 1998
20 Year Old Single Malts of Scotland
product_description:
Distilled at Glenburgie distillery in 1998, this Speyside single malt was matured in a single hogshead for 20 years, before being bottled in January 2019 for Elixir Distillers' Single Malts of Scotland range. A sweet and fruity whisky, it has aromas of cider apples, blossom honey and lemon sponge. The palate offers notes of cinnamon, biscuits and apricot jam.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 1995-vintage Glenrothes single malt was aged for 20 years, matured exclusively in American oak casks seasoned with oloroso sherry, before being bottled in 2016. Sweet aromas of strawberries and cream, black pepper, lemon meringue and apricot fill the nose. The palate offers notes of plum, orange, buttered corn and warm cinnamon.
This very rare 17-year-old Mosstowie – the second short lived single malt produced on Lomond stills at Miltonduff - was bottled exclusively for Italian importer Sestante in the 1980s.
A legendary dram. Springbank 21 year-old has a place in the heart of every malt-lover for its sherry-oak charm, velvety mouthfeel and quite bewildering complexity. A malt that approaches perfection.

A single cask whisky from Auchroisk, bottled by Signatory Vintage for the Cask Strength Collection. Distilled in 1990 and matured for 27 years in a refill sherry butt, this single malt has an intense aroma of dried fruit and toffee, with a lighter, herbal edge. The palate brings out notes of spicy pepper and fresh mint, alongside heady vanilla and rich, sweet berries.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
Bot.1970s For Visitors

product_description: The fourteenth batch of Amrut's Kadhambam was bottled in 2019. This is a combination of unpeated and peated Amrut that started life in ex-oloroso casks before being transferred first into brandy casks, then into rum casks (both the rum and brandy having been produced at Amrut also). A curious mixture, but it works. This is a unique and thrilling whisky.

product_name:
Reservoir Hardywood Gingerbread Stout
Mashup Series 2
product_description: A collaboration with Hardywood Park Craft Brewery, Reservoir’s Gingerbread Stout is distilled and aged in bourbon casks and allowed to mature and evolve. The resulting spirit is something new and different, with sweet and spicy flavours of honey and ginger, and just a hint of clove.
A floral, herbal Taiwanese single malt from Kavalan, Distillery Select No. 2 offers notes of vanilla, garden herbs, pineapple jam, grapefruit zest and heavy florals throughout the palate.
The oldest release from Edinburgh-based Crabbie, this 40-year-old single malt comes from a mystery Speyside distillery. It is packaged in an engraved crystal decanter and a red-lacquered wooden box.

A collaboration between Swedish distillery Mackmyra and jewellery dewsigner Evfa Attling, this whisky has been aged in a selection of oloroso sherry, bourbon and American oak casks, some of which previously held Swedish birch sap wine. The result is a fruity, spicy single malt with powerful aromas of spring flowers, red berries and ginger. The palate opens with intensely fruity notes, full of red berries, and toasted oak, before developing notes of cherry blossom, vanilla, tobacco and lingering white pepper spice. Presented in a stylish bottle, this whisky comes with a polished silver stopper designed by Evfa Attling specifically for her whisky.

An artisanal Swedish single malt whisky, Mack by Mackmyra is made using only Swedish ingredients. Fresh and flavourful, this whisky has elegant, fruity aromas of citrus and pear alongside sweet vanilla, mint and a spicy undercurrent. The palate brings notes of fresh pears, citrus and vanilla, and the finish is long and gentle, with notes of vanilla and spicy ginger.

A 2017 Castan-Villanova single malt French whisky from Version Francais that spent time in an ex-white wine cask. Aromas of sweet almonds, summer flowers and soft smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of old leather, grapefruit and dried flowers throughout the palate.
A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a light and creamy bourbon cask matured Yorkshire single malt from Filey Bay, Flagship offers notes of vanilla, peppery spice, apples, citrus zest and honey.

product_name:
Port Askaig 34 Years Old
Single Cask
product_description:
A 34-year-old single-cask Port Askaig single malt from Elixir Distillers. The nose has a sweet, briney character with notes of honey, sherbert lemons, candied fruits and sea-salt. The palate is smoky, sweet and waxy; notes of charcoal, peat smoke and oak mingle with sweet chocolate, barley sugars and salted caramel.

Tasting Notes (1)

Juveniles is the latest in a long line of excellent collaborations between whisky blender Compass Box and Paris wine bar Juveniles Bistrot à Vins. Whiskymaker John Glaser and Tim Johnston are long-time friends and this special whisky has been created to celebrate wine and friendship. Every Juveniles collaboration has featured a jester on the label, and this release has one of his bells in the punt of the bottle, ready to give a jingle every time you pour.


Working to Tim's brief of 'bright, smooth, not smoky...', John Glaser has pulled together whisky from Strathmill, Balmenach, Clynelish and Glendullan from refill hogsheads, re-charred hogsheads and both first-fill and refill sherry butts to create a zesty dram that balances crisp barley sugar and pear drop notes against rich vanilla and soft herbal notes.


Perfect for dinner – chilled or over ice as an aperitif, or with cheese as the evening continues.

product_name:
Bowmore 10 Year Old
Provident Mutual 150th Anniversary
product_description: A rare Bowmore ceramic decanter produced for Provident's 150th anniversary, in its original box.

product_name:
The Wee Star Sample Pack
3x20cl North Star Series 014
product_description: A trio of 20cl bottles from North Star Spirits, the Wee Stars set includes single malts from Blair Athol, Linkwood and Caol Ila distilleries.

product_name:
Cameronbridge 2006
14 Yeaar Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2006 Cameronbridge single grain whisky from independent bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured in a single cask for 14 years before being bottled in 2021.

product_name:
Irish Single Malt 1991
22 Year Old Nectar Of The Daily Drams
Seven Seals The Age of Scorpio
product_description: A limited-edition Swiss single malt from Seven Seals, released as part of its Zodiac series, Age of Scorpio is a fruity, nutty whisky with aromas of vanilla cream, toasted hazelnuts and dried fruit that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of sweet malt, oak spice, caramelised pecans, toasted almonds, vanilla, poached pears and cinnamon baked apples that linger in the finish.

product_name: West Cork Bog Oak Charred Cask
product_description: A triple distilled single malt Irish whiskey from West Cork Distillers, initially matured in ex-sherry casks and finished in charred bog oak casks. These casks are made using oak sourced from the local boglands of Glengarriff. Aromas of warm spice, leather and dried fruit fill the nose, complimented by notes of malt, cracked black pepper and baking spices throughout the palate.

product_name:
Strathisla 15 Year Old
Bot.1970s 100 Proof Gordon & MacPhail

Caol Ila 1968
50 Year Old Private Collection No.2 Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
The oldest Caol Ila ever bottled, a 50-year-old sherry-matured single malt released as part of Gordon & Macphail's Private Collection. Distilled in 1968 and only released from its single cask in 2018, this single malt leads with warming spice, followed by fruity flavours and gentle sherry. The finish is lingering, combining bonfire embers with lemon zest.


Only 199 decanters of this exceptional whisky are available worldwide.

product_name:
MacNair's 12 Year Old
Lum Reek Miniature
product_description: A miniature of small-batch blended malt whisky from indie bottler MacNair's, Lum Reek 12 Year Old is a peated blend that has been matured in a combination of red wine, Pedro Ximenez and ex-bourbon casks. Sweet peat smoke rolls off the nose in waves, accompanied by butterscotch and bittersweet mocha. The palate offers notes of heather, bog myrtle, butterscotch, toffee and sweet spices, wrapped in peat smoke.
Bottled in the 1970s, this whisky is most likely to be Macallan. One of the most special whiskies we have ever tasted, perfect sherry, very long and lingering. All you would expect from old Macallan.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
Bot.1970s For Visitors

product_description: A savoury, nutty 2010 Glann Ar Mor French single malt from La Maison Du Whisky's Version Francais series. Aromas of flaked almonds, iodine, sea salt and malt fill the nose and are echoed throughout the palate, alongside peppermint.

A fruity, malty 2018 Artesia French single malt from La Maison du Whisky's Version Français series, that has been matured in American oak casks. Aromas of pineapple, banana, green apples, summer flowers and wisps of smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of lemon pie, vanilla, coconut, mint, mango and sweet malt throughout the palate.

A limited-edition 2014 Armorik French single malt from La Maison du Whisky's Version Français series. Matured in a second-fill oloroso sherry cask, it offers aromas of damp ash, caramelised bananas, rubber, garden herbs, pineapple and toasted hazelnuts fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dried seaweed, pears, green apples, orange and smoke that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Bowmore 1968
33 Year Old Rare Reserve Cask #1431 Signatory

product_description: A snazzy bottling of 1987 vintage Glenmorangie with a fancy box and some time finishing in casks that previously held red wine from Margaux, a winegrowing region (and AOC) in Bordeaux, France. A must for collectors of Glenmorangie. MISSING PART OF THE BOX DRAWER.

product_name:
Hector Macbeth 1997
24 Year Old First Editions
product_description: A 1997 Hector Macbeth blended malt from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for 24 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its First Editions series. Aromas of vanilla, white chocolate, raspberries and freshly-baked pastries fill the nose, complemented by notes of brioche buns, red berries, vanilla, oak and caramel throughout the palate.

A deluxe version of Mackmyra Brukswhisky, DLX has been matured in a combination of bourbon, sherry and virgin Swedish oak casks. Aromas of sweet vanilla, caramel, honey, chocolate, warm toast, oak and tobacco leaves fill the nose, alongside hints of white pepper, pears, raisins and citrus. The palate offers notes of buttery vanilla, juicy pears, oranges, mixed herbs, anise, pepper, peat and juniper throughout the palate.

A 22-year-old Allt-a-Bhainne from Gordon & MacPhail's Connoisseurs Choice collection. Distilled in 1996 and bottled on 6 September 2018 from a single refill American-oak hogshead. It's a fruity dram, with a background of spongecake, hay and a touch of nuttiness.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 1996-vintage Glenrothes from Carn Mor, bottled as part of the Celebration of the Cask range. Distilled on 23 October 1996 and bottled from a single butt on 1 October 2018. It might be a from a butt, but sherry-cask character is controlled, letting Glenrothes fruit and spice out.

product_name:
St Magdalene 1964
18 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice
product_description: A bottle of 18-year-old St Magdalene single malt that was distilled at the fabled Lowland distillery in 1964, just under two decades before it was closed for good. This edition was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for their Connoisseurs Choice series.
A robust Dutch single malt from Millstone that has been matured in American oak casks, creating layers of vanilla, cinnamon, cloves and coconut throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 6 Year Old
John Grant Bot.1980s

product_description:
From Brittany's first whisky distillery, Warenghem, comes this sherry-aged single malt, which takes Armorik's fruity spirit and adds extra layers of sweet dried fruits and spices.


Warenghem released the first Breton single malt in 1998, calling it the Armorik to reflect the name that the Brittany region was given by its Roman occupiers.

In 2013, Grant's took the decision to introduce a range of Single Grain whiskies from their Girvan distillery in Ayrshire. The 30 year old was a hit at their masterclass at The Whisky Show that year and is rich with a spicy woodiness. This is the only bottling in the range to use a maize base, which was last used at Girvan in 1984.

product_name:
Springbank 1967
34 Year Old Old Malt Cask

Longmorn 1973
32 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & Macphail
product_description: A 1973 Longmorn by Gordon & Macphail. This single sherry butt was mautured for over 30 years and bottled under their "Cask Strength" serie.

product_name:
North Port Brechin 1981
36 Year Old Signatory 30th Anniversary
product_description: Astonishing single malt from a long-gone Highland distillery, this bottle of North Brechin 36 Years Old – bottled as part of Signatory Vintage's 30th anniversary series – has spent its life in a refill sherry butt, collecting subtle oak influence without losing its soul to the wood. A sublime dram.

A brilliantly buoyant Speyside from Mosstowie – the second single malt produced at Miltonduff until the early 1980s. A veritable rollercoaster of full-bodied vitality: beautifully-balanced light and dark as spicy, mature oak vies with the fresh fruit and deep malt notes at the core of this wonderful spirit.

Glencraig is particularly rare and an ideal candidate for Signatory Vintage's 30th Anniversary collection – a whisky made at Glenburgie distilled using Lomond stills. These hybrid stills, partway between a pot and a column, were only operation between 1958 and 1961, and the distillery's owners didn't release it for sale. This cask – a single bourbon barrel – is dense, with grassy and syrupy notes, as well as a core of sweet vanilla and fruit.

Craigduff is a whisky with a complex history, most of which has been uncovered by Signatory Vintage, which has bottled this very special cask in honour of its 30th birthday. Originally thought to have been made at Strathisla, Craigduff more likely to have come from Glen Keith. It was an experimental peated spirit, bringing together peated malt and heavily peated water to try an produce a smoky spirit in Speyside. It's never been officially released by Chivas and Signatory have only had a few casks, including this fruity and honeyed dram.

product_name:
Boondocks 8 Year Old Bourbon
Port Cask Finish
product_description: A bold 8-year-old bourbon from highly-rated Boondocks, this is a flavourful whiskey lent an impressive depth of character by its finishing in port pipes. Think rich, smooth bourbon flavour run through with oaky vanilla, a whiff of smoke and ribbons of red fruit. Complex and satisfying, it’s fantastic on its own or in a bourbon cocktail.

Bernheim Original is made by Heaven Hill and is the only straight wheat American whiskey available. A winner of the Gold 'Editor's Choice Award' from Whisky Magazine with a score of 17.75 out of 20 from Dave Broom & Michael Jackson, Bernheim is 51% winter wheat, 39% corn and 10% barley malt. A soft, mellow, fruity palate with gentle vanilla notes.

Tasting Notes (5)

Mellow Corn is a high-proof gold-coloured American corn whisky. As a corn whiskey, the mashbill is a minimum of 81% corn, with the remainder being a combination of malted barley and rye. A light, sweet whiskey, perfect for summer evenings.

A charcoal-mellowed single malt from a mystery Irish distillery, this is a very popular dram due to its smoothness and light, mellow palate.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Old Fettercairn 26 Year Old
Stillman's Dram

New Zealand 18 Year Old Double Wood Sample
TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A Perfect Measure sample of beautifully-complex blended whisky from closed distillery Willowbank in Dunedin, New Zealand – the world's southernmost distillery until its destruction in the late 1990s.


After an unconventional double maturation – a quartet of ex-bourbon barrels followed by a lengthy period in French oak New Zealand wine casks – this is a complex 18-year-old full of full-bodied, lingering dark fruit notes and woody spice. Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange.

Try this Glenury Highland single malt, bottled as part of the 2012 Diageo Special Releases with our Perfect Measure sample. Closed in 1985 and since demolished, this distillery is much missed and its whisky is hard to come by, and this 40-year-old is no exception. Aged in refill casks this Highland single malt has a bold, bright character, and a maturity only found after four decades in oak.

This limited-edition release of 1998 Laphroaig from The Kinship series was bottled by Hunter Laing for the 2018 Feis Ile to celebrate the completion of Ardnahoe distillery. Aged in two refill hogsheads and bottled at cask strength, this single malt has tobacco, citrus and peat smoke aromas. The palate opens with rolls of peat and liquorice, before developing into softer notes of pine needles, tobacco, sweet vanilla and lemon.

product_name:
Highland Park 1996
21 Year Old The Kinship
product_description: This limited-edition release of Highland Park from The Kinship series was bottled by Hunter Laing for the 2018 Feis Ile. Aged for 21 years and finished for six months in a sherry butt, this single malt has an elegant nose of ripe fruits and gentle floral notes of heather, alongside a salty, maritime edge. The palate opens with smoky peat and gentle fruits, including apricots and peaches, before a lingering, smoky finish with notes of sweet heather-honey.

product_name:
Spirit of Hven
Seven Stars No.6:2 Alcor
product_description:
The second half of Spirit of Hven's sixth instalment of its Seven Stars series - are you keeping up? Number six has been released as a pair as it pays tribute to the binary pair of stars Mizar and Alcor, which form a naked eye double in the handle of the Plough.


Like Mizar, some of this whisky has been aged in casks that formerly contained Chateau Margaux. This time, however, it is joined by whisky aged in oloroso sherry, Italian dessert wine and Spirit of Hven vodka barrels.

A rich and spicy whisky from Wolfburn, matured entirely in first-fill bourbon casks. It's named after the Norse longships that once dominated the Caithness coastline near the distillery – the distillery wanted to create a whisky that is just as sleek, smooth and purposeful as they were, and Langskip is the result.

Tasting Notes (1)
A 1972 vintage release from popular highland distillery, Glenmorangie. This single cask was bottled in January 1994 making it 21 years old.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
21 Year Old Bot.2003 Giuseppe Gambi
product_description: selected by Giuseppe Gambi of Ristorante Gloria from Marina di Ravenna on the occasion of 10th Anniversary of Societa dei Mandibolari,Ravenna. One of only 36 bottles.

product_name:
Highland Park 1978
20 Year Old La Reserve

product_description:
An introductory malt from Yamazaki, Japan's oldest distillery (founded in 1923). This is mild-mannered, clean, sweet malt, charming and very accessible - Speyside fans looking to try a Japanese malt should start here.

Tasting Notes (2)

A ten year old, elegantly peaty single malt from Nikka's beautiful Yoichi distillery in Hokkaido, where whisky is made as it used to be in Scotland with small direct-fired stills and matured in the finest wood the company can find. Bottled at 45% for extra oomph. On the face of it, this is expensive for a ten year old whisky, but it's well worth the money in quality terms.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Glendronach 12 Year Old
Sherry Cask Bot.1980s

product_description:
An exquisitely-packaged edition of Littlemill – the oldest, in fact, ever released from this lost distillery. This 40-year-old Celestial Edition has been bottled in celebration of the distillery owner Duncan Thomas, whose life's work was the creation of Littlemill's subtly floral, vanilla-led whisky.


The elegant presentation box that houses the hand-faceted Glencairn crystal decanter, alongside a miniature of the whisky and a commemorative booklet, depicts the configuration of the stars on the evening that the whisky was distilled.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Compass Box The Story of the Spaniard Miniature
product_description: A miniature of a 2018 addition to the Compass Box core range, this is a blend of Highland and Speyside whiskies, significant portions of which have been aged in sherry casks and - most notably - Spanish red wine casks. Predictably, this is a delectable dram full of dark fruit and berry flavours with a heavy dose of rich, woody spice.
The 8 year old entry in the Gaelic Whisky Company's Poit Dhubh range of blended malt. Peaty and full bodied with a perfumed edge.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old
Bot. Mid-1980s Litre

product_description: Old Perth The Original is a blended malt whisky from Perth, made exclusively with whisky matured in ex-sherry casks from a selection of Scotland's finest distilleries.
Born out of a happy accident when someone mistakenly poured some young Glen Moray into a vat of old Ardbeg, Serendipity is a lightly smoky blended malt. A rare find with a lovely story to tell.

The 2018 entry in Laphroaig's yearly limited edition series is one of the distillery's oldest releases yet – a 28-year-old whisky. It's a carefully selected mixture of casks, bringing together quarter casks, ex-bourbon barrels and oloroso sherry butts. It's picked up a reputation as being the best yet in the series, combining the distillery's medicinal smoke character with the fruitiness that many of its older bottles show.
A single cask whisky from Glencadam, this 1989 single malt has spent 28 years in a single ex-sherry cask before being bottled in January 2018. This bottle comes in a wooden presentation box.

An elegant, fruity limited-edition Indian single malt from Rampur, matured in American oak barrels and finished in a Pedro Ximenez sherry cask, to celebrate 75 years of distilling at Rampur. Rich aromas of toffee, creamy vanilla, dark berries, dried fruit, cinnamon and forest honey fill the nose. The palate offers notes of sultanas, toffee, Christmas pudding and burnt caramel.

product_name:
Caperdonich 1972
Bot.2011 Sherry Cask Connoisseurs Choice

Glen Grant 1956
54 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
This 54-year-old Glen Grant comes from Gordon & Macphail's immense reserves of whisky from a by-gone era.


This whisky comes from a single sherry cask distilled in 1956 and bottled in 2011

product_name:
Bowmore Vatting - Distiller of the Year
8 Year Old Bot.1995
product_description: An 8 year old whisky bottled in 1995 to celebrate Morrison-Bowmore winning the first ever IWSC Best Distiller award. It's a vatting of whiskies from Bowmore, Auchentoshan and Glen Garioch.

Founded by Robert Ransom (ex-Glenfarclas) this independent bottling from Highfern is a blend of Highland and Speyside malts. The name is in reference to the ‘Angel’s Share’, an attempt to retain all the liquid lost to the heavens.

Distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2018, producing 303 bottles using a bourbon hogshead, this is an independent bottling by Valinch & Mallet from Deanston distillery in the Highlands. It is the largest distillery owned by the Distell Group who also own Bunnahabhain and Tobermory.

Bottled by Elixir Distillers, this 38-year-old Karuizawa single malt is currently the oldest whisky in the prestigious Geisha series.
 

One half of the exquisite Pearl Geisha duo, this was aged in sherry cask no. 4348 and filled into just 172 bottles at 62.1% ABV.


The Geisha series was created to pay homage to both the exquisite whiskies of the closed Karuizawa distillery, and the majesty of its surrounding culture. As with the rest of the series, the Pearl Geisha labels were designed by The Whisky Exchange’s creative director Raj Chavda, who is also a fellow of the Royal Society of Art.
A four-year-old straight bourbon produced by Jim Beam at their distillery in Clermont, Kentucky. This young bourbon is versatile and can either be drunk neat, as part of a long drink or in cocktails.

product_name:
Brora 1981
30 Year Old Sherry Cask Chieftain's
product_description: This very rare Brora 1981 was matured for 30 years in a single Sherry butt and bottled at cask strength exclusively for the American liquor store chain Binny's, in 2011.

product_name:
Irish Single Malt 1989
29 Year Old Daily Dram
product_description: This Irish single malt whiskey was made in 1989 at a mystery distillery and bottled 29 years later by Belgian bottler The Nectar for its Daily Drams series in 2018. A sweet, malty whiskey it has notes of caramel, cinnamon and citrus throughout the palate.

A 19-year-old Deanston single malt bottled by The Nectar for its Daily Drams series. This 1999-vintage – bottled in 2018 – is typical of Deanston, with a malt-forward character supported by dried fruit and spice.
A mini bottle of Poit Dhubh 8 year old, Gaelic Whisky's blended malt. Medium sweet with a full body and long smoky finish.

Mossburn are cask experimenters, and this Island Blended Malt is a successful example of their excellent work. Initially blended from American oak barrels of whisky from the Scottish islands, the resulting whisky was then filled into ex-bourbon barrels with toasted, virgin European-oak cask heads (aka 'Mossburn Cask Bill #1'), adding an extra kick of spice.

An intriguing blended malt from Mossburn, bringing together a selection of whiskies across Speyside, blending them and then further maturing them in special 'Mossburn Cask Bill #2' casks. These are custom made Oloroso sherry butts fitted with heavily charred American oak heads, adding extra layers of American-oak vanilla and spice to the sherry-cask fruit.

product_name:
Compass Box Flaming Heart
2018 Edition Magnum
product_description: A magnum bottle of Compass Box's latest Flaming Heart release – a grassy and herbaceous dram with heaps of spicy oak influence and a powerfully thick, smoky core. Far from a one-trick pony, this is a warm, multidimensional and luxurious dram.

product_name:
Old Fitzgerald Around We Go Ceramic
6 Year Old Bot.1970s

product_description: A rich and multifaceted whisky aged primarily in ex-bourbon casks before a fairly lengthy finish in ex-Madeira casks sourced from family cooperages in Spain and Portugal. The finish has imbued Amrut's full-bodied spirit with sweet notes of honey and ripe, jammy orange rounded out by some oak-and-grapefruit bitterness and a touch of spice. A fantastic whisky bottled at a punchy 50% ABV.

product_name: Stauning Curious Peated Rye White Spirit
product_description: A peated white dog spirit from Danish distillers Stauning. Part of their Research Series – where Stauning experiment with new flavours and ideas – this is a tasty spirit, mezcal-like in its smokiness, created by peating their standard rye mashbill of 30% malted barley and 70% ground rye.

product_name:
Very Old Fitzgerald 1948
8 Year Old Bot.1956

product_description: A 19-year-old Highland Park single malt, bottled during the 1970s in the distillery's historic dumpy bottle.

From Amrut distillery, founded in 1948, just one year after Indian independence, this is a stormingly hot and spicy whisky, peated and bottled at a punchy cask strength of 62.8%.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Glen Grant 1951
62 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: This Glen Grant is a marriage of two sherry butts distilled in 1951 and bottled in November 2013 by Gordon & Macphail with the traditional old distillery label.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1948
65 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: This 1948 vintage Glen Grant single malt was bottled in 2014 by Gordon & MacPhail for its Rare Vintages series after maturing for 65 years.

An incredible set of whiskies from veteran indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail. Over more than a century, G&M have built up a selection of some of the world's finest whiskies, and this Strathisla collection demonstrates how deep their warehouses go. Six bottles distilled at Strathisla across three decades, and aged for between 41 and 59 years: 1954 bottled in 2013, 1957 bottled in 2013, 1960 bottled in 2014, 1963 bottled in 2011, 1964 bottled in 2013 and 1972 bottled in 2013. An incredible selection that showcases how well Strathisla ages.

A special edition Yamazaki from Suntory, aged in a 480-litre puncheon cask, which allows the whisky to mature much more slowly than the standard 230-litre hogshead. There's no age statement, but at 48% and unchillfiltered, it's likely to be pretty tasty.
Released in 1979

product_name:
Springbank 15 Year Old
New Born Da Mhile
product_description: Bottled to celebrate the birth of Da Mhile owner John’s first grandchild, this 15-year-old whisky was matured in a first-fill sherry cask. A wonderfully rich and nutty example of Campbeltown whisky.

A pure example of Springbank whisky. Distilled in 1992 and bottled at around seven years of age, this has been bottled without chill filtration or colouring and was produced using traditional floor-malted barley. It’s also certified organic.

product_name:
Tullibardine 1993
25 Year Old Xtra Old Particular
product_description:
An exceptional Tullibardine for the sweet-toothed whisky fan, this dram is a cornucopia of sweet biscuit, rich chocolate, caramel and candied fruit. Delightful dessert notes are curbed and rounded out by fresh-cut wood, earthy notes and a nutty freshness, making this a perfect post-meal whisky to be savoured in good company.

Tasting Notes (1)
A Highland Park single malt distilled in 1958 and matured for 17 years, before being bottled in 1975 in the distillery's historic dumpy bottle.

product_name:
Highland Park 1976
25 Year Old First Cask

product_description: Continuing the run of impressive cask strength bottlings, this edition from Amrut clocks in at a pokey 61.8% and promises their usual balance of spice and fruit.

product_name: Wemyss Malts Spice King 12 Year Old
product_description:
A spicy dram from the folks at Wemyss Malts, Spice King is a blended malt whisky with an emphasis on 12 year old island malt.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Highland Park 1986
Bot.2005 Cask 2498 For Beltramo's
Wemyss Malts Peat Chimney 8 Year Old
product_description:
A mini bottle of Wemyss Malts' 8 year old blended malt whisky, heavy on the Islay malt and full of smoky goodness. Wemyss name their whiskies after the dominant flavours, a novel idea.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenburgie 21 Year Old
Bot.2018 G&M Distillery Labels
product_description:
A long-aged dram from lesser-known Glenburgie, a big distillery with spirit that normally disappears into the Chivas Brothers blends. It's an important component and this release shows why: floral, fruity and complex, it's a pity we don't see more of it bottled as a single malt, especially after two decades of layering on complexity and flavour. Fortunately, Gordon & MacPhail have our backs.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Grant 1984
12 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory

product_description: A limited edition whisky from King Car's Kavalan distillery in Taiwan, part of their range which also includes the orchestrally inspired Solist series. The whisky was selected to show off the range of flavour that the distillery can produce and reflect the multi-armed nature of their parent company.

product_name:
Ardbeg 1975
29 Year Old Old & Rare Platinum
product_description: A 1975 vintage Ardbeg from independent bottlers Douglas Laing as part of their Platinum Selection series. Produced in the first year of Ardbeg importing large amounts of malted barley from the mainland, this is a slightly less peatier Ardbeg than one is used to.

Long-aged, elegant and very carefully selected, this single cask release from Fettercairn, launched in 2018 to celebrate the revitalisation of the distillery's on-going whisky range, is an impressive whisky. Matured for 50 years in an American white oak ex-bourbon cask and then finished for a few years in a tawny port pipe, this combines elegant old whisky with a fresh kick of berry fruit, all without becoming unbalanced.

Tasting Notes (1)

A very old whisky from Fettercairn, distilled on 23 December 1977 and laid down to mature for 40 years before bottling in 2018. It spent the final few years in Gonzales Byass Apostoles palo cortado sherry cask, adding layers of dark fruit, citrus and toffee to the elegantly fruity whisky. The result is a complex balance of fresh fruit and sherry cask character, with a touch of balsamic sweetness.

Tasting Notes (1)

Long-aged whisky from Fettercairn, distilled in a unique still that cools the neck with a constantly running cascade of water, helping to create a fruity and flavoursome spirit. This 28-year-old was matured in ex-bourbon casks and pairs the distillery's fruity character with darker, nuttier notes.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Jura 1988 Vintage Series
Tawny Port Finish
product_description: A sophisticated, cask-strength 30-year-old from Jura. Matured in ex-bourbon barrels and finished in casks which previously held tawny port, this whisky layers thick, jammy fruit and spice atop creamy vanilla and fresh citrus, resulting in all the intricate complexity you'd expect from a whisky of this age.

An interesting twist on Woodford Reserve's classic straight bourbon. The whiskey is first matured in new charred white oak barrels, as usual, but before bottling is transferred to special heavily toasted, lightly charred finishing barrel. This gives it quite a different flavour to normal, with lots of spicy oak coming through on the palate.

Tasting Notes (1)

An innovative malt from this Breton distillery. The whisky is aged first in Breton oak casks before being finished in sherry casks. This whisky has a real marine influence, which no doubt comes from the distillery's coastal location.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Grant 30 Year Old
Bot.1970s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A very rare Glen Grant 30-year-old released by independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail. Beautifully presented in a stencilled bottle, this malt was bottled sometimes in the 1970s, making it distilled in the 1940s.

Bottled in the 1960s, this whiskey surely contains a good proportion of bourbon distilled during the glorious Van Winkle ownership period. The expression is named 1849 after the year in which the W.L. Weller Company was established.

An old bottling of Copper Pot 8 Year Old blended malt whisky, a brand from George Morton of Dundee. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.


Please note


This bottle has a slightly damaged label, as shown in the photograph.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1983
14 Year Old The Cooper's Choice

product_description: This 1983 Karuizawa has spent its life in first-fill sherry casks and was bottled in 2014 for a private customer.

A miniature bottle of an 8 year old blended malt created in the 1960s and named in honour of Ben Nevis Distillery's founder 'Long' John McDonald, who still own the brand today. Bottled at a hefty 58%, it displays a spicy kick.

product_name:
Highland Park 20 Year Old
Rebus 20th Anniversary
product_description: Released in 2007, this 20-year-old Highland Park single malt was bottled to celebrate the 20th anniversary of author Ian Rankin’s Detective Rebus novels. The cask was specially selected by Rankin, and only 150 bottles were produced – all of which were presented to the author to distribute as he saw fit. The specially designed bottle is presented in a stylish wooden box, which is signed by Ian Rankin himself.

product_name:
Glen Grant 15 Year Old
Bot.1970s Peter Thomson

product_description: The 2018 release of Dalmore 40 Year Old was initially aged in white oak, ex-bourbon casks before being transferred into 30-year-old oloroso sherry casks. The palate is rich and full, notes of coffee, sultanas, dates, gingerbread and maple syrup mingling together before a finish full of blood orange and coconut notes.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 40 Year Old
Millennium Edition The Jolly Beggars
product_description: Packed with Glenfarclas's signature flavours - dried fruit, Christmas cake, rich sherry influence - this came out on top of the whole industry in a special competition between the distillers to pick the best malt for the Millennium. A tour de force in the classic Glenfarclas style.

Naarangi is an innovative release from India's Amrut. The name is Hindi for 'orange' and the whisky was aged in an ex-oloroso-sherry cask, which was then seasoned with wine and orange peel for three years. A three-year-old whisky was then finished in the cask for a further three years, producing a whisky with extra orangey notes.

product_name:
Caledonian 'The Cally' 1974
40 Year Old Special Releases
product_description:
Part of Diageo's Special Releases 2015. Aromas of toffee popcorn, grilled pineapple and honeycomb. Toasty and oaky, but not heavy.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Highland Park 8 Year Old
Bot.1980s Gordon & MacPhail

Isle Of Jura 33 Year Old
Sherry Cask Stillman's Dram

Port Ellen 1982
19 Year Old Sherry Cask Old Malt Cask

Port Ellen 1978
24 Year Old Old Malt Cask

Tullibardine 1993
24 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: Distilled in 1993, this Tullibardine whisky has been matured in a single cask for 24 years before being bottled by Berry Bros. & Rudd in 2017. This Highland single malt has rich notes of vanilla and honey alongside apricot and peach.

product_name:
Glen Esk 1983
30 Year Old 54.4% 70cl Statement No.11

Springbank 1967
40 Year Old + Mini Duncan Taylor

Knockando Extra Old Reserve
Glass Pack

product_description: Previewed at The Whisky Exchange Whisky Show 2015 as a Dream Dram, Karuizawa 1980 The Golden Samurai is one of the finest examples of sherry-cask-matured Japanese whisky we have ever tried. Bottled from a single cask, there are only a very limited number of bottles available.

product_name:
Glen Moray 2007
10 Year Old Single Malts of Scotland
product_description:
Glen Moray is an often overlooked distilery, and this independent bottling by Elixir Distillers for the Single Malts of Scotland shows why we need to pay more attention. It's a beautifully light and fruity dram, balancing vanilla and toffee notes from the single bourbon cask it was matured in against the distillery's orchard fruit.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Strathisla 1969
34 Year Old Sherry Cask Jack Weiber's

Method and Madness 28 Year Old
Ruby Port Cask
product_description:
An incredibly rare whiskey release as part of the Method and Madness range. This combines rich and spicy pot-still spirit with a dark and fruity port pipe to create an almost unique bottling. Matured initially for six years in American-oak barrels, the whiskey was reracked into a single port-seasoned cask for 22 more. It's taken a long time, but the result is worth the wait.

Tasting Notes (1) 

Please note


Due to the design of the box, some small scratches are visible.
A 1976-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 31 years in cask 6570, this was one of 231 bottled on March 27 2008.

The new name for The First Edition, Mackmyra Svensk Ek is aged partly in Swedish oak, from ancient trees planted on the island of Visingsö. These casks have imparted spicy herbal flavours, along with vanilla and toffee from the bourbon casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

The 2015 release of the William Larue Weller, the wheated expression in Buffalo Trace's highly regarded annual Antique Collection bottlings. The 2011 release came second in the running for World Whisky of the Year in Jim Murray's 2013 Bible.


Awarded Third Finest Whisky in the World in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2017.
An organic single malt from an undisclosed distillery. This was aged in casks which used to hold Sauternes dessert wine, before being released by independent bottler Highland Harvest.

product_name:
Parker's Heritage 8 Year Old Straight Malt
9th Edition
product_description: The ninth release in Parker's Heritage Collection is the first to be a straight malt whiskey , following on from 2014's wheated release. Made with a mashbill of 65% malted barley and 35% corn, this is a rarely seen style of Kentucky whiskey.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1949
40 Year Old Crystal Decanter Gordon & Macphail

Strathisla 1949
Bot.1980s Crystal Decanter Gordon & MacPhail

product_description:
A 2016 addition to Kavalan's core range, Sherry Oak uses the same casks that are normally reserved for the cask-strength Solist releases, but diluted to 46% using Kavalan spring water. Sweet and oily with notes of dried fruit, dark chocolate, pepper and raisins.

Tasting Notes (2)
