The third entry in the Emerald Isle range, and it's as impressive as the rest. A 24-year-old Irish single malt, with all the tropical fruit you could wish for in a whisky.

product_name:
Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1960
12 Year Old Bot.1972 Glass Pack

Chichibu On The Way
Bot.2015 Ichiro's Malt
product_description:
The 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way, a series charting the fledgling distillery's progress. This is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled at various times since they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest. Surprisingly complex for a young whisky, it shows the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Tamdhu Dalbeallie Dram
Sherry Cask 1st Edition

Highland Park 1966
37 Year Old Sherry Cask Duncan Taylor

product_description:
This single-grain whisky has been matured in ex-bourbon casks. It displays the light, floral character typical of grain whiskies with the added spice, toffee and vanilla notes from the bourbon barrels.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Very Xtra Old Fitzgerald 1959
10 Year Old Bot.1969 Glass Pack

product_description:
Westland's sherried expression takes its inspiration from Scotch, but has an American feel. Rich and sweet with notes of maple syrup, raisins, cookies and stewed yellow fruits.

Tasting Notes (1)

Introduced in 2016, Sherry Oak uses casks normally reserved for Kavalan’s cask-strength Solist releases, with the whisky brought down to 46% with Kavalan spring water. This is a sweet, oily dram with an uplifting note of dark chocolate, dried fruit, pepper and raisins.
A miniature of Douglas Laing's Big Peat blended malt. The composition includes whiskies from Ardbeg, Bowmore, Caol Ila and Port Ellen - big, peated and bottled at natural cask strength.

product_name:
Spirit of Hven Alioth
Seven Stars No.5
product_description: Alioth is the fifth release in Spirit of Hven's Seven Stars series, named after the starts of the Great Bear. This lightly peated release has notes of chocolate, raisins, plums, honey and citrus fruit.

This Western Australian single malt is made with local peat sourced from close of the Valley of the Kings natural park. Matured in bourbon casks, this has robust aromas of spices and flowers, while adding a splash of water unlocks notes of malted barley and powerful smoke.

A limited edition single malt from Paul John that was rated Best Asian Whisky by Jim Murray's 2018 Whisky Bible. Matured in American white oak casks for seven years, this is an enticing combination of honeyed fruits, with underlying layers of citrus spice and toasted oak.


Kanya is named after the Indian counterpart to the Zodiac sign Virgo. People born under Kanya are believed to be patient, precise and observant.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenfiddich 30 Year Old
Silver Stag Decanter

product_description:
An eight-year-old Highland single malt released to commemorate the forthcoming opening of the John Crabbie & Co. distillery in Edinburgh. Paying tribute to John Crabbie's flagship eight-year-old blend, which was created in the 19th century, this has tempting flavours of honeyed fruits, flowers and spices.


The John Crabbie & Co. distillery will open in summer 2018 in Leith, north of Edinburgh. The company's history with spirits goes back to 1801, when John's father Miller opened a shop in Edinburgh, and was principally concerned with bottling and shipping cordials and whiskies around the world.

product_name:
Zuidam Millstone 2006
10 Year Old American Oak
product_description: A 2006 vintage from the Netherland's Zuidam distillery under the Millstone brand. Distilled in May, it was aged in American oak for 11 years (despite being labelled as a 10 year old) before being bottled on 6 May 2017.

product_name: Compass Box The Story of the Spaniard
product_description: A 2018 addition to the Compass Box core range, this is a blend of Highland and Speyside whiskies, significant portions of which have been aged in sherry casks and - most notably - Spanish red wine casks. Predictably, this is a delectable dram full of dark fruit and berry flavours with a heavy dose of rich, woody spice.

product_name:
Kavalan Concertmaster
Port Finish Half Litre
product_description: A half-litre bottle of port-finished whisky from Taiwan's Kavalan, marrying their fruity young whisky with extra maturation in casks to create a balance of rich and fresh flavours.

An eleven-year-old whisky from Sweden's Mackmyra, Prestige is part of the Moment range, showcasing the distillery's most interesting casks as small batches. This was matured in French-oak casks that were previously used to hold wine from Champagne producer Phillipponat. The crisp fruit notes come through into the whisky, adding a tantalising freshness to the rich and herbal Mackmyra spirit.
A limited edition Japanese single malt from Chichibu, distilled in 2010 and matured in a single Mizunara oak hogshead, before being bottled in 2018 for Number One Drinks.

product_name:
St Magdalene 1964
24 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice

product_description: Italian independent bottlers have released this cask-strength 10-year-old Ledaig expression from the Tobermory distillery, aged in bourbon barrels.

product_name:
Very Old Fitzgerald 1942
8 Year Old Bot.1950

product_description: A 22-year-old bottling of single cask single malt from Glenburgie from Signatory Vintage, part of the Cask Strength Collection. It was distilled on 15 June 1995 and bottled from a single hogshead on 29 November 2017. Glenburgie is making a name for itself at the moment thanks to more youthful indie bottlings, but a well-aged example like this shows off the distillery's spirit's ability to hold up to ageing – complex and elegant.

A 1987-vintage single grain whisky from Caledonian distillery from Signatory Vintage. The distillery closed in 1988, but you can still its huge central chimney, towering over Edinburgh's Haymarket station. This was distilled on 24 March 1987 and bottled from a single hogshead on 7 May 2018 at cask strength.

A blended malt released as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2018 – only the second time a blended malt has made up part of the line up. Cladach means 'coastline' and the whisky runs with that theme, using only single malts made at coastal distilleries: Inchgower, Clynelish, Talisker, Oban, Caol Ila and Lagavulin. It's a dram that shouts about the seaside, balancing maritime character with soft smoke and fruit.

Tasting Notes (1)

Thomas H. Handy Sazerac is bottled straight from the barrel, at cask strength, and gets its name from the New Orleans bartender who first used rye whiskey in the Sazerac cocktail. It is full of rich flavours of toffee, fruit and bold spices, with an undercurrent of mint, clove and fruit cake.

A single-grain whisky from The Tweeddale, exploring an interesting and uncommon grain bill. Using a mixture of 50% malted barley and 50% wheat, this is a weightier spirit than most grains. It was first matured in bourbon casks and the extra complexity has allowed it to stand up to a nine-month finish in Oloroso sherry hogsheads, adding layers of fruit, spice and chocolate to the sweet and fruity spirit.

Tasting Notes (1)

Containing some of the first whisky distilled at Benromach when it reopened in 1998, this bottling celebrates the 20th anniversary of the distillery's rebirth under Gordon & MacPhail ownership. Lightly peated and aged in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, this combines notes of fruit cake, vanilla and gentle smoke.

This 1978-vintage Talisker is the first entry in the Bodega Series, a range of whiskies showcasing the distilleries connection with sherry houses and sherry casks since its 1830 founding. This inaugural entry is a marriage of five sherry butts, filled for about three months with 40-year-old Talisker. Before arriving in Scotland, the casks were part of a solera, maturing Delgado Zuleta's award-winning Quo Vadis amontillado sherry.


It's incredibly rare to see solera casks used to mature Scotch whisky, and even rarer for the ancient casks to have been used to create one of Spain's finest sherries. The result is a whisky that combines the elegance of well-aged Talisker with the fruity complexity of Quo Vadis. An impressive whisky.

Tasting Notes (2)

This elegant Swedish single malt has been aged in casks that previously held oloroso sherry, Jamaican rum, Barbadian rum and cherry wood casks, with around 75% of the whisky having been aged in the rum casks. The result is a whisky with a fiery, fruity character with notes of vanilla and tropical fruits, building slowly to notes of sweet sherry, toffee and red berries.
A 1978-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 30 years in cask 2705, this was one of 176 bottled on February 12 2009.

product_name: Wemyss Spice King Cask Strength Batch No 002
product_description: A limited-edition release from independent bottler Wemyss Malts, part of their Batch Strength series. A blend of single malts from across Scotland chosen for their spicy character, this was aged in Sherry hogsheads for additional notes sweet, peppery and woody spice notes. The nose is aromatic and spicy; notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, pipe tobaccos and sea-salt are balances by sweet caramel notes. The palate offers notes of demerara sugar, carrot cake and orange zest before cinnamon and pink peppercorn build into a long, sweet finish with plenty of caramel.

product_name:
Springbank 1966
34 Year Old Juul's 75 Private Bottling

Deanston 1999
19 Year Old Sherry Cask Daily Drams
product_description: A 19-year-old Deanston single malt bottled by The Nectar for its Daily Drams series. This 1999-vintage – bottled in 2018 – is very much a typical Deanston, with a malt-forward character bolstered by dried fruit and spice.

product_name:
Blair Athol 1988
29 Year Old Daily Drams
product_description: A Nectar of the Daily Drams bottling of Blair Athol, distilled in 1988 and bottled in 2018. Blair Athol is surprisingly well known, considering it's mainly a whisky that pops up as a key component of Bell's, but it's a favourite with whisky fans, and this 1988-vintage has an old fashioned charm, with herbal notes and a malt-forward palate.

This smooth, complex blended malt whisky from Lower East Side has a sweet balanced character, initially offering notes of vanilla and bitter almonds. Supple, fruity flavours build alongside sweet honey and a mild smoky element that builds into a smooth finish.

product_name:
Spirit of Hven
Seven Stars No.7 Alkaid
product_description: The seventh – and final – release in the Spirit of Hven Seven Stars series, Alkaid is an eight-year-old Swedish single malt whisky. Delicate aromas of toasted oak, orchard fruits, vanilla and milk chocolate fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of dark chocolate, dried figs, sweet summer flowers and green grass.

product_name:
Glenury 1968
33 Year Old Bot.2002 Old & Rare Platinum

Spirit of Hven
Seven Stars No.6:1 Mizar
product_description:
An organic single malt from Swedish distillery Spirit of Hven, Mizar is a marriage of peated and unpeated malt whiskies finished in barriques previously home to Chateau Margaux Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, rounding out a smoky, liquorice profile with woody, spicy notes and a tannic edge. Add a drop of water for a flourish of chocolate, malt and coffee flavours.

Tasting Notes (1)
Matured for at least eight years in ex-bourbon barrels, this single grain Irish whiskey from Egan's has a smooth, sweet character. The palate offers notes of vanilla, oak, fudge and a hint of spice.
A very rare 18-year-old Springbank decanter bottled in 1986 to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Fauchon: Famous French gourmet and luxury food company.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1978
Bot.1993 Cask #2694-2695 Gordon & MacPhail

product_description:
A third entry in the Diageo Special Releases for Pittyvaich. It's a rare whisky to see as the distillery was closed in 1993 and very few casks have made it out into the wild. Fortunately, Diageo have dropped another 1989-vintage edition in the Special Releases, giving us a chance to try the distillery's idiosyncratic style. It was matured in refill American-oak hogsheads and the gentle wood influence has revealed a core of fruity spirit.

Tasting Notes (1)

Hav – meaning 'sea' in Swedish – is a spicy, fruity Swedish single malt, with a delicate smokiness throughout, made with 25% peated whisky and 75% unpeated. Part of High Coast's Origins series, Hav explores the effects of different types of oak on new make spirit and has been matured in a combination of small, 40-litre virgin American oak, Hungarian oak and Swedish oak casks for at least three months, before spending a further six years in first-fill bourbon barrels.


Hav has soft aromas of delicate peat smoke, wrapped in warm spices and sweet caramel, while the palate offers notes of black pepper, fiery ginger, star anise, coriander seed and red chilli, balanced by smoky bacon and hints of sweet summer fruits.

product_name:
Glenlivet 15 Year Old
Bot.1950s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: One of the oldest known bottling's from Gordon & Macphail to have surfaced. This was bottled as a 15 year old in the 1950s at 80 proof (46%). This whisky would have been most likely distilled in 1930s, and, as the label states, matured exclusively in Sherry casks.

A vintage revived from the Glenrothes archives, a second release of 1995 whisky. The first release appeared in 2011 and some of the casks were held back for further maturation. Five years later they were pulled out of the warehouse for public showing. With five extra years, the whisky shows increased depth and intensity, showing off the titular American oak.

The 2nd release of 1988-vintage Glenrothes, a follow-up to the acclaimed 2009 edition. John Ramsay, the malt master when the previous edition was released, thought that a few more years in cask would add even more to the whisky, so part of the vintage was held back for a further seven years in cask. The new malt master, Gordon Motion, selected first-fill American Sherry hogsheads and refill sherry butts and vatted them to create this rich and fruity whisky, bottled at 44.1% ABV.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Berry Bros & Rudd Peated Cask Blended Malt
product_description:
A softly peated dram from Berry Bros and Rudd, harking back to the days when every whisky was peated. The peat here is a deliberate choice and carefully controlled to give a balanced dram, focusing on sweet fruit and gentle smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Avonside (Glenlivet) 1938
35 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail

product_description: Älv – meaning 'river' in Swedish – is creamy, vanilla-forward Swedish single malt from High Coast distillery's Origins series. Matured in a combination of first-fill bourbon barrels and ex-bourbon quarter casks, Älv has sweet, fruity aromas of vanilla, apples, peaches and grapes. The palate offers notes of sharp citrus, spicy ginger, red berries and sweet, malty vanilla.

product_name:
Wemyss Malts Nectar Grove
Family Collection
product_description: This jauntily-packaged blended malt whisky from Wemyss Malts is a riot of fruit and honey notes, perfect for those that like their dram on the sweeter side. This limited-edition blend has been finished in casks that previously held Maderia wine, and is independent bottler Wemyss' first foray into whisky finishing.

product_name:
Linkwood 1956
60 Year Old Private Collection Ultra Sherry Cask G&M
product_description: Part of Goldon & MacPhail's Private Collection Ultra series this 1956 Linkwood has been matured in a single first fill sherry hogshead for six decades, before being bottled in June 2016. Rich, sweet aromas of baked apple, raisins, sultanas, crème anglaise and toffee sauce over fruitcake fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dark wild honey, apple strudel, fruitcake and dark chocolate orange tart that linger in the finish, alongside oak spice and a touch of candle wax.
A 1967-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 32 years in cask 9908, this was one of 120 bottled on October 4 1999.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 12 Year Old
Bot.1974 Fina Club

product_description: A miniature bottle of Paul John Bold, made entirely with Indian barley smoked using Islay peat to around 25ppm. A superb alternative to classic peated Scotch whisky.

Inspired by the allusive Swedish winter sun, Mackmyra Vintersol has been made in collaboration with Port producer Quinta Do Valado, one of the oldest producers in the Douro Valley. Matured in a combination of bourbon barrels, Swedish oak casks and oloroso sherry casks, this Swedish single malt has been finished in Port pipes, creating a rich, warm character.

product_name:
Avonside (Glenlivet) 1938
33 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail

Kavalan 2011 Rum Cask
7 Year Old TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A single-cask release from Kavalan chosen by and bottled exclusively for us at The Whisky Exchange in celebration of our twentieth anniversary – online since 1999. This was matured in a rum cask for seven years, enough time to add layers of rummy fruit and sweetness to Kavalan's already excellently fruity spirit. A masterclass in balancing fruit, spirit and wood.

Tasting Notes (1)

Made with corn, rye and malted barley, this unaged corn spirit is made with spring water from Virginia’s famous Blue Ridge mountains. Expect sweet, soft aromas of corn, toasted nuts and spice, followed by a silky palate of cinnamon, almonds and pecans.

Bottled by the Limestone Branch Distillery, this rye whiskey is named after the founders' ancestor: Minor Case Beam. Part of the famous bourbon-making Beam family, Minor Case worked as a distiller until 1920, when prohibition forced him to cease, and died less than a year after the ban on his life's passion was lifted.


This is a two-year-old rye whiskey which has been finished in sherry casks for six months. It has notes of fruit sweets, warm spices and oak.

This 15-year-old Tyrconnell Irish single malt whiskey has been finished in ex-Madeira casks, creating a fruity, spicy character with aromas of white grapes, peaches, toast with honey, waffles, Nutella and sweet pastries on the nose. The palate offers notes of ripe stone fruits, milky coffee, caramel, honey and warm toast, with red apple and raisins lingering in the finish.

A 2019 release of Cotswolds Distillery’s Founder’s Choice single malt has been matured exclusively in shaved, toasted and recharred Americal oak red wine barriques. A rich, fruity whisky, it has notes of butterscotch, raspberries and red apples, before rich oak spices build into a lingering, nutty finish.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
21 Year Old Sherry Cask Old Malt Cask

New Riff Kentucky Straight Rye
Bottled In Bond
product_description: A fresh, spicy rye whiskey from New Riff, made with 95% rye and 5% malted rye and aged in virgin American oak casks for four years before being bottled. Fresh aromas of mint, black pepper and orange mingle with hints of vanilla and oak on the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon, vanilla, toffee and caramel over a backdrop of green rye spice and toasted oak.

product_name:
New Riff Kentucky Straight Rye Sample
Bottled In Bond
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of fresh, spicy rye whiskey from New Riff, made with 95% rye and 5% malted rye and aged in virgin American oak casks for four years before being bottled. Fresh aromas of mint, black pepper and orange mingle with hints of vanilla and oak on the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon, vanilla, toffee and caramel over a backdrop of green rye spice and toasted oak.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2019 release of Westland Garryana, a fruity, spicy American whiskey from Westland distillery, finished in Garryana oak casks. Aromas of honey, vanilla cream, milk chocolate, wood smoke, raspberry compote and nutmeg fill the nose, accompanied by notes of savoury rye bread, clove, summer flowers and dry oak throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glen Grant 25 Year Old
Bot.1970s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A lovely old stencil-labelled bottle of Glen Grant 25-year-old, released by Gordon & Macphail in the 1970s.

product_name: Wilderness Trail Bottled In Bond Small Batch Bourbon
product_description: A small batch bourbon from Wilderness Trail, made with a combination of up to 12 barrels. The palate offers notes of vanilla, black pepper and caramel.

Distilled in 2016, this single malt whisky from Yorkshire's Filey Bay has been matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in ex-Moscatel hogsheads, before being bottled in 2020. The palate is fruity and spicy, with notes of honeycomb, marmalade, dried fruits and cocoa.

product_name: Paul John Pedro Ximenez Select Cask
product_description: An exotic Indian single malt from Paul John, finished in Pedro Ximinez sherry casks, creating layers of apricots, figs and banana throughout the palate.

product_name:
Highland Park 1972
24 Year Old Cask #1657 Adelphi

product_description:
An old grain whisky from closed Carsebridge, matured for more than 30 years and bottled by La Maison du Whisky as part of the impressive 7th release of whiskies in the Artist range. This was distilled in 1982, the year before it closed, and spent it's life bottling bottling in a single hogshead. It is the first single grain bottled for the Artist range, and displays all the elegance and poise you'd expect from a whisky afforded such an honour.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Blended Malt 2009
9 Year Old Single Cask Nation
product_description: A 2009 blended malt whisky from indie bottler Single Cask Nation, matured in a single first-fill sherry butt before being bottled in May 2019. Aromas of juicy tropical fruits, cinnamon-baked apples and warm toast fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, salted almonds, roasted walnuts, aniseed and tart plums.

Triparva is a limited-edition Indian single malt from Amrut, Triparva is a triple-distilled single malt that has aromas of salted caramel, coconut, vanilla, peach and sweet orange on the nose. The palate offers notes of vanilla custard, peach, melons, cream, orange and honey.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1949
64 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: This 1949 vintage Glen Grant Speyside single malt was bottled in 2014 by Gordon & MacPhail for its Rare Vintages series after maturing for 65 years.

product_name:
Milk & Honey Red Wine Cask
Elements Series
product_description: Red wine casks from Israel's finest wineries were used to mature this fruity, floral Israeli single malt from Milk & Honey's Elements series. Aromas of dried fruits, ginger, oak and floral coconut fill the nose, complemented by notes of redcurrants, plums, vanilla, oak and soft summer blossoms throughout the palate.
An old bottle of Mortlach distilled in 1936 and bottled in the early 1970s by Gordon & Macphail for the Italian market under the original black Connoisseurs Choice label at 35 years of age.

product_name:
Cragganmore 1966
Bot.1980s Cask Strength Gordon & MacPhail

Milk & Honey Peated Cask
Elements Series
product_description: An Israeli whisky from Milk & Honey Distillery's Elements series that has been matured in ex-peated whisky casks from Islay, as well as ex-bourbon casks. Fresh aromas of lemon, vanilla, oak and smoke fill the nose, the palate offers notes of ginger, lemon, vanilla and savoury peat that linger in the finish.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a fruity, refined Australian single malt from Starward distillery, matured exclusively in Australian red wine barrels. It has notes of fresh grape, black cherries and caramel throughout the palate.

product_name:
Milk & Honey Peated Cask Sample
Elements Series
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of an Israeli whisky from Milk & Honey Distillery's Elements series that has been matured in ex-peated whisky casks from Islay, as well as ex-bourbon casks. Fresh aromas of lemon, vanilla, oak and smoke fill the nose, the palate offers notes of ginger, lemon, vanilla and savoury peat that linger in the finish.
A punchier version of Southern Comfort's liqueur, amplifying the whiskey elements. It's as versatile as the original and can be mixed in cocktails or drunk neat over ice.

product_name:
Karuizawa 35 Year Old
Bourbon Cask 8518 Emerald Geisha
product_description:
Karuizawa's whiskies are legendary. Not only are they of sublime quality, but the distillery's closure almost 20 years ago means that they are rarer than emeralds. This exclusive single-cask bottling of 35-year-old single malt, created by Elixir Distillers, layers vanilla and spiced butter around the Karuizawa core.


The distinctive emerald labels combine beautiful Japanese art forms with complex hot foil and intricate embossing embellishments, giving the bottles a sculptured finish. They were designed by The Whisky Exchange’s creative director Raj Chavda, who is also a fellow of the Royal Society of Art.

Tasting Notes (1)

Westland's peated malt is made with a proportion of very heavily peated whisky combined with unpeated, aged in American oak. An excellent balance between smoke and fruit, with notes of earth, green herbs and roasted nuts. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

A peated Danish whisky from Stauning, made with barley malted using local peat and heather, creating a floral, smoky character. Aromas of summer bonfires, honey and orange fill the nose, complemented by notes of tobacco, roast hazelnuts, vanilla and garden herbs throughout the palate.

A classic late-1980s Bowmore, with floral notes mixed in with peat smoke and flashes of citrus fruit. Bottled by the distillery at 16 years old, this is a great example of the style of whisky that the distillery was producing at the time.

A sweet and smoky Swedish whisky from Mackmyra's Moment series, Körsbärsrök is made with a combination of peated and un-peated whisky from Mackmyra Bruk distillery. The peated whisky has been matured in ex-bourbon casks, while the un-peated whisky was matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and German cherry wine-seasoned casks. Aromas of smoke, tar, juniper, vanilla and cherry fill the nose, complemented by notes of juniper, pears, fudge and thick bonfire smoke throughout the palate.

product_name:
WhistlePig Boss Hog VII
Magellans Atlantic
product_description: The 7th Boss Hog edition is aged 17 years in American oak then finished for three weeks in new Spanish Oak and a second finish in South American Teakwood for three days – Spain and Brazil both being countries that were part of Magellan's Journey from Spain to Chile. The Teakwood, also known as Coumarin, from Brazil is known for its healing properties and gives a very particular spice to the whiskey.

The 2020 release of Arbikie 1794 Highland Rye whisky is a spicy, sweet grain whisky with aromas of cloves, nutmeg, Christmas cake and butterscotch on the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon, honey, earthy grains and dark muscovado sugar.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1980
16 Year Old Cask #89 589 49 First Cask

Bruichladdich Classic Laddie Scottish Barley
Large Bottle
product_description: A 4-and-a-half litre bottle Bruichladdich's Classic Laddie. Made entirely from Scottish-grown barley, trickle distilled and then matured in American oak. The distillery class it as their signature bottling.
JJ Corry is a blend of single malts (aged for 11, 15 and 26 years) with seven-year-old grain whiskey. Notes of citrus fruit and spice.

product_name:
Springbank 1969
34 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A rare Springbank single malt bottled as part of Douglas Laing's Old Malt Cask series, that features a curious misprint on its label. It is not clear whether it is the year of distillation or the age that is the misprint. We will probably never know if this is a 34-year-old whisky from 1965 or a 31-year-old whisky from 1969.

product_name:
Benriach 1966 Set With Glass & Miniature
35 Year Old
product_description: A cracking old bottling of Benriach, released by Signatory Vintage back in July 2001. It's one of their special sets including a tasting glass and a miniature, giving you a chance to have a taste before you open the whole bottle. This is a classic Benriach of the era, with stacks of fruit.

A softly smoky Swiss single malt from Langatun distillery, Old Bear is made with peated malt and is matured in ex-Châteauneuf-du-Pape wine casks. Fresh smoke fills the nose, alongside aromas of red fruits and waxy orange. The palate offers notes of juicy grapes, toffee and wood smoke that develop into dark chocolate and smouldering peat fires that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Peat (Pure Islay) Sample
Elements of Islay
product_description: Bottled at 45%, this is a more approachable edition of Peat, packed with fruit spice and smoke.

product_name:
New Riff Single Barrel Proof Rye
(52.1%)
product_description: A single barrel Rye whiskey from New Riff distilling, matured for four years before being bottled in 2020 at barrel proof. The result is notes of clove, nutmeg, toasted rye bread, oak and peppery spice throughout the palate.

product_name:
Girvan 1968
47 Year Old Sherry Cask Velier 70th
product_description: An incredible distillery bottling of 1968-vintage Girvan, bottled as part of the celebrations of indie bottler Velier's 70th birthday. A tricky release, it was bottled in 2016, when Velier was only 68, to match up with the vintage. A single cask selected by William Grant's, owners of Girvan, from their extensive rare cask reserves, it was bottled at 47 years old.

product_name:
Chichibu 2013 Sherry Oloroso Cask
Velier 70th Anniversary
product_description: A 2013 Chichibu single malt, matured in a first-fill sherry hogshead before being bottled in 2017 in celebration of bottler Velier's 70th anniversary. This limited-edition bottle features Japanese calligraphy artist Jun Inoue's painting The Red Point on its label.

A powerful, rich and spicy straight rye whiskey bottled at barrel strength. Flavours of toffee, candied fruit and fig cake are followed by mint, cinnamon and clove. The finish is long and warm, with hints of coconut slowly revealing themselves.


This release is one of the five bottles in the 2017 Buffalo Trace Antique Collection.
A 1993 Glendronach single malt from indie bottlers La Maison du Whisky and The Nectar, matured for 24 years in a single sherry butt and bottled in September 2017.

A rare treat bottled for Italian distributor Velier's 70th birthday by Signatory Vintage, maybe the only bottler to still have casks of Glenisla. The spirit was made at Glen Keith during the experimental late 1970s, using a combination of lightly peated malt and heavily peated water. The result is a intriguing mix of fruit and gentle smoke – a worthy experiment.
Kavalan Podium is aged in a combination of virgin oak and refill casks. A rich, fruity and sweet whisky with notes of honey, cherry and mango. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

Awarded 89 points by Wine Enthusiast magazine, this was originally designed to compete with Jack Daniel's, which it did so well that JD (unsuccessfully) sued. Nonetheless, it is still a great whiskey in its own right.

The second batch of eight-year-old single malt from Swedish distillers Smogen has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks. Rich and full, the nose holds aromas of vanilla, earthy peat, green grass and chocolate that are complimented on the palate by notes of baked apples, sponge cakes, savoury peat smoke, salty sea air and dry oak that linger in the finish.

A rich, full-bodied single malt from Australian distillery Starward, Fortis has been matured in 100% American oak casks that previously held Australian red wines, mostly from Barossa Valley wineries. The palate offers notes of chocolate ganache, cinnamon, quince, raisins and lingering baking spices.

product_name:
Starward Dolce 2016 Single Malt
Bot.2020 Half Litre
product_description: A juicy, sweet single malt from Australian distillery Starward, Dolce has been matured in Australian red wine barrels and finished in barrels that previously held an Australian interpretation of Sicilian dessert wine. Aromas of dried fruits, toasted marshmallows and marzipan fill the nose, complemented by notes of fizzy cola sweets, red berries, brown sugar, raisins, dates and sticky marshmallows throughout the palate.

A single-cask release of Bunnahabhain from the Single Malts of Scotland, bottled as part of the Director's Special range. This was distilled back in 1975 and aged for 43 years in a single refill-bourbon hogshead. Over the years, its strength has naturally dropped, concentrating its flavour. The result is a soft and fruity whisky that shows the delicacy of Bunnahabhain's normally boisterous spirit.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenglassaugh 1967
49 Year Old Rare Cask Release Batch 3
product_description: A long-aged whisky from Glenglassaugh, the second oldest in the third release of single casks from the distillery. It's one of the darkest whiskies we've ever seen from the distillery, thanks to 49 years of maturation, with at least some (if not all) of that time in a refill sherry hogshead. The result is a deep and rich dram packed with berry fruit flavour.

Following on from the 21 Year Old and 25 Year Old Authenticus, BenRiach have now added this impressive 30 Year Old to the series. Expect a very intense Speyside malt whit notes of wild honey and peat on the nose, creamy vanilla, summer fruits and slight hint of cocoa on the palate, all infused sweet peat on the finish.

A nod to the history of Speyside, Benriach Temporis is peated, as they did back in the 1970s. It's been matured in a mix of bourbon barrels, virgin-oak casks, and Pedro Ximenez and oloroso sherry casks, adding in layers of fruit and spice on top of Benriach's honeyed peat smoke character.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 2014 Hepp single malt French whisky from Version Française that has spent time in an ex-Banyuls wine cask creating aromas of stewed fruit, gingerbread and mulled wine that fill the nose and are complemented by notes of bitter caramel, baked peaches, candied orange peel and cigars throughout the palate.

A rare Sherrif's ship label half bottle of Bowmore, released in the 1970s. This is packed with the distillery's trademark 1960s fruitiness, a flavour profile which makes these bottlings incredibly sought after.

A huge hit at The Whisky Show 2018 and The World Whiskies Awards, picking up the 2018 Best Dutch Single Cask Single Malt whisky award. Produced at Zuidam and distilled in 1996, it was bottled in August 2017 and has been a hit wherever it has popped up. Thick and oily with lots of tropical fruit flavours, confusing many experts.

product_name:
Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1953
12 Year Old Bot.1965

Highland Park 1958
40 Year Old + Crystal Decanter

product_description: A litre bottle of Bunnahabhain 12yo from its heyday in the 1990s. Rich and oily, but also restrained and easy drinking, this defined Bunnahabhain's character for the decade.
A 19-year-old Brora released by Signatory Vintage. Distilled in 1981, in the last couple of years of Brora's operation, it was matured for 19 years in a pair of casks and bottled on 29 January 2001.

A special edition Tobermory, originally bottled for the German market – we've managed to grab a few to let more Tobermory fans have a try. Matured in sherry casks, it's a rich and spicy look at this weighty and complex island whisky.

This 18-year-old single malt is part of a series of six Tobermory bottles exclusive to Germany. Aged it bourbon casks, it has a light, fresh and floral nose accompanied by notes of oak, maple syrup and sea salt on the palate.


As with each of the six bottles in the series, this comes with a collector's leaflet featuring a tear-off tab. Those who collect the tabs can enter a prize draw to win a bottle of Tobermory 42 Year Old.

A limited release of long aged Bowmore, launched in 2016. It was distilled back in 1973 and bottled in June 2016 after 32 long years of maturation in bourbon hogsheads. The result is a near legendary dram, with stacks of 90+ ratings across the internet and a reputation for epitomising the fruity character of the era.

A classic 1960s’ bottling of Highland favourite Tomatin. The distillery really upped its production in the late 1950s and early 1960s, adding stills and increasing the amount of spirit produced. This bottle carries the Tomatin trademarks of fruit and malt, at the richer end of the spectrum.

Inspired by the arrival of spring after a long winter, Mackmyra Björksav – meaning birch sap – has been matured in casks that previously held Swedish birch sap wine. This creates a floral, spicy single malt with aromas of vanilla fudge, toast, waxy birch sap, sweet white flowers, cherries, apples, pear and lemon on the nose that are echoed throughout the palate, alongside white pepper and ginger.

A smoky, malty blended malt whisky from Ian Macleod Distillers, Six Isles is made with a combination of casks from Islay, Jura, Mull, Arran, Orkney and Skye. Aromas of heathery peat smoke, oat cakes, sea salt, apple and apricot fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, warm buttered toast, salty bonfires and acrid peat throughout the palate.

product_name:
Benriach 22 Year Old
Albariza PX Sherry Finish
product_description:
Albariza is the name for the white ('alba') soil in which many sherry grape vines grow. It is an appropriate moniker for this peated single malt as, after several decades' maturation in American oak casks, the whisky is finished in Pedro Ximenez barrels. This gives it sweet notes of chocolate, raisins and dates, alongside honeyed peat and garden mint.

Tasting Notes (1)

A peated Speyside whisky with additional flavours of roasted apples, demerara sugar and lemon peel. Initially aged in American oak casks, this has been finished in dark rum barrels from Jamaica.


This whisky takes its name, 'Dunder', from that given to the cane-juice residue left in the still after rum distillation, something which is then used as a yeast source for the fermentation process in the production of further rums.

Tasting Notes (1)

2017 marks the third annual version of Laphroaig's limited-edition aged releases. This 27-year-old whisky has been matured in a combination of first-fill bourbon barrels and refill quarter casks. Smoky and fruity with notes of citrus fruit, leather and sea spray.

product_name:
Bruichladdich 1985
Hidden Glory 32 Year Old Rare Cask Series
product_description:
The very last 22 casks from 1985 have been used to create this fantastic edition of Bruichladdich's single malt. The casks were rediscovered in 2012 by then master distiller Jim McEwan, who filled their spirit into fresh bourbon barrels for added depth and complexity. In 2017 the whisky was again rehomed, this time into French oak which had previously held claret from a prestigious chateau. This three month period imbued the bourbon-aged whisky with an extra layer of fruit and sweet notes, as well as a subtle blush colour.

Tasting Notes (1)

A single cask whisky from Australia's Limeburners that's already picking up a reputation, thanks to previous casks picking up big awards. Made with malt smoked with peat from the Valley of the Giants in Western Australia, it's a big and smoky dram, intense and spicy – perfect for a winter's evening.


Please note


Picture is illustrative and may not be the cask that is currently available.

A small-batch version of The Six Isles blended malt whisky from Ian Macleod Distillers, made with a combination of casks from Islay, Jura, Mull, Orkney, Arran and Skye. Aromas of beach bonfires, strawberries and cream and savoury spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of salty smoke, fresh lime, green apple, banana, digestive biscuit and vanilla throughout the palate.

product_name:
Strathisla 1970
43 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: 1970 was an experimental year at Strathisla, with some strange bottlings appearing these days, but this is their regular, straight down the line whisky, matured long and richly coloured.
A 1995 Invergordon single grain whisky from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single barrel for a quarter of a century, before being bottled in March 2021 as part of its Sovereign series.

product_name:
Blair Athol 8 Year Old
Special Light Bot.1980s

Langatun 2016
Pedro Ximenez Sherry Cask Finish
product_description: A 2016 Langatun Swiss single malt whisky, finished in an ex-Pedro Ximenez sherry barrel, adding layers of sweet sherry spice on the palate. Aromas of nutmeg, cinnamon, dates, oak spice and lavender fill the nose, complemented by notes of pink pepper, salted caramel and dried fruit throughout the palate.

product_name: Seven Seals The Age of Aquarius
product_description: A limited-edition Swiss single malt from Seven Seals, released as part of its Zodiac series, Age of Aquarius has a warming, spicy character with aromas of bonfire smoke, treacle tarts, toffee and sweet spice that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of ginger biscuits, smouldering embers, caramel, oak spice and dark fruits that linger in the finish.

A limited-edition single malt from Tel Aviv distiller Milk & Honey, matured in a single Portuguese Cabernet Sauvignon wine cask, creating a fruity, spicy character. Aromas of red apples, apricot jam, white pepper, star anise and sea salt fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla custard, cloves, dried fruit, thyme, caramel and dark chocolate throughout the palate, with an undercurrent of toasted oak and sea salt. Created especially for Father's Day, this limited-edition single malt has space on the label to leave a message for Dad.

The third edition of this popular bottling, which blends single malt aged in a bourbon cask with that aged in a sherry cask. The two combine to create delicious notes of chocolate, tobacco, raisins, peach, brown sugar and plum.

product_name:
Lagavulin 16 Year Old
 Bot.1980s White Horse Litre

product_description: A two litre bottle of Glenmorangie 10 Year Old single malt, bottled in the 1980s for Dutch importer Wilmerink & Muller.

The first in a new series from the Swedish distiller which explores the effects of different oaks on whisky's ageing. This single malt has been matured in first-fill bourbon barrels for 4.1 years and then finished in new Swedish oak barrels for 7 months. This process has given the whisky, filled into 8,229 bottles, notable spicy and sweet flavours.


Quercus Robur is the Latin name for European oak, which grows across much of Sweden.

A peated single malt from Sweden which represents the third and last edition in the 2nd Step Collection, a series which has explored the distillery's character and the depth of its young whiskies. Made from a marriage of bourbon casks, American oak casks and Hungarian oak casks, of which 88% of the whisky was peated to an average of 38.6 PPM, no.3 in the series is an enjoyably peaty dram with undertones of fruits, vanilla, wood spice and caramel.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
34 Year Old Xtra Old Particular
product_description:
A single-cask bottling of Port Ellen 34 Year Old, created as part of Douglas Laing's Xtra Old Particular series. These 219 bottles were filled in November 2016, when the distillery still lay dormant.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenlivet 1943
70 Year Old Private Collection Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
On 14 January 1943, while the world sat under the cloud of war and world leaders, including Churchill and Roosevelt, met to discuss strategy in Casablanca, the Glenlivet distillers carefully filled sherry hogshead number 121. This cask had been hand-selected by the founders of Gordon & MacPhail, and was destined to be one of the last filled during the wartime period, as Glenlivet halted production in spring 1943. As the world slowly rebuilt itself the single malt aged peacefully, until it was bottled in June 2013 as a rare piece of whisky and wartime history.


This Glenlivet 70 Year Old from Gordon & MacPhail's Private Collection has complex notes including dark chocolate, orange, treacle, liquorice and subtle, ashy smokiness. Each in the series of just 40 gold-engraved decanters, is presented in a hand-crafted wooden box and comes with a commemorative book and certificate of authenticity.

Introduced in October 2017, this 25 Year Old single malt is one of the replacements for Old Pulteney's 17-year-old and 21-year-old bottlings. It's a very good one, too: this dram features mature and fragrant notes ranging from dark chocolate and heavy spice to lime honey, baked apples and orange peel.

Tasting Notes (1)

A rich and maritime Brora bottling from Signatory Vintage. Distilled in 1982, the year before the distillery closed, and aged for 20 years, this was bottled in November 2002. It's an excellent example of the more austere and coastal side of Brora's character.

product_name:
Brora 1982
Bot.1999 Spirit of Scotland Gordon & Macphail
product_description: A 1982-vintage bottling of Brora bottled for Gordon & MacPhail's Spirit of Scotland range. Launched in 1999 after about 17 years in wood, this has had time to mellow and shows off Brora's richly peated style.

product_name:
Glenlivet 1955
56 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
A single-cask bottling of 1955 Glenlivet single malt, created from a first-fill sherry butt. Part of Gordon & MacPhail's Rare Vintage collection, this 56-year-old single malt has notes of rich sherry, smoke, fruitcake and mint. The bottle features a label in the style of those used by the distillery at the time this whisky was distilled, and the presentation box includes a hand-signed certificate.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Grant 1954
59 Year Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A dark and long-aged Glen Grant from Gordon & Macphail's scarily extensive archives of their whisky from the 1950s. This one was distilled in 1954 and sat maturing for 59 years, before being bottled in 2014.

product_name:
Glenallachie 43 Year Old
Sherry Cask Director's Special
product_description:
A well-aged, very-sherried release from Elixir Distiller's Director's Special range – a 43-year-old single cask from Glenallachie. This was matured in a sherry butt for its whole life, as you can tell from its ruby colour. It's a sister cask of the whisky we released for The Whisky Exchange's tenth anniversary, and this is even better than that excellent bottling – big, rich and sherried.

Tasting Notes (1)

The pinnacle of Kavalan's early production - a whisky matured in Fino sherry casks, rather than the more usual darker sherry styles. Rich with more fresh fruit than you might expect from a sherried whisky.

A fruity single malt Irish whiskey from Writer's Tears, Read Head is matured exclusively in oloroso sherry casks, creating aromas of candied orange peel, chocolate covered marzipan, dried fruit and praline that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of rich nuts, Christmas cake, tangy pineapple, liquorice and melted milk chocolate, with walnuts and baking spice lingering in the finish.

product_name:
Glengoyne Time Capsule Gift Pack
(12 Year Old, Legacy, 18 Year Old) 3x20cl
product_description: A trio of small bottles from Glengoyne that including the distillery's 12 and 18 year old single malts, as well as the Legacy Chapter Two.

This single cask of peated spirit was distilled at Chichibu in 2012 and aged in a second-fill bourbon barrel. It was hand-selected by The Whisky Exchange for its rich and full texture, flavours of barbecue smoke and plum sauce, and its lingering finish.


Ichiro Akuto's Chichibu Distillery only started distilling in 2008 but has already created some of the world's most awarded whisky in its relatively short life.

product_name:
Bowmore 1974
42 Year Old Sherry Cask #4435 Signatory
product_description: Sherried single malt from Bowmore's golden period, when it was producing the tropical-fruit-led whiskies that won it a loyal fanbase. This edition has been bottled by Signatory from a single cask, which yielded 183 bottles.

product_name:
North Port Brechin 1976
40 Year Old Rare Reserve Signatory
product_description: A very special 40-year-old single malt, distilled at North Port eight years before it closed for the final time. Bottled in February 2017 by Signatory, this is a fabulous chance to try rare whisky from a lost distillery known for its dry, fruity and gin-like spirits.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1980
16 Year Old Cask #89 589 48 First Cask

product_description:
This exceptional bottling has been created from four casks of outstanding quality single malt, which were hand-selected by master distiller Robert Fleming from among Tomintoul's entire range of 1974 barrels.


This bourbon-aged whisky has delicate and complex notes of summer fruits, buttery toffee, oak spice and sweet liquorice. It is presented in a hand-crafted crystal decanter, into which the bottle number has been engraved.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
St Magdalene 1975
31 Year Old Sherry Cask Connoissuers Choice

product_description: An Australian single malt from Hellyers Road matured in a combination of American oak ex-bourbon casks and French oak Port casks, creating aromas of vanilla, marmalade and toast on the nose. The palate offers notes of winter berries, toast and nutmeg that linger in the finish.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1950
60 Year Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: Gordon & MacPhail have some good stocks of old Glen Grant to draw on, as shown by this incredible 1950 vintage bottling, released in 2010 at 59 years old.

Made from one third first-fill European oak sherry butts and two thirds refill sherry butts, Glengoyne 30 Year Old has rich notes of black cherry, marmalade, rum and raisin, cinnamon and plum compote.


Each yearly release of Glengoyne 30 Year Old is made from just 13 casks. Each bottle is presented in a solid oak box.

This chatty, personal book by brand strategy consultant, international spirit judge and host of many whisky tastings Greg Dillon will be enjoyed by the occasional spirit drinker as well as the connoisseur. He describes it ‘as a collection of personal tales, brand stories and historical anecdotes’ about the 28 distilleries and 23 brands he has experienced. It is a book which will entertain as well as inform and will make you view the spirit in the glass in your hand in a new light.

The blend to end all blends? Collectivum XXVIII is a blend of all 28 operational single malt distilleries currently owned by Diageo – hence ‘XXVIII’ in the name, which is 28 in Roman numerals. This unique whisky delivers complex aromas and flavours: expect everything from richness to dryness, nuttiness to sweetness, chocolate to citrus zest. A well-balanced homage to the greatness of Scotch whisky distilleries.


Collectivum was named Jim Murray's Scotch Vatted Malt of the Year in his 2019 Whisky Bible.

Tasting Notes (2)

An outstanding Highland Park, bottled at a remarkable 40 years old. They've done a good job on the presentation, too - extremely heavy box with proper hinges and magnetic closure, with a leather-bound booklet inside extolling the virtues of distillery and dram.
A 3cl measure of Copper Dog's popular blended whisky - about the same volume as you'd be stealing if you used an actual Copper Dog device in a distillery.

product_name:
Lark 2016
4 Year Old Berry Bros & Rudd
product_description: A 2016 Lark Tasmanian single malt from indie bottler Berry Bros & Rudd, matured for four years in just three casks, before being bottled in 2021. Aromas of orange, lemon, apricot, peach, leather and tobacco fill the nose, complemented by notes of lychee, strawberry jam, ginger and hints of dried fruit throughout the palate.

product_name:
Wilderness Trail Settlers Select Rye
British Bourbon Society Pick
product_description: Selected by a panel of British Bourbon Society members, this is a spicy rye whiskey from Wilderness Trail, made with a mash bill of 56% rye, 33% corn and 11% malted barley. Distilled on 21 December 2015 and aged for more than 4 years in a single barrel.

product_name:
North British 1991 Sample
29 Year Old Signatory
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 1991 North British single grain whisky from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single refill sherry butt for almost three decades, before being bottled in November 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A rare bottle of 1970s’ Glencoe. A ‘pure malt’, aka blended malt, Glencoes of this era are characterised by dark chocolate, pepper and peat.

product_name:
Highland Park 1992
24 Year Old Daily Dram
product_description: A 24-year-old Highland Park single malt, bottled by Belgian spirits importers The Nectar. As Highland Park fans will attest, 'Nectar' is an appropriate word for bottlings such as these.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1980
21 Year Old Silver Seal

product_description: Some of the finest whisky that we have tasted, the single malt in this bottle is Macallan 1938 that is utterly amazing old whisky, very autumnal, typical pre war style with honey, heather, stewed fruit, dried fruits, citrus orange. Bottled in the mid 1980s this whisky has been aged for 48 years.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1972
36 Year Old Duncan Taylor

Strathisla 1957
55 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: This Gordon and MacPhail bottling is another great example of Strathisla's immense ageing capability. This is a single first fill sherry butt distilled in 1957 and bottled at 55 years of age in 2013.

product_name:
Starward Dolce 2016 Single Malt Sample
2020 Release
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of juicy, sweet single malt from Australian distillery Starward. Dolce has been matured in Australian red wine barrels and finished in barrels that previously held an Australian interpretation of Sicilian dessert wine. Aromas of dried fruits, toasted marshmallows and marzipan fill the nose, complemented by notes of fizzy cola sweets, red berries, brown sugar, raisins, dates and sticky marshmallows throughout the palate.

Part of a run of great single casks of Brora bottled by Duncan Taylor for the Rare Auld range, this 26-year-old whisky captures late-era Brora's smoky and fruity character. Distilled in 1981 and bottled in November 2007.
A 1966 vintage whisky from Glenburgie. Bottled in 2014 by Gordon & Macphail, making this 47 years old.

product_name:
Longmorn 1973
30 Year Old Sherry Cask Blackadder

Milk & Honey 2017 Ex-Islay Cask
3 Year Old TWE Exclusive
product_description:
A 2017 Milk & Honey single malt, matured in a refill American oak ex-bourbon cask that was previously filled with Scotch whisky from the south coast of Islay, before being bottled in May 2021 exclusively for The Whisky Exchange.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: New York Ragtime Rye Bottled in Bond
product_description: A young Ragtime Rye whiskey from New York Distilling Company that was bottled in bond after at least four years in oak casks. Aromas of dark fruits and maple syrup open on the nose, followed by white pepper, cola cubes and tart cherries. The palate offers notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and oak spice, developing hints of leather, jammy berries and creamy vanilla.

A limited edition from Bunnahabhain on Islay, the Canasta 1980 was matured in oloroso sherry casks before spending 'a few months' in sweet Canasta sherry casks. The result is a complex and many layered whisky, with Bunnahabhain's oily and fruity spirit character carefully combined with dried fruit, treacle and chocolate notes.

Tasting Notes (1)

The 2017 release of Dalmore 40 Year Old was aged in bourbon casks for around 30 years, then aged in oloroso-sherry butts for a further seven before being finished in first-fill bourbon barrels. The result is a whisky with notes of gingerbread, maple syrup, honey and brioche.
A wheat, rye and corn mash bourbon made in Bardstown, Kentucky. The label was designed by noted artist William Nagle.
A terrific rich, mellow old-school sour mash bourbon produced in very limited quantities to a method unchanged in five generations of quality distilling.

A top-quality vatting of the peated Speysider Ardmore with some choice Islay malt, Peat Monster is never less than excellent. Pitch-perfect balance and delicious chewy complexity.

Tasting Notes (2)
The middle bottling in the Poit Dhubh range, aged for 12 years and showing dark smokiness with some sweet citrus.
A unique vatted malt from Chivas, containing malt from no fewer than 100 different distilleries.
A bottle of the popular Welsh whisky Penderyn, this has been finished in Sherry casks, after an initial maturation in American oak.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
34 Year Old The Kinship
product_description: The Kinship range from Hunter Laing is personally selected by Islay great Jim McEwan. This 34-year-old Port Ellen packs in citrus, smoke and maritime notes, along with wax, herbs and minerals. Enormous character.

product_name:
Bunnahabhain 1988
28 Year Old Sherry Cask The Kinship
product_description: A sherry-aged Bunnahabhain 28 Year Old, bottled as part of Hunter Laing's Kinship series: six single-cask whiskies that commemorate the start of the Ardnahoe distillery on Islay.
A partial replacement for Bunnahabhain's 12 Year Old, Stiùireadair is coastal and creamy with notes of dried fruit, spice caramel and nuts.
A 20cl bottle of Kilchoman's ongoing Machir Bay. It's a vatting of whisky matured in first-fill bourbon casks for around six years, married and then finished in oloroso sherry butts before bottling.
One of 74 bottles created from a single refill hogshead that was filled with spirit in 1974, and not cracked open until July 2016. A delicious piece of the distillery's history.
Distilled in 1972 and aged in a single sherry butt until August 2015, this is one of 625 bottles produced from cask number 3548. These bottles were released in the Winter 2015 batch of Family Casks.
Part of a tranche of Family Casks bottlings that was released in the winter of 2015, this would make a superb gift for anyone born in 1970.
Distilled in '69 (hopefully in the summer of…), this is part of Glenfarclas' highly-regarded Family Casks series, a range of whiskies that spans many decades of the distillery's history.
Part of a batch of Family Casks series bottlings created in the summer of 2016, this sherry-aged single malt was distilled in 1968.
Part of the superb Family Casks series from Glenfarclas, this whisky was distilled in 1963 and filled into 228 bottles from a single sherry hogshead in November 2014.
Distilled six decades ago, in 1962, this is a little piece of history from the acclaimed family-owned distillery.

Taken from the private collection of the family which runs the Glenfarclas distillery, this sherry-aged single malt is at least 55 years old. It would make a wonderful present for anyone born in 1958 – the same year that NASA, America's National Aeronautics and Space Administration, was founded.

Each bottle in this series is like a time capsule. Sourced from a single cask in the family-run distillery's private collection, this sherry-aged whisky was distilled just a year after Sir Winston Churchill had ceased to be Prime Minister of Great Britain. A superb gift for anyone born in 1956.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1979
14 Year Old Cask #1848 Wilson & Morgan

product_description: The fourth release of peated whisky from Ichiro Akuto's Chichibu distillery. Distilled in 2012 from heavily peated malt, it's been bottled at 54.5%, giving a bold and intense smoky flavour, with spice and sweetness.

A peated expression of everyone's favourite Welsh whisky, Penderyn. After an initial maturation in ex-bourbon casks, Penderyn Peated undergoes a secondary maturation in casks previously used to hold Islay whisky, layering an aromatic, smoky flavour over the Welsh distillery's signature light and fruity character.

Tasting Notes (1)
A younger expression of Hakushu, this well-mannered 10yo represents one of the gentlest introductions to the elegant, impeccably-constructed qualities of Japanese malt whisky.

The new 46% Amruts are a very different proposition to the pleasant but unexciting original release. At the higher strength this 24ppm peated effort fairly fizzes along the tastebuds. This is excellent - hugely improved stuff from a distillery coming along in leaps and bounds.

An unpeated release from Paul John, produced by Goa's John Distilleries and bottled in 2013 at cask strength. The distillery has been going from strength to strength since first hitting our shores in 2012.

Tasting Notes (1)
Chasing the Dram from Rachel McCormack is a unique book on whisky. With anecdotes, lots of information plus interviews, this combines humour with detailed content.

A special-edition Macallan released to celebrate the opening of the distillery’s first standalone boutique store, in Taiwain Taoyuan International Airport. This is the first bottle released from Macallan’s Boutique Collection and it is a rich, full-bodied Speyside single malt with notes of dark fruits, oak and a lighter hint of citrus.

Mastery is a commemorative release of Glen Moray to celebrate the distillery's 120th anniversary. A blend of five vintages, the oldest of which is 1978, matured in a combination of sherry, port and Madeira casks, this is rich with notes of chocolate, coffee and vanilla.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1972
30 Year Old Duncan Taylor

Port Ellen 1979
21 Year Old Old Malt Cask

St Magdalene 1982
23 Year Old Hart Brothers

Linlithgow 1975
26 Year Old Old Malt Cask

Glenury Royal 1970
28 Year Old Rare Malts

product_description: A heavily sherried 1967 vintage Glenfarclas released as part of the much acclaimed Family Casks Series. This was aged in sherry butt 5113 before being bottled at cask strength of 55.6% on 15 April 2016. One of just 64 bottles.
A stunning sherried single malt from the Glenfarclas Family Casks range, this whisky was distilled in 1974 and aged in a single sherry butt.
Created at much the same time as the fashion for flared trousers, this single malt was distilled in 1971 and not freed from its sherry butt until January 2017.

Launched in 2007, the Glenfarclas Family Casks series has gained worldwide popularity and is still going strong more than a decade later. This single malt is from the second-oldest decade in the series and was distilled in 1967.

Forever remembered as the year in which England won the football World Cup, 1966 also saw the birth of this whisky, which was then aged in a single sherry butt until January 2017. A fabulous gift for anyone born in that year.
Created in the same year that pirate radio station Radio Caroline came into being, this sherry-matured whisky was bottled in January 2017 and is part of the acclaimed Glenfarclas Family casks series.
Part of the acclaimed Glenfarclas Family Casks series, this bottle of 1961 single malt was bottled from a single sherry hogshead in January 2017.

A sherry-aged 1956 single malt from the family-owned Glenfarclas distillery. Part of their much-loved Family Casks series, this would make a wonderful gift for anyone with a connection to the year 1956.

The Glenfarclas Family Cask series is an ongoing range of single-cask bottlings from the family's extensive collection, which spans seven decades. This 1955 bottling is one of the oldest in the range and is a marvellous gift for anyone for whom 1955 was a significant year.

The 2014 edition of the whiskey often seen as the pinnacle of the Buffalo Trace Antique Collection – George T Stagg. Bottled at 69.05%, this is packed full of intense flavour but isn't for the faint-hearted.

Glendalough Double Barrel is a single grain Irish whiskey, aged in a combination of bourbon and oloroso sherry casks. Sweet and creamy, with butterscotch and honey from the American oak and dried fruit from the Spanish.

Tasting Notes (1)
Penderyn Celt is the Welsh distillery's 41% version of their malt finished in ex-peated casks. A fresh, sweet and smoky whisky.
Cotswolds Cream Liqueur is a combination of single malt spirit with fresh Irish cream. This is best consumed over ice, chilled, or in a traditional Irish coffee.

Released during the distillery’s 200th year, this Highland single malt was distilled before Teaninich underwent significant expansion. Reflecting its older style of production, the whisky makes an excellent aperitif or a partner to Asian cuisine. Initially sweet and zesty, this dram layers herbal notes under its toffee, lemon and apple flavours.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Glen Elgin 1998
18 Year Old Special Releases 2017
product_description:
Sophisticated Speysider from the little-known Glen Elgin distillery. Vanilla-toffee sweetness and a splendid fruit salad on the nose, joined by butter, wood and spice on the tongue. This 18-year-old whisky is made by combining whisky matured in two types of casks: sherry-style butts and refill European oak. A balanced and enticing dram.


This whisky was made in experimental fashion and some of the spirit was distilled using a yeast more commonly found in the production of millet beer.

Tasting Notes (2)

Subtle, sweet and spicy Speyside single malt from closed distillery Convalmore. Predominant notes are all from the bakery: buttery pastry cases, green fruits and a little citrus, followed by intense brown sugar sweetness and spice. A characterful and well-balanced example of this little-known distillery’s style, long-aged in refill American oak hogsheads.


Convalmore was opened in 1894 just outside Dufftown, and closed for the final time in 1985 – a year after this whisky was distilled.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Clynelish 1972
44 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: 1972 has produced some incredible whiskies from Clynelish and this one now joins the ranks. Bottled in 2016 at about 45 years old, this is about as long-aged as we've seen a bottling from the distillery – we can only thank Gordon & MacPhail and their excellent Rare Old series for the chance to try it.

Awarded 89 points by Wine Enthusiast magazine, this was originally designed to compete with Jack Daniel's, which it did so well that JD (unsuccessfully) sued. Nonetheless, it is still a great whiskey in its own right.

product_name:
Strathisla 15 Year Old
Sherry Cask Bot.1970s

product_description: A single-vintage Glenrothes distilled in 1996 and bottled by German retailer Jack Wiebers. This was bottled after two decades’ maturation in a bourbon cask (Cask #17), and has the typical Glenrothes character of sweet spice, toffee and vanilla.

A bourbon-cask-matured Glenrothes from German whisky retailer Jack Wiebers. Bottled at 49.1% ABV after 20 years maturation in Cask #18, this is a classic Speyside with rich notes of toffee, vanilla and stone fruit.
Bower Hill Reserve is a classic American rye, with lots of spice to complement vanilla, orange and apricot flavours. This is superb either on the rocks or in a cocktail.

Kavalan's Solist Bourbon releases are known for being big, bold and rich. The Bourbon Oak is selected from the same parcels of casks, but diluted with Kavalan spring water to 46%. It's still rich in flavour with notes of vanilla, coconut and tropical fruit.

Tasting Notes (1)

A magnum bottle of Buffalo Trace – a really classy bourbon from the eponymous distillery that has been responsible for some truly outstanding products in recent years. A must-stock for any bar worthy of the name and probably the best all-rounder at the price.
A sweet and spicy straight rye whiskey from Ezra Brooks that offers hints of milk chocolate, leather, spicy grains and sweet oak.

product_name:
Cockburn & Murray 6 Year Old Pure Malt
Bot.1970s

product_description: A 27-year-old Brora from Duncan Taylor, part of the Rare Auld range. Distilled in 1981 and bottled in November 2008, this is a classic example of late-era Brora, combining characteristic earthy smoke with a citrus-fruit-focused palate.
Turning Point Carolina Rye is an unaged spirit containing 60% rye, 20% rye malt and 20% corn. Spicy and warming.

product_name:
Irish Single Malt XO Part II
Nectar of the Daily Drams
product_description: Distilled at an unspecified location in Ireland, this is a deliciously fruity, malty whiskey that was bottled for the Belgian organisation The Nectar. Notes of banana, pears, rich malt, ginger and orange blossom.
Bottled by Belgian indies The Nectar, this is a Fettercairn 28 Year Old that deftly combines notes of aniseed, orange rind, orchard fruit and pine. Great nectar for Highland hummingbirds.

product_name:
Strathisla 1960
53 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & Macphail
product_description: Another in Gordon & Macphail's series of extraordinary old Strathisla's, this is a combinantion of three sherry casks distilled in 1960 and bottled more than five decades later. The perfect gift for a whisky fan of this vintage

product_name:
Port Ellen 1980
16 Year Old Cask #89 589 19 Signatory

product_description: Dálvve is a medium-peated whisky that has been aged for around five years in first-fill bourbon casks. This is a sweet and smoky whisky with notes of vanilla.

Box American Oak is a peated whisky that was aged for around four-and-a-half years in bourbon casks before being finished for eight months in small charred virgin American-oak casks. The result is a toasty and spicy whisky.
Hedonism is a blended grain whisky from Compass Box. Deliciously creamy with notes of vanilla, toffee and a hint of smoke.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 10 Year Old
Bot.1960s Securo Cap
product_description:
A very rare bottling of Glenfarclas 10 years old in a bottle that used the securo cap closure from the 1960s.


This was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail at Grant Bonding which was a joint partnership between Glenfarclas and G&M.


This bottle came from a parcel of stock that was imported by Esquin Imports San Francisco around the mid-1960s.

product_name:
Brora 1982
19 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 1982 vintage whisky from long-closed Brora, released by Douglas Laing on the Connoisseurs Choice range. Distilled in March 1982, this was bottled in April 2001 as a 19 year old.
Made to one of Beam's oldest recipes, this release of rye whiskey is made in a pre-Prohibition style. Big, bold and spicy with notes of vanilla and black pepper.
One up from their standard 10-year-old bottling, the 12 Year Old has two more years in the cask and is a step closer to the sherry-heavy older expressions.

A small bottle of Glenfarclas' classic 10 Year Old, a sweet, spicy and malty dram that is one of the benchmark single malts. This 20cl size is great for taking on outdoor adventures where a warming dram might be very welcome.

Tasting Notes (1)
Filled into a fourth-fill sherry hogshead in 1974 and bottled in August 2015 for the Glenfarclas Family Casks series.

product_name:
Dufftown 1979
17 Year Old Sherry Cask Cadenhead's

product_description:
The first Irish single malt from Midleton in a very long time – French Limousin oak adds floral aromatics while bourbon casks provide a toasted, nutty character. One to savour.

Tasting Notes (1)

Sweetdram Moonshine Liqueur is a collaboration between the East-London-based company and Kings County Distillery in New York. A blend of unaged whiskey, sour cherries, allspice, coriander and hibiscus, this is spicy and subtly tangy with a magenta hue.

product_name:
A Drop of the Irish 1989
26 Year Old Blackadder
product_description:
One of two 1989 Irish whiskies from an undisclosed distillery from Blackadder, this is number 20 in the Statement series. Aged for 26 years, including a finishing period in a rum cask, this is sweet and fruity.


Please note


Blackadder's Raw Cask series is unfiltered, and the bottles have a natural sediment.

product_name: Evan Williams Extra Aged Bourbon Sample
product_description: A 3cl (30ml) Perfect Measure of Evan Williams Extra Aged bourbon, a sweet and warming spirit that's hugely popular in its country of origin.

A legendary Springbank bottling: distilled in 1965 and bottled in 1993 by veteran independent Adelphi. It's one of their early bottlings – they'd only started that year – and is very much a dram of the times: the times when you could still find 1965 Springbank. A must-try for Springbank and Adelphi fans.


Please note


This bottle has some harmless sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1962
43 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: Another of Gordon & Macphail's long-aged Glen Grants which, along with Glenfarclas, represent the best-value long-aged sherried Speysides available. Thankfully, Glen Grant is one of those special Speysiders (like Glenfarclas, Mortlach and Macallan) that is capable of withstanding immense oak ageing without tasting like a pile of wet sawdust.

Peated whisky aged in port casks is a rare thing, even more so when it comes from India. This has excellent balance between smoky and red-fruit flavours, as well as offering notes of Turkish Delight, orange blossom and nutmeg.

product_name:
Knappogue Castle 14 Year Old
Gift Tube
product_description:
A pleasing combination of single malts aged in bourbon barrels and in Oloroso sherry casks - something which has earned it the name 'Twin Wood'. This is a limited edition from independent bottlers Knappogue Castle, featuring fruity, nutty notes alongside a rich mouthfeel.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Black Bowmore 1964
50 Year Old The Last Cask
product_description: Black Bowmore is one of those whiskies every whisky lover should taste once in their life (if they can). This has complex aromas of ripe tropical fruit, orange peel and rich black cherry, with a heavier palate of chocolate, espresso coffee, mango and passion fruit, with a subtly spicy finish. A sublime dram.

product_name:
Glenfarclas-Glenlivet 15 Year Old
Sherry Cask Bot.1970s

product_description: The oldest expression in Tomatin's travel-retail range, this 40 year old is rich with an unctuous texture and notes of tropical fruit, paprika and sandalwood. A complex whisky that's one to sip, savour and think about.

product_name:
Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old Twin Wood
(40%)
product_description: Produced from triple-distilled barley from Bushmills in Northern Ireland, this was aged initially in bourbon barrels before being finished in oloroso-sherry casks. Fruity and malty with notes of dark chocolate.

product_name:
Longmorn 1964
50 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: Another whisky from Gordon & MacPhail's incredible warehouses – this time a 1964 vintage dram from Speyside's Longmorn, bottled at around 50 years of age.

product_name:
Very Old Fitzgerald 1951
8 Year Old Bot.1959

Kavalan Classic Single Malt
Half Litre
product_description:
The flagship single malt from Taiwan's Kavalan. Only operating since 2005 they have wowed the world with their young but full flavoured whisky, concentrating on their signature flavours of tropical fruit.


Taiwanese distillery Kavalan was founded in 2005 and released its first bottling in 2008. Quickly winning awards for its single malts, Kavalan has been rising in popularity since its opening.
A miniature of Timorous Beastie – a blended malt from Douglas Laing, using only Highland whiskies including Dalmore, Glengoyne and Glen Garioch. This has the classic heathery Highland note.
A 1980s’ bottling from Lowland distillery Rosebank. This was bottled for the Italian food and drink specialist Peck.

Another incredibly priced retro-labelled old Longmorn bottled by Gordon & Macphail from their scarily well stocked warehouses - this one was distilled in 1967 and bottled in 2015 at more than 47 years of age.

product_name:
Strathisla 1957
49 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: This Gordon and MacPhail bottling is another great example of Strathisla's immense ageing capability : A marriage of two first fill sherry butts distilled in 1957 and bottled at almost 50 years of age in 2007.

product_name:
Glen Grant 50 Year Old
Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 50-year-old Glen Grant from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, who were once the distillery's official bottler and have some old, impressive stocks. Another top-quality, rich and sherried expression that the distillery has become known for.

product_name:
Glencadam St. Michael
For Marks & Spencer

product_description: An old dumpy bottle of 8yo Tamnavulin bottled in the 1970s when the distillery was still using the 'Glenlivet' suffix.

An entry-level release from award-winning Taiwanese distillery Kavalan, celebrating the craftsmanship of Master Blender Ian Chang. Aged in refill casks, Distillery Select captures the fruity, tropical character that Kavalan has become known for, whilst also displaying a refined balance from its maturation in the tropical temperatures of Taiwan. The palate is full of notes of tropical fruits and chocolate that mingle with toffee apples, salted-caramel and vanilla. The finish is smooth and fruity, full of pineapple and mango notes, and sweet, tropical spices.


As well as savouring this neat, try Kavalan Distillery Select in an Old Fashioned or a Highball.

Tasting Notes (1)

Fire is the follow up to Ice and is the second in Highland Park's series celebrating Viking legends. Aged entirely in refill port casks, this is lightly smoky with notes of dried citrus peel, vanilla and a fruity spiciness.

Tasting Notes (1)
This is an old distillery bottling of Glenfarclas 8 year old. This should be a big and oily dram with a long finish. We estimate this bottles dates from the 1970s.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
33 Year Old Xtra Old Particular
product_description: A 1982 vintage whisky from cult closed distillery Port Ellen. Distilled in the October the year before the distillery closed its doors for good, this was aged for 32 years in a refill hogshead. Smoky with notes of earth and barbecued meat.

product_name:
Laphroaig 20 Year Old
Sherry Cask Director's Special
product_description:
Part of an exclusive series from The Single Malts of Scotland range, this delicious Laphroaig 20 Year Old has been bottled from a single sherry cask. Notes of red fruit, iodine and seaweed accompany finely structured smoke.

Tasting Notes (1)

Kavalan’s flagship single malt shows the distillery’s trademark note of tropical fruit. This is young but terrifically full flavoured. A great example of why people are so excited about this fledgling distillery.
Tamdhu 10 Year Old has gained many fans since its 2013 relaunch. Creamy, sweet and rich with notes of caramel, pepper and stewed orange.
A very impressively aged Mortlach from Gordon & MacPhail. Distilled in 1954 and aged in sherry casks for more than 50 years, this is rich, spicy and meaty.
One of Gordon & MacPhail's legendary 1950s-vintage Linkwood releases. Rich and spicy and aged for more than 45 years, ebfore being bottled in 2000.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1950
57 Year Old Gordon & Macphail
product_description: A very old Glen Grant from Gordon & MacPhail. Distilled in 1950 and aged for almost 60 years, this is a rich and complex whisky with lots of spicy fruit.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1948
58 Year Old Gordon & Macphail
product_description: An incredibly old Glen Grant from Gordon & MacPhail. Aged for almost six decades, this is rich and packed full of flavour.
Bowmore 12 Year Old is the medium-peated malt from Islay. With excellent balance between tropical fruit and smoke, this is a superb introduction to smoky whisky from the island.
