product_name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled in Bond 9 Year Old
product_description:
The autumn 2018 release of Old Fitzgerald’s Bottled-in-Bond bourbon is a nine-year-old whiskey that was distilled in October 2008 and bottled in August 2018. It has aromas of caramel, dried fruit and butter, followed by citrus, toffee and black pepper flavours and a soft, liquorice-tinged finish.


Twice a year, in spring and autumn, a new edition of the Old Fitzgerald Bottled-in-Bond decanter series is released. Presented in an ornate bottle inspired by an original 1950’s Old Fitzgerald diamond decanter, the series reflects the traditions of both Old Fitzgerald and the historic Bottled-in-Bond designation.
A rare single cask of 1951 Balvenie. Aged for 45 years before being bottled in 1996. Only 90 bottles were produced and this is a true collector's item.

One of just 3,000 bottles released to the European market, this is a honeyed single malt with notes of vanilla, cinnamon and walnut. The whisky in this bottling has been aged in ex-bourbon barrels for between 10 to 15 years.

Dalmore 35 has been aged in three types of cask: a Matusalem sherry, a bourbon barrel and a colheita-port pipe. Presented in a Baccarat Crystal decanter, this is classic rich Dalmore with notes of coffee, treacle, banana and orange.

product_name:
Glengoyne 40 Year Old
Sherry Cask Director's Special
product_description:
Filled from a single sherry cask, this is an exceptional limited-edition bottling of Glengoyne 40 Year Old. A rich dram that shows its sherry influences through exotic notes of spice and a cornucopia of fruits.

Tasting Notes (1)

Thoroughly drinkable at the worst of times, Highland Park has excelled itself with this 18-year-old expression. Floral heather and trademark honey sweetness marry beautifully with peat smoke, all wrapped around ripe cherry and dark chocolate in a palate which plumbs new depths of complexity and indulgence. Intense and perfectly balanced, this spectacular dram has been named ‘Best Spirit in the World’ on two occasions – and we can see why.

product_name:
Brora 1981
18 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: Highly scored by the Malt Maniacs (90+), this is an 18-year-old whisky from closed Brora, bottled by Douglas Laing for the Old Malt Cask range. Distiller in 1981 and bottled in 1981, it's classic Brora from towards the end of the distillery's life.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 30 Year Old
180 Years In Production
product_description: Released in 2016 to mark 180 years of production at Glenfarclas, this edition of 30-year-old whisky is rich with notes of marzipan, icing, coffee and burnt chocolate.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old Cask Strength
Batch 008
product_description: Released in March 2016, this is part of Laphroaig's highly popular Cask Strength series and highly recommended for those who love the Laphroaig character. This is an impressive single malt with notes of soft peat smoke, cured meat, bonfires and orchard fruits.

A 1981-vintage Brora, bottled by Duncan Taylor for the Rare Auld range. This was distilled in the final years of the distillery's life, an era where it was putting out spirit that has since become some of Brora's most famous – long maturation has brought out its distinctive character. This one was bottled in 2004 after 22 years in the cask, showing a slightly fresher side to the that character.

Bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange, this Hanyu was distilled in the final year before the distillery closed. Bottled in 2016 and previewed at The Whisky Show to great acclaim, this is a chance to own a piece of Japanese whisky history.

Tasting Notes (1)
The 2016 release of Eagle Rare 17 Year Old from Buffalo Trace's annual Antique Collection. This is packed with notes of wood spice, cherry, toffee and vanilla.

A cask-strength, single-cask Kavalan distilled in June 2012, aged entirely in a wine barrique and bottled in 2018, exclusively for The Whisky Exchange. The resulting whisky is a full-on wine cask experience, with layers of rich dried and berry fruit complimented by sweet apple, spice and a touch of the tropical.

Tasting Notes (1)

The Explorer is the third release in Box's The Early Days Collection. Made mainly using malt peated to around 40ppm, this has been predominantly matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in medium-toasted Swedish oak. Fruity and sweet with a smoky backbone

Made with Pilsner malt, of which two-thirds is peated and aged for more than four years, this is the second batch of Early Days from Sweden's Box. Matured in bourbon casks, this is rich and warming with notes of vanilla and smoke.
Batch 001 of Box's Early Days is an unpeated whisky aged in bourbon casks. The result is a whisky which combines vanilla and herbaceous flavours.

Made at a mystery distillery and bottled by Edinburgh-based John Crabbie & Co, Yardhead is a single malt made for mixing. A sweet, young single malt it offers notes of shortbread biscuits, vanilla, toffee apples and citrus throughout the palate.

Nantou is the other distillery in Taiwan. Built in 2008 by the state, Omar single malt was launched in 2015. This is the bottling aged in sherry cask, resulting in a full-bodied and intense whisky with notes of caramel, toast, dried fruit and a hint of smoke.
Omar single malt comes from the Taiwanese state-owned Nantou distillery. Aged entirely in ex-bourbon casks, this is medium bodied with an oily texture and notes of vanilla and mandarin.

A no age statement expression launched as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2016. This is from the meatier end of the Cragganmore spectrum, packed with rich and weighty flavours that open up to reveal sweet fruit and brown sugar with a drop or two of water.

Tasting Notes (1)

The headline bottle of the Diageo Special Releases 2016 – the 16th release of whisky from cult closed distillery Port Ellen. This is a big, spicy dram, balancing smoke and hot spice against the traditional leather, citrus and seaside character.

Tasting Notes (1)

The Diageo Special Releases 2016 bottling of whisky from cult-closed distillery Brora. This is a classic dram from the distillery, balancing fruit, smoke and a softly farmyard-tinged character.

Tasting Notes (1)

A fruity and fresh release from Auchroisk, quite different to the sherry-cask-matured releases seen in the past. Zesty and floral with a softly spicy background.

Tasting Notes (1)

This gift set from Seattle's Westland contains three 20cl bottles; one each of the classic American Single Malts, Peated and Sherry Oak. A great gift for whisky lovers who like to explore outside of Scotland.

Westland's peated malt is made with a proportion of very heavily peated whisky combined with unpeated, aged in American oak. An excellent balance between smoke and fruit, with notes of earth, green herbs and roasted nuts.

Tasting Notes (1)

American Oak is Seattle-based distillery Westland's flagship release. Made with barley from Washington, this is rich and creamy with notes of chocolate custard, almond and bananas.


 Seattle distillery Westland uses locally sourced ingredients to create American single malt whiskies that honour the tradition of American whiskey-making with a Pacific North West twist.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Littlemill 1991
25 Year Old Pearls Of Scotland
product_description: A 1991 vintage Littlemill from independent bottler Gordon & Company as part of the Pearls of Scotland range. It was distilled in January and bottled in June 2016 at 25 years of age.

product_name:
Glenmorangie 16 Year Old
400 Years Of Golf in Dornoch (1616-2016)
product_description: An incredibly rare official Glenmorangie. This 16-year-old single malt has been matured in a single oloroso sherry cask and bottled at cask strength to celebrate 400th anniversary of the Royal Dornoch Golf Club in 2016.

product_name:
Glenlivet 16 Year Old
Bot.2014 Gallow Hill
product_description: This 16-year-old was matured in a single sherry cask, and is named after the hill above the distillery. Rich with notes of chocolate, caramel, pecan and toffee.

Timmer – meaning 'timber' in Swedish – is a heavily peated Swedish single malt, made using malted barley from Belgium. Matured in a combination of first-fill bourbon barrels and refill ex-bourbon quarter casks, Timmer has smoky, herbal aromas of fennel, basil and lemon grass. The palate offers notes of freshly-cut grass, garden herbs and lively citrus, balanced by rich smoke, fresh ginger and black pepper, and just a hint of salty sea air.


Swedish distillery High Coast focuses on quality ingredients and detailed production methods to create superb single malts.

This release from Kavalan's Solist series has been aged in casks which held the sweetest type of sherry: Pedro Ximenez. This is a warming and fruity whisky with notes of juicy raisins and honey syrup.

Tasting Notes (1)

Released in 2016, this bottling of Kavalan Solist has been finished in sweet Moscatel-sherry casks. The result is a complex, buttery and creamy whisky with notes of nuts and chocolate.

Tasting Notes (1)

This edition in Kavalan's Solist range has been finished in manzanilla-sherry casks. This has added a delicate saltiness along with vanilla, orange, vanilla and mint.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Tamnavulin 33 Year Old
Sherry Cask Stillman's Dram

Ardbeg 1967
29 Year Old Sherry Cask #923 Kingsbury's

product_description: An eight-year-old blended malt from noted Italian bottler Moon Import. The whisky was all sourced from Speyside and was aged in both bourbon and sherry casks.
This 12-year-old blended malt is from top Italian bottler Moon Import. Aged in both bourbon and sherry wood, we believe it dates from the late 1980s to early 1990s.
Produced for the Italian market, this is a 1960s’ bottling of Fettercairn Highland malt. The term ‘875’ refers to the fact that it is eight years and is 75 UK proof in strength.

A limited-edition release from Highland stalwart Dalmore, created by master blender Richard Paterson in his 50th year of working in the whisky industry. It combines whisky matured in bourbon casks and finished in five different types of Californian red-wine cask: Zinfandel, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Pinot Noir.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Mhor 1965
50 Year Old Rare Reserve
product_description: This 1965 Glen Mhor was awarded 90 points by Serge Valentin on Whiskyfun. Initially matured in a refill butt, it was finished in an oloroso-sherry cask for 88 months. This 50-year-old whisky has notes of menthol, spice and a whack of umami.

product_name:
Paul John Classic Select Cask
Miniature
product_description: A miniature bottle of unpeated whisky from Paul John, produced by Goa's John Distilleries and bottled in 2013 at cask strength. The distillery has been going from strength to strength since first hitting our shores in 2012.
Bottled by MacDonald Greenlees Ltd in the 1940s this brand is now discontinued. Sandy Macdonald-aka “Sandy Mac”-was popular in the 30s & 40s and used in many classic whisky cocktails across London.
Speymalt whisky has been distilled at Macallan Distillery for many years now. This 1988 vintage release was bottled in 2016, making it approximately 28 years old.

product_name:
The Exceptional Malt Second Edition
Sutcliffe & Son
product_description: The second edition of Sutcliffe & Son's The Exceptional Malt combines whiskies from 12 distilleries: Glenfarclas, Ben Nevis, Balvenie, Kininvie, Glenfiddich, Allt-á-Bhainne, Auchroisk, Glenallachie, Glenmorangie, Glen Moray, Speyside, and a parcel of 30-year-old Macallan. Finished in first-fill oloroso-sherry casks. This is rich and spicy with an underlying nuttiness.

product_name:
Springbank 30 Year Old
Sherry Cask Millennium Series
product_description:
This is the 30-year-old bottling from Springbank's much lauded Millennium Set. The set of six contained whiskies bottled at 25, 30, 35, 40, 45 and 50 years of age. This received an impressive average of 91 points from seven of the Malt Maniacs.


Please note


This bottle has a damaged box, and has also picked up a natural sediment over time.
A rare bottle of Port Ellen’s fourth release. Bottled in 2004 by Diageo, this near-mythical whisky from defunct Islay distillery is bold, powerful and peated  with notes of pepper, spices and nuts.

Due to the success of The Balvenie's Tun 1401 series, a bigger vat was needed. The third batch of Tun 1509 is comprised of 12 sherry butts, 11 American oak hogsheads and eight refill American-oak butts, all containing whisky distilled between 1989 and 1993. Rich and spicy, with an underlying vanilla and honeyed sweetness.

Tasting Notes (1)

An old bottling of 1956 vintage Talisker, complete with the old black label. This was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail, we estimate, in the 1970s.


Please note


This bottle has picked up a natural sediment over time.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1965
34 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description:
A 1965 vintage Glen Grant bottled by Signatory at 34 years of age. Just 390 bottles were yielded from a single cask.


Please note


The decanter carries bottle number 177 and the box caries 176.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
An old bottling of Linlithgow (aka St Magdalene) from Italian independent bottler Silver Seal. This whisky has pronounced zesty and lemony characters and a little coconut in the after-taste.

product_name:
Glen Grant 45 Year Old
Bot.1970s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 45-year-old Glen Grant from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail. We estimate this was bottled in the 1970s, meaning this comes from pre Second World War distillate.
An old bottling of Glenfarclas 15 year old whisky, in the rectangular bottle typical of the era. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.

Ma is a heavily peated spirit from a north-eastern Islay distillery. A blend of coastal and sweet flavours, partly from ageing in first-fill bourbon casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Midnight Moon Blueberry Moonshine
Junior Johnson's
product_description: A high-strength, unaged spirit infused with blueberries. This was distilled from 100% American corn and undergoes a five-step filtration process, resulting in an ultra-smooth and clean-tasting drink.
A miniature of The Epicurean – part of Douglas Laing's Remarkable Regional Malts series and a blend comprised exclusively of Lowland single malts. A delightful mix of sweet fruit and herbal flavours.

A historic bottling of Tobermory from the eponymous distillery on the Isle of Mull. This contains some of the first spirit to be made at the distillery when it reopened in 1972. A classic example of a long-aged sherried whisky, this has a rich texture with lots of spice and sweet fruit.

A vintage Linlithgow from independent bottler Signatory. This was distilled in December 1982 and aged for 18 years. The Linlithgow distillery, better known as St-Magdalene, was closed in 1983.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


The tin is missing its lid.

A truly legendary whisky, showing the best of Bowmore's famed 1960s' fruity character. Matured in sherry casks, it layers tropical and dried fruit with slices of damp peat and maritime smoke. A masterpiece.

product_name:
Brora 1982
Bot.2002 Reserve Cask #43 Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1982 vintage Brora released by independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail as part of the Reserve series of whiskies, exclusively for Collecting Whisky. The distillery closed in 1983 and bottlings are now increasingly sought-after.
A rare 1973 single cask bottling from Balvenie, one of only 213 bottles released from the cask. Distilled on 20 June 1973 and bottled on 19 May 2004.
A 1965 vintage Glenugie bottled by Hart Brothers at 23 years old in the late 1980s.

product_name:
Tomintoul 1968
43 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1968 vintage Tomintoul, bottled in 2012 by Gordon & MacPhail for the Rare Old series. This spent more than four decades in cask before being bottled at natural cask strength of 45.5%.

product_name:
Chichibu 2011 Imperial Stout Cask Sample
TWE Exclusive
product_description: Made in 2011 at Chichibu distillery in Japan, it has been finished in an imperial stout cask, creating rich liquorice and black forest gateau flavours throughout the palate. This limited-edition Japanese single malt has been bottled by The Whisky Exchange for its 20th anniversary series. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

product_name: Macallan Lalique Peerless VI 65 Year Old

product_description: An old rectangular bottling of Glenfarclas 25 year old – an all-time classic. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.
A 1966 Glenlivet bottled by Gordon & MacPhail with the now traditional retro "Smith's" label in 2014.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1980
34 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1979 vintage whisky from the most cult of cult closed distilleries - Port Ellen. This has been bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of their Rare Old series.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old
Cask Strength 1 Litre
product_description: A highly sought-after edition of Laphroaig's incredibly complex cask-strength 10 Year Old. This litre bottle would have been originally available through travel retail in the mid 2000s.

A very old, very rare Connoisseurs Choice bottling of absolutely ancient Mortlach 1936 from Gordon & MacPhail. This was bottled at 43 years old at the turn of the 1980s.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.

'A true classic' according to Whiskyfun.com's Serge Valentin, who's had more 1960s' Bowmores than we've had hot dinners. An incredible fruit cocktail of a dram, run through with flashes of tobacco and eucalyptus. A must try.


Please note


This bottle does not have a box.

An old bottling of 1956 vintage Talisker, complete with the old black label. This was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail, we estimate, in the 1980s.


Please note


This bottle has a low level, as shown in the photograph.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

A peated whisky from Bakery Hill distillery located just outside the Australian city of Melbourne. Earthy and smoky with notes of kumquat and tobacco.

Tasting Notes (1)

Bakery Hill Classic comes from just outside Melbourne in Australia. The flagship of the range, this has notes of nutmeg, honey and an underlying maltiness.

Tasting Notes (1)

A rich, sweet and spicy bourbon from – as you've probably guessed from the name – Bob Dylan. The Heaven's Door whiskey range is named after Dylan's song, Knockin' on Heaven's Door, but the slew of awards already picked up by each whiskey show that it's far from a gimmick. This bourbon, launched in 2018 and aged for at least eight years, has notes of vanilla, baked bread and toasted oak.


The intricate design on the bottle is modelled after a gate created by Dylan at his metalworking studio, Black Buffalo Ironworks.

Glenfarclas 50 Year Old is the third release in the distillery's Family series. It honours George Grant (1874-1949). One of a few distilleries that have stocks from the 1960s, this was bottled in 2015 from ex-oloroso-sherry casks. Limited to 937 bottles, this has notes of crème caramel, butterscotch, treacle toffee, chocolate ice-cream and sherry soaked raisins.

An extremely rare bottling of Glenfarclas 10 year old with a secure cap closure, which dates to the early 1960s. This was imported in to the USA with a small parcel of other malts by Esquin Imports in San Francisco.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1982
33 Year Old Sherry Butt Old & Rare
product_description: One of the rarest bottlings from this closed cult distillery, bottlings of which are relatively rare themselves. Just 108 bottles were yielded from the single ex-sherry butt. This was distilled in September 1982, aged for 33 years and bottled at cask strength in October 2015.

product_name:
Peat's Beast Batch Strength
Pedro Ximenez Sherry Finish
product_description: This Batch Strength release of Peat's Beast has been matured for nine months in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks, creating a layer of fruity spice amid the waves of rich peat smoke on the nose. The palate offers notes of dates, figs, seaweed, black pepper, burnt bracken and vanilla that linger in the finish.

Highland-based Loch Lomond distillery produce this single grain using coffey stills. Despite the name it is produced using malted barley, however its production falls foul of convention, so grain it is! A smooth ride, with a few interesting twists owing to its unconventional production of this Single 'Grain'.

Tasting Notes (1)
A 21 year old bottling of Glenfiddich, one of the bestselling Scotch single malts worldwide, presented in a beautiful Wedgwood decanter.
A rich and fruity Indian single malt from Paul John that has been finished in oloroso sherry casks before being bottled as part of its Select Cask range.

product_name:
Hanyu 2000 Final Vintage
15 Year Old Ichiro's Malt
product_description:
A special release from Ichiro Akuto - a single cask bottling of whisky from the final year of Hanyu distiller's operation. Bottled at 15 years of age and at cask strength without colouring or chill-filtration. A little slice of distilling history.

Tasting Notes (1)

A legendary Ardbeg, the 1974 Provenance first appeared in Europe in 1997 shortly after Glenmorangie's takeover of the distillery. This version of Provenance was for the US market and was introduced in 2000.


Please note


This bottle has a slightly low fill level.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1983
14 Year Old The Cooper's Choice
product_description: A 1983 vintage Port Ellen bottled by The Cooper's Choice in 1998 at 14 years of age. This was produced the very year the distillery closed, with bottlings now highly sought after.

A legendary Ardbeg, the 1974 Provenance appeared in 1997 shortly after Glenmorangie's takeover of the distillery. This version of Provenance was for the European market, other bottlings were done for the USA and Asia.


Please note


The lock on the box is damaged.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Dalmore 20 Year Old
Bot.1980s Edward Giaconne

product_description:
The oldest-ever whisky released from Glendronach, this was distilled on 24 September 1968, when the distillery was under the ownership of Teacher's. Aged for 47 years, this was bottled from Pedro Ximenez hogshead 5837 in January 2016 as part of the 13th batch of single-cask releases.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Compass Box Peat Monster Arcana
20th Anniversary
product_description: A smoky limited-edition blended malt whisky from indie bottler Compass Box, Peat Monster Arcana explored the effect of maturing peated whisky in toasted French oak casks. Aromas of chocolate, tar and cinnamon fill the nose, complemented by notes of lemons, baked apples, vanilla and beeswax on the palate, with rich waves of peat smoke throughout.
The third release of Port Ellen from Diageo's Special Releases series, bottled in 2003. Classic PE kippers 'n' slippers character, with plenty of grunt from the high alcohol.

product_name:
Bunnahabhain 1966
37 Year Old Sherry Cask Mission
product_description: A stunning, sherry-matured Bunnahabhain from Murray McDavid's Mission series. Distilled in 1996 and bottled in 2003 at 37 years old, it's got stacks of oloroso-cask character layered on top rich Bunnahabhain spirit.

product_name:
JJ Corry The Flintlock Batch 2
14 Year Old
product_description: Flintlock is JJ Corry's 16 year old single malt aged in 3 ex-bourbon casks. Only made in limited quantities. On the nose sweet vanilla, pear and white peach with hints of yellow flowers. The palate is soft and gentle with ripe pear and stone fruits, a lick of sweet spice and vanilla essence. The whiskey is named after a pistol found in the rafters of its 17th century tasting barn.

product_name:
Convalmore 1975
39 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A Gordon & MacPhail Rare Old bottling of the very infrequently-seen Convalmore. This distillery was closed by Diageo in 1990 and later sold to Wm Grants, who currently use the buildings for storage only.

Aged in a first-fill bourbon cask, this 1991-vintage Midleton was chosen by our customers at a special tasting held at The Whisky Exchange shop in 2015. Distilled in November, this sister cask to our award-winning bottling from 2012 is rich and mouth coating with notes of vanilla, cinnamon and green peppers.

Tasting Notes (4)

product_name:
Glenlivet 15 Year Old
Bot.1980s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 15-year-old bottling of Glenlivet released by independent bottlers extraordinaire Gordon & MacPhail under their historic George & JG Smith's label at 57%. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.

product_name:
Springbank 20 Year Old
Dell Fines Bot.1980s
product_description: A 20-year-old bottling of Springbank from the 1980s. Some minor scuffs to the label.

product_name:
Michter's US*1 Single Barrel Straight Rye
Gift Box
product_description:
This single-barrel rye whiskey from Michter's works a treat both neat and in cocktails. Peppery and spicy, this also displays refreshing orange notes, plus sweet toffee/butterscotch. Very moreish.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Deveron 15 Year Old
Baccarat Crystal

Glen Grant 1953
60 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
A long-aged Glen Grant single malt that has been nestled in sherry casks since 1953. Bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in 2013, it offers notes of orange, dark chocolate, stewed apples and beeswax. Add water and additional sweet sherry, raspberry, coffee bean and cigar ash notes emerge.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 1981 whisky from cult lost distillery Brora released by independent bottler Duncan Taylor. It was bottled from a single cask in July 2009 after being aged for 27 years. Lightly peaty, the palate is oily and waxy with hints of white pepper and ginger. A balanced, elegant dram.

A limited edition release of 1966 vintage Ben Nevis, bottled at 26 years of age. During the time the whisky was maturing, the distillery had closed and reopened twice, firstly from 1978 to 1984 and again from 1986 to 1990.

product_name:
Aberlour 1969
21 Year Old Bot.1991 Sherry Cask
product_description: A very special bottle of Aberlour 1969. This 21-year-old whisky has been matured solely in Sherry casks, and bottled in 1991 limited to just 3600 units.

product_name:
Bowmore 1966
36 Year Old Old Malt Cask Douglas Laing
product_description: A 36-year-old Bowmore from Douglas Laing's Old Malt Cask series. Distilled in 1966, during the distillery's golden era, this was bottled in September 2002.

product_name:
JJ Corry The Flintlock Batch #2 Sample
14 Year Old
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the second batch of The Flintlock Irish single malt whiskey from JJ Corry.

product_name:
Ardbeg 1976
Cask #2392 Sherry Cask Committee Reserve
product_description: Part of the first bottlings for the Ardbeg Committee in 2000, this single cask is from a 1976 batch of sherry casks that took Ardbeg's reputation into the stratosphere.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1950
57 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: Gordon & Macphail have some good stocks of old Glen Grant to draw on, as shown by this incredible bottling: a combination of two refill sherry casks distilled in February 1950, bottled in December 2007 at 57-years-old.

product_name:
Mortlach 1949
51 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A Gordon & MacPhail bottling of 1949 vintage Mortlach. Long aged and richly coloured from spending its life in a sherry cask. This was bottled in 2001 at more than 50 years old.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1965
Family Casks Spring 2015 Sherry Cask
product_description: A 1965 vintage release from Glenfarclas as part of the Spring 2015 outturn of bottlings in the Family Casks range. Matured for more than 45 years in a sherry butt and bottled on 1 December 2014.

A malt whiskey for bourbon drinkers, Woodford Reserve Malt is made with 51% malted barley and is matured in virgin American oak barrels. Aromas of caramel-covered hazelnuts, milk chocolate, apples and pineapple mingle with baking spices, oaky vanilla and mint on the nose. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, caramel, toasted hazelnuts, cocoa powder, coconut and lively oak spice that linger in the finish.
Distilled in 1954 and bottled at almost fifty years of age, this is another of Gordon & MacPhail's remarkable long-aged Strathisla releases.
A light and creamy bourbon cask matured Yorkshire single malt from Filey Bay, Flagship offers notes of vanilla, peppery spice, apples, citrus zest and honey.
A thick and creamy Italian chocolate liqueur with a whisky base. Alarmingly drinkable on its own or with ice and great poured over ice cream.

product_name: Peerless 4 Year Old Single Barrel Rye
product_description: A four-year-old rye whiskey from Peerless Distilling Co. that has been matured in a single barrel. Aromas of vanilla, freshly-cut grass and dusty hay fill the nose, complemented by notes of white pepper, caramel, oak spice and ginger throughout the palate.

A 1996 Port Dundas single grain whisky from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for almost a quarter of a century, before being bottled in June 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

Tomintoul distillery was established in 1965. To celebrate the 50th anniversary, this special release was created, comprised of whisky distilled in 1965, 1975, 1985, 1995 and 2005. This has notes of tropical fruit, nuts and spice.

A bottling of whisky from Deanston under the name Deanston Mill. We know this dates from the latter half of the 1970s as the whisky wasn't bottled under the distillery's name before 1974.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Thomas H Handy Sazerac Rye
Bot.2015
product_description: The 2015 cask-strength rye-based release from Buffalo Trace's much anticipated annual Antique Collection series. Always highly regarded, the 2012 edition won World Whisky of the Year in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2013.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1976
18 Year Old Cask #4785 First Cask
product_description: A Direct Wines First Cask bottling 1976 vintage whisky from closed cult distillery Port Ellen. This was distilled on 18 September, aged in cask 4785 and bottled 18 years later.

An Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford's Single Farm Origin series, made exclusively with barley from Grattansbrook farm and matured for three years in a variety of casks. Aromas of marzipan, white grapes and lemon zest fill the nose, complemented by notes of raisins, chocolate spread, brown sugar, orange zest, cinnamon, ginger and banana throughout the palate.
A miniature of Glenfarclas 40 Year Old. This is a classic sherried Glenfarclas, with notes of Christmas cake, dark chocolate and orange.

A well-rounded and flavoursome single malt from Australian distillery Starward, Left Field has been matured in Australian Red Wine barrels. Aromas of red apples, strawberry laces, apricot jam, orange peel, raspberries, ginger beer, vanilla and praline fill the nose, complemented by notes of sultanas, ginger cake, blackcurrants, dark chocolate and stewed fruit throughout the palate.

product_name: Mars Cosmo Wine Cask Finish Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2020 release of Mars Maltage Cosmo, that has been finished ex-wine casks, creating notes of blackberries, apricots and caramel throughout the palate.
A 1974 vintage whisky from Glenmorangie distillery in the highlands. This was aged for around 23 years before being bottled in 1997.
An old litre NAS Bowmore De Luxe which appears to have been bottled during the 1970s.
Released for global travel retail, Auchentoshan Blood Oak has been matured in a combination of bourbon and red-wine casks. Spicy with notes of red fruit and ginger.

A bit of a historical relic – this 10-year-old Lochside was released in the 1980s and remains the only official bottling from the distillery, which was closed in 1992 and demolished a short time later.

product_name:
Bowmore 15 Year Old
Glasgow Garden Ceramic (1988)
product_description: A special ceramic decanter release from the Bowmore distillery. This was released to commemorate the Glasgow Garden Festival in 1988. It contains Bowmore 15 year old, which has hints of white chocolate, exotic fruits and pepper.

An old 15 year old bottling from Bruichladdich on Islay. This dates, we estimate, from the 1980s when the distillery was under Whyte & Mackay ownership and comes in the tall bottle that was prevalent during that period.
An old bottling of Glenfarclas 15 year old whisky, in the rectangular bottle typical of the era. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.
An old release of whisky from Glen Grant, distilled in 1952 and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in 1996 after more than four decades of maturation.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the 2020 release of Arbikie 1794 Highland Rye whisky – a spicy, sweet grain whisky with aromas of cloves, nutmeg, Christmas cake and butterscotch on the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon, honey, earthy grains and dark muscovado sugar.
An old bottling of Glenfarclas 8 Year Old, which we estimate dates from the 1980s.

Bakery Hill Double Wood is distilled in Bayswater, Victoria, Australia. Aged initially in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, it's finished in French oak. Sweet with notes of marmalade and nougat.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Monymusk Whispering Breeze Coconut Rum Liqueur
product_description: Monymusk have named their coconut-flavoured rum liqueur Whispering Breeze. This can be used to add oomph to a Pina Colada.

A 1984 Cameronbridge single grain whisky from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single hogshead for more than three decades, before being bottled in February 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
An 8 year old Talisker from the 1980s, bottled for the Distiller's Agency and with a distinctive DT crest on the label.

A miniature bottle of Benriach 10 Year Old. A milestone release, this was the first core expression comprising spirit produced predominantly since the 2004 takeover by Billy Walker and his consortium. A classic Speyside whisky.

product_name:
Douglas Laing Remarkable Regional Malts Mini Pack
6x5cl
product_description: A cute gift pack containing six miniatures of Douglas Laing's Remarkable Regional Malts: blends that highlight the most prominent characteristics of whiskies from a particular region. A charming and delicious way to travel around the whisky flavours of Scotland.

product_name:
Caol Ila 1983
31 Year Old Signatory TWE Exclusive
product_description:
Long-aged Caol Ila can be excellent, and this is one of the best we've tried. With age, the smokiness of the whisky softens, revealing layers of fruit, gentle spice and elegance. A cracking dram, selected by and exclusively bottled for The Whisky Exchange. This was awarded 88 points by Serge Valentin of whiskyfun.com

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name: Gladstone Axe American Oak Blended Malt Scotch
product_description: A blend of Highland malt whiskies, Gladstone Axe has been matured in American oak casks, the bottle features a portrait of and axe-bearing William Gladstone, who as well as serving four terms as Prime Minister of the UK was a fan of felling trees in his spare time. Aromas of malty biscuits, soft oak spice, caramel and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of baked apples, barley sugar sweets, custard creams and honey throughout the palate.
A bottle of 1940 vintage Pride of Strathspey from an unnamed distillery and released by independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.
Knockando have been releasing their bottles with vintages rather than age statements for years, with this 1976 being bottled in 1990.

product_name:
Glenlivet 16 Year Old
Ladderfoot Sherry Cask
product_description:
Part of a series of single cask whiskies released to celebrate the spectacular landscape around Glenlivet, Ladderfoot is a sherry-matured 16-year-old single malt with rich notes of ginger, raisins, cinnamon, victoria plum and dark chocolate layered on top of Glenlivet’s classic orchard fruit and toffee character.


Ladderfoot takes its name from the eponymous farm situated at the bottom of the Ladder Hills. Many smugglers would have passed Ladderfoot on the ‘whisky road’ from the Braes o’Glenlivet to Fettercairn and the markets beyond, a long but quiet path that allowed them to deliver their illicit whisky to thirsty customers untroubled by the law.

product_name:
Legendaire Reserve
Vin de Paille Finish
product_description: An elegant, complex French single malt, Legendaire Reserve Vin de Paille has been finished in ex-Vin de Paille casks, creating aromas of toast, vanilla, peaches, apples and grapes that fill the nose and are echoed throughout the palate.
A 1950s release of Glenfiddich's Special single malt whisky, marked on the bottle as a Pure Malt.

product_name:
St Magdalene 1982
32 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1982-vintage St Magdalene from independent bottlersGordon & MacPhail as part of the Rare Old series. This was distilled the year before the distillery sadly closed, and was bottled in 2015 after around three decades of maturation.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a 1995 Invergordon single grain whisky from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single barrel for a quarter of a century, before being bottled in March 2021 as part of its Sovereign series.

A rye whiskey from Chicago's FEW distillery, named for temperance campaigner Frances Elizabeth Willard. This is rye heavy, with a touch of corn in the mix. Aged in air-dried oak barrels, this is a spicy offering.

product_name: Starward Left Field Single Malt Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of well-rounded and flavoursome single malt from Australian distillery Starward. Left Field has been matured in Australian Red Wine barrels. Aromas of red apples, strawberry laces, apricot jam, orange peel, raspberries, ginger beer, vanilla and praline fill the nose, complemented by notes of sultanas, ginger cake, blackcurrants, dark chocolate and stewed fruit throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1954
57 Year Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A dark and long-aged Glen Grant from Gordon & Macphail's scarily extensive archives of their whisky from the 1950s. This one was distilled in 1954 and sat maturing for well over 50 years, before being bottled in 2012.

product_name:
Banff 1966
49 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
This Rare Old whisky from Gordon & MacPhail was distilled at Banff in 1966. Aged for nearly five decades, this was bottled in 2015, more than three decades after the distillery closed.


Please note


The box is slightly scratched, as shown in the photograph.
A 1962 vintage Glenfarclas released as part of the Autumn 2014 tranche of the distillery's The Family Cask series. Matured in a single hogshead and bottled at full strength of 40.9%.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1955
57 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1955 vintage Glen Grant bottled by Gordon & MacPhail, owners of one of the most extensive collections of old casks, from Glen Grant and elsewhere, in Scotland. This has matured for 57 years, an impressive feat that very few distiller's spirits can stand up to - Glen Grant can.

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of rich, full-bodied single malt from Australian distillery Starward. Fortis has been matured in 100% American oak casks that previously held Australian red wines, mostly from Barossa Valley wineries. The palate offers notes of chocolate ganache, cinnamon, quince, raisins and lingering baking spices.

product_name: MB Roland Single Barrel Bourbon Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a single barrel bourbon from MB Roland that offers aromas of Maltesers, honeycomb, lemon curd and wild berries on the nose, complemented by notes of toasted corn, buttered popcorn, melted chocolate and fried bananas throughout the palate.
Peat Chimney is one of three blended malts for indie bottler Wemyss Malts. As the name suggests, this has lots of Islay whisky in the blend, with notes of tar and peat smoke.
The spicy entry in Wemyss Malts blended malts range, this uses a large proportion of Island malts in the blend.

Wemyss Malts name all their whiskies by their flavour profile, with the help of Charles Maclean, the whisky writer. The Hive selection of blended malts are intended to (as the name suggests) have a honeyed taste profile.

An ancient relic from Mannochmore’s distant past, this 37-year-old is an exotic beast with aromas of hot spice, black pepper and candied zest. The palate is considerably more mellow; the spice remains but is softened by citrus fruits and honeysuckle – summer blooms in a kitchen garden leading through a long finish full of spiced fruit cake and toasted almond. Don’t pass this up.

product_name:
Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1957
12 Year Old Bot.1970

product_description: An old bottling of 18-year-old Glenlivet. We estimate this was bottled in the 1990s.

product_name:
St Magdalene 1964
18 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice

Ghosted Reserve 26 Year Old
William Grant & Sons
product_description: Ghosted Reserve is a series of blended malt whiskies from William Grant & Sons. This first release is a 26 year old and contains whisky from closed distilleries including Inverleven and Ladyburn. This is rich and creamy with notes of citrus and almond.

product_name: Wilderness Trail 6 Year Old BIB Bourbon Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a single barrel bourbon from Wilderness Trail, made with a mash bill of 64% corn, 24% rye and 12% malted barley and matured in a single heavily charred barrel. Aromas of buttered popcorn, cinnamon French toast, salted butter and maple syrup fill the nose, complemented by notes of toffee, caramel, cherry jam and black pepper throughout the palate.

Part of Diageo's Special Releases 2015. Very rich and full flavoured, with tempting notes of dried fruit, gingerbread and cured meat, as well as leather and tobacco. A class act.

Tasting Notes (1)

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the fourteenth batch of Amrut's Kadhambam. This is a combination of unpeated and peated Amrut that started life in ex-oloroso casks before being transferred first into brandy casks, then into rum casks (both the rum and brandy having been produced at Amrut also). A curious mixture, but it works. This is a unique and thrilling whisky.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1961
52 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: An incredibly well-aged Glen Grant from indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail. Distilled in 1961 and aged in a first-fill sherry cask before being bottled at 52 years of age at the end of 2014. 1960s sherried Glen Grants are legendary for their complexity and this is no different.

product_name:
Brora 37 Year Old
14th Release Special Releases 2015
product_description:
The Brora bottling as part of Diageo's Special Releases 2015 has been bottled at 37 years of age – the oldest yet. Alluring aromas of bonfires, leather books and coffee, with peppery fruit on the palate. Beautifully balanced.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Clynelish Select Reserve 2nd Edition
Special Releases 2015
product_description:
Part of Diageo's Special Releases 2015. A blend of four different ages, this Clynelish has that trademark rich waxiness, along with refreshing green apple, lemon and grapefruit notes and a creamy mouthfeel.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Lagavulin 12 Year Old
15th Release Special Releases 2015
product_description:
Part of Diageo's Special Releases 2015. Very fruity and meaty, with Lagavulin's trademark smoke not far behind. A big, uncompromising whisky, and one that Lagavulin fans will enjoy.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Brora 1972
30 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 1972 vintage Brora as part of Douglas Laing's Old Malt Cask series. Distilled in March, this was aged for 30 years, yielding 204 bottles in April 2002, almost 20 years after the distillery closed.
Cask 2398 was a sherry butt from the legendary 1976 batch. this rare Ardbeg was bottled for the Feis Ile in 2004.

The second bottle in the Rosebank Roses series is Innocence, an intensely aromatic and utterly enchanting single malt with notes of honeysuckle, sweet cream, pear and rose petals. Bottled from a small number of casks, some of the last from this closed distillery, this is a beautiful dram and an essential part of any Rosebank collection.


The Rosebank Roses series has been created by Elixir Distillers, which previously operated under the name Speciality Drinks Ltd.

Tasting Notes (1)
An old release of whisky from Glen Grant, distilled in 1952 and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail around the turn of the 21st century.

Part of Paul John's Zodiac series, Mithuna is named after the Indian counterpart of the third Zodiac sign, Gemini. Matured in virgin American oak casks and finished in ex-bourbon casks, Mithuna offers aromas of liquorice, beeswax, sweet honey, crunchy toast and vanilla that fill the nose, complemented by notes of coffee, orange peel, dark chocolate, ginger, pepper and cinnamon throughout the palate. Try it now with this Perfect Measure sample bottle.

The 2013 bottling of Talisker 25 Year Old. Now bottled from refill casks at Talisker's traditional strength of 45.8% (80 proof), this is once again a classic iron-fist-velvet-glove Talisker par excellence.

Tasting Notes (1)

A legendary bottle of high-strength Springbank 12yo bottled in the 1990s when the company was filling their 'standard' bottlings with much older stock than was stated on the label. A fabulous Springbank that picked up 94 points from Whiskyfun's Serge.

A 1981 vintage Brora released by independent bottler Signatory as part of the Un-Chillfiltered Collection. Distilled on November 12, it was aged in refill sherry butt 1422 for 21 years before 927 bottles were yielded on February 28, 2003.

product_name: Filey Bay Peated Finish Single Malt
product_description: The first release from Yorkshire's Filey Bay to have been finished in an ex-peated whisky cask, marrying its light, fruity spirit with the coastal smoke of West Scotland. The palate offers notes of vanilla, caramel, peat smoke, sea salt, oranges and lemons that linger in the finish.
A fabulous old sherried Glenfarclas, released to commemorate the distillery's 150th anniversary on 23 May 1986.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old
Bot.1990s Pre Royal Warrant Litre

product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of 21-year-old single malt from Glencadam's rapidly-growing range. Bottled at a good drinking strength of 46%, this is a distillery of great potential and definitely one to watch.

A young and beautifully labelled 5-year-old whisky from Highland Park, which, we estimate, dates from the 1960s.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Brora 1982
33 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & Macphail
product_description: A 1982 vintage Brora released by independent bottlers Gordon & MacPhail as part of the Rare Old series of whiskies. The distillery closed in 1983 and bottlings are now increasingly sought-after.

The 2012 release of Talisker's consistently excellent 30 Year Old. Presented in orange livery (rather than the usual blue), this yielded 3,186 bottles at the distillery's traditional strength of 45.8%. Elegant and complex, this has the classic Talisker hallmarks of pepper and smoke, but in a softer and subtler way. Superb.

Tasting Notes (3)

A 1974-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 33 years in cask 17893, this was one of 186 bottled on June 1 2007.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.

McAfee's Benchmark is a rye-recipe Kentucky straight bourbon from the Buffalo Trace distillery, awarded 90 points by Wine Enthusiast and a former Gold Medal and Trophy winner at the International Spirits Challenge.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
Silk Cut Bot.1980s
product_description: This old bottling of Glenfarclas 15 Year Old was produced for Silk Cut. This is presented in distillery's classic rectangular-shaped bottle of the 1980s.

A 1950s release of Glenfiddich's Special single malt whisky, marked on the bottle as a Pure Malt.


Please note


This bottle has a bin-soiled label, as shown in the photograph.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
A very rare boxed bottling of Craigellachie for the Flora & Fauna series, which has since been discontinued. This has been aged for a full 14 years.

product_name:
Brora 1972
29 Year Old Old & Rare Platinum
product_description: A legendary bottling of 1972 vintage Brora from independent bottler Douglas Laing as part of the Platinum Selection series. This bottling was awarded an incredible average of 93 points from nine of the malt maniacs.

product_name:
Tamnavulin 1973
40 Year Old Rare Old Sherry Cask G&M
product_description: A Rare Old Tamnavulin from Gordon & MacPhail. Distilled in 1973, this was aged for 40 years prior to bottling in 2014.
Whisper Dry is Vya's lighter and less herbaceous sister to the Extra Dry. More than fifteen herbs are used including linden, orris and elecampane.
A small batch bourbon made in Kentucky by the Willett Distilling Company, aka Kentucky Bourbon Distillers, aged for about 12 years and bottled at the magical 107proof.

product_name: Zuidam Millstone 5 Year Old Lightly Peated
product_description: A young and interesting whisky from Dutch distiller Millstone - it's got medicinal peat but also a lot of the fruit that they've worked to get into their other whiskies.

A 2015 addition to the range, this 25-year-old Tomintoul would have been distilled around 1990, when the distillery was owned by Whyte & Mackay. In the hands of Angus Dundee since 2000, the brand has been marketed as 'The Gentle Dram' and its reputation continues to grow.

As strong on the nose as you’d expect from a 63% ABV bottling. Take your time though and, once the haze clears, find yourself in a bright garden of cut pine, summer fruits and coffee beans. On the palate, flowers bloom and dried fruit comes forward along with candied oranges and Christmas spice. Fresh oak rears its head toward the end but sweet citrus and juicy fruit win out into a long finish. A wonderful and rewarding whisky.

With only 350 bottles produced and the distillery now several years closed, the Karuizawa 1979 35-year-old might safely be called one of the rarest Japanese whiskies in existence. In the glass, it opens with an unapologetically alcoholic nose – no surprise given its substantial 58.8% ABV – but wait this out and be rewarded with wafts of gentle coffee and orchard fruit, fresh pine and rich soil. More delightful conflict awaits in the mouth, where wispy, spiced citrus wars with rich tobacco, old wood and a creeping hint of aniseed. A stunning example of Japanese elegance in whisky form.
A delightful old bottling of Dalmore at 20 years old. This was bottled in the 1970s, not long after the distillery had just been purchased by Whyte & Mackay.

A high-strength bottling of Girvan single grain whisky at 100 proof. Grant's became the first major company to release a range of single grain whiskies when the Girvan Patent Still series was launched in 2013.

product_name:
The Curious Bartender
Odyssey of Malt, Bourbon & Rye
product_description: This edition of Tristan Stephenson's The Curious Bartender is a guide to all things whisky. It covers the history, production and locations of whisky, as well as details of some whisky-based cocktails.

product_name:
Penderyn Madeira Gift Pack
2x5cl with Tasting Glass
product_description: A gift pack from Wales's Penderyn, boxing up a pair of mini bottles of their bourbon-matured, Madeira-finished whisky with a branded Glencairn tasting glass to pour them into.
An old bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old. Always a staple whisky throughout the world, it's consistently in the top few for worldwide market share. We estimate this was bottled in the 1980s.

A mix of bourbon and sherry casks matured for 19 years before the last two years are spent finishing in ex-Madeira casks, this is the top of Bushmills' regular range.

Tasting Notes (3)
An old bottling of 8-year-old Bowmore from the days before the distillery was sold to Stanley P Morrison. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.
An old bottling of 10-year-old Edradour, which we estimate dates from the 1990s. The distillery claims to be the smallest in Scotland and is also one of the most picturesque.
A richly-coloured 1973 vintage Glenfarclas released as part of the distillery's Autumn 2014 releases of The Family Casks. Aged in plain butt R1, this was bottled on 11 July 2014.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1963
Family Casks A14 Sherry Cask
product_description: A 1963 vintage entry in Glenfarclas's Family Casks range, part of the Autumn 2014 releases of single cask bottlings. Bottled in July 2014 it's a rich old traditional whisky from the distillery, packed full of sherry fruit.
Bottled in March 2014 from cask number 3054, this is a wonderful bottle of 1961 Glenfarclas from their acclaimed Family Casks series.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1961
Family Casks A14 Sherry Cask
product_description: Aged for more than 50 years, this 1961 Glenfarclas was been bottled for The Family Casks Series in July 2014. Big, bold and sherried.

This 1960-vintage Glenfarclas has been released as part of the 2014 tranche of the distillery's The Family Cask series. Matured in a single sherry hogshead and bottled at full strength of 42.2% on 9 July 2014.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1958
Family Casks A14 Sherry Cask #2065
product_description: A 1958 vintage Glenfarclas released as part of the Autumn 2014 tranche of the distillery's The Family Cask series. Matured in a single sherry hogshead and bottled at full strength of 40.2%.
A 1954 vintage Glenfarclas released as part of the distillery's Summer 2014 releases of The Family Casks. Aged in plain butt 1260, this was bottled in March 2014.
This Penderyn has been matured in bourbon wood before finishing in ex-Madeira casks. Bottled at a slightly lower strength than the standard Penderyn Madeira Wood for even easier drinkability.

product_name:
Glendronach 1971
43 Year Old Sherry PX Puncheon #2920
product_description: The oldest ever release in Glendronach's single casks series, this 1971 vintage was matured in a single Pedro Ximenez puncheon for 43 years, yielding 523 bottles in November 2014.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old Cask Strength
Batch 006 Bot.2014
product_description: The 2014 bottling of Laphroaig's excellent and popular 10 Year Old whisky at cask strength. This year's is a punch 58% – the Laphroaig we all know with everything turned up to 11!

product_name:
Glenesk 1980
33 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1980 vintage Glenesk released by independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail as part of the Rare Old series of whiskies. The distillery sadly closed in 1985 and bottlings are now increasingly sought-after.

A very special 34-year-old whisky from The Glenlivet, released in honour of their 150th anniversary on 31 August 1974.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

A bottle of Glenlivet's 'Unblended All-Malt' 20 year old whisky, bottled as a limited edition of 2400 bottles for the company's Italian importer Baretto. We believe this to have been released in the late 1960s, meaning the whisky would have been distilled immediately post-war in the 1940s.


Please note


This bottle has a torn neck label, as shown in the photograph.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
A stunning 1972 vintage Balvenie, distilled on 27 November, aged in a single cask for 30 years and bottled on 13 June 2003, yielding 135 bottles.

product_name:
Jim Beam Black 6 Year Old
Triple Aged
product_description: Jim Beam Black, the 'triple-aged' statement refers not to three different types of cask (as that would not be allowed under bourbon regulations) but to the 6 year old age statement, which is three times the minimum maturation period for straight bourbon.

product_name:
Highland Park Odin
16 Year Old Valhalla Collection
product_description:
The long-awaited fourth and final entry in Highland Park's The Valhalla Collection. Odin (aka 'The Furious One'), is a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character. Aged for 16 years in a combination of first-fill sherry casks and refill hogsheads, this is one not to miss.

Tasting Notes (3)

A rich and fruity Taiwanese whisky from Kavalan distillery, it has been finished in port casks, creating layers of warm spices and sweet fruits. The palate offers notes of red berries, sweet apples and cinnamon, balanced by ginger, dried fruit creamy vanilla.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Brora 1982
23 Year Old Sherry Cask Old Malt Cask
product_description: A 1982 vintage Brora from independent bottler Douglas Laing as part of the Old Malt Cask series. Distilled in November, it was aged in a sherry butt for 23 years, yielding 348 bottles in January 2006.

product_name:
Springbank 1995
18 Year Old Sherry Cask Renegade
product_description: This heavily sherried 18-year-old Springbank has been bottled by Mark Reynier as part of his Renegade series. Distilled in 1995, this sherry hogshead was aged for 10 years in Campbeltown and then moved to Bruichladdich for a further eight years.

product_name:
Brora 1982
21 Year Old Cask #274 First Cask
product_description: A 1982 vintage Brora from independent bottlers Direct Wines as part of their First Cask range of bottlings. This was distilled the year before a large cull of distilleries due to the decline in demand for single malts and bottlings are highly sought after today.

product_name:
Willett's Pot Still Reserve Single Barrel Bourbon
Magnum
product_description: A big still shaped decanter of Kentucky Bourbon Distiller's excellent Willett Pot Still reserve. A small batch bourbon named for the founders of the distillery.

product_name:
Brora 1981
24 Year Old Sherry Butt Signatory
product_description: A 1981 vintage Brora from independent bottler Signatory as part of the Cask strength Collection. Distilled on 1 December, it was aged in a sherry butt for 24 years, yielding 597 bottles on 28 April 2006.
A litre bottle of the older presentation of the now-defunct Aberlour 100 proof malt whisky, bottled at a punchy 57.1%.

A solid bourbon produced by, strangely, the folks of the Florida Caribbean Distilling company. They make rum and other spirits at their distillery in Florida, but this is made in Kentucky and selected by the company.
This litre bottle of Dufftown dates from the 1990s, in the last years of being able to use the Glenlivet suffix. Today the distillery is one of the select few under the Singleton banner.

A legendary Ardbeg, the 1974 Provenance first appeared in Europe in 1997 shortly after Glenmorangie's takeover of the distillery. This version of Provenance was for the US market and was introduced in 2000.
An old bottling of Glenfarclas 15 year old whisky, in the rectangular bottle typical of the era. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.

product_name:
Highland Park 30 Year Old
The Spectator 180th Anniversary

product_description: A seasonal edition of Spey Chairman's Choice follows a tradition whereby the chairman of the company would select his best casks to serve to his family on Christmas Day. This is a special Merry Christmas bottling for 2014.

The Irishman Single Malt is a hugely popular brand. Triple distilled and aged in both bourbon and oloroso sherry casks, this has plenty of ripe-fruit notes, along with vanilla sweetness, toasted nuts and apricot.

Tasting Notes (1)
A lovely old bottle of 1953 Talisker bottled, we estimate, in the 1970s by Gordon & Macphail. These 'eagle' bottles are highly prized by malt aficionados and are extremely difficult to find nowadays.

product_name:
Spirit of Hven Merak
Seven Stars No.2
product_description:
The second release in Spirit of Hven's Seven Stars series, Merak, is named after the eponymous star in the Plough. Matured in a combination of American, French and Spanish oak, this is spicy and herbaceous.

Tasting Notes (1)
Yukon Jack Jacapple Liqueur is a combination of blended Canadian whisky, spices and apple flavours. Liquid apple pie.

A miniature bottle of Penderyn Legend, matured in bourbon wood before finishing in ex-Madeira casks. Bottled at a slightly lower strength than the standard Penderyn Madeira Wood for even easier drinkability.

Kavalan Podium is aged in a combination of virgin oak and refill casks. A rich, fruity and sweet whisky with notes of honey, cherry and mango.

Tasting Notes (1)

An old bottling Glenesk bottled at 12 years of age. Used as the base malt to VAT 69, the distillery closed in 1985 and was also seen bottled under the Hillside name. We estimate this was bottled in the 1980s.

product_name:
Glenfiddich 8 Year Old
Straight Malt Bot.1960s
product_description: A historic bottling, this is one of the very first examples of single malt to be marketed as such. This 8-year-old Glenfiddich dates from the 1960s.

A very desirable bottle of Balvenie Classic, rare because it has a 12 year-old age statement, whereas most bottles we've seen are either 18 year-old or no-age-statement. Presented in the trademark bottle, we estimate this dates from the 1980s.

product_name:
Laphroaig 25 Year Old
Cask Strength Bot.2014
product_description: The 2014 bottling of Laphroaig's much-acclaimed cask-strength 25 year old. Matured in a combination of Oloroso sherry casks and bourbon barrels, both of which were first-filled.
A 1972 vintage from cult closed distillery Brora, bottled in 1993 by Gordon & MacPhail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range.

A 1981 vintage single-cask bottling of Brora from independent bottler Duncan Taylor as part of the Rare Auld series. Distilled in November, it was aged in cask 1423 for 25 years, yielding 682 bottles in February 2007.

product_name:
Glendronach 1968
25 Year Old Bot.1993 Sherry Cask

product_description: A limited edition of fewer than 2500 bottles from Tullamore DEW, made up of 18-year-old whiskey that was finished in a complex combination of oloroso sherry, port, madeira and bourbon casks. It's a spicy dram with a rich seam of fruity flavour running through the middle.

product_name:
Gordon & MacPhail Private Collection Ultra
4 Bottle Set
product_description: A real piece of Urquhart family history, this set combines the four releases from the Private Collection Ultra series – a decanter each of: 61-year-old, 1953-vintage Linkwood; 62-year-old, 1952-vintage Glenlivet; 63-year-old, 1951-vintage Mortlach; and 57-year-old, 1957-vintage Strathisla. An exceptional set of long-aged sherried whiskies. The set is without wooden boxes.

An official bottling of 12 year old Highland Park in the distillery's classic 1980s dumpy bottle. In 1979, the owners invested in marketing the single malt, which led to a massive increase in sales at the time this bottle would have been released.
A 1974 vintage Knockando and bottled just over a decade later in 1986. This was distilled just a few years after the number of stills at the distillery was doubled from two to four.
A bottle of Lakeland Liqueur, made by blending whisky with caramel and butterscotch – a classic and sweet whisky liqueur.
Kinahan's 10 Year Old Single Malt has been aged exclusively in bourbon barrels. This is a rich whiskey with notes of tropical fruit, mandarin, pepper and orange tea.

Inspired by Compass Box's regular Spice Tree, Spice Tree Extravaganza takes the idea and runs with it, adding older and more sherry-cask-matured whisky to create an even richer and spicier combination with an elegant character.

Tasting Notes (1)

A balanced eight-year-old bourbon with notes of caramel, vanilla, red fruits, apricots and spice. Wildcatter is made in homage to a short-lived bourbon label created by a notorious Texas oil baron who was known as the 'king of the wildcatters'.
Made for the release of the film Kingsman: Golden Circle. Notes of buttery leather, bold spice and sharp citrus.
A classic-style bourbon from Kentucky, Old Williamsburg, which is also kosher certified. Delicious notes of vanilla and coconut.

Released to celebrate the 80th anniversary of Nikka, this special edition of Taketsuru 21 Year Old is non-chill filtered, which has resulted in a welcome raise in abv to 48%. Nikka's blended malt is named after Nikka's founder – Masataka Taketsuru.

Joel Harrison & Neil Ridley's Distilled is a look into the world of spirits – from absinthe to brandy, vodka and whisky, and many more. With an overview of spirit categories, this is a must have for any drinks fan.

A special bottling of 10-year-old Glenmorangie to celebrate ten years of successful partnership between Bacardi-Martini and Glenmorangie in the UK. Distilled in 1992, it was aged in cask 1285, yielding 249 bottles.

Vit Hund (white dog) is Mackmyra's new-make offering, made using unpeated barley, watered down to drinking strength and bottled without ageing. With green apple and pear notes all the way through, this is typical of the distillery's house style.

Tasting Notes (1)

A very rare example of Islay whisky at this age. Distilled in 1968, this is a combination of five sherry butts, which were married together for the final year. An exceptionally complex whisky that any Islay fan will savour.

Tasting Notes (2)
An old release of Glenfarclas 15 year old whisky. Presented in an excellent square bottle with colourful label, we estimate this dates from the 1980s.
The first blended malt release from Hunter Laing, Highland Journey is a combination of single malts from the Highlands, aged in both American and Spanish oak.

product_name:
Very Xtra Old Fitzgerald 1956
10 Year Old Bot.1966

product_description: The sherried half of a pair of Karuizawas launched at The Whisky Show 2014. Hugely popular, the tasting bottles were emptied in the first few minutes of each day of the show and the whisky sold out not long after. An intense, savoury and spicy whisky.

One of a pair of mirror-image labelled bottles released at The Whisky Exchange Whisky Show 2014. This is the bourbon-matured half of the duo, although its deep and rich colour is more reminiscent of a heavily sherried dram. This sold out during the weekend of The Whisky Show.

One of the legendary Bowmore bicentenary releases, bottled in 1979 as part of their 200th birthday celebrations. Distilled in the 1960s and matured in some rather excellent sherry casks this is still considered to be one of the best Bowmores ever produced.

The 14th Special Release of Port Ellen is more elegant than last year’s – the wood tannins are subtle and the chamois leather not as prominent as one expects from Port Ellen – but that’s not a bad thing here.

Tasting Notes (1)

2014's Special Release of Brora is closer in style to the 2012 bottling rather than the earthier 2013. Aged in a combination of refill American and European oak, this has the classic Brora waxiness.

Tasting Notes (1)

This 1992 vintage Benrinnes, bottled at 21 years of age as part of Diageo's Special Releases 2014 is a big sherry-monster. Aged in sherry wood, this is a real meaty whisky – one for those who like their whiskies big and bold.

Tasting Notes (1)

The whisky from the 2014 Special Releases that will divide opinion, this is the first premium no-age-statement to appear in the range. A combination of five wood types and five vintages, this is incredibly complex and typically waxy.

Tasting Notes (1)

Cragganmore makes its first appearance in the Special Releases range for four years. Aged in refill American oak, it's rich, spicy and creamy.

Tasting Notes (1)
An old bottling of 1966 vintage Glenugie released as part of the Connoisseurs Choice series. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.

The pinnacle of the range, Spey Royal Choice is crafted from some of the oldest sherry casks at the distillery. Rich and spicy with a long finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

The newer, 46.5% version of a vatting of single malt from the Hanyu distillery built by Ichiro Akuto's grandfather with malt from the Chichibu distillery built nearby by Ichiro himself. A deliciously nutty dram.
The 1990 entry in the Macallan Fine & Rare series, this has been aged for well over 20 years before being bottled from a single cask.

The last and final release from the Ichiro's Malt Card series bottlings from the closed Hanyu distillery. The Joker "Monochrome", perhaps is the rarest and most sought after from this legendary series.

Originally produced for the American market, this is the oldest distillery bottling of Laphroaig, aged for 40 years and bottled at a cask strength 42.4%. Highly acclaimed by the whisky community, being awarded an average rating of 90 points by the Malt Maniacs.
An 8 year old distillery bottling from young Highland distillery Deanston. We think this was bottled in the 1980s, a decade for much of which the distillery was mothballed.
Dunville's 12 Year Old has ben aged in Pedro-Ximenez casks and bottled at Echlinville Distillery. The result is a sweet and lightly spicy whiskey with notes of bubblegum, custard and green apples.

Made in 1982 at Carsebridge distillery, this single grain whisky has been matured in a single refill butt for 35 years, before being bottled by Signatory Vintage in July 2019, as part of its Cask Strength Collection.
A classic bourbon created in the 1940s by five whiskey-loving brothers, Medley Bros offers notes of creamy vanilla, spicy black pepper and crunchy green apples.

Gordon & MacPhail have been storing casks of whisky for years which has given them access to gems such as this Glenlivet over the years - distilled in 1938 and bottled in the 1970s after more than 30 years of maturation.

A very appealing 1960s Dalmore released by indie bottler Cadenhead in November 1978 at 15 years of age.


Please note


This bottle has a slightly damaged cap, as shown in the photograph.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
A 1984 vintage Glenfarclas released as part of the distillery's Summer 2014 releases of The Family Casks. Aged in hogshead 6032, this was bottled on 27 March 2014.
A 1954 vintage Glenfarclas released as part of the distillery's Summer 2014 releases of The Family Casks. Aged in plain butt 1259, this was bottled on 25 March 2014.

An old bottling of Lagavulin at 12 years old bottled by "White Horse Distillers". This is a reference to the Lagavulin sharing the same ownership as the White Horse blend, of which Lagavulin is a major constituent part. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s. This version os the import in Italy by Carpano.

An ancient Mortlach 1938 bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in the 1980s. This vintage seems to have been something of an annus mirabilis for Mortlach, with Gordon & Macphail having released several stunning bottlings.
An old distillery bottling of Talisker 12 year old from the 1980s, featuring the Johnnie Walker Striding Man at the top of the front label.

An old distillery bottling of 1966 vintage Glenfarclas. It was aged for over three decades before being bottled in March 1997.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Spirit of Hven Dubhe
Seven Stars No.1
product_description:
The first release in Spirit of Hven's Seven Stars series, Dubhe, is named after the eponymous triple star system. matured in a combination of American, French and Spanish oak, this is spicy and herbaceous.

Tasting Notes (2)

Matured exclusively in Pedro Ximenez casks, this Irish single malt whiskey has a rich, fruity character with a clear sherry influence. Aromas of honey, raisins, marzipan, sherry and cinnamon fill the nose, complimenting notes of dried fruit, sultanas, plums and nutmeg throughout the palate.

An American single malt whiskey, made with locally grown and malted barley, and matured in lightly-toasted virgin American white oak casks. Fruity aromas of red berries, apples and pears mingle with creamy vanilla and brown sugar on the nose. The palate offers notes of baking spices, ripe fruit, sweet malt, tobacco, dark chocolate, oak spice and stone fruits that linger in the finish.

The age of the Knappogue Castle vintage malts has been sneaking up in the last few years since Bushmills took over the supply contract (early Knappogues were from Cooley). Here, finally, Knappogue has cast off its vintage and replaced it with a 12yo age statement. This Knappogue has been bottled without artificial colouring.

An incredible whisky from Bowmore, this was distilled in 1957 and aged for 38 long years before being bottled in the mid 1990s. A legendary bottling which received 93 points from Serge over on whiskyfun.com.

The rarest and (at time of release) oldest official bottling of Brora, this 1972 vintage was aged for 40 years, before being released exclusively for Travel Retail in 2014. Only 160 crystal decanters, with copper necks and a crystal stoppers were released for sale – a true piece of history from this long-closed, cult distillery.
An old bottling of long-aged Glen Grant bottled from independent bottler Gordon & Macphail. Distilled in 1948, this was bottled, we estimate, at over 30 years of age in the 1980s.
A sweet and spicy bourbon from The Willet Distillery, Old Bardstown offers aromas of caramel, oak, vanilla and hints of summer flowers that are echoed on the palate.
A rare old bottle of 8 year old whisky from Tomintoul which, we estimate, was bottled in the 1980s.

At 40 years of age, this is Balvenie's oldest regularly released bottling. Each new batch is created as the previous one runs low and is focused around a careful blend of old sherry and bourbon casks.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1979
21 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: An old bottling of 1979 vintage Port Ellen from independent bottler Douglas Laing as part of the Old Malt Cask series. Distilled in February, this was aged in a single cask for 21 years before 330 bottles were yielded in August 2000. The distillery sadly closed in 1983 and bottles are heavily sought-after.

An old litre bottling of 8 year old whisky from the Dufftown distillery bottled under their old coat of arms label. We estimate this dates from the 1970s.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

An old litre bottling of Dufftown-Glenlivet, bottled at 12 years of age. We estimate this dates from the 1980s, meaning it would have been distilled in the 1970s, a decade which saw the distillery double in size from four stills to eight.

A very popular island malt from Orkney, Highland Park 12 Year Old is smooth, smoky and heathery, with a lovely honeyed touch coming through on the finish. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1990s.

An old bottling Glenesk bottled at 12 years of age. Used as the base malt to VAT 69, the distillery closed in 1985 and was also seen bottled under the Hillside name. We estimate this was bottled in the 1980s.

The fifth in Bowmore's Tempest series of cask-strength 10-year-old releases. This one, the second under master blender Rachel Barrie, allies some of Tempest 4's softer side with the intensity and weight of the earlier editions – the best of both worlds.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenugie 1966
33 Year Old Silent Stills Signatory

New Riff Single Barrel Proof Rye
(51.3%)
product_description: A single barrel Rye whiskey from New Riff distilling, matured for four years before being bottled in 2020 at barrel proof. The result is notes of clove, nutmeg, toasted rye bread, oak and peppery spice throughout the palate.

The first organic Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford, Gaia 1.1 is made using 100% organic barley grown on seven different farms in Ireland. It has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon, virgin American oak, French oak and Vin Doux Naturel wine casks creating a fruity, spicy character.

A bottle of the extremely rare Glen Flagler single malt. Produced from stills housed within the Moffat grain complex between 1964 and 1985, this bottle was bottled at 8 years of maturation. Glen Flagler bottlings are very hard to find and are extremely collectable. We estimate this was bottled in the 1970s.

An official bottling of 12 year old Highland Park in the distillery's classic 1980s dumpy bottle. In 1979, the owners invested in marketing the single malt, which led to a massive increase in sales at the time this bottle would have been released.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name: Amrut Fusion and Paprika Popcorn Pairing Set
product_description:
Amrut Fusion and Joe and Seph's Smoked Paprika And Cheddar Cheese Popcorn is a match made in heaven. Try the pairing yourself with this set, which also includes a branded Glencairn glass to enjoy it from.


Amrut Fusion gets its name from the fact that it uses two barleys: Indian and Scottish - with the latter being peated for good measure. Fusion has been picking up awards ever since it first appeared in 2009.


Please note
