This single pot still Irish whiskey from Teeling is made with a combination of malted and un-malted barley, creating a creamy texture alongside a sweet, fruity character. Aromas of vanilla, stewed apples, cinnamon, apricot yoghurt and banana milkshake fill the nose, alongside rich sherry aromas. The palate offers notes of toasted barley, salted caramel, dark fruit, winter spice and rich nuts, with hint of red apples and milk chocolate.

A robust, spicy single malt from Israeli distillery Milk & Honey, matured in a combination of bourbon, virgin oak and shaved, toasted and recharred casks. Aromas of red apples, peach and nectarine are joined by oak spice, beeswax and honey on the nose. The palate offers notes of nutmeg, oak, cloves, honeyed orange peel and apple that linger on the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)

A 1982 vintage whisky from closed distillery Linlithgow (aka St Magdalene) bottled in mid-2011 by Signatory as part of the Cask Strength Collection. This was matured in a wine treated butt and has a rather pokey bottling strength of 63.1%.

product_name:
St Magdalene 1982
29 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: An Old Malt Cask bottling of 1982 vintage St Magdalene by Douglas Laing. This was distilled shortly before the distillery closed down, one of the victims of the early 80s whisky glut, and matured in a refill butt for 29 years.
A 1980s bottling of 8 year old whisky from Deanston, back in the days before they dropped the 'Mill' from their labels.
A post-1974 bottling (as they didn't use their own name before then) of single malt whisky from Deanston. This one has the added interest of the back label calling the whisky Deanston Mill...

A 1988 vintage from The Glenrothes, matured for almost 25 years before bottling. The palate has a silky mouthfeel with wonderful rich fruit and a weight and depth that belies its 43% bottling strength.

Tasting Notes (2)

A delightful old bottling of Dalmore at 20 years old. This was bottled in the 1960s, when the distillery had just been purchased by Whyte & Mackay. Serge Valentin on whiskyfun.com gave it 93 points and commented it was sweet, fruity and full of secondary flavours.
Distilled in 1956 and matured for almost two decades, this Highland Park single malt was bottled in 1974 and is presented in the distillery's historic dumpy bottle.
A 1956 vintage Highland Park, aged for 20 years and bottled in 1976 by the distillery in a dumpy bottle.
A Samaroli bottling of 1965 Ord, no mention of the Glen that now decorates their name, subtitled 'Bouquet'. Aged for 40 years and beautifully presented.

product_name:
Inchgower 1967
Bot.1988 Sherry Cask The Costumes
product_description:
A 1967 vintage Inchgower, released as part of the Italian bottlers Moon Import's legendary 'the Costumes' series. Released in 1988 after over 20 years maturation in an ex-sherry Butt, this was awarded 91 points on the Malt Maniacs' Monitor.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

A 1966 vintage Glenlossie released by legenedary Italian importer Moon as part of their 1988 series 'The Costumes'.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Avonside (Glenlivet) 1938
39 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: An late 1970s bottling of Gordon & Macphail's Avonside Glenlivet Highland single malt, matured in sherry casks for 39 years.

product_name:
Avonside (Glenlivet) 1938
33 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: An early 1970s bottling of Gordon & Macphail's Avonside Glenlivet Highland single malt, matured in sherry casks for 33 years.

product_name:
Strathisla 1937
35 Year Old Sherry Wood Connoisseurs Choice
product_description:
A 1937 vintage Strathisla, matured for 35 years and bottled by Gordon & Macphail under their Connoisseurs Choice Label.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.

product_name:
Strathisla 1937
34 Year Old Sherry Wood Connoisseurs Choice
product_description: A richly coloured bottle of 1937 vintage Strathisla, bottled by Gordon & Macphail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range 34 years later.
A 1980s release of 5 year old whisky from Tullibardine.

product_name:
Tomatin 1968
21 Year Old Sestante for Spinola
product_description: A 1968 vintage Tomatin, aged for 21 years and released in a 'kilted' bottle by Sestante for fellow Italians Spinola.

An old bottle of Tormore 10 year old. A relatively young distillery in Scotch terms, it was only founded in 1958 and production began in 1960, at a time when the Scotch whisky industry was booming. We estimate this was bottled in the 1970s.

product_name:
Strathisla 21 Year Old
Bot.1980s Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail

product_description: An extremely rare early 1980s Connoisseurs Choice bottling of 1966 single malt from closed distillery Millburn.

A Samaroli bottling of 1962 vintage Mortlach, bottled in the 1987 after 25 years of maturation.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Royal Lochnagar 1969
14 Year Old Sherry Cask Connoisseurs Choice
product_description: A 1969 vintage Royal Lochnagar bottled in the mid 1980s byt Gordon & Macphail for their Connoisseurs Choice range at 14 years old.

An old bottling of top selling Glenmorangie 10 year old. We estimate this was bottled in the 1960s. We're not sure why, but older bottlings of Glenmorangie 10 take on an oranginess, both in colour and taste and can be really intriguing.

A 7 year old whisky from Livet valley resident Glenfarclas, bottled sometime back in the 1970s.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
This bottle is missing the back label which shows that this whisky was distilled in 1948. Slightly damaged label, but good level. A very special old whisky bottled in 1969.
A rare bottle of pre-war Linkwood, distilled in 1938. Bottled at an impressive 44 years of age by independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail, this is a real collector's item.
A very rare old 1980s edition of 1949 vintage Glenlivet bottled at osme point in the 1980s by Gordon & Macphail.

A 1949 vintage Glen Grant from independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail. One of the minority of distilleries in Speyside that can take extended cask maturation, we estimate this was bottled in the 1980s and is therefore well over 30 years old.
A well aged Glen Grant bottled by Gordon & Macphail from their well stocked warehouses. This was released in the 1980s.

An impressive whisky liqueur from Drambuie, with the name celebrating both the legend of its creation during the Jacobite uprising of the 1740s and the company's large collection of Jacobite glassware.


A blend of 21 year old whiskies that was matured for a further 24 years in a mix of sherry and bourbon oak, for a total of 45 years, before mixing with Drambuie's secret recipe of herbs and spices.


The liqueur has been filled into an etched lead crystal decanter and is presented in a double doored wooden cabinet with a replica Spottiswoode 'Amen' glass and a leather bound book telling the story of the Jacobite collection. An impressive liqueur, which was a hit at the 2011 Whisky Exchange Whisky Show, and very limited, with only 100 bottles being produced.

The eleventh Port Ellen in Diageo's Special Releases series was distilled in 1979 and bottled at 32 years old. We reckon it's the best official PE in many years - sadly our allocation was completely pre-booked before the stock arrived.

Tasting Notes (1)

As reliably excellent as ever, the 2011 Special Releases Lagavulin 12yo was distilled in 1999 and vatted from refill American oak casks. As you'd expect, this is a very upfront, sooty-sweet Lagavulin in the classic style.

Tasting Notes (2)

A belated entry in Diageo's 2011 Special Releases selection, hitting the market in early 2012. Closed in 1985 and since demolished, whisky from the distillery is sought after by collectors and drinkers alike due to the comparatively small number of bottlings available. This 40 year old is one of the oldest we've seen, only beaten by the 2007 50 year old Special Release, and is sure to be popular amongst fans.

Tasting Notes (1)
A special distillery bottling of Mortlach released for Scotland's Insider magazine.

A 26 year old whisky from Glen Esk, closed in the 1990s and now increasingly hard to find even as an independently bottled spirit. This one was distilled back in 1974 and bottled in the autumn of 2000.
A 1975 vintage whisky from closed distilery Linlithgow, also known as St Magdalene, bottled at 24 years old by Signatory.

product_name:
Glen Grant 38 Year Old
Bot.1980s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A lovely old bottle of Gordon & Macphail Glen Grant, released in the 1980s (unusually in a green glass bottle) at the grand old age of 38 years old.

product_name:
Strathclyde Grain 2006
12 Year Old Distillery Edition
product_description: A 12-year-old Strathclyde single grain whisky from The Distillery Reserve Collection, matured in a single cask for more than a decade and bottled in August 2018.

product_name:
Thomas H. Handy Sazerac Rye
Bot.2011
product_description: The 2011 bottling of Thomas H Handy's Sazerac, the multi-award winning straight rye and one of the cornerstones of Buffalo Trace's yearly Antique Collection releases. A vibrant and super-spicy rye that won World Whiskey of the Year in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2013.

The first couple of batches of Bowmore's Tempest, a cask-strength 10yo vatted from first-fill bourbon casks, have been incredibly popular, and rightly so. This one continues in that same great vein, but with a more elegant touch and tantalising tropical fruitiness, especially with a drop of water and a few minutes in the glass. Our favourite batch so far, this is fabulous stuff.

Tasting Notes (1)
A long aged whisky from Gordon & Macphail, distilled at Strathisla back in 1949 just before the distillery was bought and rejuvenated by Chivas Brothers, and bottled in 2006 at 56 years of age.

A fine looking bottle of seldom seen whisky from Speyside's Strathmill, a replica of that bottled in the 1940s and emblazoned with original's price (12/6) and tax (8/5). This was bottled for Strathmill's Centenary in 1991 and was given only to staff.

A bottling of 1982 vintage whisky under the name of Linlithgow, the alternative title for the now closed St Magdalene distillery. This is a single cask bottled by Mackillop's at cask strength in April 2011 after 28 years of maturation.

product_name:
Brora 1983
18 Year Old Silent Stills Cask #40
product_description: A single cask 18 year old Brora bottled by Signatory for their Silent Stills series. This was distilled in 1983, the same year that the distillery closed, and is bottled at a cask strength of 52.9%.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old
Bot.1990s Pre Royal Warrant
product_description: An old bottle of Laphroaig 10 year old, bottled in the early 1990s before the company received the Royal Warrant from Prince Charles in 1994.
A litre bottle of 12 year old Dalmore, bottled by the distillery owners in the 1980s.

product_name:
Talisker 8 Year Old
DT Label Bot.1980s
product_description: An 8 year old Talisker from the 1980s, bottled for the Distiller's Agency and with a distinctive DT crest on the label.
An old bottling of 10 year old Macallan, very richly coloured and distilled during their days of using only the very finest sherry casks. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.
A 1976 vintage official bottling of Glendronach. This was aged in a mixture of seasoned oak and sherry casks and bottled at 18 years old, which has resulted in a complex and sherried malt.

A bottling of Longmorn from Connoisseurs Choice featuring their old skool black label. Distilled in 1955, when the distillery was still an independent with its own floor maltings, and bottled 24 years later.

product_name:
Milk & Honey Sherry Cask
Elements Series
product_description: The world's first whisky to be matured in Kosher sherry casks from Jerez, Spain. Robust aromas of red fruits, sweet malt, marshmallows and hints of tobacco fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, dried fruits, tobacco and gentle oak spice that linger in the finish.
An old style Connoisseurs Choice bottling of Glenugie, distilled in 1966 and bottled 16 years later.

product_name:
Springbank 12 Year Old
Bot.1990s Ceramic Decanter
product_description: A special edition 12-year-old Springbank presented in a black ceramic jug.

The third release in Teeling's Renaissance series was initially matured in ex-bourbon casks, before being finished for 18 months in Muscat wine casks and being bottled at 18-years-old in January 2021.
A bottle of 1977 vintage whisky from cult closed distillery Port Ellen. Independently bottled in 1992 by Gordon & Macphail as part of their Connoisseurs Choice series.

product_name:
Strathisla 8 Year Old
Bot.1980s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: An independent bottling of 8 year old Strathisla by Gordon & Macphail. We think this was bottled in the 1980s.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old Cask Strength
Batch 003 Bot.2011
product_description: The 3rd batch of Laphroaig's riotously popular small batch editions of their famed 10yo cask strength Islay single malt. No doubt this will be as big a hit as the previous editions - this is an expression that never disappoints.
An independent bottling of Macallan from Signatory, distilled in the same year that the distiller floated on the London Stock Exchange.
A great looking bottle of 8 year old Talisker, bottled for the distillery in the 1970s.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1964
30 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory

Port Ellen 1979
31 Year Old Old & Rare Platinum
product_description: A single cask, cask strength bottling from this cult silent distillery, produced in 1979 and matured for 31 years in a refill hogshead. It's packaged in a rather pretty fur lined wooden box as part of Douglas Laing's Old & Rare Platinum Selection range.

A marriage of two casks, one filled on April 29th 1996 and the other April 29th 1999, bottled by Macallan to celebrate the wedding of Prince William and Catherine Middleton on April 29th 2010.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.
A very appealing 1960s Dalmore released by master bottlers Cadenhead's in the mid-1980s (as evidenced by the use of the same font as The Goodies).
A 21 year old release from this closed distillery, formerly the twin of still running Clynelish. Bottled by Direct Wines as part of their First Cask series.
A 23 year old bottling of 1981 distilled spirit from cult closed distillery Brora. Bottled in the mid 90s for Direct Wines as part of their First Cask series.
A bottling of 14 year old whisky from this now closed east highland distillery. Distilled in 1978 the whisky is a vatting of 4 casks, bottled in 1993.

product_name:
Strathisla 8 Year Old
Bot.1970s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
A 1970s bottle of Strathisla 8 year-old bottled by Gordon & Macphail.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
A mid-1990s full strength bottling of a 1972 cask from extinct Lowland distillery Glenflagler by indie bottlers Signatory. Glenflaglers are extremely rare these days as the distillery closed in 1985.

The fourth release in Teeling's Brabazon series has been finished in Carcavelos white port casks and bottled at 13-years-old. Aromas of juicy melon, pear, runny honey and zesty lemon fill the nose, complemented by notes of warm hay, white grapes and crunchy red apples throughout the palate, with hints of milk chocolate and stem ginger.

product_name:
Lagavulin 16 Year Old
Bot.1980s White Horse Litre
product_description: A great looking litre bottle of Lagavulin 16 year old, bottled in the day' before the Diageo take over when the label still carried the name of White Horse Distillers, one of the branches of the Distillers Company that were included in the buyout.

product_name:
Brora 1972
30 Year Old Sherry Cask Old & Rare
product_description: A 1972 Brora bottled by Douglas Laing for The Whisky Shop in the early 2000s after 30 years of maturing in a sherry cask.

A special bottling of Glenfarclas to mark the distillery's 175th Anniversary in 2011. The casks used for this span six different decades, with the oldest cask being from 1952. A highly sought-after commemorative bottling.

Tasting Notes (1)
An old 1990s bottling of Bruichladdich for then-owners Whyte & Mackay's old Stillman's Dram series.
A fabulous 1960s bottling of Old Fitzgerald 6yo, with the wheat-heavy spirit produced in 1957 at Stitzel Weller, one of the greatest of the lost American distilleries.

product_name: New Riff Single Barrel Proof Rye Sample
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of a single barrel Rye whiskey from New Riff distilling, matured for four years before being bottled in 2020 at barrel proof. The result is notes of clove, nutmeg, toasted rye bread, oak and peppery spice throughout the palate.

New York based Gillies grew up in Edinburgh and used her expertise in jewellery making to create the elementally inspired bottle. It not only features the metallic net, but also a piece of Orkney sandstone carved with the Highland Park crest and a hidden silver replica of the Rose Window from Orkney's St Magnus cathedral inside the bottle, slowly revealed as the whisky is drunk.


This would mean little if the liquid itself wasn't also impressive and inevitably it is. Only 275 bottles were produced from a vatting of five casks, all filled in 1960, and it has the hallmarks of continuing Highland Park's reputation for superb old whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)

The second in Glenmorangie's series of Private Editions (the first being the hugely popular Sonnalta), Finealta has sparked interest in that some lightly peated barley has been used in its creation - supposedly inspired by an (ahem) recently-discovered 1903 order for Glenmorangie from the Savoy hotel. The name is Gaelic for 'Elegance', it says here, and Finealta has been matured in ex-sherry and plain new American oak casks.

product_name:
Macallan 20 Year Old
Masters of Photography Albert Watson
product_description: The second of Macallan's Masters of Photography series sensibly avoids the controversies of the first, with a special 20yo sherried whisky and a book of photos by Albert Watson on the journey of the sherry cask. The presentation box contains ten of these photos reproduced as special prints.

product_name:
Highland Park St. Magnus 12 Year Old
Edition 2
product_description: The second edition of Highland Park's Magnus series sees the former Earl elevated to sainthood after his canonisation following his murder by an evil relative.

A bottling of Balvenie's Founders Reserve from the 1980s, packaged in a rare cognac-style bottle. This whisky was a key member of the Balvenie range, albeit in less fancy packaging, from the early 80s onwards but was retired a few years ago.

A special bottling of two single sherry casks of 1968 selected for leading Glenfarclas collector Luc Timmermans (his birth year), who couldn't decide between them and made the sensible decision to vat them both together.
A very rare 1980s bottling of Ardbeg 1973, bottled at 46% by Glasgow's Moncrieffe & Co. for the Italian market.

A very rare 1970s decanter of Springbank 25yo.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
Matured in three different types of cask, each of which contributes extra nuances to what is destined to become a classic Irish malt. Perfect as an after-dinner dram.

product_name:
Tamnavulin-Glenlivet 20 Year Old
Sherry Cask Bot.1980s
product_description: A very old distillery bottling of sherried Tamnavulin 20yo, produced for the Italian market at some stage in the 1980s, when they were still using the '-Glenlivet' suffix.

A massive step up in quality from the standard Hakushu 12 yrs, this 18yo is amazingly well-defined (as we've come to expect from Japanese whisky) with deliciously rounded fruit and cereal flavours, at times surprisingly reminiscent of the finest Irish potstill whisky (eg Redbreast 15yo).

Tasting Notes (1)

Amrut Fusion gets its name from the fact that it uses two barleys: Indian and Scottish - with the latter being peated for good measure. Fusion has been picking up awards ever since it first appeared in 2009, and in 2012 was named the best whisky for a Rob Roy in the Ultimate Cocktail Challenge in New York.

Tasting Notes (1)
Myth is the sister whisky to Legend from Wales' Penderyn. Aged entirely in ex-bourbon casks, this is full of dried fruit and sweet flavours.

From the ever-dependable Wild Turkey operation comes one of the best straight rye whiskies around. Now at a new strength of 40.5%.

Tasting Notes (1)

One of the most consistently excellent of the super premium releases from Diageo, this cask strength Talisker 30yo is vatted from a mix of refill American and European oak casks and sadly limited to less than 3000 bottles worldwide.

Tasting Notes (1)
Usually an immediate sell-out, the 10th release of OB Port Ellen is from 1978 and has been bottled at 31 years old.

The 9th release of Diageo's revered Brora 30yo is, in our opinion, one of the greats. Gorgeous fruit, with much less emphasis on smoke & peat this time.

Tasting Notes (1)

The 2010 release of Balvenie 17yo is a bit of a curio, having been re-racked after inital normal maturation into casks that previously held...a peated Balvenie?! So this is a peated finish rather than a peated whisky. The smoke is there, but not as full-frontal as you'd get if the spirit itself was peated. A very interesting experiment, and we await the peated Balvenie that previously graced the casks with eager interest.
Maker's 46 is a higher strength release from Maker's Mark. Partly matured in barrels with new French-oak staves, which adds extra spice, sweetness and vanilla notes.

product_name: Woodford Reserve Masters No.10 White Corn
product_description: The 10th edition in Woodford Reserve's Master's Collection is made using white corn, rather than the usual yellow. This has resulted in a lighter and sweeter whiskey with notes of lemon custard, shortbread, white pepper and butter.

product_name:
Bruichladdich 1966
Bot.1983 Sherry Cask Moon Import
product_description:
This amazing sherry matured Bruichladdich 1966 was bottled in 1983 for Italian gastronome, wine critic and intellectual Luigi Veronelli.


Imported by Moon Import, this was an exclusive limited-edition made for the Italian market.
Naked Grouse has been relaunched as a blended malt. Based around sherry-matured whiskies from Macallan and Highland Park, this is rich and enticing.
A 1970s early outing as a distillery-bottled single malt for sophisticated Speysider Glenrothes. From back in the days when 8 years old was considered pretty old for whisky. A very rare bottle.
A very limited-edition official bottling of Glenfiddich 40yo, originally released in 2002.

product_name:
Speyside 1958
 40 Years Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A very special Glenfarclas 1958, bottled by Signatory at forty years old in 1998 as the jewel in the crown for their tenth anniversary celebrations. Less than 500 decanters were produced from a single sherry butt. An incredible 95.59 points in Whiskybase.
A Perfect Measure sample bottle of Knob Creek Rye. Not as spicy as many ryes, this is a great in-between release, sitting between a high-rye bourbon and a pure rye to give the best of both worlds

An Australian straight rye whiskey from The Gospel, made using single-source grain from near Melbourne. Aromas of buttery rye bread, toffee, vanilla and white pepper fill the nose, complemented by notes of clove, pepper, green apple and caramel throughout the palate.

product_name:
Glamis 10 Year Old
Glenfyne Distillery Bot.1930s
product_description: An extraordinary find, this is one of the rarest single malts we've ever come across. Glamis is the single malt from the long-extinct Glenfyne distillery (sometimes also known as Glendarroch), which was situated in Ardrishaig on the edge of Loch Fyne and closed in 1937.

product_name:
Wilderness Trail 6 Year
Old Bond Single Barrel Bourbon
product_description: A single barrel bourbon from Wilderness Trail, made with a mash bill of 64% corn, 24% rye and 12% malted barley and matured in a single heavily charred barrel. Aromas of buttered popcorn, cinnamon French toast, salted butter and maple syrup fill the nose, complemented by notes of toffee, caramel, cherry jam and black pepper throughout the palate.

The 2017 vintage of single malt distilled in England's picturesque Cotswolds, released as a limited edition. This is no novice whisky, however, it's a highly enjoyable dram with notes of orange peel, spice, oaky malt and dark sugar

A superb Irish single malt, with a creamy character and a wonderfully smooth palate. Very drinkable.

Tasting Notes (2)

Svensk Rök is a peated expression from Sweden's Mackmyra. With juniper added to the kiln, this is spicy, smoky and made exclusively using Swedish ingredients.

Tasting Notes (1)
An old 1980s screenprinted bottle of Highland Park 12yo.

product_name:
Glenlivet 8 Year Old
Bot.1960s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A lovely old 1960s bottle of Glenlivet 8yo with Gordon & Macphail's famous Smith's label.

One of the stupendous cask strength Longrows bottled in the 1980s by legendary Italian bottler Samaroli. These extraordinary whiskies from Longrow's first vintage sealed the reputation of Springbank's peated malt.

product_name:
Evan Williams White Label
Bottled in Bond
product_description:
A bottle of Evan Williams' higher-strength white label at 100 proof. Evan Williams is revered as the first ever commercial distiller in Kentucky (he started in 1783). Today, the whiskey bearing his name is made by Heaven Hill and is the second-biggest bourbon brand in the US.

Tasting Notes (1)
Essential for fans of Japanese whisky, this is elegant and delicious. Hakushu is owned by Suntory, the company that founded pioneering Japanese distillery, Yamazaki.

An old bottling of 12 year old Glenlivet, consistently amongst the top selling Scotch whisky brands in the world. We estimate this was bottled in the 1960s, a decade which saw the distillery lead the way, both in becoming the first whisky to be marketed as a single malt and the first Scotch distillery to open a visitor's centre.

product_name:
Ardbeggeddon 1972
29 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description:
A very special Ardbeg 1972, bottled from a single sherry cask to commemorate the Plowed Society's Ardbegeddon gathering in Las Vegas in 2002. A legendary bottling that won huge critical acclaim on release and remains highly sought-after.


Please note


This is limited to one bottle per customer.
A very rare 28yo Laphroaig 1967 bottled in the mid 1990s by Direct Wines for their First Cask series (not to be confused with the more recent Dutch independent bottlings of the same name).

Benrinnes is another Diageo distillery of which very little is seen. Most of the malt produced at Benrinnes is used as blend fodder, so it's great to see a debut single cask bottling to sit alongside the Flora & Fauna version and 2009's acclaimed Special Release 23yo.

Another of Springbank's legendary full strength Local Barley single cask bottlings from 1966. This one picked up a humungous 94 points from Whiskyfun's Serge Valentin.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Garioch 1968
29 Year Old Cask No.614
product_description: One of a string of single cask 1968 Glen Gariochs bottled in the late 1990s at 29 years old. 29 years old! You wouldn't get too many whisky companies doing that these days, so kudos to then-owners Morrison Bowmore for bottling when the time was right instead of waiting another year.

Cask 13 is part of a series of legendary 25 year-old Glendronach 1968s bottled by the distillery exclusively for All Nippon Airways in the early 1990s. These extraordinary sherry casks are generally acknowledged by connoisseurs as the best Glendronachs ever bottled.

A single European oak cask of Glenkinchie 1992, bottled in 2009 as part of Diageo's Managers' Choice range. Along with the Dalwhinnie, this is one of the oldest bottles in the series.

Tasting Notes (1)

A single cask of Inchgower 1993, bottled in 2009 from European Sherry Oak by owners Diageo for the Managers' Choice series. Amazing colour on this.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Rosebank 1991
17 Year Old Cask #05 The Single Malts Of Scotland

product_description: The trademark note in Nikka’s Miyagikyo whisky is an elegant fruitiness. This is the ideal introduction to Japanese whisky, and is a moreish dram loaded with red-berry fruitiness.
A wonderful old bottling of the increasingly rare Knockando 1965 Extra Old Reserve. This version was bottled in 1990.
One of a series of classic Connoisseurs Choice bottlings of Ardbeg 1974 from Gordon & Macphail. These are approaching legendary status now.
A 1963 vintage Strathisla by veteran independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail. Bottled in 2008 at well over 40 years of age, this should be a classic example of old sherried Speyside whisky.

An old release of 19-year-old Glendronach aged in sherry casks and bottled for the American market in, we estimate, the early 1990s.


Please note


There is a small tear on the seal, as shown in the photograph.

A special 1974 vintage whisky from Glenmorangie distillery. This has been matured for approximately 22 years and bottle in 1996.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1976
Bot.1998 Cask #4758-59 Dun Eideann
product_description: A very rare Port Ellen bottled by Signatory for their Dun Eideann range from two of a series of famously excellent 1976 vintage casks. This should be very special.
This rare Longrow from the 1980's does not come up very often. We believe only a small batch was done which was sold only through the Cadenheads shop in Edinburgh.

product_name:
Brenne Estate Cask French Single Malt
Cognac Finish
product_description: An unusual dram from France, twice distilled in the copper alembic stills normally used in Cognac production. The Cognac theme is further continued in the whisky's aging process, as after a period of maturation in new Limousin oak barrels it is then finished in Cognac casks. The result is a single malt with intense notes of apricot, banana, rose, vanilla and bubblegum. One for those with a sweeter tooth.

An Indian single malt from Rampur, distilled in the picturesque foothills of the Himalayas and matured in a combination of ex-bourbon casks and ex-Cabernet Sauvignon casks. Aromas of honeysuckle, lychee and tobacco open on the nose, followed by orange zest, green bananas and sweet baking spices. The palate offers notes of cinnamon and clove, marmalade, savoury malt and sweet lychee, with black pepper lingering in the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)
A very rare bottle of the first Clynelish Flora & Fauna edition.
A litre bottle of the Dalwhinnie 15yo, one of the gentlest drams around, and a great beginner whisky. A founder member of Diageo's Classic Malts selection.

product_name:
Macallan 12 Year Old
Robert Burns Semiquincentenary
product_description: A very elaborately-packaged Macallan released to celebreate the 250th Anniversary of the birth of Robert Burns. A vatting of two casks from different years that both bore the number 1759 (the year of Burns' birth), this comes in an unusually pretty decanter with an insert containing a map and a Burns poem as well as information about the bottling.

"Candela is the international unit for the measurement of the intensity of light. It defines brilliance. So it seemed appropriate to name one of our brightest creations after this international standard. And whilst its brilliance transcends mere luminosity, we believe few other whiskies shine as brightly."


Official notes by The Dalmore

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Grant 1976
32 Year Old Sherry Butt Old Malt Cask
product_description: A beautiful deep, dark colour on this Glen Grant 1976, bottled from a single sherry butt by Douglas Laing for their Old Malt Cask range.

This is only the second ever official bottling of Glenfiddich 50 year old, and has been created from two casks (a 1955 and a 1957) married for six months before bottling. Just 500 bottles of this extraordinary whisky have been created. They are released on a strict global allocation of 50 bottles per year for the next ten years. Each bottle is decorated with Scottish silver, sealed with a waxed engraved medallion and is housed in a hand-sewn leather box with a leather bound book and signed certificate.
A very old and rare bottle of Talisker 1955 bottled by Gordon & Macphail.
An old bottle of Connoisseurs Choice Brora 1972, bottled in 1993.
A small-batch cask-strength bourbon from Maker's Mark that offers notes of caramel, cinnamon, vanilla and tobacco on the palate, alongside raisins, baked apples and custard.

Not to be confused with the malts from Kininvie released under the same name, this Hazelwood was blended from 100 casks in 2001 to celebrate the 100th birthday of Janet Sheed Roberts, grandaughter of William Grant, founder of Glenfiddich, the malts and grains used in this blend are all from the family distilleries. Originally only available to employees, this is a rare collector's item.

Monkey Shoulder is a mix of three different Speyside single malts and is great with mixers or just on its own. Smooth, sweet and very easy to drink.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Grant 42 Year Old
Bot.1970s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description:
An old 1970s bottling of some very old Glen Grant. This should be spectacular.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

A beautiful embossed bottle of Old Bushmills Pure Malt. This is the first of its kind we've seen, and we estimate it to be from the early 1900s. Amusingly, this bottle displays the correct distillery establishment date of 1784, rather than the 1608 they tout around now.
A rare old 29yo Dalmore bottled by Whyte & Mackay for their now-defunct Stillman's Dram series.
One of the first editions of Glenfiddich 40yo, bottled in 2000.

product_name:
Linlithgow 1975
22 Year Old Silent Stills Signatory
product_description:
A rare cask-strength bottling of the now-defunct Linlithgow (aka St. Magdalene). This single cask from the 1975 vintage was bottled in the late 1990s by Signatory for their Silent stills series.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

The replacement for the hugely popular Elijah Craig 12 Year Old, this no age statement bourbon is created from spirit aged between eight and 12 years old. Notes of nuts, vanilla, coconut, dark fruit and caramel.
A 1990s bottling of Glenugie 1967 for Gordon & Macphail's Connoisseurs Choice series.

A very old early 1980s Connoisseur's Choice bottling of Glenugie 1966, this was bottled at 15 years old. As Jim Murray once said, "...this distillery never seems to let you down. The rule of thumb is: find a bottle of Glunugie and you'll find liquid gold." (Whisky Bible 2008)
The 9th Port Ellen Annual Release is the first official 30yo and a definite return to form after a couple of 'mediocre' releases.

product_name:
Laphroaig 10 Year Old Cask Strength
Batch 001 Bot.2009
product_description: The first batch of the Laphroaig Cask Strength 10 Year Old, released in 2009.
A recent addition to Balvenie's tremendously successful releases of finished 17yo's, this has been finished in Madeira wine casks for a delicious combination of sweetness, spice and dry oak.
The replacement for the hugely popular Elijah Craig 12 Year Old. Notes of nuts, vanilla, coconut, dark fruit and caramel.

product_name:
Pe1 - Elements of Islay
Sherry Cask
product_description:
Here at last - our Elements of Islay Pe1!! Unlike our other Elements bottlings, this is from a single cask, so we've not got a lot. Serge over at Whiskyfun rated this at 93 points (cheers, Serge!). Missed a Malt Maniacs gold by a single point in 2009.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Gold Bowmore 1964
44 Year Old The Trilogy
product_description:
44 years of quiet maturation in the famous number one vaults, has allowed an exceptional and rare example of Bowmore single malt to develop – the oldest one ever to be released from the distillery.

Tasting Notes (1)

A duty-free exclusive released at the turn of the millennium, this is a blend of malts aged between 10 and 25 years old. Due to the careful blending, this is a complex and impressively flavoursome malt.

product_name:
Highland Park 1977
21 Year Old Bicentenary Repatriation
product_description: The re-packaged version of the famous Highland Park Bicentenary bottle. Although the original version was believed to have sold out on release in 1997, hundreds of bottles were found in a Japanese warehouse in 2008.

product_name:
Karuizawa 1967
42 Year Old Cask #6426 TWE 10th Anniversary
product_description:
Here it is - the legendary Karuizawa 1967 42yo from cask 6426. The oldest and most famous Karuizawa ever bottled when it appeared at the tail-end of 2009, we only ever had around 200 bottles of this one, and after Whiskyfun and Whiskynotes both gave it humungous 95 point scores, it sold out in a little over 24 hours.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Brora 1981
28 Year Old Sherry Cask Old & Rare Platinum
product_description:
A Brora 1981 bottled at cask strength (aged 28yo) by Douglas Laing for their Old & Rare Platinum Selection. Smart new boxes on these new Platinum Selections.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.
A superpremium Glen Elgin 1998 bottled at full cask strength, this is part of Diageo's Managers' Choice series of single casks bottled in 2009.
An old release of Glenfarclas's 105 proof whisky. This whisky was 8 years old at the time of bottling, which we believe was during the 1980s.

The fourth official release of Bruichladdich's heavily-peated Port Charlotte single malt came out in 2009, arriving the same week that it was named Best Whisky at the 2009 Whisky Fringe in Edinburgh. PC8 Ar Duthchas has been amongst the most highly-regarded of this hugely sought-after series ever since.

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1962
Sherry Cask #2647 Family Cask III
product_description: The third release of 1962 Glenfarclas in their Family Casks range and it's a belter - a big sherry monster in a range of sherried beasts. Serge Valentin on Whiskyfun.com gave it 92 points and tipped it as being better than their excellent 40 year old...

product_name:
Glenfiddich "De Luxe"
Silver Stag Decanter Bot.1980s

product_description: A beautiful set containing a bottle of Glenfarclas and 4 glasses. The set was commissioned to celebrate the 150th anniversary of the distillery on Friday 23rd May 1986, with the casks personally selected by John Grant.

product_name:
Angel's Envy Bourbon Sample
Port Finish
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of Angel's Envy, an interesting bourbon with a unique twist - after the initial maturation it takes a leaf out of Scotch Whisky's book and spends between 3 and 6 months finishing in port barrels. The more experimentation the better, we reckon, especially when it turns out something like this - marrying the sweet caramel and grain of bourbon with the rich sticky wine flavours of a port cask.
A 1980s bottling of 8 year old Highland Park, with the old label picturing the distillery.

product_name:
Glenury Royal 1973
24 Year Old Silent Stills
product_description: A late 1990s bottling of a single cask Glenury Royal 1973, bottled at full strength for Signatory's Silent Stills series.
A bottle of 8 year old Dalwhinnie, bottled by the distillery in the 1980s and presented in their livery of the time.

product_name:
St Magdalene 1964
17 Year Old Connoisseurs Choice
product_description: A very rare bottling from St Magdalene distillery. This 1964 vintage whisky has been matured for 17 years and bottled by Gordon & Macphail for their Connoisseurs Choice series. We can't get enough of these old-style brown labels.
The 2020 release of Nikka Taketsuru blended malt whisky is a smoky, full-bodied whisky with notes of rich oak spice, aromatic peat and sweet flowers throughout the palate.

product_name: Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage 2012 Bourbon
product_description: A 2012 vintage single barrel bourbon from Evan Williams, bottled in November 2019. Spicy aromas of chilli flakes and cedar wood are tempered by caramelised walnuts and buttered corn fill the nose, complemented by notes of peanut butter, rye toast, popcorn, pepper and coconut on the palate.

A special edition of Macallan 10yo, selected by disgraced former Speaker of the House of Commons Michael Martin for sale at the tourist shop in the Houses of Parliament. An interesting historical piece, as Martin was forced to resign shortly after this version had appeared, meaning it was only available for a very short time.

product_name:
Four Roses Barrel Small Batch Limited Edition Bourbon Tasting Set
6x3cl
product_description: Explore the annual release of Small Batch Limited Edition bourbon from Four Roses with this Perfect Measure tasting set. This set includes a 3cl sample bottle of each of the following: Four Roses Barrel Strength Bottled 2014, Four Roses Barrel Strength Bottled 2015, Four Roses Barrel Strength Bottled 2016, Four Roses Barrel Strength Bottled 2017, Four Roses Barrel Strength 130th Anniversary Bottled 2018 and Four Roses Barrel Strength Bottled 2019.
Part of Bowmore's tradition of commemorating Scottish sporting events with limited edition special bottlings, this one is in honour of the 1996 international horse trials at Blair Castle.

product_name:
Glen Elgin 14 Year Old
United Distillers Christmas 1990
product_description: This 14-year-old Glen Elgin was never commercially released. Distilled in the mid 1970s, it was bottled exclusively for United Distillers staff for Christmas 1990.

product_name:
Bimber Oloroso Cask Finish Sample
Batch 4
product_description: A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the fourth batch of oloroso sherry cask whisky from west London distillery Bimber. Initially matured in first-fill ex-bourbon casks to create layers of creamy vanilla and caramel, it was finished in Spanish oloroso sherry casks, giving notes of fruitcake and walnuts that linger in the finish.
A mini bottle of the Gaelic Whisky's well aged 21 year old bottling of Poit Dhubh, powerful with balanced smoke and sherry wood.
A mini bottle of Gaelic Whisky's 12 year old Poit Dhubh blended malt, medium bodied with some dark smoky notes. This an elegant yet complex whisky.
A long-aged Tomintoul 1976 bottled in 2007. Something of a departure packaging-wise as well.
An old Signatory bottle of Linlithgow, distilled in 1982 and bottled from a single cask in 2000.
Old Forester Bourbon is made in the same style as when it was first introduced by George Garvin Brown in 1870. High in rye content, this is full bodied and rich.
A miniature of Glenfarclas's wonderfully sherried 15 year old.
A bottling of 8 year old Glenfarclas from the 1970s, the days when they still suffixed their name with a "-Glenlivet".

A very special bottle of Aberlour 30 year old. This whisky was distilled in 1966 and has been aged for 30 years. This whisky has been matured in a mix of two Sherry butts and one bourbon hogshead. It was originally 52.1%, but has been reduced down to 43% for bottling. Limited to just 1000 bottles.

product_name:
St Magdalene 1982
26 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: Another bottling from the much-lamented St. Magdalene distillery by Douglas Laing for the Old Malt Cask series, this has been matured in a refill butt.

A really incredible Glenfarclas - a forty-year old expression of cask-strength cult favourite 105, bottled late in 2008 to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the appearance of the 105 expression. It's astonishing that they managed to maintain the 60% abv over forty years in sherry casks - this will be an epic dram.

Tasting Notes (1)

The seventh release in Penderyn's Icons of Wales series, this is a rich sherry-finished single malt inspired by the Welsh legend of Rhiannon. Sweet aromas of vanilla, oak, red berries, blackcurrants, hazelnuts, pears, marzipan and sultanas fill the nose. The palate offers creamy notes of caramel, figs, red berries, frangipane, chocolate ganache and coffee.

Something of an oddity, here - this Macallan 1947 was originally bottled for Italy in 1962 as a fifteen year-old, before being repackaged for the Fine and Rare range. This is likely to be more peaty than today's Macallan, as the distillery was forced to use peat in the kilns for a few years during and after WWII because of the scarcity and high price of coal.

product_name:
Brorageddon 1972
30 Year Old Sherry Cask Douglas Laing
product_description: A special bottling of 1972 Brora for members of the PLOWED Society in the early 2000s after 30 years of maturation. They like their whiskies big and this doesn't seem to have disappointed.

product_name:
White Bowmore 1964
43 Year Old The Trilogy
product_description:
White Bowmore has been gradually maturing in six bourbon casks


in the distillery’s famous No 1 vaults since 1964; they have now been bottled as a coveted collector’s item for whisky connoisseurs throughout the world. An extraordinary melange of pure tropical fruit character with venerable oak and maritime notes.

Tasting Notes (4)
A second batch of 27 year-old sherried Laphroaig, this time from 1981. Bottled from just five Oloroso sherry butts - the same as 2007's 1980 vintage which won the top prize at the Malt Maniac Awards.

A hand-picked blend of sweet and spicy bourbons, Yellowstone Select is a classically-flavoured bourbon with plenty of character. On the nose there are notes of rye spice and sweet cherries, the palate brings rich, smoked caramel and finishes with brown sugar and oak flavours.

One of the oldest Glenmorangies ever released, this is a full-bodied, sweet and fruity whisky showing unmistakeable signs of long ageing in wood, plus the effect of additional finishing in casks that previously held sweet fortified wine from the Andalucian province of Malaga. This is a one-off limited edition small batch whisky, with just 2597 bottles relased in 2005.
A rare single cask ex-bourbon Longrow bottled around ten years ago by Murray McDavid.

product_name: Woodford Reserve Old Fashioned Gift Set
product_description: A lovely gift set from Woodford Reserve that celebrates the Old Fashioned. This set includes a bottle of Woodford Reserve Distiller's Select bourbon and a bottle of Old Fashioned cocktail syrup.
A rare 1970s distillery bottling of no-age-statement whisky from Glen Esk, which closed in 1985 and has since been repurposed as a maltings.

Sazerac is a terrific spicy rye from Buffalo Trace in a great old-time bottle. We understand this to be six years old. Great in a Manhattan, especially with Carpano's Antica Formula vermouth.

Tasting Notes (2)
A rare old bottle of Glenfarclas at the now-discontinued age of 8 years. We reckon this was bottled in the 1970s.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1954
51 Year Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A dark and long aged Glen Grant from Gordon & Macphail's scarily extensive archives of their whisky from the 1950s. This one was distilled in 1954 and sat maturing for over 50 years.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1953
52 Year Old Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1953 vintage Glen Grant, bottled at 52-years-old by Gordon & Macphail. This was an important year for the distillery, as they merged with Glenlivet to form the imaginatively titled Glen Grant and Glenlivet Distillers Ltd and commenced the expansion that led to the latter being the second biggest malt in the world.

product_name:
Single Malts Discovery Mini Pack (Talisker 10
Cardhu 12 Singleton 12)
product_description: A trio of miniature bottles exploring different styles of single malt, including Talisker 10 Year Old, Cardhu 12 Year Old and Singleton 12 Year Old.

product_name:
Singleton of Auchroisk 20 Year Old
20th Anniversary
product_description: A special bottling of Singleton of Auchroisk to commemorate the distillery's 20th anniversary. This would have been produced using some of the first spirit to run off the stills in 1974 and was bottled 20 years later in 1994.

A famous old expression of The Macallan 30 year old, matured entirely in sherry oak casks. This was the last edition of the sherried 30yo before the introduction of the Fine Oak series, and also the last 30yo before Macallan revamped their bottle shape and packaging, ditching the wooden boxes for 25yo and 30yo.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.

A 1970 vintage Hillside bottled as part of the Rare Malts series. Dormant from 1899 to 1938, Glenesk reopened as a grain distillery. Converted to a malt distillery, it was renamed Hillside in 1964, then renamed back to Glenesk around 1980 before being closed for good in 1985. Bottlings from this distillery are highly sought after.
A rare 1970s bottling of whisky from since demolished Glenury Royal, bottled at 12 years old under the label of John Gillon and Company.

A special commemorative bottling of 1979 vintage Glentauchers released by Gordon & MacPhail to celebrate 100 years of production at the distillery in 1998. The malting began in May 1898, with the first spirit running from the stills the next month.

product_name:
Glenlochy 1968
39 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 2008 bottling of 1968 vintage from Glenlochy, part of Gordon & Macphail's Rare Old Series, mining their warehouses for interesting old casks that rarely see the light of day. Bottlings are increasingly rare, especially as the distillery closed in 1983 and was demolished in the 1990s, especially of casks this old.
A 1960s distillery bottling of Glenfiddich's 15 year old whisky. This has a fantastic label, with a great pre-SWA regs description of 'Unblended All-Malt Scotch Whisky'.

product_name:
Dalmore 150th Anniversary Crystal
Sherry Cask Bot.1989
product_description: A decanter created in celebration of the 150th anniversary of Dalmore's 1839 founding. Made by Edinburgh Crystal and with a metal medallion engraved with the Dalmore stag crest and bottle number. We believe this contains a 30 year old malt and was only made for staff and is one of only 50 bottles.
A very rare bottling of Bowmore 1973 presented to guests at a banquet held in 2001 to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the original Stanley Morrison company.

product_name:
Bowmore 10 Year Old
Provident Mutual 150th Anniversary
product_description: A rare Bowmore ceramic decanter produced for Provident's 150th anniversary.
An early 2000s litre bottle of the now-defunct Aberlour 100 proof malt whisky, bottled at a punchy 57.1%.

A superb example of wine wood-finishing (so often reviled by some), Glenmorangie 1981 spent the last two of its 21 years of maturation in casks formerly containing sweet wine from Chateau d'Yquem. A legendary 'Morangie.

product_name:
Talisker 1955
38 Year Old Cask Strength Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1955 vintage Talisker from independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail as part of their cask strength series of releases. Bottled in 1993, this spent almost 40 years in wood, the majority, if not all in sherry casks. Awarded an impressive 92 points by the Malt Maniacs.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1980
16 Year Old Cask #89 589 28 The Ultimate
product_description: A 16 year old Port Ellen from Dutch independent bottlers The Ultimate Whisky Company. Distilled in 1980, just three years before the distillery closed, this was bottled in November 1997.

A very rare distillery bottling of Mortlach, one of the most under-rated Speysides around. This 1971 vintage was released a few years ago as part of Diageo's 'Superpremium' series.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Longmorn 1973
21 Year Old Sherry Cask First Cask
product_description: A rare independent bottling of Longmorn, this expression is a single sherry cask from 1973. Darker than the photo suggests, this should be an epic dram for sherry fans.
A glorious old bottle of 1846 vintage Glenlivet. Released by independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail, specialists in well aged whiskies, we estimate, in the 1980s, making this well over 30 years old.
An 18 year old bottling of Glenfarclas bottled for the Morgan Sports Car Club in celebration of their June 1989 Scottish gathering.
A superb Dalmore 12yo from around the turn of the 1970s/1980s, when a young Richard Paterson had already been working for Whyte & Mackay for around ten years and was really hitting his stride.
An old-style bottle of the Caol Ila 12 year-old from the time when it was mostly used as a blending-malt workhorse for DCL.

product_name: Gladstone Axe Black Axe Blended Malt Scotch
product_description: A blend of malt whiskies from the Highlands and Islay, Gladstone Black Axe is inspired by former UK Prime Minister William Gladstone, who had a penchant for felling trees. Bold, malty aromas of vanilla, toasted oak and smouldering firewood fill the nose, complemented by notes of caramel, aromatic peat, heather, oak spice and a touch of sea salt throughout the palate.

A mouthwatering medium-bodied floral, heathery Linlithgow (aka St. Magdalene) distilled mere months before the distillery was forced to close. Remarkably fresh for a whisky of this age.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glen Grant 1973
34 Year Old Sherry Cask SMoS
product_description:
An absolute gem of a Glen Grant, matured in a sherry puncheon since 1973 for your organoleptic pleasure. Fruity and nutty in the old sherried style, but no sulphur.

Tasting Notes (1)

An old bottling of Glenfarclas 15 year old. We estimate this was bottled in the 1970s, a decade which saw a great deal of change at the distillery. The on-site floor maltings were decommissioned, a visitors centre was opened and the number of stills were increased from four to six.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
An old release of Glenfarclas 15 year old whisky. Presented in an excellent square bottle, which we would estimate to have been released in the late 1980s.
A very desirable bottle of Balvenie Classic, rare because it has a 12 year-old age statement, whereas most bottles we've seen are either 18 year-old or no-age-statement.
A whisky from Linkwood specially bottled to celebrate the 25th year of the Burghead Maltings, which opened in 1966.

product_name:
Macallan 25 Year Old
Sherry Oak Anniversary Malt Bot.1990s
product_description:
An old bottling of 25 year old Macallan, part of the acclaimed and highly sought after Anniversary series of bottlings.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

One of the rising stars in the premium bourbon market, with a growing following in the UK due to its distinctive looks and exceptional quality.

Tasting Notes (1)

A new addition to the distinguished family of Balvenie vintage releasese. This is described as an aromatic single malt with an explosion of flavours; zesty fruit, brambles, rich honey, brown sugar and vanilla.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Strathisla 35 Year Old
Bot.1980s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A rare old G&M bottling of long-aged Strathisla from the 1980s. This should be delicious.
A rare bottling of very old Glenlivet 1948 by Gordon & Macphail.

Ta-Daa! The first publicly-available bottling of Kininvie, workhorse for the Grant's stable. You may well have had Monkey Shoulder (which has plenty of Kininvie in it), but this is the first opportunity to try it as a single malt in its own right.
An old 1980s bottle of Bunna's standard 12yo.
An old bottling of Knockando whisky, distilled in 1967 and bottled in 1979. Making this whisky approximately 12 years old.

product_name:
Glengoyne 15 Year Old
Kiln Decanter Bot.1980s
product_description: A superbly naff 1980s bottling of a litre of Glengoyne 15yo inside a kiln-shaped decanter, complete with pagoda-shaped stopper.

product_name:
Port Ellen 1979
13 Year Old Douglas Murdoch
product_description:
A 1979-vintage whisky from closed cult distillery Port Ellen on Islay. This was aged for 13 years before being bottled by indie bottler Douglas Murdoch in the early 1990s.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.

product_name:
Port Ellen 12 Year Old
Douglas Murdoch
product_description:
A very rare independent bottling of Port Ellen bottled at 12 years old, so no later than 1995 or early 1996.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.
A miniature of Labrot & Graham's Woodford Reserve; superbly smooth, flavoursome bourbon, rich and full-bodied with a sophisticated range of flavours. Excellent as a digestif after a rich meal.

Nikka's entry-level whisky from Miyagikyo distillery. Light in body, yet full of flavour, this is an excellent introduction to Japanese whisky. Elegantly fruity with sherry-cask character.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Glen Grant 1948
58 Year Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: An ancient dram aged for nigh on sixty years. Thankfully, Glen Grant is one of those special Speysiders (like Glenfarclas and Macallan) that is capable of withstanding immense oak ageing. An excellent malt bottled by Gordon & Macphail in 2006.
Launched in 2013 in the USA, Bulleit's 10 Year Old Bourbon is now available on these shores. Rich and spicy with notes of vanilla, cinnamon and dried fruit, this is excellent value.

product_name: Macallan 55 Year Old Lalique Crystal Decanter
product_description:
The second edition of Macallan's Lalique series of staggeringly old Macallan in difficult-to-ignore crystal decanters. This one is entitled 'Natural Colour' and the decanter is based on a perfume bottle design by Rene Lalique dating from 1910.


Please note


 There is a very small tear to the outside of the box.
A rare bottling of Glenmorangie using whisky distilled on 21st January 1976, the day of Concorde's first ever commercial flight. Presented in an elegant wooden box, this is a hard to find whisky.

product_name: Jeptha Creed Straight Four Grain Bourbon
product_description: A sweet and spicy bourbon from Jeptha Creed, Straight Four Grain is made with a combination of 70% Bloody Butcher corn, 15% malted rye, 10% malted wheat and 5% malted barley. Aromas of vanilla cream, geraniums, hydrangea, dried apricots, red berries, peach cobbler and blackberry jam fill the nose, complemented by notes of nutmeg, clove, toasted pecans and mint throughout the palate.

One of only a handful of long-aged distillery-bottled releases of Glenury Royal. This 1970 vintage is very special whisky from a tragically lost distillery. Impeccable cask selection has led to perhaps the best of Diageo's recent releases from Glenury.

Tasting Notes (2)
A rare distillery bottling of this obscure Speysider from the 1970s.

product_name:
Black Bowmore 1964
42 Year Old The Trilogy
product_description:
Over its many years of distillation, Bowmore has produced some outstanding, iconic limited edition bottlings. This particularly stunning example of Bowmore was distilled on the 5th of November 1964. The spirit was carefully filled into exceptional Oloroso sherry casks then laid down to mature deep in the distillery vaults below sea level.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Rosebank 1991
16 Year Old Cask #3020 75 The Single Malts of Scotland
product_description: A bottling from our amazing stash of Rosebank. This one is a vatting of complementary casks bottled at 46% and shows floral, honey and spice notes.

They say Laphroaig is like Marmite - you either love it or you hate it. That goes double for sherried Laphroaig, but this cask-strength vatting of five Oloroso casks came first in the Malt Maniacs Awards 2007.

Tasting Notes (1)
A single malt whisky made in Texas by craft distilling powerhouse Balcones.
An old 1980s bottle of Cragganmore 12yo, bottled in the 1980s around the time of the distillery's induction into the Classic Malts series.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1966
45 Year Old Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: Another of Gordon & Macphail's long-aged Glen Grants which, along with Glenfarclas, represent the best-value long-aged Speysides available. Thankfully, Glen Grant is one of those special Speysiders (like Glenfarclas, Mortlach and Macallan) that is capable of withstanding immense oak ageing without tasting like a pile of wet sawdust.

product_name:
Ichiro's Malt MWR
Mizunara Wood Reserve
product_description: The return of a legendary whisky from Ichiro Akuto, formerly of Hanyu distillery and now founder and distiller at Chichibu. This is a blend of malt whiskies from his extensive stocks, including whisky matured in mizunara – fragrant Japanese oak. Outstandingly rare, with only very limited amounts available to the whisky industry to use to make casks, mizunara is uniquely fragrant and adds a refined and almost incense-like air to this whisky.

product_name:
Linlithgow 1982
24 Year Old Old Malt Cask
product_description: Also known as St. Magdalene, bottlings of Linlithgow are becoming increasingly rare as the distillery closed some time ago. Linlithgow is extremely highly-thought of thanks to some stellar bottlings over the last decade.
A miniature bottle of Four Roses Original bourbon, matured for at least five years in American oak barrels for smoothness and carefully blended for a consistently smooth, creamy flavour.

A 20 year old bottling of Ledaig from Speyside distillers as part of their Douglas Murdoch range of independent bottlings. Since 1996 this has been the name for the peated malt produced at Tobermorey distillery on the Isle of Mull. However this is believed to have been produced in the 1970s when the distillery itself was called Ledaig and all production carried that name, peated or unpeated.
A dumpy bottle of Springbank 25yo released in the 1990s, meaning the liquid was probably distilled in the late 1960s or early 1970s. Say no more.
A dumpy bottle of Springbank 25yo released in the 1980s, meaning the liquid was probably distilled in the late 1950s or early 1960s. Say no more.
A 1970s bottle of Fettercairn produced for the Italian market. Why '875' you may ask? It's due to it being 8 years old and 75 UK proof.
A rare example of an official bottling of Glentauchers. This was released at 12 years of age in, we estimate, the 1980s.
A 1980s bottling of Glendullan's old standard expression, pretty much the only distillery bottling they've released - a 12 year old.
A bottle of 8 year old Dalmore bottled in the 1970's by "Duncan Macbeth and Co", one of the names used at the time, so it seems, by owners Whyte & Mackay.

Hats off to Diageo for 2007's Super-Premium releases, the quality of which was superb. Yet even in the stellar company of such delights as the Lagavulin 21 yrs, this stunning Talisker stood out. Extraordinary complexity and fabulous balance.

Tasting Notes (1)

This annual release for Port Ellen from Diageo is another 1979. We sold our allocation of the sixth release in a matter of weeks, so please be quick if you want one of these. As with the Brora, we don't know how many more of these releases there will be...

A legendary Lagavulin, originally released in 2007 - and it's to be the last fully sherried release, we're told. Boasting 95 points on Whiskyfun, this has become incredibly sought-after.

Tasting Notes (2)

The 6th bottling of Brora 30yrs from Diageo is another classic 1970s-style Brora, and standards are just as high as ever, with overt citrus and medicine cabinet notes. This is yet another fabulous release from this much-lamented extinct distillery, scoring 93 points from Whiskyfun's Serge Valentin.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1963
Sherry Cask #4098 1st Release The Family Casks
product_description:
The Glenfarclas Family Casks series is a new range of vintage casks from one of Speyside's best distilleries. All but three of the range (1952, 1979 & 1984) are from first fill or refill sherry casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1958
Sherry Cask #2245 1st Release The Family Casks
product_description:
The Glenfarclas Family Casks series is a new range of vintage casks from one of Speyside's best distilleries. All but three of the range (1952, 1979 & 1984) are from first fill or refill sherry casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1956
Sherry Cask 1st Release The Family Casks
product_description:
The Glenfarclas Family Casks series is a new range of vintage casks from one of Speyside's best distilleries. All but three of the range (1952, 1979 & 1984) are from first fill or refill sherry casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1954
Sherry Cask The Family Casks
product_description:
The Glenfarclas Family Casks series is a range of vintage casks from one of Speyside's best distilleries. All but three of the range (1952, 1979 & 1984) are from first fill or refill sherry casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Glenfarclas 1953
Sherry Cask 1st Release The Family Casks
product_description:
The Glenfarclas Family Casks series is a new range of vintage casks from one of Speyside's best distilleries. All but three of the range (1952, 1979 & 1984) are from first fill or refill sherry casks.

Tasting Notes (1)

Penderyn is a Welsh whisky distilled once in a unique Faraday copper still with an added purifier and rectification column and, after a spell in bourbon barrels, is finished in Madeira casks for extra smoothness. Launched in 2004, Penderyn has built on its early promise and really carved a niche for itself.

A whisky’s age is much more than a number, with changes happening to the spirit every day it's in a cask. Twenty five years is enough time to round off youthful edges and create harmonious and balanced whiskies. These are some of our favourites.


This set contains a 3cl each of: Auchroisk 25 Year Old | Benriach 25 Year Old | Glen Scotia 25 Year Old | Glenfarclas 25 Year Old London Edition | Talisker 25 Year Old | Caol Ila 25 Year Old.

A massive 4.5 litre bottle of cask strength 10 year old Ardbeg, bottled as 'MOR' (this was the original MOR bottling). A serious bit of kit that will take up a chunk of space and provide a talking point at whisky related gatherings for years to come. Lifting it to pour a dram may require help.

A 1981 vintage Brora from independent bottler Signatory as part of their Cask strength Collection. Distilled on December 8, it was matured in sherry butt 1557 for 23 years, before 613 bottles were yielded on June 8 2005. The distillery sadly closed in 1983 and bottles are highly sought after.

Released to celebrate the distillery's centenary, this 17yo Benromach spent its final two years in sherry casks dating from 1886, 1895 and 1901 before bottling in 1998 by Gordon & Macphail, who had recently taken over and re-invigorated the distillery after a fifteen year distilling hiatus.
This was previously the only generally available official release from Aultmore, launched as one of the earlier entries in the Flora & Fauna range in 1991.

product_name:
Glenrothes 8 Year Old
Bot.1970s Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A beautiful old 1970s G&M bottling of sherried Speysider Glenrothes. Very hard to find these days.

product_name:
Dalmore 1973
33 Year Old Haut Marbuzet Finish
product_description:
Part of the 'Rare & Prestigious' range from Whyte & Mackay. This 1973 Dalmore was originally matured in American White Oak casks before a second maturation for several years in Cabernet Sauvignon casks from Ch. Haut-Marbuzet, a Cru Bourgeois claret from the St. Estephe appellation. This is being styled as 'The Ultimate Finish' and comes in a suitably smart presentation box.

Tasting Notes (5)

A bottling of Brora distilled in 1975 and released as part of the Rare Malts series, 20 years later. Closed back in 1983, bottlings from Brora are now in high demand. This was awarded an average of 91 points by 4 of the Malt Maniacs.

America's biggest-selling premium bourbon, the much-loved Wild Turkey 101 is a richly-flavoured concoction with a mellowness that belies its high strength.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Secret Stills No: 2.1 (Cragganmore) 1966
Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A Secret Stills release from Gordon & Macphail from distillery #2 (shh, it's Cragganmore...). A 1966 vintage whisky bottled in 2006 at about 40 years old.
An old-style Glen Garioch 10 year old, bottled in the 1980s.

product_name:
Dalmore 1992
12 Year Old Black Pearl Madeira
product_description: A cut above the standard Dalmore 12yo, this Black Pearl edition has been finished in Malmsey Madeira casks for extra complexity.

A legendary Ardbeg, the 1974 Provenance first appeared in Europe in 1997 shortly after Glenmorangie's takeover of the distillery. This version of Provenance was for the US market and was introduced in 2000.
An old bottling of Glenfarclas 15 year old whisky, in the rectangular bottle typical of the era. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.
An old bottling of Dufftown, from back when everyone in Speyside stuck 'Glenlivet' onto their names.
An old bottling of Dalmore 12 year old whisky. This appears to have been bottled sometime in the 1980s, before they switched to their current 'dumpy' bottles.

product_name:
North British 1991
29 Year Old Sherry Cask Signatory
product_description: A 1991 North British single grain whisky from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single refill sherry butt for almost three decades, before being bottled in November 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

Formerly known as Yellow Label, this is a very popular bourbon, aged a minimum of five years in oak barrels for extra smoothness and carefully blended for a consistently smooth, creamy flavour.

Tasting Notes (1)

Monkey Shoulder is a mix of three different Speyside single malts and is great with mixers or just on its own. Smooth, sweet and very easy to drink.

Tasting Notes (1)

A Perfect Measure sample bottle of the third entry in the much anticipated and sought after London Edition range of whiskies from Japan's Chichibu, a tiny distillery sat about 70km north-west of Tokyo. This year's whisky is a vatting of seven casks of whisky aged between six and eight years, a mixture of ex-bourbon barrels, casks that previously held peaty whisky and casks with new mizunara-oak ends.
Buffalo Trace is a really classy bourbon from a distillery that has been responsible for some truly outstanding products in recent years. This is terrific stuff.

product_name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel
Barrel Strength
product_description: A full-bodied cask strength single barrel Tennessee Whiskey from Jack Daniel's that offers aromas of oak spice, honey, smoke and walnuts on the nose. The palate offers notes of raisins, dried apple slices, cigar boxes and peppery spice that linger in the finish.

product_name: Johnnie Walker Green Label 15 Year Old
product_description:
Relaunched in 2016, Green Label is arguably the richest horse in the Johnnie Walker stable. This blended malt whisky travels the regions of Scottish whisky production and conveys the whirlwind of flavours to your mouth. Hearty.

Tasting Notes (1)

The first new Maker's Mark recipe for at least 50 years, Maker's 46 is named for the number of different wood 'recipes' they tried before getting it right. Bottled at 47% it is matured in part in barrels containing a 'ladder' of toasted new French oak barrel staves to give more spice, sweetness and vanilla.
A 1973 Longrow bottled by Italian import Moon as part of their beautifully labelled 'The Birds' series.

product_name:
Glen Garioch 1968
29 Year Old Sherry Cask #8
product_description: A distillery bottling of 1968 vintage Glen Garioch, bottled at 29 years old in their old stag livery before their rebranding in the new millenium.

Another of the famed Bowmore bicentenary bottlings from 1979, this one distilled in 1964. This is one of the best of the bunch with a 95 from Serge at Whisky Fun and a reputation as one of the best Bowmore's ever produced.
A lightly coloured Aberlour (in comparison to the also released dark version) in a heavy crystal decanter, released in 1979 to celebrate the distillery's 100th anniversary.

Following on from Very Young and Still Young, Ardbeg Almost There showed the final stage in the evolution of young cask-strength Ardbeg 1998 before it blossomed into the Renaissance 10 yr-old. As you would expect, this is a mellower, more rounded, better balanced dram than the younger incarnations.

Tasting Notes (2)

product_name:
Ardbeg 1975
29 Year Old Old & Rare Platinum
product_description: A 1975 vintage Ardbeg from independent bottlers Douglas Laing as part of their Platinum Selection series. Produced in the first year of Ardbeg importing large amounts of malted barley from the mainland, this is a slightly less peatier Ardbeg than one is used to.

product_name:
St Magdalene 1970
23 Year Old Rare Malts
product_description: A bottle of 1970 vintage St Magdalene, released by Diageo as part of their Rare Malts series. The distillery was one of the many victims of the cull of 1983, making their malt much sought after.

A green and crunchy entry in the Hakushu Range, combining whisky of a wide variety of ages, from across the range of casks used by the distillery to create a gently smoky dram, packed with fruity flavour.

Tasting Notes (1)

One of a series of really terrific Japanese malts from the sadly now defunct Hanyu distillery. Bursting with character and complexity, these masterpieces from a 'lost' distillery are pricey, but well worth it. A massive hit at this year's Whisky Live.

Tasting Notes (3)
A bottle of 12-year-old whisky from Glen Ord, bottled by then distillery owner Dewars under the Glenordie name in the 1980s.

A snazzy bottling of 1987 vintage Glenmorangie with a fancy box and some time finishing in casks that previously held red wine from Margaux, a winegrowing region (and AOC) in Bordeaux, France. A must for collectors of Glenmorangie.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Ardbeg 1975
30 Year Old Old & Rare Platinum
product_description:
A 1975 vintage Ardbeg from Douglas Laing as part of their Platinum Selection series. This was the first year of Ardbeg using large amounts of barley malted off site. Aged for 30 years in wood, this is complex with a classic salinity.

Tasting Notes (1)

The highlight of 2006's super premium releases from Diageo. This was so popular that we sold through our initial allocation within weeks. This starts off as an elegent dram that builds on the palate to a powerful peaty, smoky, salty, peppery beast, it has complex coastal characters with notes of citrus and the most perfectly balanced finish.

Tasting Notes (1)
A single cask release from Signatory for their Rare Reserve series. This 1969 vintage whisky from Springbank has been matured in a refill butt for 34 years.

product_name:
Springbank 1966
34 Year Old Lateltin Lanz Ingold
product_description:
A legendary 1966 vintage Springbank bottled as a private bottling around the turn of the millennium. Having been matured in a sherry cask for 34 long years, this was awarded a score of 93 on the Malt Maniacs' Monitor.


Please note


This bottle contains sediment.

A highly desirable official bottling of Rosebank 8yo from the 1980s, shortly before the distillery's untimely demise.


Please note


The presentation box has small damages.


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.

The 6th release of Diageo's legendary year Special Release Port Ellens. Distilled in 1978 and bottled at 27 years of age this is an increasingly rare dram as investors and drinkers fight over the remaining bottles.

Tasting Notes (1)

product_name:
Port Ellen 1979
26 Year Old Cask #7094 Old Bothwell
product_description: This single cask, cask strength whisky was distilled at Port Ellen distillery, just 4 years before it closed. Matured for 26 years and bottled by the Old Bothwell Wine & Spirits Co.

product_name:
Mortlach 1968
37 Year Old Sherry Cask Private Collection G&M

product_description: An old release of Miltonduff whisky. Ages for 12 years and bottled at 43%. We estimate that this is from sometime in during the 1980s.

A 1966 Lochside from independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range. Formerly the site for Deuchars' Beer Brewery, Lochside opened in 1957 as a joint grain and malt distillery. Closed in 1992, official bottlings were rare and independent bottlings are therefore highly sought after.
A lovely old 1980s distillery bottling of Inchgower 'From the House of Bell's' according to the label. They keep a bit quieter about that these days.

A 1972 vintage Glendronach aged for 18 years in sherry casks. Despite being produced under a previous ownership, this is an excellent example of the sherried style the distillery is renowned for today.

product_name:
Glen Grant 1968
31 Year Old Sherry Cask Adelphi

product_description: A 1982 vintage Glenesk, bottled by independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail as part of their Connoisseurs Choice range. Rarely seen as an independent bottling and even rarer as an official bottling, the distillery closed in 1985 and bottlings are in high demand.

product_name:
Secret Stills No: 2.1 (Cragganmore) 1966
Sherry Cask Gordon & MacPhail
product_description: A 1966 vintage whisky bottled by Gordon & Macphail in 2006 as part of their Secret Stills series. Aged in sherry casks 1450 and 1451 for the best part of four decades, this is from distillery number 2 – Cragganmore.
A Brora 1982 in the smart new Connoisseurs Choice packaging. Bottled from refill sherry butts at 43%.
